We are in Croatia celebrating our Babymoon (last holiday as two before our baby arrives in October) and also our 5 Year Anniversary. We were brought special complimentary cocktails at the end of the night and also a lovely pink rose for me to take home.
We can’t recommend this special restaurant enough and would like to thank all the staff and chefs at Nautika for an amazing experience. 
Beckie, Harry & bump!
Kent/ London UK
Incredible totally faultless worth every penny! Will be back x best night ever!!! Never had food like it! 👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌👌

If you are thinking or visiting Nautika, you should definitely make sure To include it as part of your trip to Dubrovnik. The food was beautifully presented and well cooked. The service was top notch Maro was an excellent server. Although pricey definitely worth a visit.
Brilliant food and service. Do not miss this experience. Do make sure to censorer at visit and ask for a good local wine (Mili).
Maro(waiter), the food, views, and Tomoslav were OUTSTANDING!! We’ve traveled to many places around the world and our experience at Nautika was top notch!!

Absolutely amazing! The place is beautiful and staff are super friendly and the food is delicious. I love that you get a lot of food as well for the price. It’s definitely not like other expensive restaurants and you only get a small amount of food. I am definitely going back.
We visited Nautika in July 2022. The experience was excellent from the start when we were greeted. Recommendations were great and matched our tastes! Definitely a go for a full Dubrovnik experience!

My wife and I had reservations and were seated timely. Very classy place. We opted for red meat, though there were several seafood entrées available. We dined on entrées, one of beef and the other of lamb. We washed down the delicious food with a bottle of red Croatian wine that was recommended. Miles A. of Boca Raton, FL.

Amazing! Fantastic food and incredible service. 10/10. 

Valentino our waiter was attentive, knowledgeable, and a consummate professional. 

Would recommend to anyone in Dubrovnik.
Delicious food, first class service from our waiter Valentino and each course came with really interesting history and facts about Dubrovnik - five stars!
Everything was amazing, the food and the place overlooking Dubrovnik. Must be seen! The most kind waiters, especially Valentino!

My husband and I had the best dinner of our stay in Dubrovnik at Nautika! The food, drinks, and service were all excellent. We did not have a reservation and decided to wait for a table and we are so glad that we did. It was so worth the wait! An incredible dining experience from our honeymoon we will never forget! Thank you, Nautika Restaurant!

My fiancé and I and another couple had dinner here. We had the scallops, and then the daily catch fish which was sea bass. It was massive and delicious! Highly recommend this place. Make sure you book in advance. We booked a reservation over a month before and the on the wall seating (best seating) was already fully booked.
We ate on the terrace and had a wonderful experience! The service was Michelin level and the food terrific!

One of the best dining experiences I’ve ever had. The view is amazing. Having diner while having the view of the old town is really nice. Food was amazing and the service was so good. Highly recommended

Perfect honeymoon dinner. Ivan the tall was fantastic, attentive and friendly and food was wonderful.
We will be back!!
Everything was perfect. The quality of the food is outstanding. Service is commendable. A great treat! The bill was a little pricy, but definitely worth it.

We came here for my girlfriend’s birthday and we were arranged with a front row of the perfect sea view of Dubrovnik at the terrace. The service from Mica and the restaurant manager Josip were brilliant. We will definitely come to visit again!

Our first visit to Dubrovnik, so we looked for a high-quality restaurant. We certainly found it!
The service was attentive but not overbearingly so, throughout the meal. Our welcome was warm and friendly. All the servers are smartly dressed with white gloves and waistcoats, despite the heat (38c).
The menu was easy to understand, and the wine list was 'wine bible' with extensive wines from around the world.
The food was exceptional in terms of presentation, flavour, and creativity. All three courses were equally satisfying and enjoyable.
We asked for advice to select a local Croation wine - our selection of BIRE from GRK was wonderful and complimented our meal perfectly.
Our server Valantino made our experience memorable with his attention and help throughout our diner.
One of the best '10' meals ever from over 60 years of overseas travel!
The highlight of our visit and we loved Croatia and the people we met.
It is not easy to get a table here but it worse it. Everything super fresh and delicious, professional service and beautiful view.

Everything was amazing. 

all very very good. wonderful atmosphere wonderful food superior to any local restaurant. very professional staff, kind and smiling.
This is a beautiful restaurant, wonderful service, food and the location is unbelievable. Can thoroughly recommend

This restaurant is not cheap but such a gorgeous setting and the food was amazing 
I am so pleased due to rain the restaurant managed to change our reservation from the friday eve to the sat evening. Having nice dry weather is a must if you want to sit on the terrace. We booked a front table and we got a front table 
the staff were impeccable and the food was sublime 
Yes its expensive but for a special occasion and in my opinion so worth it

We had the 5 course tasting meal (including 2 complimentary items!) and it was simply fantastic. The staff are excellent, the views are beautiful and the views are incredible. Truly a Michelin star experience!
What can you say about perfection? Well Nautika is it. Amazing food, amazing service and killer views. Need I say more!
Exceptional restaurant with beautiful views. The food and the servers were both great and made for a fantastic evening.
I would rate this place 10 out of 10 if I could! The service the food the view! The best in Dubrovnik hands down. Valentino was our server and he was fantastic. Please tell him Jennifer sent you 😊

Friendly and nice atmosphere, really good food.
At the gates of old town, one could expect whatever, but this is good. Reallt nice

Both the food and the ambience were extraordinary! My husband and I both had the Seabass and were delighted. Evan was our waiter and he was exceptional, both personable and attentive. We highly recommend Nautika!

Amazing menu & background! What made our dinner special was the service of Mario - he helped us with menu & drink selection, was accommodating & had wonderful suggestions. He made the evening very special with him empathy, knowledge & narrating bits of local history. Thank u Nautika, chef, team & Mario!

Dinner tonight was one of the best my family and I have ever had. The entire wait staff provided excellent service. All food and drinks were exceptionally presented. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to experience 5 star dining.

We had the most incredible dining experience at Nautika. The food, service and atmosphere was second to none. The most amazing way to finish our holiday. We had the 7 course tasting menu and every dish was divine. Ivan, our waiter was the best host and made our evening even more special. Thank you

Mario went above and beyond to make our dinner spectacular! From the view to the celebratory drinks celebrating our engagement - the experience and service was impeccable! Thank you Mario for an incredible dinner on our last night in Europe!

Excellent restaurant, beautiful food and super staff. Seafood and meat superb 
Super wine, great service by Valentino

My partner and I have had a wonderful evening dining at Nautika. Our experience wouldn't have been what it was without the spectacular service of Mario who we were so fortunate to have taking care of us tonight. He was extremely attentive, giving recommendations of places to visit during our stay in Dubrovnik and talking us through the whole experience. He even arranged some complimentary cocktails to be presented to my partner and I for our anniversary. The food and the views were truly spectacular and nothing like I'd ever experienced, but it was Mario who made it truly special for us and we are very grateful.

We visited Nautika on the last night of our trip. We wanted something special to top off our 40th birthday celebrations. It did not disappoint! The location, service and food were all exceptional. My request for a couple of special touches were done with no questions asked and made the end of our trip unforgettable ! The shrimp risotto was the best risotto I have ever tasted. I would not hesitate to go back the next time I visit xxx
Incredible food, view, service - all 5 stars. One of the best meals we’ve ever had - very creative takes on classic dishes

My friend and I had amazing experience in Nautika restaurant. The quality and tasty of the food are just fabulous. The restaurant has amazing view and it's definitely worth seeing. The workers were great you can really tell that they are professionals, passionate about their job. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to have an amazing and unforgettable experience.

One of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik. Super delicious fresh food with amazing ambience. Waiters are attentive and knowledgeable. You can ask them everything. I highly recommend this place for everyone who wants to have amazing fine dining experience in Dubrovnik.

I visited Nautika with my friends on the last night of our 40th birthday trip. We wanted something special, and it didn’t disappoint. Fantastic location/setting, delicious food and wonderful service. Nothing was too much trouble, their attention to detail was amazing and they dealt sensitively with the fact that we were celebrating our birthdays without one of our best friends who we lost to breast cancer three years ago. Can’t recommend highly enough, it was the perfect end to our special holiday.

Nautica is beautifully positioned at the very edge of the gates of the old town. Terrace overlooks the sea and is very romantic. On separate days we tried both 7 course tasting menu and a la carter. Both were exquisite with distinctly Dalmatian theme. The quality of the dishes were outstanding , beautifully presented and using the best local ingredients. Wine list was more then impressive with the superb selection of highest quality of Croatian wine as well as superb collection around the world. 
Tomislav the Restaurant Manager and his team were first class and their attention to finest detail was demonstrated all the way. 
We have dined in a number of Michelin star restaurants around the world and surely it can be only a matter of time before Nautica is awarded one. 
Fantastic experience , fantastic food and fantastic service. We will definitely return !

We ate here last year and enjoyed it immensely. We booked it again for this holiday too. After a shacky start with a poor table we finally got a lovely table right on the front deck overlooking the bay. Thanks to the duty manager Tomis. 
Ivan our waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The Somelier (don't remember his name) was friendly and very knowledgeable, helping me choose a slightly different wine to the one I would have chosen, explaining grape varieties in this region of Croatia. 
The food was not only well presented (all the waiters are in white gloves) but tasted lovely. In fact our dessert was so nice I ordered seconds.
BOOK EARLY AS TABLES IN PRIME POSITIONS GO QUICKLY.
Not dure we will be able to get seats again on this trip, but I would happily go back.

This restaurant was by far the most special, beautiful romantic evening.

The service, the scenery and the food all exceeded our expectations! If you are traveling to Dubrovnik and have the money to spend then you cannot miss this restaurant

We booked in advance as wanted a "wall" table, these are very popular, just be aware when booking!

Our booking was for 6.30pm so still light when we arrived but as we had the tasting menu it was dark when we finished and had the beautiful backdrop of the lit castle to enjoy. 

The food was exceptional, every single course was tasty, well prepared and beautiful to look at. The sommelier picked out 2 fantastic local wines to go with the food and service was first class, professional as well as genuinely friendly. 

We had a wonderful evening and would highly recommend.

Everything about our dinner at Nautika was wonderful - we managed to get a table overlooking the water (tip: you need to go for an early or late sitting to get these) with stunning views of the fort lit up at night. The food was exquisite and service from our waiter, Valentin, was exceptional. It's expensive but worth every penny for a special night out.

From the helpful way we were treated when I booked to the curtesy , humour and care of the staff throughout dinner this was a fabulous experience . Class , class , class all the way . Fabulous fish cooking , tremendous cocktails, superb wine list ,it’s expensive but not bonkers and worth every penny . Generous and confident , there is a warmth about the way they treat you which contrasts with the way many “fine dinning “ establishments treat their guests . One of the top 3 restaurants I have visited ( frankly that’s a lot of restaurants we are talking about !) . Go if you are in Dubrovnik and can get a table - it will make you HAPPY .

My husband and I had the chance to dine at Nautika during our stay in Dubrovnik . It was the best experience of my life. The food was just superb! Nothing that we tried disappointed us. The beetroot and trio sea food for starter , the lobster tail and lamb dalmatian style for main and   the chocolate for dessert ... everything was perfect, full of taste and amazing to look! 
The view from the terrace was breathtaking. The service was absolutely flawless. The team was very considerate and always present when we needed them.
We will definitely come back again!

Easily our most disappointing meal out in 3 weeks in Croatia. This was our splurge in Dubrovnik after seeing it on you tube. Booked more than 1 month in advance we still didn't get a wall table. Way too much cutlery changing and table lurking and no fun conversation or nice music. The atmosphere was not cozy or romantic, just stuffy and uncomfortable. We had an ok bottle of wine, shared a starter( fois gras) which was delicious but very small, lamb chops that were so fatty and a pork dish that was miniscule. 1800kuna with a round up. Seemed like a place maybe Beverly Hills Housewives would like but we did not

It is a Michelin restaurant, so a reservation is required. At least if you want the best places outside. Claim first row against the wall on the outside. This way you will experience all the beauties of the view of old Dubrovnik.
We did not choose from the menu, but we chose a longer tasting menu, which perfectly combines seafood and meat food.
Even though the wine list is very long, we chose a local wine, Dubrovnik Malvasia. It suited everything we ate.
The staff is very professional, knows the food, they have sommelier for the wines.
Romantic atmosphere, great food and service. It will have to be repeated.

Perfect place to eat just outside the old city walls. Book a table on the terrace overlooking the sea. The service was tremendous, as was the meal. We had the fixed price meal, all courses of which were excellent.

The locals called this the “best restaurant in Dubrovnik!” Our experience supports this assessment. While we haven’t tried all the restaurants in town we have eaten at the French Laundry and La Tour d’Argent. This compares well in terms of food, presentation and service and it trounces them in terms of view and ambience. See that table at the corner of the wall in the picture? That was our table! A dinning experience of a lifetime! Order a cocktail. You will be delighted with the “at you table” preparation.

Wow, what an experience! We were given Nautika as a recommendation from two friends that had eaten here during their stay in Dubrovnik. Everything from the food and wine, to the service, to the view was just spectacular! Every dish that we had was complex and SO good. If you are a foodie, this is a must visit! In addition to amazing food and drink, the staff were amazing. Incredibly attentive and hospitable, and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful experience. A huge thank you to the Nautika team for making this experience truly unforgettable! We will definitely be back. Alyssa and Jesse
interesting menu with many choices, prices are a little higher but given the location and quality understandable

The overall experience of this restaurant is very special with silver service, live music, beautiful restrooms and the best view in Dubrovnik.

We had the 5-course tasting menu with wine flight. The wines were nice individually but weren’t paired well (in my humble opinion). 
The food was presented well adding to the nice experience however was lacking in flavour. Some of the dishes didn’t quite work as well.

Overall experience 5/5, food 3/5.

We were spoiled and treated as a king and queen right from the beginning of our visit. Food, wine, staff, everything was sublime. It was a special night for us, my husband’s birthday, for me Mother’s Day.
View splendid as well.

My husband and I had dinner here last week on our visit to Dubrovnik. We hadn't booked but it was no problem getting a table facing out to the beautiful view over the harbour. The waiters were so friendly and helpful. Food was amazing and great wine too. We even had complimentary grappa which was delicious. By the time we left the lights had come on and this made the whole setting truly magical. I would highly recommend this restaurant for service food and ambience, loved every minute thank you 😊

Amazing service with great attention to detail, knowledge of local produce used and wine exceptional. Small hiccup which was resolved very professionally by the management. Unfortunately it was raining but you’re comfortable and warm on the terrace and still get to admire the view. Would recommend.
Good fine dining experience with a nice view, when you’re in front of the terrasse. Very good selection of wine and cheese. There were also some vegetarian options.

This experience could not have been more perfect! The view from the terrace (ask for the first row) overlooked the sea, city walls and fort. The five course tasting menu was divine with local fish and different olive oils with each course. the winner was the shrimp over a slice of polenta accompanied by melted chèvre; truly an inspiration from the chef. The wine sommelier was extremely knowledgeable and provided us with a wonderful selection for our dinner. We were treated to an after dinner wine with the more than fabulous chocolate dessert. In addition to all of this, the service was impeccable, the best we have had. Carefully orchestrated serving and friendly staff made for a marvelous evening. A must do when in Dubrovnik.

The meal was to celebrate my wife's birthday. She had the 5 course tasting menu, and I had the 7 course menu that meant we had virtually covered everything. The food was exceptional in presentation and taste ! The staff made the whole experience special including the wine somelier and the wondeful Darco !!
We booked online and were upgraded to the outdoor terrace by the wall with heater and blankets as required.
Highly recommend this terrific Michelin star restaurant .

My wife and I had our 8th wedding anniversary dinner there. The whole experience was absolutely outstanding! The food and the service were second to none. Had and shoulders about the Burj Al Arab. If ever you are in Dubrovnik, make a reservation. Such knowledge and pride in their local produce- and the food was fabulous!

Just had the most fabulous meal at Nautika. The service of the excellent staff was outstanding and the amazing food was in a class of its own. Not just a meal but an an exceptional dining experience for people who love how delicious food is artistically presented as well as how great it tastes.
Book a patio table before dusk. The views are incredible and there is a serenity that comes from the soft lighting on the towers. The service was good and food as expected - delicious.

Booked Nautica for a joint birthday dining experience for my best friend and I. 
From the moment we arrived we received superb service and were looked after extremely well. 
The view is unforgettable, simply beautiful even once the sun had gone down. 
The food was absolutely delicious, The scallops were the best have ever eaten.
The wine list and brandy were impressive, we loved the plum brandy. 
The restaurant made our meal special by giving us special birthday deserts and to finish the evening the live pianist played a beautiful rendition of the Game of Thrones theme music (we are big fans) 
A dining experience that will be treasured for a long time and others will have a lot to live up to. Thank you Nautica!

This is an awesome experience, the food is superb the wine pairing eve better. Having had a meal here three years ago we were nervous of damaging our lovely memories but we were not disappointed, it was even better this time and we felt spoilt. It was a lovely meal with a lovely ambience don’t miss it .

Beautiful restaurant, beautiful location, nice staff and wonderful food. 
We booked a table on the ‘second tier’of their patio which was absolutely fine - still great views. Our waiter was very helpful throughout explaining all the dishes he brought even down the olive oil parings!
Food was fantastic as were the drinks including a special cocktail of the house (can’t remember it’s name but it had woodford reserve in it) which was theatrically made at the table.
The foie gras was standout, but overall we were delighted with our meal and the experience. Yes it was expensive but pretty much on par with e expectations

We were inDubrovnik in September to celebrate my husbands birthday. I wanted to have a very special dinner to celebrate it. After doing my research I decided Nautika would definitely be special. First let me say thank you to Jan Prebisalic head concierge at the Hilton hotel. I contacted Jan and asked him if he could make our reservation. We requested a front row table and he said he would do his best. We received a response later saying that Nautika could reserve a table for us on the second row. That was fine because it is such a beautiful restaurant and the location is unbeatable. When we arrived at the restaurant we couldn’t believe how beautiful it was. Even if you aren’t dining there you should walk by to see it. We arrived at the restaurant and the hostess said that they were able to move us up to the front row.Little did we know I think she seated us at the best table on the terrace! The view of the forts is absolutely amazing and we were fortunate enough to have a full moon reflecting off of the ocean.
We were seated and it was like stepping back in time where waiters wore red jackets and white gloves. It’s truly an experience. Our wine sommelier suggest a local red wine and it was absolutely delicious.
We ordered our entrees and just sat and starred at the view.
Our entrees ,like the wine we’re delicious. The service was definitely top notch. Yes it is expensive but well worth it. It was one of the best dining experience we ever had and thank you again Jan for making this happen!

A special meal to conclude our honeymoon and wow! We went for the 7 course tasting menu with wine pairing and every dish was amazing in its own way - the tuna was unreal! Service was friendly and professional and answered any questions we had. We were moved to a table on the side terrace to enjoy our dessert and drinks. We were offered a complimentary drink once we had finished the meal which was a lovely touch.

I was very impressed by the service and the food at Nautika Restaurant. Highly recommend it for a great meal while visiting the city. The presentation, setting and delivery of the meal and drinks were on point. Not to mention the great view of the fort, which added to the pleasantry of the overall experience. Loved it!

We had a nice dinner here but had a terrible table right by the servers gathering area. Way too busy and lot's of whining by the servers and even some ugliness as far as comments. One of our group spoke the language and shared some of the dialogue. It is clear the servers did not always like each other. We had a crusty old senior waiter, the food was above average but small portions and overpriced-especially the cocktails. The location is in the heart of the tourist area so some of this is to be expected but they do have some absolutely beautiful view tables on the water side.

Caught unaware of the onslaught of tourists at the end of September, I was left without dinner reservations at the better restaurants. Upon returning to Nautika a second consecutive night, the very astute hostess Katarina recognized me and after some mild begging on my part, agreed to seat me in the unreserved side of the terrace. I was happy to just sit down and have a sensational view on the very last night of my unforgettable vacation in Croatia. Moro (sp?) was my waiter and listened to my plea for a light menu, assisting me in a perfect selection of a beetroot salad as a starter followed by the Ahi tuna. He brought 3 different olive oil selections, giving me background on each (I later bought one at the store across the way) and selected a perfect local white wine to pair with the meal. The food was excellent, the setting was a "10", the weather was perfection and the moon was full. The only thing that was missing was someone to share it with...so I'm sharing it with YOU! I highly recommend this restaurant but take care to reserve early! Expensive but worth it. And, to top it off, there was a beautiful piano in the background playing some of my Sting favorites. A highlight experience!

I had planned this dinner, as a surprise for a special birthday. We were seated in the beautiful small terrace at the top of the restaurant overlooking the bay (amazing!). We had it all to ourselves for the first hour or so - the best setting I've ever eaten in. The food was excellent, so tasty and the staff give you lots of information about what you're eating. The cocktails were also great! The staff are so professional, friendly, interactive and really make you feel you are dining in luxury! I read some reviews on here before going about the menu being expensive, but you get what you pay for - at the Michelin Star you expect to spend some money, but this is really worth it. I'm still thinking about the food! And I would 100% recommend! Table by the wall-front at sunset would be my advice! Thanks Nautika!
Apart from the beautiful situation and the decoration, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was delicious and the atmosphere relaxed. and quiet although the restaurant was full

Where do I start?? The views are spectacular especially when you have a table along the exterior wall overlooking the water below. The wait staff wear white gloves. The wine list included 800 bottles but we went for the specialty cocktails. What a treat! The Smokey Old Fashion was prepared at the table and was quite a show. The food presentation and the mixture of ingredients made for a delicious eating experience.

We had a lovely dinner at this restaurant next to old City. The location on the terrace was perfect, the service outstanding and the meal delicious. Mario, the waiter, did an exceptional job making us feel at home.

Nautika is most likely one of best restaurants in Dubrovnik Outside overlooking the small bay where many a scene of game of thrones was filmed. The lighted castle on the rocks makes a beautiful background. The food at this restaurant was amazing. Also if you are into smoked whiskey drinks. They do a smoked pine cone and prepare it at the table. Everyone in our group stated best food on the trip

This is where we went to have the desserts, mentioned in our earlier review, since we didn’t get them in another restaurant. This turned out to be one of the best desserts we have ever had. The composure, the flavour, the presentation, everything was excellent. The service was first-class and the drinks were excellent too. The location and atmosphere are wonderful. We certainly wish we would have had more than just desserts and drinks in this restaurant, because this place is outstanding.

My wife and I went to this restaurant based on other reviews and it was great. I would definitely recommend trying to get a reservation because they dont have a ton of seating. We had a table that had a front row view of the water and the city walls. It was absolutely beautiful. The food was great and the service was top notch. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion. It is a little expensive but it is a high quality restaurant.

Very good service and mouthwatering dishes 👍 Portions are not big, but enough for gastronomic journey. 
Amazing view from the balcony.
Amazing service and food in a gorgeous setting with piano player adding to the overall experience of a wonderful night!

Refined food, in a wonderful location, beautiful tables. Delicate treatment of the ingredients, interesting flavors, without being strange, beautiful presentation. The service is attentive, yet discreet. The timing of the dishes is just right. Any wish is immediately recorded and taken care of. A wonderful experience, HIGHLY recommend. Expensive, but not offensive and clearly worth it.

The food was exceptional 

Beautifully presented, the waiting staff were extremely professional and polite

Service was very slow, however the waiting staff did apologise and brought us an amuse Bouche and also a plate of divine chocolates to end our meal 

Highly recommend the veal and also the beef The flavours are impeccable

We were sat on the outdoor terrace at the rear of the restaurant, a stunning little area but not much of a view 
It’s preferable to Pre book a table on the squares terrace to take advantage of the spectacular views over Dubrovnik’s city walls

Everything about this place is super special. If you want to treat yourself or have a special occasion to celebrate then this is the one. From start to finish everything was absolutely perfect. We arrived and had a fantastic view of the fort and sea, however due to how early in the evening it was our table was overlooked by a lot of tourists which I found a little uncomfortable- especially as it was a special occasion for my husband. The staff were wonderful and moved us to a less “busy” part of the terrace…..absolutely perfect and a very romantic setting. We opted for the 7 course tasting menu which was out of this world. Couldn’t fault a single course and it was cooked and presented to a very high standard. Just what you would expect from a fine dining restaurant….if not more. I believe this restaurant is featured in the Michelin guide but not yet awarded its first Michelin star….I genuinely don’t think it will be long before they gain this recognition. Having dined at a few “starred” restaurants in London this place really does deserve that accreditation. It isn’t cheap, but you’ll know that from checking the website, however I can say wholeheartedly that it was worth every penny for the food, experience, location and service. Would definitely recommend this place for that extra special night out … especially with a loved one.

Enjoyed an amazing family dinner, with impecable service and high quality dishes. The trio of seafood starter was amazing, the lobster tail was really well cooked and accompanied with a tasty bisque, but the star of the show was the lamb dish cooked sous vide. Probably the best lamb dish ever! For vegeterians the asparagus risotto and the mushroom pasta topped with truggle shavings were memorable! Highly recommend for foodies, families and couples alike! And dont forget to sample the long list of cocktails - the Lagavullin 200 was a treat!

My experience at Nautika was divine from start to finish – the entire time I felt like I was the only guest. As a solo traveler, I often get the worst table, but they gave me the center table on their famous terrace, overlooking the bay. As I got seated, I was attended to by 3 waiters who made sure that I was comfortable. After I settled, they helped me pick a cocktail to kick off the evening (Bird in a Cage) which I LOVED. I then wanted to order a bottle of blanc de blancs, knowing I will not finish it but wanted it since it was my birthday (they didn't know) but the sommelier gently suggested that I order a particular brand by the glass instead since it tasted just like blanc de blancs - and he was right! I chose the Foie Gras appetizer which was spectacular and on par with (if not better than) the Foie Gras I had in Paris last month – the temp of the Fois Gras was perfect and the accompaniments accentuated the delicate flavor. For main, I chose veal which was delectable. And I never had to ask for anything as the waiter magically appeared when I needed something. It was a truly memorable birthday dinner - if Nautika can make a person feel this special on a special day (without knowing about my birthday) on a random weekday in August during a crazy heatwave, then they have clearly mastered the art of immaculate dining experience. Croatia is a casual place, but if you want to be treated like a royalty with the warmth that is inherent in Croatians - Nautika is your place.
Is beautifully set restaurant overlooking the sea. Fine dining set up and service but the food does come short of expectations. The food is good but not great. For the price I was expecting more.

If u want to have an unforgettable dinner go to Nautika restaurantthe view the decoration the food the service the pianist every detail in that restaurant is made in its best way.Nautika is the place to be if u want a calm romantic and of course a classy restaurant ❤️

Oh my, a magical setting just outside the city wall, from the moment we arrived the service was simply faultless. The attn to detail in every course was amazing, even the choice of oils with the bread! 

A rare thing we were downsold on wine too once we had picked our food, we were not rushed it did not feel like we had the table for a set time, the ambiance was lovely. our daughter said her tuna was the best she had ever had, I can say the same for the veal. we even shared a desert because we could not miss it!

yes this is not a cheap restaurant but the value for the entire experience was worth it to us, after so long without a holiday and or a meal served, for us it was approx £100 a head but we could not have eaten another thing and did not go without on drinks. so go and treat yourself...

We loved our experience here and the food was nearly perfect. I highly recommend the tasting menu. The view is amazing. The service is superb. Expect to spend a lot of money (ours was almost $400 for three people with a mix of ala carte and tasting menu plus wine), but that is what vacations are for, right?

The setting on the terrace, overlooking the small bay that separates Fort Lovrijenac and the Old Town, is stunningly beautiful. Book the first row in the terrace at 7pm if you’re here in August so you catch the sunset. Yes, it’s expensive, but this is easily Michelin star level food (I know they don’t have one but the quality is there). The staff are hugely attentive and knowledgable (thank you Mario!) I had the five course tasting menu (4 fish dishes and a desert) with the wine pairing. All of it was top drawer and the Dalmatian white wines just excellent (Bire Grk is outstanding). We will be back.

Well…. The Michelin rating is the first clue; however, it’s hard to describe the ambiance and breath taking views with dinner. Expensive but worth every cent. I would have skipped two nights eating just to save to go here! Unbelievable completion of an amazing trip!

We spent an evening with family and friends there to enjoy the city of Dubrovnik and appreciated the location very much. Unfortunately you really pay an exceptionally high price for the view. The service was attentative and professional. We ordered 3 courses of witch the Startes where the best in terms of taste and food quality, The mains where average. Be prepared to go home with a 250 $ bill per person minimum. 
However we enjoyed our evening. But found the next day a bottle of wine on our bill that we ordered but never received because it was sold out. The money could be claimed back but this should not have happened.

If you want to be served like a queen and eat like a princess, this is the place you are looking for.

We took a five-course menu. The dish didn‘t just looked perfect, but it was also deliciously prepared. My favorite was white fish. 👏🏻👏🏻 to the cook 👨‍🍳, who plays with the perfect combinations of flavors. All preises to the manager for the idea. The entire staff is very friendly.

Ambience: The best sea view, the terrace between the old town and the Lovrijenac Fortress, also known as the Gibraltar of Dubrovnik. In the background you hear the light, pleasant sound of a pianist. Simply perfect. ❤️

Simply put, the best meal and service I’ve had in my life - thank you Mario. We came looking for reservations another night of the week but they were able to sit us early at 6:30pm. The were very attentive to my wife’s gluten allergy and warmed special bread to enjoy her meal with. We greatly enjoyed the specialty gin and tonic cocktails (instagram worthy presentation). Also the wine pairing with our beginning courses, main, and dessert was excellent. My wife loves her fish and I loved the roasted lamb. We finished things with a delightful dessert wine and cheese sampler. Couldn’t ask for a better meal or service.

We had the most amazing evening at Nautika Restaurant. We had champagne to start and a delicious 7 course tasting menu with a beautiful bottle of Provence rose. We followed this with a highly reccomended dessert wine, and then cocktails.

All of what we were offered was exquisite and the staff could not have been more helpful. The view of the sea is stunning and is really elevated by the live piano player.

A must visit for a romantic dinner in Dubrovnik!

We’ve eaten here several times, so I wanted to bring my family here, who were visiting from abroad. Our experience was as excellent as always. The BEST service, amazing food, and the greatest view of any restaurant imaginable. My family was so pleased, and it lived up to all our other visits. For us, it’s not a visit to dubrovnik without a meal at Nautika. (We live in Croatia, but all the way up at the top of the Adriatic.) Word of advice: make your reservation well in advance!

Thank you Valentino for a lovely evening. You really took care of us and made sure we had a lovely evening. Great recommendations on wine, and of the menu. We had a lovely sea view table upstairs and beautiful views all evening. Can’t fault this place at all! Why don’t they have michelin stars!!!! The service was incredibly good.. staff so warm and welcoming. They have set very high standard of service. I’ve heard of ‘wine pairing’ but never ‘olive pairing’. Worth the experience whatever the cost. Thank you for an enjoyable last night in Dubrovnik.

Really great food. The risotto to start was so nice, the lamb for my main was cooked to perfection. We didn’t order desert but the small complimentary desert the gave us was a nice touch. An expensive dinner but definitely worth it.

We had high expectations and this restaurant far exceeded them! From the location to the service which was hugely attentive without being stuffy, to the sublime dishes - I can only suggest you go there! Every single dish we tasted was special and we love our food. A totally wonderful last night and birthday celebration in Dubrovnik!
The restaurant has amazing views and food. Our waiter Martin was great. Highly recommend to those visiting Dubrovnik and are looking for an experience.

They make you feel like a king from the moment you go through the door to time you sadly depart. The staff clearly have an enormous pride about the local produce, ranging from the fine Croatian wines to their excellent food. Would highly recommend.

Amazing view, vibe, and service. The soup, appetizer, and dessert were delicious. The tempura shrimp blew my mind. Surprisingly, I was not impressed by the main courses. I have had better veal and tuna. Finishing three dishes with three different olive oils (a bit too much) was interesting; I’m not sure if I liked it, but it was definitely unique.

I don’t usually take the time to leave a review, but this restaurant is absolutely incredible. My boyfriend and I had to come back a second time during our week in Dubrovnik despite the expensive prices (well worth it). Best service I have ever experienced and food is amazing. My boyfriend was amazed by the foie gras and lamb and I was as well with the lobster. Not to mention one of the best views in Dubrovnik!! Thrones fans will recognize it right away. Unfortunately I took the photo when it was dark.

I have gluten allergy (celiac) and the staff was so accommodating I could hardly believe it. Both times the server confidently told me they could prepare anything gluten free and was aware of the severity of the allergy. They brought out fresh baked gluten free bread, the best I have ever seen. If you are gluten free you know how bad gluten free bread usually is if it’s even offered. This bread looked so good I waited to make sure and ask before eating it because I thought it might be regular bread. Although the lobster typically comes with pasta, they were able to substitute it and it was perfect. They even baked me an extra batch of bread to take home. This was an unforgettable experience and i see why it is a Michelin restaurant. You have to go!!!!!

Thank you for a truly memorable evening. The food was Devine, the service impeccable, and the view and ambience Breathtaking! Prior communication directly with the restaurant was excellent. I am vegetarian, my husband has a nut allergy and we had our 5 year old daughter. All of us were looked after and very happy with the food. The signature cocktails were yummy and pretty. 
Must must must book here if visiting Dubrovnik
Absolutely amazing!! I was here with my family and we really enjoyed it and we will come back as soon as possible.
Best exprience ever!!! The food was great and the location was absolute perfect! I can only recommend this place!! The service was excellent!

We enjoyed every bit of our experience at Nautika. We were treated like royalty and it didn't stop from the moment we arrived until we left. The view is amazing and worth going before dark so you can relish it! The drinks were not only delicious but also made with lots of love. If you like an old fashioned, you absolutely must order one! 

The meal starting with an amuse bouche delighted our tastebuds and got us really excited for the rest of the meal. We enjoyed our starter and our meals and really can't say enough good things.

The service was over and beyond and I would recommend this place to anyone! It is a splurge but well worth it and unforgettable. 

P.S. GET THE SHRIMP AND POLENTA STARTER!! :)

We made a reservation months before, and made a request to have a seat with a view. When we arrived we were fortunate enough to be given the best seat on the terrace! Stunning views, and an overall amazing atmosphere. The staff were very attentive and the service was excellent. We both had the 5 course menu and all of the food was incredible. Best tuna tartare we’ve ever had. Overall incredible experience, highly recommend

It has everything! Amazing view, great service and friendly staff, delicions food and fine wines. Both fois gras and lamb was one of the best I ever had, Potato gratin with truffels was very interesting side dish and so were the scallopes with fresh truffels. The wine list is overwhelming but we followed the recomendation and the pairing worked wonders!
We are in awe, this place is beautiful and has the best view in the city. As a good Dubrovnik restaurant, the service did not disappoint and the food was great. I can’t wait to come back.

Nautika Restaurant lies on the very edge of the sea at Pile, alongside the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old City. From its unique terraces, you can enjoy a truly one of a kind view of the Adriatic and the fortresses of Lovrijenac and Bokar. One of their offers is lobrste from the Dalmatian island of Vis and delicacies from the local waters of the Adriatic.

This was our first restaurant in Croatia and OMG did it set the bar high. We were seated in the private area upstairs with the most amazing view I have ever seen. The food was incredible. Pretty sure we tried the whole menu. Michelin status for sure. White glove service, they explained every dish in a very detailed way. They had different olive oils for every dish and the waiter explained each one. We didn't know what to expect from the food in Croatia but this was very exceptional. The presentation was on point and every single little detail was better than the last.

While all of the restaurants we enjoyed in Croatia were beautiful or comfortable, this one, between the walls of the fortress and Lovrijenac was exceptionally beautiful, especially at night when thy are lit up. Start with a fruity cocktail and settle down to a romantic night. White gloved waiters are very attentive and know their stuff. The food was perfectly cooked (I had the foie gras and rack of lamb - best I have had). The sommelier can recommend a nice bottle of Croatian wine. You can dress casually, but the setting is not one for jeans (in my opinion).

Perfect location for a Dinner in Dubrovnik. Seaview and View at the Castle -- perfect for Sunset and at Night -- illuminated Castle.
perfect Service & Menu.
High quality of service staff and really impressive.

We went to all of the best restaurants in Old Dubrovnik unit we got to this one. WOW...beautiful old building that used to house the Navy. Nestled on a small cliff overlooking the sea . (for game of thrones fans you'll know the location). White glove service (not sure if was because of covid ). The food and the service was a 10. We had 7 people and it was all our favorite place.

Spending dinner with you love one, on one of the most beautiful terrace in the world , under the ancient Dubrovnik's wall would be enough! Having with that excellent food with great service give it an extra treat.
Food was excellent, we took tasting menu and didn't regret.
Price is high!
Outstanding place, with excellent view. Perfect service, perfect menu, perfect wine list. Definitely a place to visit!!!

having a negative experience of visiting Panorama restaurant (these are restaurants of the same chain), I went to this one with some apprehension. But I was wrong. Apparently the approach of the administration and staff is completely different. Full hospitality, delicious food and a huge selection of wine menus. The staff was great - charming, humorous, unobtrusive and at the same time very courteous! Highly recommended to visit. the price tag is high, but it justifies itself.

Had a wonderful dinner here with my wife for her birthday. Some of the freshest seafood we ate in Dubrovnik and worth the expense. Great location which is hard to beat. Our wait staff was very kind and attentive and made us feel very well taken after.

My Wife and i visitied Nautika on 6th August. I cannot praise this resraurant enough. The service, the setting and food are all as good as you can get. 
How this restaurant has no michelin star is beyond me. We visitied 360 restaurant four days later and not one single aspect of the restaurant was better. 
We have visited several michelin starred resaurants from all around europe. This is equal if not superior to all of them.
Honestly do not miss out on this as you are i for a real treat.

Thanks so much

Miles & Kimberley Dickson

We visited the restaurant a few days ago as a special occasion meal for my 25th birthday on our last night in Dubrovnik. The service was amazing - the staff couldn’t do enough for you and were so kind and explained all the ingredients and the origins. We shared the truffle tagliatelle to start - generous helpings of truffle and you could tell the pasta was homemade and so fresh - a little al dente which was great. I ordered the sea bass which was so tender and cooked beautifully on a bed of well seasoned vegetables and a delicious corn blend type mash. My partner had the lamb which he claimed was the best lamb he’s ever had - so tender and moist. Throughout the meal they brought homemade fresh bread with a variety of Croatian olive oils which we were told the history of. The wine list is extensive - we sampled alongside some cocktails - I had the spicy mojito which was good but not the best - could’ve been stronger and spicer. The negroni was served theatrically in a slim jug which was swirled around then poured - my partner enjoyed throughly. We were brought a range of complimentary chocolates with the bill - they were amazing - we were told they were also made in house which was a fantastic touch - I would’ve bought a whole box of the white chocolate with a praline filling. All in all - a great venue for special occasions or when in Dubrovnik for a truly sensational experience.

We had Black risotto and tuna stake as main course and it was amazing! White wine We had was also good, cant remember the name but waiter recommended it as the best of local ones.
Warm recommendation for this one, you wont regret

The first thing is staff that was so kind and helpful, even thou they were booked, they managed to provide a table for my daughter and me on the terrace with fantastic view. They make you feel very welcome! The food and wine were great! Unforgettable experience! Will come always when in Dubrovnik!

Our last night and we managed by chance to get great table overlooking the sea. This was fine dining at its best. We had eaten at all top trip advisor restaurants and I think whilst v expensive it was worth it for special occasion. 

Service impeccable. Cocktails amazing and food whilst smaller portions was exquisite. I’ll upload some photos but it’s worth visiting here for a treat. My partner and I love all food from authentic smaller back street cafes to fine dining. I think this was way above Panorama etc that whilst good for their scenic views etc, the food here Was just excellent and staff made it even better. Thank you for a wonderful last night and also for the complimentary dessert. Hopefully we will be back God willing again.

This was one of the best dining experiences we have had! The quality of the food was needless to say, amazing, particularly the risotto and veal. The wine was lovely - we had a Zinfandel and then finished with the ice wines, which were a real treat. The wait staff were friendly, knowledgeable, engaging, and really made the experience special for my wife and I. On top of all that, the views were lovely with the Dubrovnik Old Town framing the Adriatic Sea as the sun faded away. 

This was just an all-round wonderful experience!

Nautika has a jaw-dropping view from its terrace and that makes up for the standards of the food. It is by no means a place where food is not up to standards - I would rather state that it is not value for the money you pay.

Don't let that stop you if you want some prime snaps or enjoy company with the city, the sea and the rocks as a backdrop. 

We spend around €300 for starter and main dish (with bottle of wine) for two,

Everything about our meal here was amazing. The food and the intricate flavours but also the service and attentiveness of the staff throughout the evening. Oh yes and of course the view is brilliant!!

Being able to sit outside in this nicely decorated restaurant and to enjoy the astonishing sea view was remarkable. You get a wonderful mediterranean experience paired with excellent quality food. We got their 7 course tasting menu - each course was beautifully presented. Lots of fresh sea food, different kinds of award winning Dalmatian olive oils and interesting ingredients.

Staff is highly professional and very amusing. Big compliments. The sommelier was very kind as well and helped me choose the perfect wine. 

If you don’t drive I highly recommend to try their cocktails. Each and every one is nicely arranged and looks fantastic. Highly recommend.

We enjoyed a nice lunch here.
Very good food, nice beer but more expensive than expected.
Nautica is a great place and very nice position to sit..relax and enjoy your beer there.

If you are looking for a beautiful location, splurge worthy meal and impeccable service this is your spot. I booked well in advance and I think we had the best table in the entire restaurant. Valentino and his team are maestros of service. Could not have had a better dining experience. Thank you for making our big fancy night out into something so memorable.
We enjoy here very much...We came to dinner, very good food , small meal,but very nice presention. Very very expensive, it was four of us ,starters and main meal, with 1 drink 300 €.

I enjoy a great meal, I'm guessing that you do to otherwise you would not be suffering my witterings.
Nautica is a great place to enjoy a meal. The food is excellent and with a large range of seafood. We ate there a couple of times, (see, we returned that's a good sign. We were not disappointed. 
In addition to an excellent nosh you also get to occupy a brilliant people watching seat, if your into that sort of thing. And then there's the view.......

Good food you pay for the view
The tasting menu was good but the view is spectacular more so in the evening.
Cocktails are amazing👍
They have a no dog sign but the staff was super nice and still gave us a table on the terrace.
Very nice thank you👍

Beautiful restaurant with unbeatable view of Dubrovnik.

The restaurant is ranked as one of the best in Croatia, therefore we were expecting a bit more, nevertheless the food was delicious, fish fresh, food decorations interesting, service corresponding to the level of restaurant but really an expensive restaurant.

There are many excellent restaurants in Dubrovnik that have excellent food and are cheaper.

Spectacular restaurant just outside the city gates overlooking Old Town and fort, with incredible sunset views. Outside seating in the warmer months, blankets are available if you should get chilly. Professional, knowledgeable service, in a friendly engaging manner. We enjoyed the five-course tasting menu with the wine pairing. All of the dishes were creative and delicious and we eagerly anticipated each one. Outside tables are highly desirable, reserve well in advance.

If you want to experience memorable dinner in the heart of the Dubrovnik, definitely you try... especially the atmosphere of the restaurant and the wine selection was really great. feel adriatic while tasting fresh ingredients of the menu

Visited on the last day before their winter break. What an experience. We were very well looked after by Valentino who took time to talk about the menu’s and wine to help,us with our choices. The attention from him and the other staff made us feel very special. The location overlooking the bay and St Lawrence Fort is magnificent. The quality of the food and wine was outstanding. If you want fine dining and to feel special at the great location by the old town then this is it. It’s not surprising that this was voted one of the most romantic restaurants in the world.

3 friends abroad yet again for a long weekend. We always book superb places. But oh my goodness, this was the BEST. They excelled. 
We, as suggested asked for the best table on the balcony and the sea view was fab. 

We were so well looked after. One of us vegan, one vegetarian, and one big meat eater. We emailed ahead and they were so helpful, devising a menu for all of us. 

The food was totally delicious. Exceptionally so. The wine pairings perfect. 

Can't recommend it enough. Totally fabulous.
We arrived earlier in the day and had been recommended this restaurant by friends so looked forward to the experience. The service was good and the setting was excellent

We were lucky enough to eat here on a beautiful evening. We reserved a table in the "front row" of the terrace which has a wonderful view. We decided on the fish tasting menu and every course we had was excellent. The service from Valentino was exceptional, very professional & friendly. As you will realise this is not in the lower or medium price bracket to eat in but what you get is very good food, service & views and a memorable evening which we will remember for a long while.
Incredible food, great wine recommendations, friendly staff and wonderful views of the city walls. We had a lovely evening.

Magical View , very good food and a super service !!!! If you travel to this exceptional place dont leave without visiting this exceptional restaurant . The food was perfect and the service was outstanding , ask for a table on the second floor terrace ,the view is astonishing !!!

We have been there in a night. 2pax the place is nicely decorated. We chose the tasting menu. And the taste of the food is really good. The most impressive part is the waiter is telling all into very detail about the food the ingredients and what surprising us the most is the different kind of olive oil they use for each dish. That is really impressive. 

Comparing to the similar restaurant I have in other places for similar kind of food, I can say it is quite nice, to the standard. But not astonishing. And the price is quite expensive. But still the ambiance of the dinner is very nice. The interaction with the waiter makes me feel at home. I like the place.
Great view of the city walls and the ocean. Really pretty. Food was only ok though. Starters were good in general but the mains were not impressive.

All excellent. Delicious food. Elixir for the body and mind. Stunning view. My opinion the best of Dubrovnik. Service very very polite, friendly without being tired. Is expensive indeed but all are according to your expectations.

"Dubrovnik's Finest Restaurant" - and indeed it is!
The very location recommends Nautika for a special evening: view and atmosphere are outstanding and create the perfect setting for fine dining. The tasteful décor of the restaurant and the highly professional staff create a cultivated framework for the excellent cuisine. F&B Manager Tomislav Lonac had the kindness to show around and explain the design considerations - justly proud of the distinguished restaurant he himself was a true representative of.
Placed on the terrace on a warm October evening, we had chosen the 5-course fish menu with accompanying wines - and this proved a perfect choice indeed, excellent to the very detail. The service and information given by our evening's host Valentino on the Croatian wines, olive oils, the individual dishes was outstanding; we together enjoyed an unusually pleasant 'food experts' discussion of ingredients and potential variations. 
Nautika is an special experience - and a very special memory. All respect and admiration for the outstanding team; it would be our greatest pleasure to return one day.

The food was hands-down the best we've had in Croatia during our 10 days there. We sat on the terrace and the ambience and view was magical. Staff was friendly and attentive. Really happy with our visit.

The place is beautiful, with a terrace with sea/fortress views. Very professional and friendly staff, they speak several languages. The extended wine list couldn’t be better. We had the chefs suggested menu, everything was delicious

A wonderful dinner and evening with friends. We booked a table and sat outside. We had the most amazing views on a warm October evening. The service was outstanding, perfect attention to detail with lots of information provided about the menu and wines etc, including information about the local Croatian produce. We were blown away with the service and I’ve never had a gin and tonic served in bird cage before! Would love to go back one day in the future. Thank you team.

location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
review: Totally worth it. The service, location and most importantly food were all just perfect. Yes, it’s expensive, BUT we had two soups, and two starters, a shared dessert, a beer and a glass of sommelier-selected wine for about £120. Which, when added to the fantastic complimentary amuse bouche, the huge selection of breads and Croatian olive oils, and a couple of digestifs on the house, was more than enough food for us. We decided to “splash out” and we didn’t regret it. All while overlooking one of the most recognisable game of thrones shooting locations. Would recommend Nautika to true foodies and the prudent alike.

Visited Nautical on the last day of our 5 day break for a special family meal celebration.
Yes, this is a very, very expensive restaurant but the wine list is amazing and the food was beautifully presented and cooked.
We decided to not have the tasting menu but opted for 4 starters, main courses of lamb and also lobster tail finished with 2 deserts and 2 Irish coffees. All beautifully presented and cooked perfectly.
Total cost with tip was around £120 per person which was made worse with the terrible UK pound exchange rate due to imminent Brexit.
Perfect place for a one off special treat for the family or a romantic meal for 2.

What a class restaurant we visited and the food 
Drinks and beauty of location view impressed us too much.staff professional and best service provided 
We will surely visit next tine again
Absolutely amazing view over the waterfront. Good drinks. We didn't eat here though, so can't say much about the cuisine.
Definitely one of the most romantic restaurants in the world. Amazing view, delicious dinner, and impeccable service to celebrate our anniversary.

username: Noel Patrick M, Lord & Lady Weston
review:
Everything about this restaurant is superb.
We started with first class cocktails (Margarita and a French 75 ) in the Bar where we were entertained by one of the Best Piano players I have heard in years. As a Bonus, we watched a Japanese guest couple dance a fine tango - they too were superb!!

We ate on the Balcony with one of the best views in Dubrovnik. The service was very professional and faultless. It was a warm night so we went for the Croatian Rose which was great. The wine list is HUGE, and very very impressive with wine from all over the world.

Food was faultless throughout

It is on the expensive side but then it is a deserving world-class restaurant at the very top of the game. I saw it is in Conde Nast Top 5 restaurants. It deserve to be there!!

We went for birthday celebrations and can’t fault at all the service, quality and setting. Overlooking the water and the fort it is stunning. Despite having a time slot the service wasn’t rushed and was so attentive you felt you were the most important people in the restaurant. The wine selection is vast but the recommended locally produced wine was excellent and reasonably priced. All of the food was first class and because we weren’t hurried in any way we ate dessert too. No wonder this has the number one rating on Trip Advisor.

Firstly, location. Couldn’t be bettered but it’s no good if the rest of it isn’t right! Which it was! Food delicious - one of the best steaks I’ve eaten for quite some while - and impeccable service but not too in your face. Excellent wine list. With the sommelier’s help, we chose a mid-price Croatian Pinot Noir, which was delicious. Would definitely recommend and will return on our next visit to Dubrovnik.
Wonderful food and service. Romantic view outside and lovely indoor dining. We went twice because we had such a good experience .

This restaurant is a true delight. The location is superb and offers views of the fort. The staff is so professional and friendly. Our waiter, Maro, was so fun to chat with and very helpful with our food and wine pairing. Lastly the food, wine and dessert cocktails were all fantastic.

Nautika elevates their cocktail service to an art form. Many of their signature cocktails are beautifully prepared table side and served with panache. Come thirsty. You will not be disappointed. 

We were here for a birthday celebration, so our group pre-selected our multi-course menu. I chose beef carpaccio for my taste, vegetable soup, tuna fillet as my appetizer, the veal entree, and chocolate cake as my dessert. Based upon my meal and the beautiful dishes that were appearing and disappearing around the table, everyone was delighted with their choices. 

While you may prefer the dinning room for your meal, we selected the second floor, covered balcony to enjoy our dinner and the spectacular sunset. The service was exactly what you would expect from a restaurant of this quality - very attentive, but never intrusive.

We were fortunate to get a great table outside in the front row center offering great views of the sea, Dubrovnik walls and fortress to our right. Almost everything we ordered - Grilled sea bass fish of the day, the sea bass menu entree, the tagliatelle with black truffle starter and the cuddle fish starter delicious. The only slight disappointment was the grilled tuna entree - it was good, but didn’t measure up to the other dishes. The service is very professional. Although the waitstaff were in suits, most of the patrons were casually dressed. The wine list is a three inch thick book. With sommelier assistance, we ordered an excellent local wine. Nautika was by far the most expensive meal we had on our trip, but we all thought the restaurant provided good value. 

We arrived early for a drink so we could experience the sunset from the patio.

My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary here. Absolutely incredible.
Sit outside , be there for sunset. One of the most romantic dinners we have ever had.
Swallows flying , sunsetting , live piano music, on the water just fantastic.
Make sure you order one of their special cocktails, they are a show unto themselves. 
Food was so delicious, clearly the best we had in Croatia
Nautika is a must when in Croatia.
Go bring the person u love ❤️ most in the world and enjoy each other.

Excellent service by both the waiter and sommelier, delicious food with a thoughtful extra sweet treat at the end, delicious food (lamb and sea bass), and a beautiful view. I appreciated that our waiter gave us suggestions when we asked. Nice dinner, overall.

We took a chance and asked for a table without a reservation. Luckily they could fit us in with time constraints but that wasn't a problem. I was glad we got a table because the food and service is impeccable. After ordering our food, we were presented with appetisers which were very nice. Our starters were Mini Garden soups which were presented with a sample of the ingredients on the rim of the bowl. The server then told us what exactly was in the soup which was a nice touch. The soup was delicious. The mains were Sea Bass fillet on a bed of tomatoes and with spinach and a vanilla cream and Veal Fillets with potato gratin, pea mousse and malvasija sauce. Both these mains were accompanied by a speech from the server again about the ingredients which were enlightening. The food was beautifully presented and the food was cooked perfectly. The wine lit is extensive and the sommelier on hand at all times to pour your drink. There was never any rush to move you on. The prices are a bit steep but you are paying for quality food and fantastic service. Why has this restaurant not got a Michelin Star?.

This restaurant was a great option to have dinner with my girlfriend.
Great location right in the old town, where everything happens.
The view is more than overwhelming with a great service.
Food is really nice and there's a wide variety to choose from.
Price was fair

This I must say was a great place to eat. It’s not your average restaurant. You can tell from the price, but inside I beautiful and the service is top class. I went with my girlfriend on my birthday and we got table on the terrace just by the wall looking out on the fort and the walls of old town Dubrovnik. You hear the soft sound of water under you and you see the stars over you. Happened to be a wedding in the fort and they had fireworks out just in front. The staff was amazing and I would like to name Mario specially who served us. He was great. I proposed to my girlfriend and he helped me plan and bring the ring in a special box. Well we sat there til everybody left, we could not get enough. Delicious food, we took lobster tail and the 7 tasting menu. So good. Thanks for the memory

Fantastic location, superb food, arguably the best service I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. But, invariably good food & service comes at a cost, so be prepared, but that said, it is worth it & I wouldn’t hesitate to re-visit it is truly superb.

My two friends and I visited on Sunday 15th September with a terrace table booked.

We all ordered the 7 course tasting menu. Our favourites were the beef carpaccio and the veal, both of which were utterly delicious. The spicy tomato sauce alongside the cuttlefish was perhaps not our favourite, and for me the tuna with fennel 3 ways not my favourite (I don't like fennel, apparently!).

Dessert was exceedingly sweet, and my two friends didn't eat it as it was just "too much" - our waiter insisted on providing us with a replacement which really was a generous gesture.

Our wines were delicious, an istrian Malvazija was particularly enjoyable. 

Our meal finished with a complementary liqueur (choice of cherry, plum or carob bean -yum!).

The service was second to none, just the right amount of attentiveness. Particular thanks to our own waiter Mario, although at times we had 4 people serving us! The live piano music was very enjoyable too. 

If you are looking for a special meal and don't mind footing the tab for a rare treat, Nautika gets our vote.

If you look for outstanding food, extraordinary service and a great scenery, Nautika is the place to go!
The service and the quality of the offered dishes is extraordinary. 
Thanks, I really like to recommend this restaurant.

Lovely position overlooking the sea. Wide choce of food beautifully presented and extensive wine list with a very knowledgeable sommelier. A little more epxepnsive than I had expected but as we had such a pleasant evening it didn't seem to matter.

A great way to end a superb day in Dubrovnik. We sat on the terrace overlooking the bay where “Game of Thrones” was filmed. 
The food was fantastic. We had Sea Bass in Salt which was truly exceptional. 
I highly recommend a visit.

We visited Nautika recently and had a great meal here, even though it was unseasonably wet. Particular highlights were the vegetable soup, with the ingredients lined up along the edge of the bowl and the veal steak which was superb. An excellent wine list and free flowing olive oil as well. Highly recommended.

We had a fabulous evening at Nautika. It is a beautiful restaurant, the food is delicious and very high quality, the cocktails were stunning from the smoked old fashioned to the best espresso martini I have ever had. The real standout was the service. Highly professional but warm, friendly and knowledgable. Just loved it!

Fantastic end to a lovely weekend away. The food and service were of the highest standard and thanks to all the team for their friendly and attentive service from start to finish. Rajko our waiter was great and Darko provided a perfect suggestion for our wine.
Would recommend this venue to anyone visiting the city.

Food was excellent, as was service. An element of theatre to the service - a bit over the top perhaps. Quite expensive - excellent food representing much better value for money, is easily found at alternative restaurants in the old town.

such a fantastic venue - it was our 30th anniversary and the restaurant was a perfect place. the appetizers, meal and dessert drink were just perfect. we shared a fresh fish per the waiter recommendation it was perfect . Highly recommend this place especially if you have a special night in mind.
Food was amazing especially the lamb and chocolate fantasy. Service was the best I’ve seen in Croatia. And the views were very romantic. I would definitely come back

These 3 words sells this incredible place set within a small harbor with views of the Adriatic and the old City walls. Food is authentic loved and carefully executed. Shout out to to the Markos and thank you very much for your kind service.
Had a wonderful meal at Nautika. Service was second to none and the food was delicious. Highly recommend.
We visited in a family group of nine of varying ages. Great place, good food, excellent friendly service and all reasonably priced in a wonderful outdoor setting just outside the town walls.

We knew from the start this would be special from the reviews, website and photos we had seen previously. It didn't disappoint and was a meal which we will never forget not only because of the romantic and amazing views but also because of the impeccable service and truly scrumptious food. This is one of those restaurants which means you are really spoiling yourselves and we felt like royalty throughout the whole night. If you want a special evening with truly out of this world views then you must eat at this restaurant.

We booked for a special event, when we arrived we were upgraded to a fantastic table on the terrace. The service, food, wine and atmosphere were perfect. At the end of the evening a boat wandered into the bay and launched an amazing firework display. No idea what event it celebrated.

We had a super corner front row table overlooking the city walls. So the atmosphere was great. And the food matched it. After a tagliatelle with truffle we had the most perfect veal fillets. Both cooked just right, one medium and one medium rare. The wine was Grk from the Bire winery in Croatia, which was so so good. All of this comes at a price but it was simply delightful.
The serving staff were all top-flight professional and looked after you with amuse- bouche and truffles ( as we didn’t feel like a dessert). Also got olive oil tastings during the meal. A good knowledge sommelier added to the experience and proved his skill with his choice.

This restaurant is simply Devine. We arrived without notice and were able to get in on a cancellation we had the best table in the house, views into the small bay at the castle and watched the sunset. Aside from the view and the ambience, the food was sublime, I can’t recommend enough. The wine was excellent and the service was amazing. If you want a top notch meal with superb service go here!

Unbelievable is all I can say. From the spectacular view overlooking the Adriatic to the gorgeous food presentation to the service to the meal itself - I’d give it 6 circles if I could (and 5 $$$$$) so be prepared. Best fois gras ever tasted, delicious fish soup appetizer and sea bass entree and yummy veal. The white chocolate and raspberry mousse was the best! Check out the drink photo with the rose petals. Just beautiful all around!

My other half booked this for us weeks before we were due to go on holiday, we had a side terrace seat overlooking the fort, it was stunning. 
The staff are so lovely and very helpful especially when it comes to the wine bible, it is huge, but if you explain what you like they can recommend the best options. 
The menu isn’t massive but I always think this is a good thing, everything on it looked amazing. 
Various olive oils from different regions were paired with the bread, and other courses, which I thought was a lovely touch and were some of the best oils I’ve had.
To start we had a complimentary amuse bouche which was lovely.
We then had the bisque and the risotto to start and then the lobster and the sea bass all of which was amazing, super fresh and perfectly cooked and the presentation was wonderful, for dessert we had the trio of chocolate, which was so lovely. 
After dessert we were moved to one of the prime tables that had become free which I thought was a lovely touch as these tables are usually booked up 3-6 months in advance. The waiters offer to take your picture and have no issues taking many and from different angles too, nothing is too much trouble for them.
The evening was rounded off with a complimentary glass of traditional liqueur, it’s super strong. 
This is truly a beautiful restaurant, with stunning food and wonderful staff, I can’t recommend it enough.

An amazing evening. We had a beautiful table overlooking the sea and the most amazing food. What lifted the experience up further were the waiters. They couldn’t have been more helpful or attentive. Well worth the hype.

We were looking for somewhere a little special to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We were extremely lucky to have found this restaurant. From the minute we arrived to the moment we left we were made to feel special! Attention to detail was perfect. The staff were both supportive and attentive - helping with the selection of drinks to match the amazing food we had chosen. We couldn't have planned a better experience if we had tried. Food was worth a 'michelin' star and the service second to none. Without hesitation I recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a truly amazing experience. I am not going to spoil this review with any specifics as I hope you also get the opportunity to experience the magic they have to offer

I was super pumped about this meal and Nautika did not disappoint. Everything was perfect. The view, the service, and most of all the food. Ivan was our waiter and he was flawless. My husband got the seven course tasting menu and I did the five course so we could try as much as possible. We also each did wine pairings. I still cannot believe how good the wine in Croatia is. 

Our favorites were the shrimps served on polenta and the tuna steak. If you do the tasting menu I highly recommend the wine pairing as well because each wine took the food to another level.

We will definitely be back next time we return to Croatia.

Best meal that we had in Dubrovnik. Great service. The preparation of the Old Fashioned was phenomenal (torching pine cone for smoke flavor as one part) and the drink when completed was the best of its kind I have ever consumed. We had a five course meal for a large table and it was superb. At first I thought portions would be too small, but I was precisely full and not over-filled at the end. Taste of each course was sublime. Highly recommended.
We had a fantastic dinner here for 8. The food, service and view were amazing ! I highly recommend this restaurant !

We enjoyed a lovely meal on the terrace overlooking the harbor and fortress. The owner and waiter provided excellent service, very attentive but not overly so. My “salad of choice” was beautiful and delicious. My grilled lamb was the best I’ve ever eaten. My wife enjoyed her veal as well. Nautika isn’t inexpensive but is a lovely spot for a special meal.
