Don't miss Nautika while in Dubrovnik.. its a must.... the food was exceptional and staff extremely friendly and accommodating .. be sure to get a table on the terrace for a romantic evening dinner and amazing view of Fort Lovrijenac at night.. wine list is also amazing.. we will be back.. Dave & Sandee

Be careful you’ve booked the Correct restaurant as there is a chain. We didn’t and the staff very quickly accommodated us.
Food was exceptional but the staff are the true gems of this establishment. Their knowledge of the menu and wine list was staggering-they advised us well!

Went to this restaurant with my wife for our anniversary,
It is located just outside the walls of the old town but in a great spot overlooking the sea. It has seating inside and out but you need to be seated out side to take in the views and atmosphere. If you can book well in advance and get the tables that immediately look over the sea but I imagine they are hard to come by if not the other tables outside are lovely too.
We had the Croatian Tomac champagne which was excellent and compared to the more expensive branded champagne a bargain at £100. The sommelier was excellent who gave us some great advice of what wine to have and the background on it. The service was excellent which believe me in most Croatian Hotels and restaurants is hard to find especially with a smile on their faces. We were then taken through the menu which was five star especially when you bear in mind that I have eaten in many fancy restaurants in London. Price wise compared to London around the same but cheaper than the many fancy restaurants that we have again in London.
Nice touches inside too with the decor and pianist.
Keep doing what your doing guys its totally worth it.
Will be back!

This has to be one of the best resturants in Old Town Dubrovnick. The location is stunning, the staff are very polite and professional, and nothing is too much trouble. The food and wine were exquisit. The sommelier was very well informed regarding the wine list and we respected his choice to best accompany our meal. I would recommend the fois grois for starters, and the veal for main, it was outstanding! I would also advise that one books a table if one expects to be front line where the best views are to be enjoyed. A first class resturant on every level.

We decided to visit Dubrovnik for the wine (Zinfandel) and the food.
Nautika certainly showcases with distinction their talents.
The atmosphere is presented with a layer of pride. This value for the client is created by the staff. 
From the greeting at the door to your beautiful table, one can tell a special evening is about to begin.
It is clear their intended purpose is to satisfy the customer and their expectations. 
The quality of dedication and care is obvious in the number of tables served by the waiter, five. 

Additionally, the wine steward was available to help with the right pairing. 
Throughout the experience, the Maître D greeted us upon arrival, visited us, and catered to our every need.
The evening was ours to enjoy.
We had time and assistance with our menu selections. 
The chef's commitment to quality was apparent with the  preparation of the food and the artistic design.

This restaurant has been recommended as a place to celebrate special events like anniversaries and birthdays.
Isn't life a special event?
 We recommend this restaurant as a place to celebrate life.
 We are  grateful for discovering  Nautika  and the opportunity celebrate there.
From salad and fish soup via sea bass to chocolate dessert - with beautiful views and excellent, unpretentious service - in short, our best dinner and evening ever. Thank you for the love drinks!

Views are fab and lovely music
 excellent service staff could not do enough for you top class restaurant. Thank you.

Our family of seven were center stage on the veranda for a special meal. Inside, we passed through beautiful paneled dining rooms on the eay to dining al fresco.

Service was supurb. Cocktails well made. Food ordinary. Most of us had the whole fish which was well prepared. There were no outstanding moments to report.

Nautika was on my list before we even got to Dubrovnik, but we kind of ended up there on the fly. We were jumping off cliffs at Buza Bar about midday and figured we'd stop by Nautika for late lunch after (for some reason I relied on a review that listed this place as "casual dining"). Unfortunately, they don't serve lunch. Fortunately, they didn't judge us when we showed up a bit later for dinner in day-time SUPER casual attire (my boyfriend was still in his banana print swim shorts and non-matching tee) and gave us a table, because this was an experience we couldn't have possibly missed! It's a casual experience masked as a fine dining restaurant in the best way possible - the food and ambiance rival any Michelin starred restaurant I've ever been to around the world, but the staff is so unpretentious, fun-loving and relaxed that you feel completely at ease.

We were seated at 6pm and were told that dinner would last about 2.5 hours. They offer both an a la carte menu and 2 tasting menus - we generally prefer to share a bunch of dishes so we actually tried a bit more than the tasting menu was offering and ordered exactly what we wanted for about the same price. We started with cocktails, which they take very seriously - the presentation is impeccable and despite the fact that this place is a white tablecloth fine dining spot, they don't judge you for "doin it for the gram" in the least. Our server Martin was absolutely fantastic. He gave us phenomenal recommendations, was very light (unlike what you'd expect at a fine dining venue) and we truly could've spent the whole night chatting with him.

Here's what we ordered, and we loved it all:
- Homemade Fish Soup
- Shrimp Served on Polenta
- Adriatic Scallops
- Seabass Filet
- Lamb Dalmatian Style
- A super chocolatey dessert

On the 1st of September my girlfriend and I visited Nautika for dinner. We were so impressed by everything from the pleasant greeting we received as we entered to the service we received at the table. The food was amazing. After dinner but before dessert I asked my girlfriend to marry me. I didnt want to draw attention as to not embarrass my girlfriend. She said yes. The Maître D spotted it with his eagle eye from across the restaurant and brought us over a bottle of Champagne and congratulated us. They couldn't of done anymore for us. The view from our table was so incredibly beautiful. I couldn't recommend this restaurant highly enough.
Make sure you get an outside table looking over the water. One of the best places to be for a great meal at a reasonable price.

Nautika has an idyllic setting and the food is up there with any fine dining restaurant that we have been to before. We had the 7-course tasting menu with matched wines and (we discovered) matched olive oil pairings. Although difficult to pick a highlight from such exquisite courses, the cuttlefish did warrant particular praise. Our waiter, Valentino, was extremely helpful and interesting. I was mainly motivated to write a review on here by some of the other reviews criticising the price- putting it simply, you get what you pay for and it compares very favourably with other restaurants of similar quality (few that there are).

We booked about a month in advance for 4 adults and 1 child (4 years of age). This place is next to none for quality of service! From the moment we walked in, to the minute we walked out, it was a top-notch experience.
Our group had the lobster, tuna, and beef, and they also specially prepared a chicken pasta dish for my daughter. The lobster came out on top!!! The wine was fantastic and the atmosphere and views surreal. Well worth the planning and pricey menu. We were told they only host 120 dinners an evening - hence the reservations required during the season - so get your spot. 
(as an aside, could do without the live piano GoT theme songs being played - but that's also coming from someone who hasn't seen a single episode.)

In truth we found this restaurant at the last minute on TA. We called and couldn't get in. I called the Hotel concierge and they got us in. When we got to the restaurant the hostess said that if we were ok with having the table for just 1.5 hours they could give us the best table they have. Otherwise it would have to be just a bit farther back on the terrace. We went with the best table. And it was! right against the edge of the terrace with the best view in the place. We hit it right at sunset. 1 of the top tables I have ever sat at. Service was great.Food was fantastic. Sommelier was really a good guy and helped us find some reasonably priced gems. Truly a great experience.

This restaurant is in a lovely setting overlooking the Fort and the sea. The staff are very welcoming, efficient, polite and professional. Some of the best service we've experienced. The food was well cooked and tasty but the fish of the day (John Dory) was exceedingly expensive for what it was and the price should have been clarified when we ordered the dish. Only minimal side vegetable dish was included with the fish. If we'd ordered some of the other mains we may have had a different experience and certainly the cost would not have been quite so high.

We went for the view. 6:30 reservation allowed us to see in daylight and at night when Fort and city wall are lit up. Service was impeccable! Food is high priced(paying for spectacular view) but excellent. Make reservation well in advance.
The restaurant is located in the heart of Dubrovnik, from the terrace there is a very good view of the old town and the sea, there they serve very good drinks and food

This was a truly great experience at the top terrace overlooking the sea. We had the 5 course fish menu with a Croatien 2010 Risling. Everything perfect with the polite guidance of Mario. 

Everything about the restaurant is recommedable

We had dinner here to celebrate a 60th birthday. Our table was on the terrace with the water and fort as our backdrop, the location is simply stunning and makes for a very special dining experience. Food was beautiful and the sommelier recommended a fantastic wine. The staff were very attentive and friendly and they made the night extra special when they arrived with birthday desert and sang “happy birthday “. 
I would certainly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion.

We had a beautiful corner table on the second floor terrace overlooking Fort Lovrijenac which was built to protect Old Town. Just a stunning view....no other way to say it. Please request corner table on 2nd floor terrace, you won’t be disappointed! This is a very expensive dining experience but very memorable. They have an extensive wine list with a lot of local wines plus international options as well. We elected to go with an aged wine (2009) from Brac. It was excellent but also quite pricey. My wife and I both started with the Foie Gras which included 2 very large pieces..a huge portion actually. It was excellent although maybe 10-15 seconds overdone. That doesn’t sound like much but when you are talking such a short time to cook seconds matter. Still we loved it! We also both had the veal tenderloin. It was expertly prepared and a nice portion as well. Food was delicious! Service was very professional. Our server had a deep knowledge about wines and this wine selection. Overall, it was an amazing evening!

Our group had a private upper balcony sitting for dinner in one of the most scenic locations in Dubrovnik. As the sun set over the water and the light came on to highlight the walls of The Old City we dined on some amazing dishes. The lobster bisque was outstanding and our mains consisted of the most perfectly cooked fish and veal. Make sure you leave room for dessert with both options we ate being exceptional. Friends with dietary needs were delighted with the options available to them also. Wait staff were very attentive and friendly and we would absolutely recommend a visit to Nautika if you want a fine dining experience. Bookings essential.

I will not start by the lovely view and very tasty food well prepared by an excellent chef; but by the extremely lovely hospitality of all staff, especially our main Waiter “Mario”. 
It is because of his politeness and friendly welcome; my children fell in love with this amazing restaurant.
All the food is well prepared, amazing presentation, the deserts are not to be missed.

A visit here will be an ever last memory. Very attentive and helpful staff to assist in your menu choice. The food is prepared to perfection and your accompanying wine selection is great. Lovely ambiance. Enjoy

The restaurant is located just outside the Old town walls, between the Old town and The Fort. We were given a table by the wall, overlooking both the fort and the old town. Great setting.
Food was excellent, as was the service - very friendly staff. Although I thought I had chosen what I wanted to eat, the waiter recommended alternative dishes and what a good choice!! Very well presented dishes and very tasty. 
The wines recommended with each of the dishes were excellent too. Nice touch also with the free cocktails offered to us by the management for our anniversary.
It is not a cheap meal - not by a distance, but it was worth every penny.
A very enjoyable experience.
Beautiful view. Food and drinks were excellent (one of the top old fashioned I had. Mario was great!

The food here was delicious. We had the seafood trio appetizer and sea bass for dinner and both were amazing. The service is outstanding with friendly waitstaff that go above and beyond. The view is absolutely beautiful of the water and was a nice place to watch the sunset while eating. We would highly recommend this restaurant. It is well worth the price.

Definitely a 5 star restaurant. We tried our luck and we got seated at 7 pm. 

Best meal we had in Croatian. 

Best service for restaurant- hands down. 
Ambience is amazing- facing the fortress. 

I got to try their pre-fix menu (5 course). My family friends ordered ala carte. 

I highly recommend getting the pre fix. 
If you like wine, they have sommelier who was helpful on the selection. 

Each course of meal was amazing- they used different olive oil to accompany the meal. Got to buy a few bottles at the duty free airport for half the price in Dubrovnik. 

Highly recommend going to this place.
Excellent meal!! The best meal we had in Dubrovnik! Quite expensive but most definitely worth it. Excellent food and staff.

Visited the restaurant last night.
Wow, it is worth every penny and made our holiday extra special.
The service is amazing, Valentino made us feel very welcome and made recommendations about the menu. 
Stunning views, book a table outside on the terrace.

Ate in this restaurant, after reading great reviews. great location overlooking the sea. We choose a tasting menu with wine pairing, which was experience but well worth it. Food was amazing, the service was second to none from all the staff they were very attentive which made the whole experience more special
This place was amazing. Service was phenomenal. The food was insanely delicious. Make sure you book weeks in advance and ask for a table outside with the view. Breathtaking!

I booked this restaurant a month before we traveled but for some reason we were not on their reservation list! The manger took charge straight away assuring us he would find us a table and while we waited to enjoy a complimentary glass of champagne for the booking confusion.

Shortly after we were given a table upstairs inside a terrace which we were grateful but would have been nice to be outside on the main terrace but we ordered drinks and ordered food. The manager then came up and told us he had a table on the main terrace which we could move to which we did and the views are amazing. 

The service in this restaurant is impeccable so professional and the way the manager went above and beyond to make sure we had a nice meal really was great.

The food is unbelievable the best we had in Dubrovnik I can’t highly recommend this restaurant enough. I would like to say a huge thank you to the manager and staff for making our evening one to remember.

Location: over looking the tvrdava bokar, right outside the old town
Ambiance: where elegance meets history 
Host: the duty manager was extremely friendly and hospitable. 
Service: Ivan was amazing, he really took hospitality to the next level. 
Food: Looks and contents. They have specialty drinks, delicious artisanal palate teasers appetizers, main courses and dessert. 
Price: pricey but worth every penny
Tip: book a table outside by the tvrdava bokar castle

Go go go! Excellente location, excellent service, excellent food, excellent wine! I think I’ll go again! Book ! If you don’t, you might not have this great pleasure. And, by the way, try Raspberry Queen for desert! Wow!!!!!!!

You need a reservation. Especially if you want to be on the terrace. We called on the day and managed to get a table for two on the entrance terrace which actually ended up having a great atmosphere and still overlooking the walls. The food was faultless and was presented extremely well. I had two dishes from the appetisers menu for main. I asked our excellent waiter, Valentino, whether this was ok (rather than choosing a dish from the main meals) and he said of course! Whatever I wanted. Which was nice. I had truffle tagliatelle and scallops. My partner had the veal, which I tried. The veal was so good, it’s what I would recommend. We shared a dessert which our waiter chose for us and then ended the meal with a choice of grappa. Having been to a few 1* and 1 2* restaurants in the UK, there doesn’t seem to be anything missing from this place and I am sure it will get a star soon!

The quality of the staff were above and beyond. Especially our waiter Ivan. He went out of his way to get us what we needed. The attention to detail from the journey over olive oils & presentation of our cocktails were very impressive. The view was spectacular. The mains themselves were good but not amazing. For the price we wanted the quality of cooking to be a bit better. Presentation was very good.

We visited this restaurant for a meal the day after our wedding. We booked in advance and got the best table in the restaurant overlooking the sea and the fort and the city walls. 
Service was fabulous, they put slot of effort into making sure you know what goes into the food but also make a big effort with the cocktails as they make them in front of you. 
The food was impeccable. 
We could not of asked for anything more from this great restaurant and will highly recommend to anyone.

We decided to treat ourselves to dinner here on a recent visit to Dubrovnik – the eye-watering prices mean that it is not somewhere you will eat every night, but for me it was worth every Kuna.

Firstly the location is stunning just outside the City Walls with all outside tables having a sea view. Before dinner we sat on the terrace and had a smoky mojito which for me was even better than the original Cuban classic thanks to the smoked sugar and hint of lavender. For starters, I had the Prawns with Goats Cheese and Almonds on Polenta – I have to say I was a bit sceptical about this dish as on paper shellfish paired with a strong goats cheese and nuts sounds a bit of a strange combination. Happy to report though that the chef proved me wrong as it was delicious with all the flavours working really well together.

For the main, I had the veal fillet in a wine sauce served with truffled potato gratin. Again the cooking was on point as the truffle did not over-power the rest of the dish and the veal was extremely tender. The OH had the beef fillet which again was cooked to perfection. All of this was washed down with a bottle of the local Posip wine. The wait staff were fantastic taking time to explain the dishes and the wine and our glass was never empty. Another nice touch was that each dish was paired with a local olive oil whose origins again were all expertly explained by the wait team.

As mentioned this place is by no means cheap, but I figure that you have to treat yourself once in a while, especially on holiday, and the cooking and ingredients are without doubt of a very high standard. Would definitely recommend.

We have heard so much about this place and were lucky to get a table together with our friends a Wednesday evening. We were greeted in the entrance by a couple of very nice waiters that took us to our table. Then it was a treat all the way long - a fishsoup for starter that tasted like heaven, we had both brancine and tunafish as main and they were also extremely good and as desert different of the desert menue and they were all to die for. Together with this we had fantastic wine from the amazing winelist - I have never seen a winelist this complete - all the best croatian wines you can have - and not only that but also different ages of them. The service was also as good as you can have. All in all 10 POINTS for everything - Thank you Nautika !!!!
Visited Nautika on our first evening in Dubrovnik and had a wonderful table with a stunning view. The food set the bar, the local wine excellent. We had a wonderful evening.

We had a great food experience at this restaurant. We had a table at the terrace where the view is fantastic. We had the 5 course set menu which was delicious with some good Croatian wine selected to us by the sommelier. The staff were friendly, efficient and very skillful. By far our best meal in Croatia It does not come cheap but it’s worth it.

This was by far our most expensive dinner in Croatia, but it was also our most memorable. The food was amazing, service was excellent. View just speaks for itself. Treat yourself and come here for dinner. You won't regret it.

This is a gem of a restaurant in the heart of Dubrovnik. Just outside of the old City gates sits this pearl of a restaurant. We sat on the balcony near the water. While we did bake in the sun for the first 20 minutes, the views, the service, the overall ambience, and the cocktails made us quickly forget the glaring sun. The food here was good, but the beverage service from an outstanding wait staff and sommelier was unforgettable. We truly.enjoyed our evening. Not to miss are the signature cocktails..

Nautika Restaurant is an oasis just outside the walls of the old city of Dubrovnik. The food is top notch and the staff exceedingly attentive, but the view is spectacular, whether you are a history buff or thrive on Game of Thrones!

We spent a week on a yacht, island hopping. Food was good during the week, but at the end of our trip, we stayed two nights in Dubrovnik and really wanted to have a fine dining meal. It was also our wedding anniversary, and when I asked my hotel concierge to book, he immediately suggested Nautika. 

It was perfect location, We had a perfect table on the terrace facing the Lovrijenac. Service was attentive, and professional. Great food, especially the fresh grilled fish. My sons loved it so much, they finished it to the one. It was not a small fish ! 

We had nice cocktails, and good pastas as well. 

My boys got to perform and play on the piano in the reception too. That was FUN. 

The only imperfection to that evening was, our hotel concierge booked our table and informed Nautika it was our anniversary night and we were there to celebrate. A cake was reserved for us supposedly. There was no sign of any notice from the restaurant staff. We celebrated with our kids elsewhere eating Gelato after dinner.

First of all, very romantic area. To see historical monuments and hear the sea, fantastic. 
Food is great. Mario organizes service very good. 
Price is high but quality is also high

We had an excellent time at Nautika! The service and food was excellent. We had some minor issues with one of the main course which led to some more troubles with longer waiting time but the staff went lenghts to make everything okay for us again and more than reimbursed our discomfort. Truly a 5star experience.

As it has all been said, perfect service, great food and great wine. We chose a Croatian Sparkling and a Pinot Grigio- both very acceptable and on the lower priced side of the extensive wine list.
As Australians we prefer our meat a lot less done- the lamb and veal were still tender- but we prefer them pink.
3 courses with Wine and coffee came to $450 aud per couple. So a long way from the mosr expensive- but up there, I feel the price matche dthe food, service and location

We was recommended this restaurant by friends and tried to get a booking but they was fully booked. However we tried anyway and they managed to get us a table for 2, as we was looking at the menu the manager came over and said they had a no show and would we like to move to the sea view seats which made the visit even more special. 
The food is to die for and the service from the team is second to none. The cocktails were fantastic and even made ones not on the menu. The cost for the two of us was £310 buy certainly worth it and a great way to celebrate our anniversary.

Nautika has it all. The view, the ambiance, the attentive staff, an excellent sommelier, and delicious food. It does come at a high price, but for us it was a true treat. The filet and sea bass dishes were excellent and creative. Definitely order the Dingac wine!

Lots of small pleasant professional touches made this meal a great experience. 

Most notable was our waiter Martin’s expertise, he seemed to know exactly what we wanted and when. 

One of us had a starter but they gave both of us plates to enjoy it as it was so nice, the effort they made presenting it was enough to tempt us both into having a glass of wine with this course too, which we didn’t regret as it complemented the dish very well. 

Sea bass and fillet of beef for mains were outstanding, again along with the matched wine. 

Also received good guidance on desserts and matched wines. It’s clear they’re not trying to get you to go for the more expensive wines either, they just want you to have the best possible experience. 

Aside from the food, the piano player, toiletries and scenery were all of standards you’d expect in a Michelin star restaurant. Perhaps this restaurant isn’t far away from receiving this honour.

Stunning location, stunning food. Had the teasing menu. Every course, beautifully presented and cleverly explained without going over the top which sometimes happens. Comprehensive doesn't even come close to describing the wine list but watch the Sommelier's inclination towards the ridiculously expensive! Stick to your guns even if he doesn't agree with you! Was amusing rather than off putting though. Was lucky enough to have the perfect table at the front of the terrace overlooking the bay. Book early and request it. Its worth it

Excellent location, especially the front terrace. Really fine and innovative cooking, worth tasting it. Not cheap, but worth every penny paid for. Very professional and in the same time very friendly staff. I would visit again.

First of all a tip - they do two primary sittings, at 6.30 and 9.30, which will get you the best seats. If you make a request outside of these times they can accommodate you further back, but they will email you to check whether that is want. I didn’t spot the email so lost the reservation, however managed to get in after requesting to be waitlisted and they called us back following some cancellations on the day. Apparently cancellations are fairly common so definitely worth asking to be waitlisted if need be.

Secondly, it is undoubtedly expensive-especially the starters, which are probably most expensive I have seen anywhere - more than £30 for a beef carpaccio, albeit a good one.

However, those minor gripes/difficulties aside, it is a magnificent restaurant. The photos illustrate the setting, with beautiful views over both fort and city walls. The food is arguably better - each course, from amuse bouche to dessert, got better (and all but dessert served with its own Croatian olive oil, which was a touch I enjoyed!) Flavour combinations are ambitious but perfectly executed, with meats cooked to perfection.

Finally, service was friendly and attentive throughout, and they even through in two post dinner cocktails for us to celebrate our anniversary-thanks!!

You can never go wrong with service and food on this spot !!! It was a stormy night and we didn’t have reservation but they took us in to dry out and we ended up having dinner .. they gave us towels to dry up and offered drinks while waiting for the storm to pass ! But hey we ended up having the best dinner in Dubrovnik!! Food is top notch ! Service is unbelievable! Yes it’s pricey here but it’s worth a try !!!

The service was excellent, the view outstanding, the food very good and it was a memorable experience. But it is expensive. E.g. Over 1000 Kuna per person (£125). We had the same sort of food quality, possibly even better, at Restaurant More, for less than half the price for 3 courses and a bottle of wine per couple. Not quite as spectacular a view, but still great, and service not quite as full on professional, but still a great experience. And we thought better overall value for money.
Also, the Nautika sister restaurant, Panorama has even more spectacular views than Nautika and you can do lunch there for a quarter of the price. 
One service irritation about Nautika was that we were not told about the 10% discount at sister restaurants. Panorama gave us a 10% discount as we'd eaten at Nautika, without us asking. And we were not offered chocolates and after dinner liqueurs at Nautika whereas the moaners at the table near us were.
So, go and enjoy the Nautika experience, which we did, but prepare yourself for the end price.

We were lucky enough to get a table at Nautika as I was on the waiting list, they called us up in the morning and we got great tables with amazing Dubrovnik views.
The food was exceptional except my beef was a bit rare for me when I asked for medium. We also payed over 2500 kuna which is a lot, having eaten at Michelin star restaurants for a lot cheaper but I guess that’s just how Dubrovnik is anyway, prices are high everywhere .

Definitely, one of those restaurants you will remember forever. Highly recommended to Ask for a seat on the terrace to enjoy fine dining experiences with a view, overlooking Dubrovnik’s city walls and the sea. The restaurant is right outside Pile Gate. The food itself was also incredible and staff is highly professional. I was surprised to see their wine list! They have an extensive selection of wines!!! We had the shrimp risotto the tagliatelle with truffle flakes for the starters and the veal fillet and beef fillet for main dishes.

I went with my wife to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary 
From the moment we arrived we knew we were going to have a fantastic evening 
We were shown to our table overlooking the old city walls
The selection of cocktails were fantastic 
The level of service throughout the entire meal was excellent 
The wine waiter provided excellent advise from their extensive wine selection 
The food was amongst the best I had eaten topped off with my new favourite dessert 
Zucappa afogarto ( try it if you get a chance and like Icecream and dark rum)
Overall five stars all the way and I will be going back on my next visit to Dubrovnik 

The price of the meal whilst at the high end it was worth it for the experience and the service offered to celebrate our anniversary 

Enjoy

Perfect end to a great holiday in Croatia. Absolutely excellent. Very friendly and welcoming staff. It was probably one of the best restaurant experiences of my life. An incredible experience, not just a meal. Fantastic panoramic views over Dubrovnik's city walls and the sea. Attentive, knowledgable staff about local wines, liquors and the food. The food itself was also incredible, worth every penny.

A must to end the trip but a pre-booking is recommended to avoid disappointment.

We fell in love with the terrace of Nautika and decided to book it a month in advance of our stay in Dubrovnik. And it lived up completley to our expectations.
As every meal looked interesting and good we took the 7 course tasting menu, and it was a great harmony of dishes, mixture of fish and meat. The plates looked deserving of a Michelin star.
We were amazed by the wine list, which is literally a book, not a list. So many good wines, and different years of good wines.
The service was impecable, from the manager, to the sommelier and our great waiter.
My most wow effect were however two gin tonics they brought us a gift. They were so creatively done, one decorated with white rose petals and a bird cage, and the other had a perfume by side to spray all the aromas on the gin tonic, just amazing.

We showed up around 7pm one evening and was lucky to get a table on the 3rd floor balcony. I had the lamb and my partner had the sea bass. For dessert, we had the Raspberry Queen. The meal was excellent and was made even better by the service and the view.
Similar to 360 without the 'star' and great food, excellent Croation wine list (my goodness these are good) in a period Courtyard setting. Definitely a repeat experience.

My husband and I visited the restaurant as a surprise for our anniversary and I have to say that the whole experience exceeded our expectations.

As we made reservation months in advance , we were seated on the main terrace with stunning view to the Lovrijenac Fort and City Walls .

From the warm greeting at our arrival from the general manager Marco ; the hospitality of our waiter and sommelier to the delicious food – everything simply made our evening unforgetable.

The 5-course tasting menu gave us a great variety of dishes to sample--with some additional touches offered by the restaurant. This restaurant deserves Michelin star as it is the best restaurant we tried on our trip through Croatia.

I must say they have the most perfect , the most amazing, stunning wine list my husband has ever seen and ,believe me, he is big wine lover.

At the end of dinner, we got complimentary drinks as a small gift for our anniversary and those drinks were the final touch to our perfect night !

Guys, you are simply the best! Love you all !

Celebrated my 50th birthday here in July. Booked in advance as we were a group of 8. From the moment we stepped foot in this restaurant our experience was amazing. The foyer for drinks had a gentleman playing the piano - bar service was fantastic. Once shown to our table on the terrace overlooking a stunning castle- it took our breath away. The service from the waiters was second to none- attentive and knowledgeable staff. The food was outstanding.

I can honestly say this is one of the best restaurant I’ve been to.

Thank you to all the staff 

Look forward to returning to the beautiful country of Croatia.

Everything about Nautika was exceptional and exceeded my expectations. The location along the Adriatic and the city walls is just stunning - especially after the sun sets and the lights come on. The service was flawless and our waiter, Valentino, was the best. Drinks and food were amazing. If you visit Dubrovnik, Nautika is a place that you should not miss. I can see why it is one of the most romantic restaurants in the world!

My husband and I booked a table here for our second night in Dubrovnik. Thank god we did - probably the best sushi we’ve ever had (and we have had a lot!)!! The blackened cod in orange was absolutely sublime and with views over the old town, the whole evening was superb. Thank you!

My wife booked this place for the Saturday evening, it was truly amazing. Very memorable for all the right reasons.
Our waiter Valentino made it special, very knowledgable, easy manor. The wine complemented the food, we dined for over 3 hrs . This is one place you must experience in Dubrovnik.

From the service (spectacular) to the food (incredible) to the cocktails (do yourself a favor and start with one) to the views (unreal), Nautika was by far my favorite restaurant in Croatia and in my top 3 in Europe. The service was absolutely top-notch the entire meal. The head waiter suggested a gin and tonic to start the evening and we put our faith in him to choose one for each of us-- he did not disappoint. My drink was served in a bird cage (inspired by the swallows you'll see twirling and diving over the water as you eat) and scattered with rose petals. It was not just gorgeous, it was delicious as well. Given we'd been a bit gluttonous with food on this trip already, we decided to not do the tasting menu and ordered a la carte instead-- everything was delicious. I had written in advance to Nautika (definitely make your reservation in advance) to let them know it was our two-year anniversary. At the end of the meal, the head waiter gifted us with two gorgeous cocktails (with pomegranate and rose petals) as a treat. The views were also just incredible---it felt as if we were watching some sort of movie go by. I cannot recommend this spot more!

My husband booked Nautika as a surprise for my birthday and they were extremely helpful with all his requests. We had a lovely table overlooking the Lovrijenac Fortress. We chose cocktails to start and decided on the 7 course taster menu which didn’t disappoint. The only issue was trying to make room for all the food. The sommelier chose a white wine and a red wine that would compliment each course and the waiters all sang happy birthday to me when they brought out my cake. A truly memorable evening and a must for
a special occasion!!
Arrived without a reservation but was kindly accommodated. Had a delicious lobster pasta and a gorgeous view with impeccable service.

Went there on a Thursday evening during summer, I would recommend to book your table to get the best view. View over the wall of the old town is amazing. Service was attentive and nice. Food was really good but portions were really small, especially concerning the main course. Cocktails were fabulous. Overall a bit pricey.
We had a wonderful experience. Food was great. Drinks were ok.... but the setting is spectacular ... the terrasse overlooks the ramparts of the old city ... cannot be better !!!

Our visit to Nautika was amazing -- great food paired with a wonderful view of the city walls and the fortress. Especially at night, when the walls are lit up, you'll feel like you are transported back in time. Plus, the staff is super friendly and gave us a memorable experience on our first night in Dubrovnik.

The special meal of our holiday did not disappoint. Booked a few weeks beforehand so managed to get a second row table overlooking the Adriatic. Yes, on the pricey side but worth it for that special occasion. Service was attentive but not intrusive and very informative. Certainly one of the biggest wine lists we have ever seen. I was impressed that their wine recommendations to match the fish was from their lower priced wines and it was excellent. A great evening all round.

This is how it should be done, its expensive, but from start to finish, a truly memorable experience, if you take the location, the professionalism of the service, the superior menu offering, one of the best restaurant experiences i have ever had in my life !!
I do not create a fuss, but i am fussy about whom I give my best yet vote to.
making random tourists feel special, is an art.

This restaurant is simply unbelievable. Our night here was so special. Make sure to request a table outside, which allows you to capture the perfect view of the bay. 

Nautika probably possesses the best wine menu I’ve ever dealt with, accompanied by the most professional and welcoming staff. 

With regards to food, you must trust the staff there as for us they took control and our meal was up there with the best. 

A truly iconic restaurant which we will definitely be dining at more than once on our return.

Ate dinner here on our last night in Dubrovnik; what a nice evening and a wonderful way to end our visit. The setting is beautiful next to the shoreline, the food was excellent and the service by the wait staff impeccable.

This restaurant is the top of the top restaurants. The location is excellent with a beautiful outdoor dining experience. Do request a table on the outer wall with a view. Waitstaff, food, ambiance - all superb. It just doesn't get better and there are only a couple of rivals. Well worth the cost. If you love food and a dining experience, this is where you need to go in Dubrovnik.

After being recommended by our son who took his fiancé here 2 years ago we decided to book Nautika before we left last week for Tuesday night our 3rd night. What a delight, we had a wonderful table on the 3rd level over looking the bay and the old walls and buildings. 
So many opportunities for photos, all the area lit up after dark giving us even more shots. 
The food was like a piece of art. My wife’s Mini Garden Soup was a picture. Amazing mini garden dressed around the outside of the plate. My Tagliettelli sprinkled with shavings of black truffle was divine and I could have had this as a main course. 
We both fancied the sea bass fillet served on a bed of cherry tomatoes and young spinach leaves. The topping of vanilla cream just enhanced the overall delicious flavours. 
We decided to share the pudding, A Raspberry Queen which also hit the mark. 
We were made to feel special which is special as this often does not happen in Fine Dining establishments. 
All the staff at some time seemed to have come to our table. But the main guys were brilliant and the Sommelier was a delight with a great sense of humour.
All told a wonderful experience but at a price. We enjoy fine dining and appreciate the hard work and artistry that goes into the preparation, some others may not. We had 2 courses and shared a pudding course. A G&T a glass of special sparkly rose and a glass of white wine. 
It was better than I expected price wise for the special place and food. 
A 5 course set menu is 820kn and the 7 course 920 s for this quality of food it’s equivalent to around £100 for 5 courses and £120 for the 7 courses which appears good value. 
We would recommend to our fine dining pals for sure.

The food was very good and cocktail definitely some of the best I have ever had! Must try the espresso martini after dinner, but when I made the reservation they said we would have a table first row but unfortunately there was a giant plant obstructing my amazing view. That was they only downside.

Having booked a table well in advance to secure a front row table on the terrace we were really looking forward to visiting this restaurant. It did not disappoint! Although the food is a little pricey, the atmosphere and service ensure it is worth every penny. Our waiter was fabulous and made us feel at home throughout the meal. The food and drinks are delicious and imaginatively presented. Highly recommended for anybody looking to add something extra special to their Dubrovnik trip. 

Tips - 
- Book well in advance for a table on the terrace. The views are incredible. Especially at sunset. 
- Although choices are limited for vegetarians, they do have a separate menu you can ask for. The goats cheese salad and truffle pasta are lovely (.... although theses are starters so the menu would benefit from a few more vegetarian mains)
- the cocktails are delicious and bring a little theatre to the experience

It was our honeymoon and my new husbands birthday so I wanted to book an extra special treat. The food was absolutely delicious, and we were given a special complimentary cocktail. 
My only complaint was that after requesting a table at the front of the balcony weeks in advance we were given a spot right next to the entrance where many other tourists were stood to look at the view of the city walls and were continually looking over our shoulders. It was not exactly a quiet and peaceful experience. Other tables were still available further away so I'm not sure why we were given this spot.

We tried to book online unsuccessfully so went speculatively that evening and they managed to squeeze us in. It did not disappoint!!!
The tasting menu was exceptional, all courses were delicious and service on par! We ran out of time (due to being squeezed in) so they moved us into the lounge which was fantastic with the pianist. We had our dessert and cheese and finished with a very strong aperitif. We left very happy!

Apparently they are usually 10 days booked in advance so we were lucky, book early to avoid disappointment!

Booked well in advance for a terrace table & it was worth it. Fabulous views of the town & harbour. My wife was delighted with the surprise. Food excellent if pricey & the wine list is daft, but if there is a demand then so be it. The service was immaculate & it is impossible to criticise the total ambience & experience. No wonder it is rated at the 6th most romantic restaurant in the WORLD! Fab-u-lous.
Great views, and if you are celebrating something special, then Ok but the food was not out of the ordinary

Lovely restaurant if you looking for something special. Its very fine dining, delicious food and excellent service. At the foot of the Fort outside the old town next to the bay so a stunning location. Perfect for a relaxing dinner away from the crowds.
Must book ahead if you want to eat here - same with all the best restaurants in Dubrovnik.
This restaurant is one of the most important restaurants in Croatia. Servis food and location, everything is top notch.

Another visit to Restaurant Nautika during our weeks visit to Dubrovnik. Excellent table with wonderful views over the Adriatic Sea.

Service was extremely professional and waiting staff very helpful and polite. Food was amazing The lamb main course was wonderful and the service is first class. Fine dining it is and a little more expensive as you would expect but what memories we have yet again. As always we drank Croatian wines and the white was excellent.

Well done top the team again.

On our next visit we will book again.

An excellent restaurant with an envious view. Two of us dined and had the seafood medley and summer cuttlefish salad for entrees and sea bass and lamb for mains - each dish was impeccable. The cocktails are also inspired and well made. Our only criticism was that we both found the amuse-bouche bland - but the food quickly improved.

6 of us ate at Nautika. Started with Croatian rose champagne and then accepted guidance on Croatian whites and reds to go with the 7 course tasting menu accompanied with several local olive oils. All of the food was fantastic, served with style by Ivan. If you plan on a visit book ahead especially if you want a front row seat with views over the water. We booked 2 weeks ahead. Not a cheap night out but we will remember it for years to come!

I was concerned this would be a bit of a tourist trap and more style over substance but I was very pleasantly surprised. They had had a cancellation and moved around their bookings to give us a much better table. The service was friendly but professional, slick but with a sense of humour. One of the best meals we have had - incredible. Worth every penny.

Four of us came to Dubrovnik to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. I chose the restaurant based on trip advisor reviews. We were made to feel special as soon as we arrived and there was an abundance of staff available to serve us. The location is stunning as was the food, service and atmosphere. We were surprised that at some point during the meal, there was a firework display - amazing. Expensive restaurant but so worth it for a special treat!

Overall great experience apart from some misunderstanding while placing order. Staffs were professional and very attentive, kudos to our lovely waiter Martin. We were moved to a table with nicer view when a customer finished earlier and we are really grateful for that.
This was fantastic. food setting & service.. Couldn't fault it. It was a nice treat to eat here. highly recommend.

Our hotel and our private tour guide both recommended Nautika to us. Our hotel concierge made our reservation for us. Wow! We've eaten at many fine restaurants and this rates right up at the top. We were a party of five seated out on the terrace on a relatively cool evening. The tower space heaters coupled with the cozy wraps allowed us to completely enjoy the setting and spectacular views of the Adriatic Sea. Breathtaking. We were treated like royalty. Every dish prepared to perfection. Outstanding craft cocktails including a knock-your-socks-off smokey Old Fashioned. Such a memorable evening to close out our fabulous week in Dubrovnik.

This restaurant definitely lives up to its culinary reputation and is hands down the best food in town with a view. Marko and his team go out of their way to make a unforgettable experience. Having had a little issue with our reservation, Marko went above and beyond not only to resolve the issue but show us unmatched hospitality. A must visit when in dubrovnik.
Everything, the site, the service, the food, and the special details, were wonderful. They made our stay even better!!!

I reserved a table here months in advance, I was very excited for this meal as it was my first fine dining experience ever! I came to Dubrovnik on a solo vacation and although I tasted many things while in Croatia my meal here was the most delicious :) The service was the best I’ve ever had also! I sat outside at what I would say was truly THE BEST table on the patio with a view that had me smiling the entire time I was there. The white chocolate mousse dessert was so incredible I wanted to order a second one! The lavender sauce to pour over it honoured lavender that grows in Croatia and was so tasty and complimenting to the mousse. The beef fillet is something I’ve been craving since being back home in Canada. I sent my compliments to the kitchen and I hope they received it. I can’t wait to come back! Thank you!

My mum and I have just returned from a short trip to Dubrovnik where we visited the Nautika on our first night and we were so impressed by the experience we had to visit again! The service was impeccable from everyone we had contact with and all the staff worked together to make it one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. The food was really excellent and the recommended wines we had were perfect choices and I now have a new found love of Croatian wines. One of the really good differentiators was how both the wines and the food were presented and then explained in terms of origin, history and content. The use of the different olive oils to complement each course was also a nice touch and we were very much encouraged to take our time and savour the experience. I can’t wait to bring my husband back when we visit later this year and couldn’t recommend the Nautika more highly.

The service and the staff deserve all 5*
Very high quality restaurant and professional staff. Nice and romantic sea & castle views. 

The food was good but the portions were more like appetisers. If you’re hungry that’s not the place where you’ll have your appetite fulfilled. 

I would say you pay for the extraordinary experience and treatment not for the food, because in my opinion when leaving a restaurant of that class it’s not fair to think “where can I grab a pizza”. 
People are used to get value for money so they have to improve a bit to have it perfect.
Stopped by for a late night cocktail and to enjoy the view. The hostess and servers were so welcoming and attentive. Having just arrived in Dubrovnik, it was a wonderful way to kick off our trip.

I treated my husband to a special birthday dinner here. We had reservations outside on the patio but the weather did not cooperate. We were seated inside at a table where it was a bit difficult to see outside and when the staff saw us keep getting up to look outside they moved us to another table that was fantastic. 
The service was impeccable. We had two appetizers and then the Sea Bass and Lamb. We shared the dishes and just loved all of it.
This is a special restaurant. It is expensive but I feel worth the price for the atmosphere, service and just in general feeling very pampered for an evening.
Superb food. Extensive wine list. Incredible service and views. Waiters were very attentive and the whole thing was a dining theatre. Highly recommend.
dinner overlooking old city walls. great food and service but a bit expensive compared to other fine dining in Dubrovnik.

My husband and I booked a reservation at Nautika for our four year wedding anniversary. We requested the best table, and they did not disappoint. The views of Pile (BlackWater) Bay are incredible. The service at Nautika is also amazing. I was at a loss of words at how wonderful our waiter was. I believe his name was Mario (its been a week since we dined there). The cocktails were out of this world, we are not wine people, but the wine list was amazing. The cocktails were presented in such a unique way and such a flare to them. The food was also increidble. I ordered the Lobseter and my husband the Sea Bass. We also ordered a selection of cold apps and soups and the chocolate dessert - oh my heaven. One of the best things I have ever eaten. The food, staff and and the ambiance were perfect. They made the night so special for us.

Had an absolutely wonderful dining experience at Nautika. The lights, magnificent views and live music create an atmosphere of luxury and relaxation. The staff are incredibly professional, friendly and knowledgeable: from menu recommendations to general tips about Dubrovnik. We were extremely pleased with the level of service, comparable to the best restaurants in the world. The dishes were extremely fresh and delicious, their presentation sophisticated and classy. The experience was definitely a memorable one, in the best way possible!

There are not enough great things that I can say about Nautika. My Mom and I visited Dubrovnik recently and booked a dinner reservation at Nautika. Our table was seated outside overlooking the old city and cliffs and was stunning. The sommelier, our waiter, and other staff members had comprehensive knowledge of the wine list, food, and dessert menus, and helped guide us in our recommendations throughout the evening. The truffle pasta is the best I've ever had - make sure to order it! Furthermore, our server and restaurant manager Tomislav gave us an olive oil tasting so we could determine which olive oils we liked best - this was SO nice and we really appreciated the great service. Nautika will be the first restaurant I visit the next time I'm in Dubrovnik - five stars all around!

The view was awesome and the personnel extremely friendly, polite and professional. Unfortunately the food was only ok, not excellent for it's tase, although very beautiful - altogether excessive price.

We went to Nautika to celebrate our tenth weeding anniversary and they made our night very special. It was a rainy evening but they did not allow that to rain on our parade. The waiter was very personable. The food excellent. Thank you.

Everything about our meal at Nautika was wonderful - the service, the ambiance, the wine and the food! We booked early and were lucky to get a table right on the front row of the terrace overlooking the fort. It was a truly memorable evening and one of the best meals we have ever had!

Conde Nast named Nautika as the 5th most romantic restaurant in the world. Situated just outside the medieval Pile Gate, the best tables overlook the sea facing a giant rock with a fort on top that is beautifully lit up at night. 

The food is great and the service exceptional. You simply must go. We had a lovely chat with the manager and his team. Later we strolled the medieval City and stopped for a glass of wine. When I went to pay I was stunned to be told that a guy from Nautika had quietly paid our bill and then left without telling us. Utterly amazing.

Had the perfect evening at nautika last night. The service was fantastic, we felt very well looked after. the food delicious and the views stunning... lovely atmosphere, a wonderful end to our holiday would love to come back!

My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful meal at Nautika. Make your reservation far in advance as you can and request a table on the outer edge for the best views. I'd also recommend opting for an earlier seating to enjoy the sunset. Our meal was excellent- we had a couple wonderful starters and the chef's white fish recommendation of grilled John Dory. The skin was to die for. Also, take advantage of the sommelier on staff, he recommended a fantastic wine (the best we had in Croatia).

What a mean and what a view. Make a reservation and enjoy the sunset overlooking the city walls. They have a la carte options as well as degustation menu. The olive oil options were delicious. Save room for dessert.

If you want spectacular food with highly attentive service in a great setting then look no further. You will, however, pay a lot of money for this.

We celebrated a 60th birthday in style with an experience none of us will forget. 3 of us had the 7 course tasting menu and every course was memorable. My wife chose 3 courses from the A La Carte which were all fabulous.

We all had G ang Ts to begin with and these were served theatrically (this is the first time anybody has whipped the rim of my glass with a sprig of rosemary!).

In addition, we chose 2 superb wines from the extensive wine list. (Cost of £120).

The bill for this extravaganza was £700 including a tip. 

This restaurant compares very favorably with several Michelin starred restaurants I have visited and I would recommend it for a very special occasion.
The view is just everything! Most romantic dinner I had in long time and me and my boyfriend really enjoyed it! Very tasty food and very polite staff.

This restaurant is in the most beautiful and romantic setting - our table was on the edge of the balcony over looking the small harbour and delivered the most stunning views during our 2&1/2 hours and four courses making our evening wonderfully magical. 

We started our evening with a visit from the restaurants sommelier who after a brief chat over the types of wines we normally drink and highly anticipated meal he recommended a local wine that surpassed some of the best NZ Sauvignon's (I'm a kiwi by birth) and set the tone for a wonderful evening ahead. 

This restaurant is a sea food lovers paradise and if my wife was a fish lover I could have eaten through the entire menu - alas most of the really exciting dishes were for two so alas my seafood choices were somewhat limited. Never the less - service was unhurried and informative - walking us through our selections and speaking us through each dish as it was delivered. As the evening air cooled they brought out heaters and blankets ensuring we were comfortable. 

Nautika truly delivers an evening of good wine, great food and heavenly views as the sun fades away leaving the twinkle of stars across rolling sea, absolutely wonderful!

An amazing restaurant with a beautiful view. We were on the top terrace overlooking the ocean and the fort and it was lovely. Our waiter was very nice and the fish soup was delicious as well as my Seabass entrée. I highly recommend this place

We were offered the table that we had reserved earlier this week. We got there a bit earlier and were seated almost immediately. The view of the old city and of the Adriatique Sea. The night we were there was a bit cool in early May and both warm sheets and an overhead heater were provided which allowed us to focus on the excellent food and service offered.

We went for the all inclusive 7 plates course and the quality of the food could not have been better. From the beef carpaccio to the shrimp soup, tuna and veal fillets, we were impressed with everything.

We completed the meal with a nice carob cake and local cheese. The selection of wine is impressive and the sommelier suggested some very fine wine.

Our meal was completed by the restaurant offering us nice liqueur as « digestif » as we say in french.

All in all a fantastic evening that we will not forget.
Excellent view to the old castle and sea, nice set-up with professional waiters, fantastic food, nice piano live music, quite expensive, but worth the experience.

These guys have it all! Great menu with super wait staff, huge wine list , live piano , and great views of the walls and water! We were very impressed all night. Not sure the “ranking” but it’s gotta be too 10 in the city or better. Had some great Croatian wine too and port for dessert.

As a restaurant with a riveting view you must enjoy the outdoor patio. With outside heaters to beat the evening chill in May we had a dinner to remember . The meal started with a made in house breadstick and cucumber jelly and served with a mixture of croatia finest olive oils. It was our fist night in Dubrovnik so fish was on our minds. We both had the grilled sea bass on a variety of local grilled tomatoes in vanilla sauce covered by a perfectly cooked crispy skin on fish fillet . For desert the misses had fresh raspberries in a white chocolate cup with a lavender sauce with raspberry cake and raspberry drissell. Service was impeccable.
It is not a cheap place, but you can be sure that you will have great fresh food, amazingly nice service and a stunning atmosphere in a beautiful location.

We went to Nautika restaurant for a late lunch after spending the morning enjoying the city of Dubrovnik. The temperature was on the low seventies and we were undecided wheter to sit on the terrace facing the old port or on the inside. We decided on the terrace and had an excelent lunch. On every chair of the terrace there were blankets and as an added precaution the waiter lighted a lamp next to our table. The service was outstanding, not only professional, but with a constant smile. The view could not be better and the food very tasteful. A wonderful experience.

First day in Dubrovnik - the booking was made for us by our accommodation (Guest house Forty Four), and it did not disappoint.

We chose the 7 course tasting menu (840 kn pp), with paired wine flight (additional 440 kn pp)..

All the courses were wonderfully described by our waiter, and superbly presented. They tasted as lovely as it looked. The sommelier did equally as good a job matching the Croatian wines (which were equally as nice).

The food portions were not tiny, and just the right size.

The cuttlefish was a pleasant surprise.

The other standout was the (free, optional) olive oil flight for each course....we never knew that Croatia had so many superb (and award wining) olive oils, nor how different each tastes, nor how each can compliment and already tasty meal!

Well presented, well laid out, very pleasant & knowledgeable staff, lovely food, wonderful views of the walls.

This is one of the best restaurants my boyfriend and I have ever eaten at. This was a very special night for us as my boyfriend proposed to me and the staff could not have been more accommodating. The food was delicious and the view was phenomenal. I couldn't recommend this restaurant enough. If you come to Debrovnik you must visit here for the experience!

Abdolutely excellent, one of the best. We spent a remarkable evening in this wonderful place. we celebrated with our friends. But I think that the restaurant and their personnel made our evening so remarkable. Service was fabulous, food excellent and wines were more than perfect. This is absolutely worth to visit to see and feel professionals on their duty. not to mention the scenery. Tasting menu (7 course) is my recommendation, with local wines.

Very delicious good wine helpfuly personality 
You Will tried beef food 
the Restaurant has got very view.

My girlfriend and I booked this after a recommendation from a friend. We both agreed this was one of the best meals we've ever had and we've eaten at quite a few michelin starred restaurants. 

Service was incredible from a waiter known as Ivan and we were given complimentary mini starters and shots at the end. The food and presentation was incredible and the atmosphere magical and romantic.

No wonder it's in Condo Naste's top 5 most romantic restaurants! Bravo to this restaurant!

Paul

During our one week stay in Dubrovnik, we visited several restaurants - all with exceptional service. But this one is next level. We went there spontaneously and had no reservation and were kindly offered different tables. There is one terrace upstairs, which is a bit more closed, to shield the guests from the wind. But we decided to sit downstairs on the open terrace with an amazing view of the Dubrovnik bay. Since we got there late, there were only free tables in the second row but we still had a great view. We got recommendations for great local wine and also food (you must try the dessert with the chocolate trio!). But what was outstanding was the service. There were several most nice and polite waiters around us, trying to make everything perfect. Yes this place is expensive. Is it worth it? Yes! Will we come back? Hell yes. This was April now but I guess in summer it will be almost impossible to get a table without reservation. So, be smarter than us and call in advance to get a table in the first row and have the most wonderful evening. And just for the sake of completeness, - this restaurant is in the michelin guide. No big surprise ;)

We were a large party and Nautika did an excaptional job of accomodating us. Setting up for outdoor seating to begin where we had drinks but also having upstairs indoor seating if we chose not to eat outside (private room). The food and accompanying wines we chose all Croatian were fantastic as was the service . The wait staff were fantastic, very persoanble. Lastly the location outside Old Town and the surrounding views make for a dining experience to remember ! We would definitely go back.

Having read all the wonderful reviews about Nautika restaurant we decided it would be the perfect place for our last meal before we left Dubrovnik after our city break. We made a reservation for a table on the terrace on the first day we arrived. Everything was fantastic from the moment we entered the restaurant, the table on the terrace with amazing views, the cocktails, food and wine pairings and outstanding service provided by everyone. Thank you for making our last evening so memorable.
Incredible location, views are stunning food fantastic service off the charts highly recommended, thank nautika

Spending some time in this hidden gem of the City we went to have a dinner in this restaurant overlooking the entrance to this spectacular City...restaurant is classy and service and food were great but it was very expensive for us

We had a fantastic meal here while visiting Dubrovnik for a short city break. The restaurant’s location in the old town is excellent and close to other attractions/places of interest, while the large terrace provides al fresco dining at it’s finest (GOT fans will especially appreciate it). The staff were excellent - knowledgeable, friendly and very attentive. The food was delicious and beautifully presented, with the suggested wine a perfect accompaniment. Overall, a very enjoyable and memorable experience - we would love to return one day.

There are no words to describe this wonderful restaurant. Five stars experience overall.
If we come back to Dubrovnik, we surely will be booking Nautika retaurant again!
This was a beautiful place and the staff really friendly and attentive to every part of the visit. Romantic views and atmosphere.

The food and drinks. The ambience. The service. All outstanding! Only come here if you want to have the most enjoyable experience. I can’t wait to return to Dubrovnik, so I can have another exceptional experience here like the one I had last night.
Great view at this place. And attentive service. Food was good with a nice touch of olive oil pairing.
Amazing location and atmosphere. Food was excellently presented. Idea for a special dinner with a loved one. Try the orange wine whilst relaxing listening to the pianist.
The view was amazing and the food was very tasty. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and funny. Will definitely will go back again.

In one word amazing!
The view was incredible 
The staff was courteous attentive and funny!
The piano was played and clearly heard on balcony but did not interfere with conversation
(And favorite was theme of GOT heheheh)
The food was impeccable in quality in presentation and taste, the price is high as one can see but if can be weathered you can enjoy amazing meal in a beautiful city or on the set of game of thrones if you can simply erase in you mind the tourist running through the shots and paint in the flying dragons
Náutica Restaurant in Dubrovnik is a great fine dining place, in which the waitress treat you like a King and the food is fantastic.
Great service, beautiful view, Lovely food good choice. great atmosphere, we kept returning back to this place as we liked it so much

The terrace view and ambience are absolutely stunning. We were impressed with the food and the service. They have a good wine list and a helpful sommelier. It was very hot when we dined for dinner (July 29, 2018) but the terrace was comfortable being so close to the water. This is the place to dine in Dubrovnik, especially on your last night in the city...

I booked this restaurant for my wife's birthday evening meal and so glad I did

From the off the location set the scene for an amazing and beautifully romantic dinner. The staff are friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable of their produce and menu items
We had a table outside, ( highly recommended even in the evenings as they have great patio heaters and blankets if needed), as you are on the cliff edge overlooking the old city walls which are all beautifully lit up

Give yourself plenty of time to read through the 'Wine directory' which has an amazing array from all over the world. Our waiter recommended perfectly for our requirements and this added to the theatre of the evening

The food.... Another WOW of the evening, beautifully served, presented, created, described, tasting and accompanied with local olive oils and home made products
Our waiter, ( Mario ), surpassed all expectations for the evening, all to a very high standard and his colleagues also, as we dealt with them over the evening

I would not hesitate to highly recommend this restaurant, booking probably essential and I certainly be dining here again on future visits to Dubrovnik

Came back here 2 years later with my girlfriend this time, same amazing waiter. Same amazing service, Same amazing tasty food. Although pricey, you cannot beat it – nothing else like it. The best fish I've ever ever had! and wow what a view!? Lovely lovely lovely. Make sure you're booked for sunset as the kayakers come in and have a close to sea cliff view

Truly impressed! My husband and I saved this restaurant for our last meal in Croatia. While the weather was perfect the entire week of our trip, our very last day was not so pretty. We were hopeful that the wind/rain would die down, and that we could sit outside in the spot we requested, but it didn't. We arrived and were seated upstairs inside. The look of disappointment on my face must have said it all, and we were asked if we would like to try and sit outside on the small covered terrace. It was perfect, with an incredible view! They even gave me a blanket in case I got chilly. We were very happy to have been offered the covered seating. Every single member of staff were delightful, kind, and hard working. Our waiter really took his time explaining the menu, offering up suggestions, and his wine knowledge opening/serving skills were super impressive! This was the best service and meal we had all week. Tagliatelle, and scallops for starters. Veal and beef fillets for main course. All were phenomenal! You must try the his and hers gin and tonics....trust me! The sommelier recommended a nice Croatian wine to accompany our meal, and it was also delicious. After dinner Croatian aperitif and chocolates were the icing on the cake. Every little detail was spot on, and you will not regret dining here! Compared to other restaurants in Croatia, yes this is pricey, but its fine dining and well worth it. They truly made us feel special, and we would return in a heartbeat. Thank you so much for the amazing memory!

The restaurant is perched on a look-off between the new city and the walled city with an amazing view of the sea. The food, wine, and ambiance are well worth a visit. We were fortunate enough to have a table on the outer wall overlooking the water.

We loved this restaurant. The view, the service, the food & wine, the ambiance... It was all spectacular. We went into it knowing it was expensive, but it wasn't overly so. It felt appropriate and completely worth it! The cocktails at the bar were really special and the sommelier was wonderful and helpful. If you have the chance to go, go! It's a very nice, beautiful restaurant without being pretentious.

My wife and I ate here to celebrate my birthday. We knew this place was expensive, but, we were going to have whatever we wanted. First let me rate the service: first class! The wait staff worked together like a well oiled machine. Always attentive never intrusive. The sommelier chose a Croatian Zinfandel that paired perfectly with our meals. The food: Outstanding! We started with Cuttlefish Medallions in Sesame for my wife and a Trio Seafood Delicacies for myself. All were beautifully presented and delicious. For our mains Veal Filet and Dubrovnik Malvasija Sauce for my wife and the Lamb Cutlet Dalmatian-style for myself. Again delicious mouth watering delights. Since it was my birthday, and yes my wife had to tell them unbeknownst to me, the servers came out sing happy birthday in their rich baritones serving our desserts. What a night! Oh and yes the views are stunning.

I took my husband here for his 40th birthday dinner during our holiday. The food was delcious, the setting wonderful and the service fantastic. It was pricey but that is to be expected given the location and quality of food.

We decided to dine here based on the outstanding reviews. 
The service was just perfect. We had the foi gras, carpaccio, and truffle appetizers. Each of these were perfect. Well balanced texture and flavors each with wonderful taste. 
For the meal we chose the lamb and filet mignon. Melt-in-your-mouth quality meat with wonderful garnish for a lovely meal. 
The three Desserts were also beautifully presented and perfect taste. 
This is a must-go location in Dubrovnik. Check opening times since they will close for three months after this weekend. This is their regular seasonal schedule. The staff gets to travel and visit vineyards around the continent and eat at competitive locations for comparison. 
What a concept for any business.
I wrote to Nautika as I wanted to surprise my wife for our anniversary- they organised flowers and the night could not have been better- amazing food and fantastic service- highly recommended

We enjoyed a superb meal at Nautika. The service was faultless and the fish absolutely delicious. We would love to return, but the prices mean that this is definitely a restaurant for special occasions only.

We had a wonderful rail side table overlooking the Fort and had the 7 course menu which was superb. The staff were all very attentive & knowledgeable, particularly the Somelier - you will need help with the choice of 650 wines! Not cheap but fabulous as a treat.

We were here in late October and we had a table on the terrace. The view was great. The service was terrific. And the dining experience was very good.

We started off with their signature gin tonics. The presentation of the cocktail was wonderful and the taste pretty good too. The soup, appetizers, and desserts were all great. For a dinner like this, I expect great food and great experience. The experience was very good.

The veal was just above average though. but still it was a great experience and nice way for me to end my Croatian trip with wife. A bit pricy.

Oh, it gets pretty cold and very windy in late October at the terrace. Most of the guests elected to be moved inside mid way through their dinner
Extremely friendly staffs and services. Food is pretty good just the veal is a bit over cooked. Aside for this, this place is worth going when you have time in Dubrovnik

We had dinner here and the food was wonderful. Wine was also very nice but a little pricey. The only negative was the time between courts was a little bit short in out opinion. The waiters were friendly

Just back from a fabulous meal at Nautika. The service was of the absolute highest quality. Friendly and informative but never intrusive. A wonderful setting on the seafront with piano music in the background. Delicious amuse bouche and lovely starters. Helpful sommelier chose a delicious local wine. Amazing fish,3 fresh fish brought to the table before cooking allowing us to choose the best. Beautifully oven cooked with potatoes, courgettes, aubergines and olives, carefully served at our table. 
The bill at 125 pounds per head puts it into the very upper echelons of cost and it was not quite at that level. Whilst the food was superb there was relatively little value added. I would certainly eat here again.

quality of food was very good - service attentive - and of course the view is the star of the show - this is an expensive restaurant compared to local alternatives but if you had similar view / food quality in other places it would cost significantly more so good value!

Nautika came highly recommended to us by our AirBnb hosts, and it did not disappoint! We were given a table on the balcony looking out over the beautifully lit cliffs framing the water. Sunset dinner is breathtaking. The food was wonderful, and the wine list excellent. I highly recommend the truffle pasta.

excellent meal with a funny, useful and adaptable team. food is delicious and that is not always true for Croatia were food is usually good but repetitive. The cuisine is inventive and very tasty. the place is absolutely divine with a stunning view on the walls of Dubrovnik. Some will say they have the feeling to be in game of throne. Nevertheless food is far better than the blood bath of game of throne and you will have good findings.

we tried the orange wine which is specific from this area and the gin and tonics of the restaurant, very good and funny.

obviously this is a gastronomic restaurant and you will have to pay for it but nothing disturbing for such a place and food.

We had a fabulous meal here.
We booked the terrace for our dinner.
Everything from the table setting, the staff, the location and dinner was excellent. A true Michelin Star Dining Experience.
We started with the shrimp with Polenta, which was so so tasty. You could taste the freshness of the shrimp.
I am a big Foie Gras person, and this was the best sautéed Foie Gras that I ever tasted.
For Main’s, we had the Sea Bass, on a bed of fresh sautéed cherry tomatoes, and the beef medallion topped with crispy celery flakes, which was so tender and tasty.
We ended the meal with the Chocolate Fantasy, which was to die for. It was a dark chocolate with cream on the side. Pure Decadent!
I am a non drinker, and the server made me a virgin cocktail, which had a hint of Rose essence, mint, lime juice and ginger.
