It was delicious, and it was presented so spectacularly well.
Mario was our server, and he was amazing in guiding us what was the best, the different varieties of olive oils that we tasted.
Fantastic service by all our servers.
Thank you so much for such a fantastic dining experience in your beautiful country!
blown away by the food and staff and location ..... will return next year . Food was the best i have ever had in europe . Thankyou for such great service . we stayed at Villa Dubrovnik

We splurged for our final night's dinner in Dubrovnik and this place did not disappoint. The staff was awesome, the experience was amazing. When you go here you get a top-notch dining experience. Well worth the money.

Everything was really good, the service was amazing, very friendly staff, also professional. Foodwise- they were able to accomodate my boyfriend who has a vegetarian, gluten free no mushroom diet with no problems. They have a piano there, very good atmosphere. Five stars for almost everything.

Great location in the evening with fantastic views. service excellent and the starters were amazing but my main wasn't nice (but as i didn't eat it but didn't complain they knocked the cost off the bill - nice touch). J's was (just) okay though. We both had meat mains which may have been a mistake. puddings were very nice. would recommend and would try them again. not offered coffee though which was strange (did they want the table back?)

I went to this restaurant and liked it so much that I ate there next day again. :)

The location of it is amazing, although next to the Old Town, it was secluded. As a solo female traveler I was worried about too many questions from the waiters but they were so professional, looked after me very well and made some light conversation without disturbing my privacy. Wooow, what a lovely place! Can't wait to go back!

The staff at Nautika went out of their way to make us feel special. It is an elegant place, exquisitely appointed, where we enjoyed a fabulous meal in an outstanding location. We had a table on the terrace close to the railing, overlooking the picturesque Adriatic Sea. We got there just before sunset, and although sunset that evening was curtailed due to cloudy conditions, the short display of color in the sky made for an incredible view. Our waiter was so friendly, and so helpful. The manager came over to greet us, and the wine steward brought us our wine and decanted it - all of them shared with us tidbits of information about the location, the region, and the culture, but not in any kind of intrusive way. The meal was excellent. After a delightful amuse bouche, I had scallops with truffle shavings, and my husband had prawns in a delicious sauce. For mains, I had an excellent steak and my husband had lamb chops - all prepared perfectly and served with inventive vegetables. We had a Plavac Mali wine, which was a great compliment to our food. And, although we had no room for dessert, our waiter returned with complimentary aperitifs and a small tray of chocolates. The restaurant's interior is also very elegant. Just inside the door a pianist played during the evening, with the sound carrying out to the terrace and providing a lovely background to our meal. Memorable, wonderful experience.

We went to Nautika during our Croatia cruise to celebrate my mom´s birthday. Already making a reservation was a pleasure as the stuff was really helpful when we needed to switch days due to a change in our cruise schedule.
We had such a nice service - so helpful, so friendly, so nice - really overwhelming. The food was delicious (we had Seafood trio, Tuna, Beef fillet & veal fillet) and of absolutely high quality. 
We have to highlight the service which was outstanding! They even sang a birthday song for my mom and brought asmall cake. 
Nautika is a restaurant we definitely recommend - a dining experience at his best!
Thanks you for this wonderful evening!

Beautiful surroundings overlooking Dubrovnik fort. Fine dining, with all the pretentiousness that goes with it. Excellent food, excellent service with numerous staff attending you. Extremely expensive, but what you would expect from fine dining.

Truely memorable dinner! The view was amazing and tasting menu delicious! 
Waiters were very attentive and offered wine suggestions.

Where to start. After reading several reviews on Nautika i decided to book a table on the patio for our three year anniversary, well in advance. On email I was informed of the timings for the first row (18.30 and 21.30 seating) but that they accepted other timings for the evening but they will have to be only on the second row of the patio. I confirmed 2nd row on the patio would be fine and was very much looking forward to this Michelin star experience at 19.30. For completeness i think it’s also important to note that we live in London and have not only dined at numerous Michelin star restaurants here, but all over the world; Amsterdam, Rome, Cape Town, Italy, Spain... so we’re not newbies here, although even without that experience it wouldn’t be hard to rate this as a total fail on their part. 

It was our first day in Dubrovnik and not realising the traffic coming into the old town by car (despite looking like we were a 5 min drive away) i realised at 19.20 (10 minutes before the reservation) that we were going to be around 10-15minutes late, so i called the restaurant and informed them / confirmed they would hold our table etc. We arrived and the hostess took us to our table, except the table was not on the patio - it was on the side terrace - tucked in the corner, which meant our view was that of tourists looking at the beautiful Adriatic sea! I pointed out i had booked well over a month ago and had specifically requested a patio seating for our anniversary, at this point the manager came out and i explained the situation saying this was not acceptable and not what i had booked, he didn’t apologise, instead he proceeded to tell me it was a ‘first come first serve on the patio’ (blatant lie) and proceeded to say with a smirk on his face something along the lines of “but don’t worry, you’re not going to let this ruin your evening are you? You’re still going to have a wonderful time”. Wow, so you not only give our table away then proceed to tell me i need to get over it. Outrages, it gets worse from there, i asked him to move us once a table became available, at which point he said that he wasnt sure that will be possible as they are fully booked for the evening (!) so firstly, they gave our table away, secondly they didn’t apologise and finally they weren’t going to try fix it at all. I struggle to wonder if we were treated this way because we were a gay couple? I doubt he would have talked in that nonchalant manner to a man. We really should have left at this point but as it was our first night in Dubrovnik, and our annniversary we decided “not to let it ruin the evening”. Unfortunately it just didn’t get better from there, we felt the waiters were totally pompous and fake, nothing felt genuine about this restaurant. To top it off we ordered two starters and the tuna for the main and the food was very average! The tuna was the blandest tuna steak i have ever had. How is this a Michelin star restaurant?! Even the food was sub-par. 

Shame really as on paper it looked like it would be a real winner. We dined the following night (to make up for this failure) at Above5 restaurant - now that is a 5 star place, Naukita management could learn a lot from that team of excellent staff and management. We were in Dubrovnik for a further 6 nights and Naukita was by far the worst dining experience we had, there are so many excellent and better restaurants in Dubrovnik, please don’t waste your money over this overly hyped restaurant.
My friends and I had a magical night at Nautika on my Birthday.....thanks to all the wonderful staff (especially Mario) for a night I will never forget....we will be back!

One of the best dinners I have ever had. And the view was a bonus! Excellent service and delicious food. Had the trio seafood app. Super fresh tuna, bass and lobster combo. Fillet was unbelievable. Served on gnoccho with mushroom sauce. They topped everything with an olive oil. Asked for our wine preferences and chose an excellent Syrah. Since I was celebrating my birthday I asked to keep my menu and the waiter had the chef sign and date it. Very special night.

Last evening our group of 5 came to Nautika for a dinner to end our trip to Dubrovnik.

We were seated outside with a spectacular view of the water, landscape and fortress. We had a 6:30pm reservation and totally loved having cocktails while the boats and kayakers moved gracefully through the waters below and the sunset changing the sky palette as we took in the view.

There are cozy white wraps if one is a bit chilly as the sun sets, as well as heat lamps- very comfortable.

Our servers were top notch- informative, polite, and pleasant to be nearby if we needed a refill of our drinks or help with our selections.

The salads and soup courses were creatively presented as well as so
delicious! 

Our entrees followed with the same artistic perfection.a few of us would recommend the beef fillet - grilled to perfection- and so tasty... hit the spot if you choose meat over the variety of fish offered.

We almost didn’t choose dessert- but decided to share 2 for the 5 of us. A taste of chocolate cake and a lemon treat. 

We lingered as the night was perfect in every way. 

This venue is special and you will not be disappointed - a 10 out of 10!

We came here to celebrate my husband’s 40th and our anniversary. We’d booked a table outside for the view but unfortunately the strong winds meant we had to dine inside. Our initial disappointment was forgotten within minutes. The service was fantastic, the food unbelievable and all in all we had one of the best nights ever! Who knew olive oil pairing was a thing?! If you can’t secure an outdoor table it’s still absolutely worth the visit.
was there with my partner. what a great place and amazing location. Food was delicious and staff was friendly. It is a bit expensive though.

This restaurant is a highly coveted dining venue in the heart of Dubrovnik. Nabbing a table is close to impossible. But somehow, my lucky stars enabled me to snatch one when I decided to walk-in. The restaurant’s debonair and hospitable Manager Marko made sure my dining experience was beyond exquisite. I had 2 starters and skipped the main course because I have a relatively small appetite. Each dish was prepared with aesthetics and gastronomy merging beautifully like a well-orchestrated symphony. Another thing worth mentioning is that they do not have a wine list. What they have is a thick hardbound book containing an extensive selection of local and international wines!

Based on reviews I encountered on TripAdvisor, past diners raved about the fantastic views by the terrace but strong winds prevented outdoor dining this evening. Nonetheless, the impeccable service, local sparkling wine and gourmet delights more than made-up for this missing element.

What an amazing restaurant on all levels! From the moment I made the booking with Nautika many months ago they have been nothing but highly professional and provided only the best service. 
Our meal experience was one of the best we have had all around the world! The explanation of the menu, the wine list, matching our wines to our food, to the explanation of all the local olive oils they serve their dishes with where second to none. Our waiter communicated brilliantly without being in our face which helped make the experience all the more special. To top off a great night the chef baked a special Lemon Tart for my wife’s birthday cake which wasn’t even on the menu! 
I can only highly recommend you visit Nautika on your next trip to Dubrovnik!

This is a beautiful restaurant with exceptional ambience and incredible views of the Adriatic. Well worth the visit. However, expect to pay prices that are consistent with Michelin starred establishments while the food does not hit that mark. The wine list is one of the best I’ve seen all over Europe. An outstanding selection of both Croatian and international wines from every producing country. The sommelier is exceptionally knowledgeable and very willing to help with the right choice. The service is vigilant and friendly but also missed in some basic aspects that one would associate with a restaurant with these prices. The food is very good and the presentation is elegant. However, you get the feeling that they just trying a little too hard to get that first star which is not yet deserved.

I heard this was fabulous but it exceeded our expectations. The view from our table on the terrace was absolutely breathtaking. We took the 1st seating and was able to watch the sunset. As the sun went down the fortresses and walls lit up. The service and attentiveness of the staff was unrivaled. We chose the 5 course dinner menu and was overwhelmed with presentation and flavors. This is a must and worth every Kuna!

Probably the most spectacular dining terrace and restaurant in Dubrovnik, just outside the Pile Gate, overlooking the walls and the sea.
This is a beautiful, classy, fine-dining establishment, with impeccably high standards, and very possibly the largest wine list I've ever seen.
The emphasis is on quality and service from the second you arrive at the place, right throughout the experience.
Not cheap, but worth the premium, even if only to experience the finest, faultless food and wine away from the rabble.
When you book, be sure to specify Nautika, if that's the one you want - they do own other restaurants, so just be sure!

We made a reservation a week ahead of time, and were rewarded with one of the finest meals we had in Croatia. The setting on the terrace overlooking the Adriatic is sublime. Polished, attentive wait staff, knowledgeable sommeliers, and beautiful presentation of food and drink. Every course was inspired, well executed, and delicious. Not to be missed.

Delicious dinner, beautiful setting, great service all at Nautika. We recently had our anniversary dinner here and were very pleased with everything. Sat outside overlooking the beautiful walled city of Dubrovnik on our 51st wedding anniversary. Such a special place to celebrate. We were well taken care of in all aspects. Highly recommended.

I celebrated my birthday with my wife at the magnificient Nautika restaurant. Sitting between the Lovrijenac fortress and the Dubrovnik fortification, right on the bay, this is an incredible setting. In Game of Thrones terms, it is between the Red Keep and Kings Landing. Fairy tale stuff. Then the food and service. We had tuna and it was simply perfect. The wine we chose was BRK, a rare wine from the island of Brac. Perfect! The service could not have been more personal, friendly, adequate and classy! 

A rare 10/10 rating from me! Simply the best dinner experience I have ever had, anywhere!

Nautika has got to be the most exquisite dining experience.

From greeting to service to food they performed to perfection. 

The crisp white tablecloth to the velour under cloth added a touch of class.

The service of food and drinks was a precision team performance. Well choreographed. What I really enjoyed which is lacking in service across the country is they were able to bring their personality with them. They smiled, chatted and above all were engaged, focused and enjoyed their work.

The food was presented with sheer elegance and style. The menu was extremely well put together and the combination of flavours, colours and local ingredients sets this dining experience apart from any other place. 

Do yourself a favour and order a gin.... another choreographed presentation in itself and the gin was divine. 

The venue is so elegant with stunning views.

We had high hopes for our visit to Nautika and overall we were not disappointed. The service was very good and attentive, we were very grateful that the staff made such an effort when they realised one of our party was celebrating a special birthday.
Our food was delicious and we enjoyed the wine selection.
The entrance terrace proved to be an excellent seating position.
It is very expensive, however I would say it is worth its price for an all round dining experience. It is not often I would pay so much, but we had a great time.

On Saturday 15th September, I visited and enquired if a table for two was available. I was informed by a female member of staff that none were available. I therefore made a reservation for Monday evening, 17th September at 19.30. The member of staff took my details and mobile number. She said she would telephone me prior to my reservation. Needless to say, I did not receive the call. What very unprofessional service. You have let yourselves down very badly and therefore not as good as you claim to be. Shame upon you Nautika.

Four of us went for a special evening out for my birthday and the whole experience was amazing.

The minute you walked in they made you feel special. Staff were so helpful and knowledgeable.

Food was delicious and even though we weren’t on the main terrace it was still a lovely table.

I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant, it’s pricey so perfect for a special occasion.

The waiters even sang happy birthday to me.

A truly wonderful experience.

I knew to expect a fine dining experience but I was honestly blown away by the service at this restaurant. Treat yourself! Nautika is absolutely worth it. You need to make a reservation at least several days ahead of time, especially if you want a table on the terrace (which you do! You really do!) I got a table on the terrace at 18:00, with sunset just after 19:00 and it couldn't have been more perfect watching the colors of the sky change over the water as I ate. Besides the location, the food was exquisite and the service exceptional. It was one of the best meals I've ever had, truly!
We had the 7 course tasting menu and weren’t disappointed. Gorgeous ambience and the staff couldn’t have been more helpful. The beef carpaccio was out of this world

My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant during our Croatian holiday for our four year anniversary dinner. I have to say this was the BEST dining experience I have had in my life. We literally walked in on a red carpet and the staff were incredible. Mario was our server and he was just amazing. The views were incredible, the food out of this world, and to top it off, they surprised us with anniversary drinks after our dinner with rose petals on the tray. If you're going to Dubrovnik, splurge one night and go here, you will NOT be disappointed. The care each staff member took in treating us like royalty, and kindness above and beyond, was truly remarkable. I will remember this forever!

We reserved our table about a week before to celebrate our anniversary meal. The view was stunning and the food was amazing, we particularly enjoyed the beef!The staff were lovely, very attentive and friendly. They even gave us two complimentary cocktails to celebrate our special occasion. Overall it was a memorable experience which we both really enjoyed, would recommend this restaurant for a fine dining experience.

Thank you for a lovely evening!

Imagine dining above Black Water Bay with the finest food and the most attentive service. We luckily planned well ahead to get a prime spot on the upper terrace. 

Everything about Nautika is special. The setting is amazing -- just outside of the Pile Gate and overlooking the Adriatic. The service was attentive and helpful. The food outstanding. One of the features that we really appreciated was the selection of an olive oil paring for each course. Croatian olive oils are among the best in the world and each one we tried paired well with fish, vegetables, and pastas.

As we were celebrating a special occasion, the restaurant treated us to dessert. A total surprise and a very nice touch.

Strongly recommend. Nautika is worthy of its high reviews and strong reputation.

Nautica was first on our list in Dubrovnic.Restaurant view is priceless but most impprtantly food is very good(seafood).Service was excellent from start to finish.Is important to make reservation,ask for table on balcony.

They could serve fish and chips here and there’d still be a waiting list for tables. The view from the terrace extends from the City walls across the bay to the ‘ Red Keep’. Just a jaw dropping sight. And cocktails as we watched the sun go down. Way over the top gin and tonics, replete with rosemary essence and a spray of orange (?) liquor, but very, very tasty. 

The food varied from very good ( Tuna Tartare) to outstanding ( Seared sea bass). We chose the 5 course tasting and at €100, and for the quality it was very good value. 

An extensive wine list. Varies from well priced local wines to stratospherically priced imports, including an Ornellaia Super Tuscan. We were recommended a white from Croatia, Karaman Malvasija but it was €50 a bottle. An excellent recommendation and a young, fruit driven wine. 

Just a delightful evening, and with attentive and friendly service from a raft of waiters.

Had a wonderful time. Had the 7 course taster menu and it was impressive. Top end of our budget but worth it for the setting, food and service....even if the service did feel a bit stuffy at times but that's more because we aren't used to the fine dining thing. Waiters couldn't have been more accommodating! Very good!

I haven't written a review in a while, but this dining experience deserved it. The evening may have honestly been the best, total restaurant experience we've ever had. The location, the meal, the wine, the service... every aspect was impeccable. 
We made reservations weeks in advance to ensure we had front row on the terrace. This provides an unobstructed view of the Old City walls, and the Adriatic. It just made the evening all the more magical. 
From the moment we arrived, the service was personal and exceptional. We were introduced to our head waiter Mario (awesome), along with the sommelier. They managed to always be available, without hovering. 
For starters, we had the Foie Gras. This simply was the best we've ever had. It was perfectly prepared, and the sommelier paired it with a delicious, local, white wine. Honestly, I could have simply had another serving, and been complete for the meal. "Amazing" is not hyperbole in this instance. 
For main course we had the Beef Fillet. It was very good. We both prefer ours a little more rare than this came out, but it was nevertheless delicious. Again the sommelier's recommendation was perfect. We had a local red (Dingač, big, full-bodied) which went perfectly with the beef. 
We turned down dessert because we were in a good spot, but did decide to have a Dubrovnik coffee. It's their twist on Irish coffee, using a local liqueur made from carob. It was excellent. A chocolate-like flavor without being too sweet. Truly one of the better coffee drinks we've had. Since we didn't order an actual dessert, they brought us out a small selection of chocolate truffles. Just the perfect finishing touch. 
Typically when we travel, we're "One & done" as pertains to dining, but this experience was so extraordinary that we've already made reservations to return to Nautika prior to our departure next week. We simply can't pass up an opportunity to experience that Foie Gras one more time before we go.

Not only was every portion of our mean outstanding but there was an incredible focus on every minute detail in order to make our evening a very special one. From the complimentary appetizer to the complimentary chocolate and digestifs at the end of our meal, the quality of the dinnerware,tablecloth and other such amenities, nothing luxuries was spared !
The food was cooked to perfection and the tastes were amazing !
We highly recommend this restaurant with an incredible view as well overlooking the Adriatic in the most beautiful scenery.
The restaurant is not inexpensive BUT it truly is worth every Kuna.

Nautika sits on a little square just outside the entrance to Dubrovnik's Old Town. I imagine the building must have once been a rich merchants house. It perches above the Adriatic with views of the majestic walls of the OldTtown and the sea. The seating is all on outside terraces and the roof area and makes for a magical setting. And, of course, the food, drink, wine and service are all top flight. If you are looking for a romantic evening in Dubrovnik you would be hard pressed to beat this.

This was a really special place. The food was amazing and presented so well. But the service was also fantastic - really exceptional. They were knowledgeable, attentive at the right times, presented and explained everything incredibly well, and the location is amazing - you won't find a better spot. Definitely sit outside. And all things considered, it wasn't horribly pricey (don't get me wrong, it's not cheap, but it wasn't insanely expensive either). Def a must go place while in Dubrovnik, and order the cognac drink 75 something - the preparation, presentation, and of course, the taste were all amazing

Nautika is just outside the gates of the Old Town. There is a large outdoor space along with an elegant indoor space. The service is excellent -- first class. Food is well prepared and tasty. Some Croatian dishes, but mainly an international menu. Nice for a special occasion.

Far and away, this restaurant has the best views of the old city, of all the fine dining options in Dubrovnik. The wine list is extensive and the service is impeccable, from the greeters in front to the waiters hovering to assist at every moment. If you go, I would stick to the menu choices rather than catch-of-the-day, unless you like your fish very plain/ simple with minimal sides (the fresh fish is more expensive here than other places).Overall, this is a “must do” if you want a true fine dining experience in a breathtaking location.

We enjoyed a fantastic dinner overlooking the city walls combined with wonderful Dalmatian wine recommended to us by the knowledgeable sommelier.

The food was superior and the service excellent.
Thoroughly recommend this restaurant. Stunning location, attentive staff and beautiful food. A perfect evening.

From the moment we were welcomed the service was impeccable. We were seated at an amazing table on the terrace, and then the rain came in unexpectedly. They graciously moved us inside, then outside again once the weaqther passed. They wanted us to have the experience of dining with the spectacular view. The cocktails were so origina,l and a musy to start your experience at Nautika.The cuisine was amazing. The service was truly remarkable! Will go back again on our next visit to Dubrovnik! Thank you for a wonderful experience!
The food and service was excellent. We sat outside on the terrace where the view and the atmosphere was amazing. The staff went that little bit extra because it was her Birthday.

Situated right outside the old city walls this restaurant is an absolute delight! Quality meals and even better service made for a fantastic evening, a little on the pricy side but it’s fine dining in a key tourist location so I guess it’s expected.

We came to Dubrovnik for a week and we choice to reserve a table at Nautika for out special evening. From the beginning All the staff was very welcome and professional in there work. The food was excellent with high level of local ingredients. The set menu was delicious with a complimentary cocktail excellent too. We would like to thank all the staff. Will visit again !!!!!

We booked a table in the terrace however when we arrived the weather turned windy and we were given indoor table. Once the weather again got better, they gave us a table at the smaller terrace with great view and more intimate seating area. We both had 7 course tasting menu which I can highly recommend. Food was of great taste and quality, the service was excellent. Our waiter was very professional perfectly explaining each dish as well as the pairing olive oils in very detailed way. We had GRK Bire white wine which was superb companion with the 7 course tasting menu. Will definitely come back to this place!

What a place! Fine dining - super! Great food - absolutely fabulous! Service - everyone make feel welcome at all times! 
Gin and Tonic as appetitive - what a new combination! View - simply incredible!

I would vote for Nautica to be recognized as San Pellegrino Top 50! Everything about this place is amazing and great. Fellow travelers, book in advance and enjoy!!! It’s pricey but amazing!!!

We entered restaurant Nautica with a lot of joy, looking forward to what we though was going to be a near Michelin Star dinner. Well I must say it wasn't, not even close. 
This restaurant is full of people who lost grip with reality, thinking they are the finest restaurant (according to their advertisement), but in real life they belong to the middle class. 

I don't like to right negative stuff, but this restaurant is so overpriced against other great restaurants in Croatia, that I like to add a little review. 

So some details: food not coked perfectly, wine pairing with different kind of menu's same wines and both not matching at all. Where the wine is great, with the food it brings both food and wine down. The food is not up to standards. Can go in a lot of details, but I think that's not fair. 

So in short: Superb location! Arrogant service and average food. Price/quality disastrous

The setting of Nautika is truly special. We dined overlooking the sea and the ancient architecture. Service and food were excellent. I recommend to go early and be there for sunset followed by the stars and moon coming out.

This restaurant is a must for anyone wanting a truly 'fine dine' experience. The food is exquisite; quality, taste, presentation. The waiter service is excellent; knowledgeable, courteous, very smartly dressed. We had the lobster and chocolate desert accompanied by a beautiful rose wine which the waiter recommended. All the tables are lovely but book well in advance to get a table overlooking the sea. A wonderful evening meal - thank you to all staff at the Nautika.

The place is beautiful 
Make sure to book in advance to have a table overlooking the wall! 
The waiters and staff are so so so friendly and kind! The truffle tagliatelle was delicious, the chocolate cake/mousse desert with olive oil was insane!
They get delicious olive oil to accompany every meal and they're all so good
The food was perfect. The service was perfect. The view of the Adriatic was perfect. What more can be said……

We travel a lot and this restaurant is at the top of our list! The location is inspiring. Try to make your reservation as soon as your plans allow and ask for a terrace water edge table.

In addition to a perfect location the restaurant provides excellent food. Our meal was spot on with delicious flavors and perfect quantities. I asked the sommelier to just bring some wine to go with each dish. His selections of croatian wines were spot on.

The waiters were attentive yet at the same time relaxed and friendly. 

This evening was the highlight of our one week along the Adreatic Sea.

Great place, good Food, amazing view, I can not have gluten or dairy and they easily adapt the dishes.
High recommended

Celebrated our wedding anniversary at this beautiful restaurant. We reserved a table a few weeks before and got a beautiful table on the terrace with an amazing view.
The staff were knowledgeable of the menu and the food was simply amazing!
Go in and invest for first class service, 5 stars restaurant interior and delicious food. This place has it all with breathtaking views of sea and the beautiful old town walls.

we reserved in advance and were lucky to get a table with a wonderful view. the food was so unbelievably good and the waiter was very knowledgeable. He helped us choose wine and gave us different olive oils to taste. The dinner could not have been better. thank you Nautica for an evening to remember.

The service is friendly, the food was very good but the portions were too small for some dishes even by the standards of some michelin star restaurants. The tuna was top notch and the goat cheese salad was ok.

Can't fault it at all. I took my partner here for her birthday, and it was perfect in every aspect. 
The setting is the most beautiful we've ever seen, out on the roof terrace. Very romantic.
The food was stunningly good. My partner had steak and I had lamb, and both could have been eaten without teeth, amazingly tender. 
Its not cheap by any stretch, but if you're after a perfect night for a celebration, you couldn't do any better than this. 
A special mention for our waiter Ivan, he catered to our every need and gave us all the info we needed.
Superb food, not only the fish but the accompanying vegetables and the desserts. Excellent service - friendly, charming and relaxed, but super-efficient. A wonderful location.

We had a simply brilliant evening at Nautika. The service was spot on- friendly yet professional. The food was delicious and we really enjoyed the tasting menu. A really beautiful setting overlooking the old town walls and the sea. Highly recommend.

What more to say...wonderful views, fantastic food (speaking as a Michelin star seeker in the UK), attentive staff and reasonable prices, treat yourself to a meal here and have anything that includes the fish stock (exquisite).
We were lucky to get a table as a walk in! The view is obviously amazing. The waiters were so nice and knowledgeable and welcoming. The food was great!
Amazing dinner on the patio during sunset for our anniversary. Food, drinks, and service were next-level.

The restaurant is very well decorated and very romantic, has live piano music, nice terrace, balcony with a great sea view. 
 We liked the menu and the presentation of dishes, though even more fresh sea food would be just great.
 Definitely recommend coming here for drinks as the presentation and preparation of cocktails is very attractive and specific.
 The staff was great, kept joking and interacting, was very helpful and professional all evening long, we are very glad about our experience and enjoyed our evening. Great Mediterranean time.
Impeccable location, service, attention to detail, and wonderful food. Do not hesitate to go there if you are in Dubrovnik.

This was my first time here and certainly not my last. I came with my wife and 7 year old child. They even made my son chicken and fries at his request. Nothing was too much for the staff. Head waiter was a gentleman and carried on filling our glasses and checking we were fine. All the staff made a fuss of my son which he loved. The food was 5 * minimum, outstanding. Wine was fantastic and I couldn’t have asked for more. Will be returning ASAP. Worth every penny.

We were amazed by the food at Nautika. Everything was delicious and the dishes were topped with local olive oils which was an interesting addition. The veal was some of the best that I've ever had, even compared to top Michelin starred restaurants. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in Dubrovnik. The views add to the magical atmosphere of this wonderful restaurant.
We ate here on our last night in Dubrovnik and were blown away by the level of service we received from all of the staff and of course the food, and wine. Definitely recommended.

Very nice meal, very nice atmosphere, very nice experience, not cheap but not over priced either; if you want one special night in Dubrovnik go here.

Request the sea view or balcony view prior

In our opinion this has one of the two best views in Dubrovnik as long as you sit on the terrace. I think u need to come for the 6:30 seating to get the best tables and the views. There are later seatings

Sit and take pictures of the sea and the sunset. Memories forever.

The food is wonderful. We had the sea bass baked in Salt. Expensive but very tasty. We also had a salad, very fresh and tasty. Desserts are wonderful.

The wait staff is wonderful and the sommelier did a great job selecting the Croatian wine for us.

This is fine dining.
We had a best dinner in Dubrovnik. Everything we eat was perfect and service was briliant. For sure wil came back again.

One of the best restaurant I’ve ever been,
Service beyond perfect
Breathtaking view
Impressive wine choice and advice from the house sommelier 
Nice refined food (small portions)

Last night was Honestly the best dining experience I’ve ever had (our party of 4 all agreed and we are still talking about it now). Our waiter was amazing, the food was spectacular and the cocktails and wine just 👌! The manager personally visited our table to welcome and when we departed.... and the pianist played our wedding song when we asked while we waited for our table! ( we got married a few days earlier)

Excellent food, excellent service (Mario our waiter was brilliant) 
We had a 3 course meal and finished every crumb on the plate. The view was amazing on the terrace. 
Best dinning experience ever, highly recommended.

We had a wonderful last night in Dubrovnik at Nautika Restaurant, where we had a 7 course menu. 
The staff was excellent both in service, social skills and knowledge about food & wine. The view is stunning. 
Even though the price level is among the more expensive restaurants in the area, you defiantly get what you pay for (maybe more). Will highly recommend this restaurant, and we actually made a new reservation for some friends while we where there, since the experience was so good - so thank you Nautika:)

Really really enjoyed this restaurant. The service here is just mind blowing. They treat you soooo well, never been treated so well in another restaurant. The staff is very courteous. We did the 7 course tasting menu since we couldn’t pick what to eat and it was the best decision because you get all the best options to try! Highly recommend this place and a reservation well ahead of time.

Ok, this is undeniably the greatest setting of all restaurants in Dubrovnik. However I’m not sure if it was worth the hefty price. My husband ordered a seafood dish that albeit was delicious (according to him) - it was not a big enough portion for the price paid and he left hungry. I ordered the truffle tagliatelle which was delicious but was on the starter menu so I’m confused why it was served as a main on the vegetarian menu. The price was the same on both menus - I did ask if it was a main meal portion, to be told yes but it was tiny so im dubious. I would have ordered a starter but goats cheese is not to my liking and that was the only veggie starter. But once again I’m unsure what was supposed to be a starter/main. We contemplated grabbing more food from elsewhere while we were paying the cheque we were THAT hungry. I did not feel our waiter was approachable enough to ask again about portion sizes so we paid and left feeling unsatisfied. I am aware this is a fine dining restaurant, certainly not the first I have eaten in. My advice, if you’re going to come here make sure you have a big lunch!

We chose to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary at Nautika, and were not disappointed. The location is stunning, overlooking the walls and the St Lawrence fortress. We both selected the 5 course tasting menu and every course was delicious. Our waiter provided excellent service, fine dining without being pretentious. A very memorable experience.

We sat on the upper gallery and could not have had a better view! It was a beautiful dinner with excellent service. Just know that this restaurant is way more expensive than any other place in Dubrovnik. The food was good....not outstanding...my husband's tuna dish was beautiful, but very tiny portions, and my fish was good, but for the price....not great. So, as long as you know that it is very pricey....go and enjoy the evening as the view and service make this place special!
Great and exclusive place surrounded by professional persons; good relation price quality. In one word the best in Dubrovnik.

We had a fabulous evening at Nautika. We booked several months in advance, based on the great reviews and were not disappointed. 
The service really is exceptional, so many little touches and details. 

The staff are also flexible and accommodating to customer preferences and they made my daughter feel very special by adapting a dish on the menu to her preference and making an amazing non-alcoholic drink for her. 

The food is fabulous, loved the shrimp risotto. Mario, our waiter was so attentive and explained the menu to us and nothing was too much trouble. He had a good sense of humour and there was none of the snottiness that you sometimes get in high end restaurants. Watching the swifts soaring overhead as the sun went down made the whole experience so incredibly atmospheric and memorable. 

We can’t wait to return to Dubrovnik to eat here again.

We had a great meal at Nautika on our last night in Dubrovnik. So glad we chose to dine here. The food was excellent -- the sea bass filet, the tuna filet, the salad with goat cheese and the chocolate dessert as well as the "Orange Meets Prosec". The wine list is so extensive that it looks like a mini-encyclopedia! The waitstaff were attentive, helpful and friendly. The location is memorable -- just outside of the Pile gate. Ask for outdoor seating overlooking the water and the fortress. Our dinner was expensive and worth it.

We visited the Nautika because it was the #1 top rated restaurant in Dubrovnik on Trip advisor.

For a family of 4 we spent over £500 uk pounds.

The restaurant is in a perfect location, the staff are amazing, we weren’t rushed.

We just found the food alright - we expected more. 3 of us had Large Shrimps starter and Lobster Tail main - both dishes were alright but no wow factor. Our youngest daughter had the beef which looked fantastic.

It’s a special restaurant and we had a special evening (my wife’s birthday and the staff sang with a candle at dessert) we just expected the food to be more special for the price.

Had a great evening though x

A really beautiful restaurant based at the cliff face overlooking the walls of the old town of Dubrovnik
Most wonderful dining experience 
We had been recommended this and it did not disappoint
As well as a dining experience it was an education as the waiter explained every dish from its origins to its preparation
I would highly recommend but i tip give plenty of notice as it books out well in advance
Make sure to ask for table at outside nearest to the water side to experience all the views

I chose this restaurant for an anniversary and I couldn’t have picked a better location and setting. I emailed beforehand to make sure we had a nice table on terrace and it didn’t disappoint. The food was amazing and tasty however very pricey and I would only recommend it for those who are willing to pay high prices for very small portions of food. We had to fill ourselves up on bread as the portions were extremely small.

Was recommended by the local. Price on high side. Luckily got a table just 2 hours before dinning time.Was so excited to have dinner there. 
Nautika was honoured to host Saint John Paul II on June 6th of 2003. Selected as the sixth most romantic restaurant in the world by Condé Nast Traveller in 2008.
The food, services, wine was outstanding and comparable to a michelin-starred restaurant. Served oliver oil menu to match different dishes Don't miss the tasting menu and ask for off menu wine pairing.The waiter was professional. They served wine like a sommelier. He was knowldegeable and gave the explanation for each wine with grapes varietal, origin and taste. It seemed that like a croatian wine tasting session.The view was so romantic and enjoyed sunset with delicacy.Barvo.

The only thing that may be better than the food at Nautika is the beautiful setting with views of the city walls. Our meal was delicious and our wait staff were the perfect amount of attentive. Enjoyed tasting the different olive oils from around the region. The shrimp appetizer with polenta was fantastic and we had two different types of white fish that were also excellent. If you are a chocolate lover - try the chocolate dessert - but I recommend sharing as it was very rich! Would certainly return here for a special evening if I find myself back in Dubrovnik! I do recommend making reservations - I did online about a week before and we were fortunate to get a table on the first row of the terrace!

This was the Only Resturant that i had pre booked months in advance. Recommend by my friend who was there only weeks prior to us. I was there with my husband and sister. The views were some of the best I have ever had and the service as well. I loved it all. The price tag is quite high but a must for a perfect setting both inside and out. The food was sometimes really on and then just ok for other dishes. Regardless worth visit and cost.

location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
review: Excellent menu, superb service and just the best setting possible in the Old Town of Dubrovnik. The special recommended Gin and Tonics are a must! Expensive night but certainly worth it for any special occasion or the most memorable holiday dinner you’re likely to have!

Was fully booked but offered a drink to see if any cancellations and then a table came available in prime location !
Service impeccable and food amazing - will remember the evening for a long time and 
Highly recommended for a special holiday treat
Thank you

I came here with my best friend for a blowout meal as a treat for her birthday. The waiter service was impeccable, our waiter Martyn even brought us bug spray because I was complaining I'd be bit the previous night. Nothing was too much trouble for them, they even put truffle sauce in a separate plate in case I didn't like it. I had the sea bass for my main course and it was the nicest fish dish I've ever had.
They were helpful recommending which wine accompanied each course and the desert wine was delicious alongside the chocolate pudding.
My only criticism would be I didn't see a menu choice for vegetarians/vegans.

Had dinner at the Nautika Restaurant on the balcony as seen in the photograph overlooking the bay between Fort Bokar on the City Walls and Fort Lovrijenac. We asked our hotel to make the reservation and it took a few days before we could get a table. Recommend therefore making an early booking.

This was the day of the World Cup final and even though Croatia were beaten by France the town was in a party mood as they still felt proud as a country to have come second. As a result the town had prepared fireworks and during our meal a large barge had been positioned in the bay so we had a grandstand view of the display.

The meal was superb we all started with soups which were truly delicious followed by sea bass, lamb and steak dishes which were outstanding. We also had some excellent local Croation wines with the food. We were helped by the staff who were very knowledgeable about the wines.

We were a group of 16 and were given a private terrace with an amazing view. We had to delay our time as a previous excursion and over ran. No problem. We had a 5 course set menu that was fantastic, we went with their wine recommendations, which were explained and all delicious. Because we started late we inevitably finished late (late late) and still they managed to look after us without dropping the smile. Which could not have been easy. Loved it.

We had a fabulous meal at Nautika and tried the 5 course taster menu. The staff were very accommodating to a few minor adjustments. Sea bass and lobster tail both standout dishes. 

Book ahead to request a table on the terrace overlooking the sea and the walls, a really stunning setting.

If you would have forgotten what is the essence of fine dining, just go here!
This restaurant is just impecable: amazing food (3 michelin stars worthy) with perfect service.
After a way too busy visit to Dubrovnik, this restaurant is just the oasis of peace amd service you atlre looking for.
It is very expensive and you have to be well dressed or you won’t be seated but it is worth every penny, kuna or euro.
The food is extraordinary, the cocktails to die for and the service incredible. It has been a long time since I lived such an
amazing culinary experience!
This restaurant is what made my visit to Dubrovnik worth while.

My advise: save up, invent a special ocasion and go here!

The restaurant is located in front of the Pile gate overlooking the sea and old walls of thencity..the sunset is worth of every euro spend overhere because it is like the dream. If you have the option to go then go and get a table overhere. Offcorse the food isntasty and nice as you expect for the amount of money.

I have to admit than when we first saw the location (a short walk from the main entrance to the Pile Gate and main tourist collection area) we were a bit concerned; we even contemplated cancelling. But we are sure glad that we kept our reservation. From the moment we arrived the service and overall dining experience was exceptional. Nautika is clearly a restaurant that takes unbelievable pride in delivering a special experience to its guests; it's a level of service that's incredibly hard to execute from top to bottom. The food and wine list is as good as advertised; they do an amazing job with the scallop/potato/kale small plate and the flavors and richness of their shrimp and polenta dish is outstanding. Fresh fish availability was more diversified than in other high-end restaurants in Dubrovnik and we enjoyed trying a few things we hadn't seen on other menus. 

After our exceptional meal we ventured into Old Town for a bit of shopping and quickly made our way back to Nautika for one last drink before heading back to our hotel. Even sitting in the lobby and listening to the piano player while sipping on Plavac Mali was a memorable experience. We will certainly be back on our next trip to Croatia.

We dined at Nautika during our recent stay in Dubrovnik and it didn’t disappoint. Having pre-booked which is wise to avoid disappointment, we were seated at a lovely table with views of the old town walls and the sea, and the service and quality of food and drink was excellent. We went for the 7 course tasting menu paired with wine from an extensive list, and very much enjoyed the food and the use of local ingredients, plus the knowledge that the waiters had of their origins. The atmosphere is relaxed but formal and they really take care of you, moving us to a different table after dinner so we could enjoy a different view and serving some fantastic complimentary Croatian digestifs (try the hazelnut liquor!) and coffee. It was lovely to dress up a little for the evening but it’s not pretentious - most people were in holiday dress but on the smarter side (shirt/polo t shirt and shorts/chinos for the men and summer dresses for the women). Not cheap - will set you back at least £300-350 depending on what you drink - but an absolute highlight of our holiday and would highly recommend.

Reviews are accurate. Just an amazing dining experience and worth every dollar. Staff was great and food was outstanding. 9 courses in total we had over three hours - all were top notch. View was beautiful.

Fish dishes are amazing! Very tasty and even beautiful! Stuff is very polite and welcome, amazing view and location. I recommend to visit restaurant on sunset for a romantic dinner, atmosphere is just wonderful 💜

Our wedding planner recommended this place to us for our first meal as husband and wife the night after our wedding. The staff certainly complied with her request to give us a good table - what an amazing view we had of the sunset, fort and old city walls. 
Our waiter was so attentive and professional, and had a good sense of humour to enjoy a bit of banter with us. The specialist wine waiter was also brilliant, letting us taste the different wines before we made our choice. 
The food was incredible. I am vegan and this was not an issue at all for the staff of Nautika, our waiter brought me the vegetarian menu (without me even asking, as they'd had a note from our planner), told me everything that could be made vegan, and double checked for me anything he was unsure of. 
Yes, the restaurant is on the pricey side, but it's undoubtedly worth it. In this case you most certainly do get what you pay for. 
We loved Nautika so much, that we are going to back for our wedding Anniversary next June! A perfect romantic evening!

This is a very pricey restaurant ($45-$50/entree and $30-$35 for starters), but the service, atmosphere, and food is impeccable. It was absolutely worth the splurge for our honeymoon. The host sat us at a prime table with a view of the city walls, the setting sun, and Fort Lovrijenac. Our server was a true professional and gave us perfect recommendations for wine. It was a magical evening.
Very nice terace on walls with beautifull view on sea and forterres , nice fine food place , definitly recomended .

We stopped by the previous night and were told they were booked for the next night but to swing by and check if they had any openings. We followed instructions and came Tuesday at 2015. They said they might have an opening. We sat on the side and ordered drinks. A table opened up before we even had our drinks!

Service is amazing. The nicest people we have met in Croatia so far! The menu is expensive but it comes with great food. The drinks were great too. We recommend the veal. 

Bottom line-get a reservation but have hope if you don’t have one. Our meal was 190$ including tip—2 drinks, one app, and veal and a bass dish. 

Enjoy!
While the food is great, it's not out of this world, know that you're paying for the ambiance and service. Waitstaff and sommelier were excellent!

This restaurant is special, sitting right between the old city's wall and St. Lawrence Fortress. The view is lovely, the staff is excellent, and our meals were delicious. This is a place you go for special occasions, as it is expensive. But for us it was well worth it.

Very nice and comfortable place.
The view is wonderful as well as the whole city. Food is good although it is not in the foreground. Staff very professional.
We are very pleased with this place, the prices are good and affordable.

It’s expensive but you are probably aware of it before reserving a table. View is fantastic, waiters attentive and friendly. Although you pay twice as much as in other restaurants but you get the fine dining experience. Only food we didn’t like was the cuttlefish medallions in sesame.

We booked this a month in advance and we were so glad we did! The staff at this exquisite restaurant are so attentive so friendly and make you feel so welcome and so relaxed. My wife and I started with their gin signatures which were delightfully opulent! Mine on a silver plater with perfume essence and my wife’s in a bird cage!! I had already decided what I wanted to eat but my decision was changed by their expert knowledge and understanding of what you liked. The food was excellent the service first class and we would recommend it to anyone. We were made to feel special and it’s our favourite restaurant. Thank you all it was fantastic! David and Lisa xx

What a great restaurant Nautika is! The food was excellent and the service we had was unrivalled in Dubrovnik. The staff really went the extra mile and nothing was too much for them. Lovely location as well, so beautiful to sit overlooking the ocean. Highly recommend.

We had a delightful evening at Nautika - all the staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. Particular highlights were the veal and the lobster, beautiful well balanced dishes. The sommelier recommended some great Croatian red wine.

I booked this restaurant about a month previous after doing much research.

Let me be upfront about the things I felt that stopped me from giving it 5 stars:
- I made the booking and was told in the email to reconfim. It didn’t matter what number I used none worked to do so. I went to the restaurant a half hour earlier to make sure my reservation was still kept and ‘there was no problem’. So, here is my issue - you take my credit card details and tell me that you will charge me if I don’t show but I can’t get a hold of you and neither can my hotel (Hilton) you have a problem and that is not on the customer side.
- Further - I specifically asked for the terrace (upper) with the view. But as typically seen by Europeans single means ‘cheap’. Really? I was VERY disappointed by this that I was seated on the lower terrace and I was the first there.
- You take bookings as 6pm but I was told to wait in the lobby as you are having your wait staff meeting....wait...should that not be done before your 6pm booking?? Crazy talk...you need to get your act together people.
- It rained - like stormed for a while at the beginning of the dinner. I told the staff. They were too busy rescuing all the other tables rather than the table I was at and had to get myself out of the rain before I was seen to. I would have thought the guest would have been the first to been to?
-Lastly - small but when I mentioned wiith excitement that there was a double rainbow after the rain to the wait staff...I was told all about how a rainbow occurred. Like...really? I teach science and I know how the world works...I was just pointing it out so she might share with other customers about it so that they might like to get a picture...didn’t need the science behind it (which she got wrong btw).

Can I please share about the incredible things that happened:
- it rained (as mentioned) the temperature dropped and I was asked if I would like a lovely white blanket to keep me warm - the waiter ( I wish I could remember his name!) told me how to sit so that he could wrap me the best.
-The food (that fish soup) was incredible!
- Overall service was great.
- Sea bass....the best ever! That vanilla flavor!
- Great waiter with great knowledge of wine
- Wasn’t made to feel strange by being a female eating by myself - they get exta for this

I would come back? Yes! Yes! Yes! Great place and great food but for me not quite 5 star...yet...

This review gets 5/5 based on the service alone. I booked a table on the terrace outside a couple of months in advance for our special Anniversary, and I got exactly what I asked for. The communication from the reservations team was excellent, and the service from the moment we arrived and throughout our meal was exceptional. Food wise, I'd probably give 4.5/5. My starter of shrimp risotto was superb, but my wife's scallop dish was pretty average with the scallop lost amidst the kale and truffle accompaniments. Mains of lamb and beef were very good however, and the chocolate desert one of the best I've had. Champagne was eye wateringly expensive even by London standards but given the occasion I paid up. The evening ended as it had begun with further exceptional service as the restaurant marked our special day with a complimentary cocktail. Thank You.

Co-worker recommended us to go Nautika and they were so right. Our dining experience at Nautika restaurant was definitely five stars because...

1. View: Nautika seated us by the ocean as we requested...and OMG what a lovely view of Adriatic Sea at the sunset! How else can you indulge yourself for your summer vacay;)

2. Service: our head waiter Mario was so good to us and ensured to send his fellow waiter to our table while he was serving others. Perfect management is what I like.

3. Flexibility for taking orders: I had four courses dinner while my hubby ordered the five course dinner. We don’t drink much so they got us nice local champagne by glass...but it was so great so my hubby ended up ordering white wine by glass a few times more (should have ordered a half bottle).

4. Food: yes as you might have seen all pics of dishes from others all our dishes was beautifully decorated and color coordinated. They use truffle they use wasabi... very delicate combination and tastes were exquisite. Yet what I was most ecstatic about was the soufflé dish with shrimp. I did a little happy dance to it for my first bite:)

5. Price: not cheap I tell you but totally reasonable:)

6. Building: amazing historical building. If you dine outside don’t forget to check out the inside too. They had a pianist playing when I was there and it was just perfect. 

Staffs, chefs and everyone at Nautika was wonderful. Love love love to go back there again!
Great meal, great service, spectacular location and view. Two of us shared the salt encrusted sea bass, which was excellent. The signature Citrus G&T was fantastic.

location: Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
review: We went there after our first night in Dubrovnik when we had dinner at 360, expectations were high and Nautika made up to it. Food was great, service very friendly and what a view. Would definitely recommend, had a great evening.

I proposed to my girlfriend in Dubrovnik and had dinner booked at Nautika and it was absolutely amazing.

I couldn't recommend this place more. The service was impeccable from start to finish and the food was the best I have tasted. Fine dining but at a reasonable cost.

We shared a starter, had desert and a bottle of wine and it was no more than £200.

They also gave us free cocktails as a congratulations for our engagement.

If you really value good food and service, Nautika is a must when visiting Dubrovnik.

Thank you for an amazing evening.

Atmosphere/Ambiance -- 9 
Service -- 8 
Meal -- 7
Cocktails -- 8 
Je ne sais quoi -- 9
Would I go back -- Yes

I would go back just for the views. The restaurant sits just outside the old city so the view of the city is really remarkable. Be sure an make a reservation and ask for the front row. The cocktails are great...extremely creative in their presentation. Order the drink 'bird in a cage" and you'll see what I mean. The service was wonderful and the meal was good. I would go back.

Nautika is a beautiful restaurant on a beautiful location, but... 
It was way way too expansive to the size of the dishes, and we were sorry to say it wasn't so good. 
So, I wouldn't recommend it... Ther is enough beautiful restaurant in old Town..

This has to be one of the best restaurants I have eaten in. Absolutely Outstanding. The food was superb each course thoughtfully prepared well presented and a diners delight. The attention to detail and the attentiveness and knowledge of the staff added to what was an absolutely enjoyable evening.

This is a seriously good restaurant, London fine dining standard and impeccable, professional hospitality. We were lucky enough to get onto the upper terrace where there are only 4 tables and got the best of those...the view is stunningly good no matter which side of the table you sit. The food is 'fine dining' at its best, the service attentive but not obtrusive, friendly but not obsequious...these guys know exactly what they are doing and deliver the perfect experience. Yes! its pricey!...London prices! and although elsewhere in Dubrovnik old town you don't really get what you pay for at Nautika you leave feeling that the experience was worth every penny....so treat yourself you will not be disappointed.
Special mention to Ivan (there are 4 of them though), who was delightful and made us feel very welcome guests.

Service was probably the best I have ever had.
Location is up there with the best - overlooking kings landing !
The food was just wonderful, with just the right quantity and quality.
The toilets were immaculate and the interior decor of the restaurant was sumptuous.

But the service and warmth from the waiters made you feel a million dollars and it felt so genuine.

Couldnt fault it.

My husband and I were recommended this restaurant and we were not disappointed. The service was second to none and the food was delicious. Our friends enjoyed a very unusual gin, worth asking when you visit. All in all a lovely experience with a view to die for!

Exquisite meal, magnificent setting and impeccable service, that is the Nautika Restaurant, I booked my reservation several months in advance to be able to sit on the Terrace and it was worth it. It was absolutely one of the best dining experiences ever. If you are looking for a Five Star dining experience, you will not be disappointed. This is not just dining, it is creating an incredible memory.
Nautika is a beautiful restaurant with amazing views. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly as well. The food was great and I can easily say it was the best meal we had while in Dubrovnik.

This classy restaurants is a perfect place for romantic dinner. The menu is creative, with fresh local ingredients and great wine list. The service is impeccable, the best I have seen in Dubrovnik (and I live here!) and the view is breathtaking... I would strongly recommend this place for anyone looking for an exciting dining experience..

This restaurant overlooks the old fort and ocean - it is stunning view. The food and service were world class. Ask the hostess Dragonna for a great table. Perfect place for a very special occasion or simply a romantic evening.
Nautika is a Dubrovnik classic. The food is really good, view superb. We loved the foie gras, the sea bass was good..but overall the key to our experience was the service and the view. Thank you

On our first day in Dubrovnik we came across this restaurant we absolutely loved the food and the views that we returned 4 times throughout our holiday. If you ask you also get a 10% off voucher for each future visit
Outstanding location , food and service. The menu is delicious and enhanced by the terrific views of old town by the ocean. Pricey but worth the attention to detail and a delightful evening.

My husband and I visited the restaurant and I have to say that the whole experience exceeded (and then some) our expectations.
Firstly, on arriving we were seated on the ground floor some way away from the sea view... no matter we could still see it as well as the city walls. Then our waitress told us that a table had become available on the balcony if we’d prefer it... and what a table it was. 
Moreover on top of the stunning views, the food, service, drinks - in fact the entire experience was truly unrivalled. The staff were wonderful - unobtrusive, attentive and knowledgeable. 
My husband and I travel frequently, and have been fortunate enough to dine in some of the best restaurants, however I would say, and without reservation, that Nautika is very special.
Make sure you book - and absolutely try the His & Hers Gin: unforgettable!

My friends and I reserved this restaurant a few hours before we arrived on a Saturday night. Bottom line up front, the service was phenominal and the food was delicious. It wasn't the best 5 star restaurant I have been to but it definitely had the best service. Halfway through the meal with an ocean view, it started to rain a bit and the staff did everything they could to help keep us comfortable and provide us with the best possible night they could. To top off all the great service, they even gave us umbrellas to walk home with at the end of the night. What a solid dinner and experience!
We had the 7 course tasting menu which was superb. The service is impeccable and the view is pretty good too! Yes it's expensive but you get what you pay for. We would definitely recommend.

Difficult to get a table, fantastic old building and great reviews, so maybe our expectations were too high however we left disappointed. We tried better places in Dubrovnik at 1/3rd to half the price and all less pretentious and much more relaxed. Our waiter was excellent though and high food quality, but main servings are starter size portions, so if you come hungry, you will need 3+ dishes. Would not rush back to N on next visit to Dubrovnik. A few guests/tables around us complained that food "was not up to standard of the establishment" and dishes were "bland" and "too small". Dont know if they had been before, but they certainly expressed their opinions. If you want the views, boo alternative just across from N; Dubravka. Similar views, extremely friendly service, great atmosphere, at 1/3rd the price.

Travel like a CEO.

Náutika restaurant Dubrovnik

Super attentive specialised service. Excellent, sophisticated food and espectacular views of of the old town. Not much else you can ask for when you go to this excellent restaurant in Dubrovnik Croatia. Expect to pay a high price for the pre fix tasting menu of 5 or 7 courses. Approximately 150
Euros per person and at least another 100 euros for the wine. A 400 euros dinner for two. This is what you pay for when you go to one of Dubrovnik’s two top restaurants. 
Wanting to spend less, don’t go for the tasting menu and pay maybe 100 euros less. If you go, always ask for a 1st row table ocean view table. The sommelier will always decant your wine selection regardless of your selection. Croatian wine is pretty good one and range from 60 to 150 euros a bottle. Dare to try Croatian wines; you will not be disappointed. 
Presentation of the dishes is artistic but not overly worked, which is good in my opinion. 
A great dining and elegant experience if you are willing to spend 200 euros per person. 
Want to spend less, then go to one of the 50 restaurants inside old town. You will
Find dozens of decent restaurants from
Mexican food to local and Italian food, where you will spend 50 euros per person. Want to spend even-less, go to one of the many pizzerías inside old town.

This is the best restaurant in Dubrovnik. The food is first rate, the staff are attentive but not intrusive, polite not obsequious. The views are stunning. It’s a great place to take friends or to go for a romantic date. It is not cheap but you are getting a first class experience. Book well in advance, weeks if not months, to get the best front line tables. Highly recommended.

The place is by far the best restaurant in dubrovnik, service is just outstanding and the location is breathtaking. We order some cocktails as appetizers which were the best so far in Croacia. Then the main dishes were completely delightfully.
I completely recommended this restaurant.

Nice,great staff,great food,really good location.Staff was really nice and helped us with everything we asked for. Really great and kind people. Prices are maybe to high for average people but it's definitely worth it.

My girlfriend wanted something near the walls, so I found this restaurant, with an astonishing view. Had to make a reservation for two and asked specifically to be on the edge of the balcony. It was worth every penny. The location, the view, the service, everything went smoothly. 
We had a reservation for 21:30, finished eating around 00:00, and the weather was perfect outside.

The food is delicious, altough we had gastronomic pana cotta offered that wasn't at my taste. 
Everything else was top notch !
Recommended by many, the place comes with a significant price tag, but nevertheless the food of worth the price.

We just had a dinner tonight with my family. The food setting is wonderful comes with a GREAT Quality of Food. It is also considered one of the best services that I have ever had in Croatia!! In my opinion, I think the michelin star restaurant supposed to be given to Nautika restaurant rather than 360 restaurant in Dubrovnik because in term of service Quality is way much much better!

There are too many cheaper options but if you want to celebrate a special event or want to experience a great food with your love, than this is the right place… 
We enjoyed the food and the great view on our last night in Dubrovnik… The food deserves Michelin stars… Fois gras and the veil carpaccio were awesome… The seabass cooked perfect but it tasted OK… The steak was magnificent…. The wine list was size of a encyclopedia, we preferred local wines… Enjoyed every moment…
Perfect in every way - location, view, staff, service, wine and of course food - in fact, beyond perfect!!

We had a very good dinner at Nautika. The fish soup and Tagliatelle with truffles were very good starters, We shared the fish of the day, Sea bream. Which was boned an served by Ivan (our waiter) table side. It was very good. Ivan took very good care of us and don't miss the Chocolate dessert. The setting is lovely and the whole evening was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Easy reservation process via email for our party of 11. We were seated on the lower terrace and the views were breathtaking. Shamelessly took photos throughout the entire night. Since we were a large group, we had to prebook our meals with two tasting menu options. Both options were delicious and we were very full by the end of our meal. They had an extensive wine list but we're not wine experts so we had cocktails which were served in a very creative way! Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner, took us around 3 hours to get through the entire menu and the staff were very attentive and made sure we were comfy and happy. Would highly recommend!

The setting, service, food, drinks, and presentation made our dinner at Nautika probably the most memorable dining experience we have ever had. The warm greeting at the beginning from the general manager and the ease with which the sommelier helped us choose a perfect wine were great, but the hospitality and service from our main waiter (I believe his name was Ivan—thank you Ivan!) made the night perfect. We booked ahead and had a table right at the stone wall, giving us perfect views of the nearby historic structures and sea. The 5-course tasting menu gave us a great variety of dishes to sample--with some additional touches offered by the restaurant. We recommend the first seating at 6:30 pm, which gave us views both during daylight and also after sunset. We are so glad we chose to dine at Nautika during our recent visit to Dubrovnik.

Such an amazing meal in an absolutely beautiful setting. Everything we ate was spectacular, and made even more so by the drizzling of different local olive oils depending on the plate. The servers were very knowledgeable and friendly, recommending a fantastic wine and making sure we were happy with everything we had. It was a pricier meal, but so worth it.

We ate this beautiful restaurant on Monday last week. Everything about the evening was special and without fault: our waiter had a great, warm sense of humour and not have been more attentive; my gin and tonic arrived in a bird cage (amazing) and the food was a solutely delicious. The veal dish was probably the best thing I had ever eaten. My bf received a delicate and gorgeous little birthday cake, which was washed down with grappe on the house. Simply perfection and worth every penny.

We had the pleasure of having dinner here on a Friday evening. We opted for a late dinner and the staff were very welcoming and had us under a canapé as there was a bit of rain that evening. 

The sommelier was fantastic and took us through the wines. We are big fans of Croatian wine so were happy to opt for a bottle of Merlot.

The food was stunning and we look forward to visiting again.

Loved our experience here! My husband and I dined here on our last leg of our Croatia vacation. The view is extraordinary and well worth watching the colors pop as the sun went down. 
The waiters are attentive and the sommelier is great. We enjoyed cocktails before dinner and wine by glass with dinner. The food was very good as I had an appetizer and steak for dinner my husband did the 5 course. All the food was beautifully arranged, tasted good and the front and center terrace table was perfect. Thanks to everyone there for making our 3 hour dining experience memorable.

We were a group of 8 friends including 4 vegetarians. We went to Nautika for the first seating of the evening (had to vacate our table after 9 pm). We had a great and memorable experience there, having dinner there while the sun set behind us. 

To begin with, they have an impressive wine list, with international as well as local wines on offer. We selected a couple of local wines suggested by the sommelier which were all nice. Among the food items, the fresh fish cooked in sea salt was quite special, as was the pasta with black truffle that our vegetarian group had. We ordered other food too, and none of what was served to us was disappointing. 

All said and done, its the little things that added up to make the experience truly special... like the knowledge of the sommelier, the friendly restaurant staff, the play on the 5 types of local olive oils they served us, the outstanding dessert, the elegant yet simple decor of the ultra clean rest rooms. Wonderful!
One of the best times in restaurant ever. Staff is so friendly, food is so good that I don’t even know what to say. Totaly worth every euro, zloty or kuna.

Before I give my review on the meal I need to express my frustration with diners who have to smoke throughout their dinner which adversely impacts other diners who prefer to savor their food without the tobacco fragrance. It’s just wrong.

For appetizers we had a mixed salad with an assortment of all different vegetables and goat cheese. It had avacado, star fruit, cucumber, mixed greens, carrots etc. The second appetizer was a cuttlefish fish salad, highly unusual but extremely good.

For entrees we enjoyed a polenta with large shrimp, with goat cheese cream and almond flakes that was properly seasoned and perfectly cooked. The other entree was the beef filet with a big Roman gnocci, celery chips and a mushroom gravy. They had a very extensive wine list with over 500 varietals with a very heavy local flavor plus many international ones as well. We found a gem in a 2007 Lopez de Heredia blanco. This is definitely one of the top 3 or 4 restaurants in Croatia. Make the reservation sooner than later if you’re going to be visitingo

Booked a celebration dinner with my 3 best friends prior to our arrival in Dubrovnik. From the moment you step foot in there you are treated like royalty. Pianist/singer sets the scene and mood and the wait staff are second to none. We sat outside facing the sea/walls as the sun went down. The wine menu is extensive and you are advised by your very knowledgable waiter. The food was beautiful and very tasty...I’d recommend the Steak or Sea Bass. Definitely one of my most memorable dinners ever! Yes it’s expensive... but you pay for what you get!

Here’s the deal- Nautika was a beautiful restaurant! The setting is stunning and most of the wait staff were friendly. Our waiter gave off a slightly pretentious vibe, but I guess that is to be expected when the meals are upwards of 100€! I just didn’t really dig the food. Maybe I should have ordered something else, or maybe my high expectations were not met, but it seemed a little overrated to me. However the tuna tartar (my favorite part of my 5 course meal) was exceptional. I wouldn’t use the term “average” to describe my experience, rather “good but not great”.

We had the 7 course taster with wine pairings (and delicious pre-dinner gin and tonics) which I'd definitely recommend. 

Every course was good, but the veal, tuna with garlic, and cuttlefish were standouts. 

Wine pairings were mostly local Croatian peninsula wines and all went excellently with the food. The rosé with cuttlefish, red with tuna, ice wine with carob cake, and red dessert wine with cheese were particularly great.
