They paired most of the courses with different olive oils, I couldn't really taste the differences with food until the last 'blended' oil, which was rich and delicious. They even provided a truffle oil with the cheese which was so pungent a table nearby thought a bottle had been dropped and I could still taste after the post-dinner grappa. 

Service was excellent, attentive and engaging without being overbearing.

The location overlooking the water, with piano playing in the background make it a lovely place for a delicious meal.

I went here with my wife and one other couple and we loved it. The staff were all so attentive and polite and made us feel welcome immediately, especially our waiter Mario. We were lucky enough to get a table outside from 6pm - 9.30pm and the views and sunset were unreal. The food was delicious and served in a way that was very pleasing to the eye. We were recommended to a reasonably bottle of white which was delicious and complimented the food well. As each dish was served it was accompanied by a new olive oil which Croatia is famous for (I did not know this) and Mario explained a little about it. Once we finnished our meal we were invited inside for some free signature cocktails which was a lovely touch. There was also a live piono player playing in the room which gave a great ambiance and toped it off by playing the theme tune of Game of Thrones. All in all a fantastic evening and would highly reccommend.

Just returned to my hotel after a truly memorable meal at Nautika. True it isn’t cheap but we absolutely got what we paid for both in terms of the food and the service. Our waiter Ivan was wonderful, explaining every course in detail and making an excellent wine recommendation. I was impressed that he didn’t point us to the most expensive wine but to one which complimented our food perfectly. I can’t mention one course above another as everything was sublime. We had a table on the terrace complete with sunset, sweeping swallows and moonlight. All in all a perfect evening. If you are in Dubrovnik treat yourself, you will not be disappointed.

Our host in Dubrovnik recommended Nautika for eating a good a dinner. We listened to her and booked a table for my wife´s birthday. We orded a tasting menu, all seafood, one dish better than the other. Together with some good croatian wines, it was some of the best meal we have eaten. At last a good cup of coffe, with some small chocolate goodies and some local liqueur’s. The butler and waiters was very polite, and had a good move, which made the evening even better. It became a memorable celebration of my wife’s birtday.
Get here early and get a seat outside. Amazing views of the sea and ancient walls. The food is great and the service was too.

If you can be lucky enough and get a table on the Terrace the views are amazing, the swallows swooping up and down, in and out of the cliff rocks. We were there just as the sun was setting. The manager greeted us and introduced us to our waiter who was sensational, every course was described in detail, presentation sublime. This isn't the cheapest restaurant on Dubrovnik but in my opinion is easily the best.
Beautiful view, kind stuff, EXCELLENT prawn soup, seabass and tunafish, beautiful interior, pricey but value for money

This is a lovely restaurant. The attention to service is excellent, the location is unbeatable and the quality of food is impressive. They are unashamed about their pursuit of a Michelin Star and that doesn’t seem to be an unrealistic ambition. It’s not cheap but it is good value. A very enjoyable evening. We are happy to recommend it.

We got an awesome spot upstairs and watched the sun going down. The staff was really nice and we were looked after really well. The food was pretty good too- especially the entrees and desserts. The mains were a bit bland- could’ve had a bit more sauce- flavour for the price you get charged. Mum had some lobster pasta though and she loved it. All in all we had a lovely night and would recommend to go. Especially for the really nice setting.

We had a fabulous evening, despite the rain, the food and delightful service were sublime. I happily parted with nearly €300 for two and don’t regret a cent. 

However, why why why were our plates cold for the main course eating al fresco on a cool evening?

Get that right and it’s a 120% vote. Thank you for a memorable evening.

Honestly one of the best meals I have ever had. Everything (literally everything) about the experience was fabulous. The venue, the view, the table setting, the decor, the loos (yes - this does matter!!) and most importantly the food and the staff. As another reviewer quite rightly said, you are treated like Royalty. The cocktails not only looked and tasted amazing, but were delivered with so much detail, care and panache. The level of sophistication of the staff was second to none. Attentive, charming and knowledgeable without being intrusive or over the top. 
I will return to Dubrovnik purely to eat here again. 
Thank you Nautika for an unforgettable evening.
This place is amazing. The food here is just brilliant and you are treated like royalty. Never have I ever been to a restaurant that I have been treated with such courtesy. And the view.... stunning.

We were lucky because without reservation we've menaged to get the table! 
Very good and Moody evening. 
Service excellent.

This is the restaurant to go to in Dubrovnik if you're looking for a meal that is truly sublime. I booked ahead as I'd read the good reviews and I'm a fussy eater- I want to eat food that is above the ordinary and this restaurant delivered. We had a lovely table on the terrace overlooking the fort and the little bay beneath. The grand piano was playing in the background. Don't be afraid, while the menu is limited what you'll get is suberb. We were offered and accepted the amuse bouche, probably the only less than wonderful dish. A tiny jelly and cream concoction with a grissini stick, which was perhaps too subtle for my palate. I ordered the veal and my companion had the beef. I accompanied my veal with a very pleasant glass of Croatian Zinfandel, I was told by the waiter that Croatia is the original native home of the Zinfandel grape, who knew? The veal medallions were a perfect size, beautifully tender and pink in the middle, accompained by potato galettes, flavoured with a hint of truffle and a pea puree, with a hint of mint. The combination was suberb, savoury, satisfying, interesting and moreish. We finished up with the orange meets prosec dessert, again a brilliant combination of a sweet wine jelly with an orange flavoured delicate layered slice with almond praline, so lovely. The tart wine jelly against the creamy orange, with the soft biscuit layers and the crunchy praline. It was unexpectedly better than I was expecting. The bread rolls were soft,fluffy and fresh, and olive oil; buttery and golden, with a bite. The service was almost choreographed and personal but restrained. From my experience tonight this restaurant is on par with many of the Michelin starred restaurants.

Well, people go to museums to see Mona Lisa, the masterpeices of Picasso, but this, this is a masterpiece of food. Never had we ever eaten such a delicios meal, with so much tastes combined. The only word to describe our dinner is art. All the complenents to the service as well, we really enjoyed our time here. Big thanks to all of You!

A beautiful atmosphere surrounded by fortresses and mystic.
The service could not be any better from start to end, our waiter was more exited than us by enjoying his job.
This is the place to be for food lovers!
Expensive but worth it.

We have eaten at dinner by Heston bluememthal and Benares both multi Michelin starred restaurants and nautika Is just as good , plus it has positional ambience over the water and adjacent to the castle walls that adds to its sublimeness, The service was exceptional and very personal - we were served by Ivan who was a wonderful compliment to the awesome tasting menu we had . I would like to thank the team for making our short break to Dubrovnik one of the best experiences of our lives - wonderful , if you have the money this is an experience not to be missed -

Beautiful view and excellent view. Deffinetly worth going there, this restaurant has a excellent food and service and spectatular food, their service is very intetive i would recomend to try their lobster and its a must plave to visit if you go to dubrovnik

From the moment we got there the service was impeccable. Staff noticed that I was a little chilly so immediately adjusted the heat lamps to make us even more comfortable.
Food was amazing and the best Sea Bass we've ever had. The waiter who attended our table was mesmerizing with his knowledge of food and history of the old town.

Having heard our table conversation we also had a surprise birthday cake brought out to us from the staff. Attention to detail is excellent here and a must go for beautiful fine dining cuisine. Out of the 5 nights we spent in Dubrovnik 3 of them we're spent eating here. Amazing and cant wait to return.

Stopped in for cocktails - which were delicious, and ended up also ordering a snack as we watched the sun go down. 
From the moment we sat down, the service was impeccable and friendly. 
We ordered the trio seafood delicacy and shrimp on polenta, both were fantastic. 
This was a great way to end our vacation, thank you!

As soon as we arrived in Dubrovnik we made it our mission to find this restaurant and book a table for our last night, after reading the reviews and seeing the amazing location. Even though we were wearing jeans and trainers we were greeted by the hostess with a warm welcome, and who happily booked our table for the Saturday evening, recommending a time so we could ensure a spot out on the terrace and even showed us around the restaurant. Upon arrival on Saturday evening we were greeted by all of the staff and felt welcomed. Our waiter Mario was exceptional, the service we received from him was amazing, he had excellent knowledge and we felt he really cared about our dining experience. The food was outstanding and presented beautifully, but the view itself was exceptional, especially as the sun was setting. This was a special occasion, a birthday celebration, and we definitely celebrated in style. If we return to Dubrovnik we will definitely be returning to Nautika! Thank you for the experience, it was outstanding!

Exceptional in every way! From the moment we walked in to the moment we when we left.

Our waiter for the evening was Mario, very informative, attentive (as were all the staff) and courteous.

The food is excellent and only outdone by the stunning views.

When we left the manager walked us out and wanted to make sure we had a good evening, which we certainly did. 

If and when we return we will definitely be coming back.
Simple the best food. Everything was fresh and nice yust waiter was rude and unfrendly but is ok. Hightly recomended 👌

Great food and amazing view of the Fort. I went in the evening and saw the lights shine on the fort which made it really special. There is something about being right by the ocean that makes it very comfortable to enjoy a meal

Amazing restaurant with a great view, lovely food and even better service. Try and book early and get a table on the cliff edge, it is worth it. The food was fantastic and the staff so lovely, we stayed late into the night and the waiter recommended brilliant local wines and after dinner drinks too. They send their waiters and staff to the best restaurants in the world for development, our waiter was visiting top places in London, Copenhagen and Paris, shows an excellent touch from the owners to invest in staff like that. We tried all the fine dinning places in Dubrovnik and I wouldn’t bother with the rest but this is a must

But it is a five star superb restaurant. Ivan our waiter was excellent but so also we’re so many of the other staff. A dining experience overlooked by the city walls but looking out over a bay as the swifts perform aerial acrobatics is a memorable event. Try the taster menu for tastes and textures to revel in. Worry about the cost later. Just enjoy it.

If you want to a fine dining experience this is the place to come in Dubrovnik. The staff were very attentive, the food was delicious. With lamps and blankets you could sit outside as the sunset in April. I had the prawns and polenta to start (best polenta ever), followed by the veal - yum yum YUM!!!

Booked a group of 10 people for dinner. We had a lovely time. We enjoyed the views and the excellent food. Portoins were on the smaller side but the food did not disappoint. We enjoyed tasting the many grappas as well.

We chose here for our anniversary and knew it would be pricey but it was far higher than we expected. It was almost double the cost of other places we ate at and felt were better if not a similar quality. You do pay for the location but this is a fairly steep price for a good view. Having said that, the service we could not fault. They are a great team and very knowledgeable and friendly. The food is delicious and very well presented. Just know they are small portions for the price tag. They did throw in some good extras but I felt overall it is simply priced too high.

Thank you so much to everyone at Nautika for a fabulous start to our weekend away for my partners birthday.
Not only was the food incredible and the staff attentive they made my partner enjoy a wonderful birthday by singing happy birthday with a candle in his pudding and giving us complementary cocktails to finish our evening. 
Yes this restaurant has a rather large price tag but the drinks are beautiful, the food is mouth watering, the service is first class and the view is simply stunning and worth spending a little extra.

A huge thank you to all involved.

When we travel, we try to have one really outstanding meal, and we chose Nautica for our trip to Dubrovnik. It exceeded our already high expectations and was a meal to remember.
We prefer formality and the décor, table settings, and service were very much to our liking.
Following a delicate amuse bouche, our starters, Adriatic scallops for me and thick shrimp soup for my wife, were rich and satisfying. Each course was served with a paired olive oil, with the bottle left on the table for topping up and for the warm, fresh bread. 
My sea bass had a perfectly crispy crust that made each mouthful of the fish a nice combination of textures. My wife had "lobster tail" and was somewhat disappointed by both the serving size (3 small pieces) and that there was nothing distinctive about the flavor. We had two unusual desserts, and affogato based on coffee liqueur, and a drink called "Show me the Bird." My wife had seen a small bird cage brought to a table near us, and we asked what it was. Our waiter said it was their "signature gin and tonic." The cage is ceremoniously removed to reveal a large wine glass of flavored gin with rose petals on the base of the cage. Great fun.
Service was formal yet friendly and attentive but not hovering. Dishes were brought to the table on a silver tray by a sous-waiter, with the waiter placing them on the table. Removal was reversed, with the waiter removing the plates and placing them on the tray held by the sous-waiter, who then carried them away. The large staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful.
Wine service included a good explanation of the origin of the wine (Stina, from the island of Hvar).
We dined inside because of the weather, and it would appear that outdoor arrangements are a bit more informal. There are two terraces, a large one next to the sea wall and a smaller, more intimate one, on the upper floor of the restaurant.
Nautika closes for the winter season, so be sure to plan your visit for when they are open.
The date of our visit was March 23, 2018.

My wife and I had a fantastic meal in the Nautika Restaurant during our stay in Dubrovnik as we celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary. The service was outstanding, the food was to die for and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming. Well done to all the staff! Thanks for a most memorable evening! We’ll be back! Think the Croatians and the Irish have a lot in common!
As the above reviews say this place is Wow! Service you can't top , food that makes you just want to keep eating. If your here them do it, push the boat out and have an amazing night like us.

All the bnest for staff and owner.
Good food and service. Beaufiful view. Nice exterior and interior.
Friendly staff.

Nothing but good to say about this place. It definitely stands out
being high scale restaurant in this area. I didn't expect kid menu for this
kind of restaurant, but my daughter is a very picky eater, and they went out
of their way to prepare a simple red sauce pasta just for her. Food wise, we
had the most amazing salt baked sea bass, lamb cutlet, and Adriatic
scallops...etc. Plate presentation was also amazing. Last, the red wine that
was recommended by their sommelier was also exactly the fully body type that
we asked for, it was the Dingač MMXIII

First and only negative is that it’s pricey. Then we have learnt that everything here in Dubrovnik is!!!!!
That said this is one of the best meals I have ever paid for. The restaurant surroundings and ambiance are beautiful. The service is exceptionally good with all wines, olive oils, and food described to you. We had shrimp risotto and then sea bass and both courses were excellent. Beautiful meal. Highly recommend and we will go again.

We can’t fault anything of Nautika’s offering, from the attentive service, to the fabulous food, and individually selected olive oil for each course. This is a must-place to visit, as long as budget is not a major issue. Perfect for a special date.

From the moment we entered the restaurant we knew we were in for a fantastic food experience. The food was of the highest quality and tasted just as good. There was three of us in our party and everybody really enjoyed there meal. 
The Shrimp Risotto for a starter was amazing followed by the Lamb Cutlets done to perfection along with a lovely bottle of local Red wine which we were advised about was superb. A real food experience which I would highly recommend.

After visited great restaurants as 360, protos and posat I think náutika is overpriced in wine list , local wines and international they were way too high prices compareted with other high level cousine restaurants in Dubrovnik

We visited here whilst staying in Dubrovnik to celebrate our wedding anniversary and my birthday. 
The service here is top notch. The waiters tell you everything about the menu and the wine. 
Food was excellent as you would expect from the prices. 
Would highly recommend.
We had an amazing time. The staff was super nice and friendly. The food was delicious (try the sea bass!) and the place was beautiful! Loved it!
Beautiful setting, nice variety/selection of food, service not great, more expensive than others inside gate

Great location for an evening meal as the walls are lit up which makes the meal very romantic. Tasty food, not a lot of choice for veggies but what I had was delicious. Other half loved the choice.

Slightly more expensive than the average here but worth it for the setting.

I went over there for a dinner and I have to admit that they admired my expectations. 
Waiters are the finest and the food is the best.
One of the best restaurants I have visited during my travel.

That what it sue on the restaurant business card and how so true . Excellent !!

In July we booked a special holiday for our 30th wedding anniversary unfortunately the terrible hotel we were staying in messed the whole thing up. We ended up walking out of the hotel and made our to the City and by luck we found Nautika .

The staff were very accommodating and they found us a very nice table. The food , service and setting were truly first class. 

We enjoyed our special Anniversary night meal so much l cancelled all the meals in my hotel and my wife and I ate at Nautika for the remaining 3 nights of our holiday . Our last night was very special .

A very special place , thoroughly recommended, don’t miss it.

We got engaged here, so right off the bat, you know I loved it. The extra factors here are the staff, the views, and the extents to which the staff went to make our night and next days amazing. Marko (a manager) is probably the best restaurant manager I've come across in terms of his warm demeanor and his desire to make us feel extra special, even before the ring came out. Essentially, my fiance coordinated with the staff while I was in the restroom, and after he asked and I said yes, a fleet of about 7 servers came out with champagne to celebrate. We then returned several times of the next few days to take daytime photos at the same table (overlooking the Adriatic Sea), and each time Marko and company were warm, extremely hospitable, and just really friendly and smart (in English). We will absolutely return here for an anniversary in the future!

If you want a complete dining experience then you should go here. 

From the moment you walk in they take care of you. We ate outside with the option of heaters if we wanted them. 

The waiters were superb with great knowledge and attention to detail 

Superb food and wine we would definitely go back.

What can I say , we are foodies but are sometimes disappointed by pretentious crap more often these days peddled at some so called starred restaurants. This restaurant is different , Waiters were great open friendly gave plenty of time and advice to make sure we had understood the choices , local knowledge , taking the time to try and understand our tastes which greatly added to the experience. On to the meal fantastic flavours fish soup was sensational , strongly flavoured consommé truly excellent. Salt baked Bass fantastic. All 6 of us left the restaurant completely satisfied and bearing in mind you get what you pay for the bill was a fair price for the quality. Weather was not good for outside terrace dining but if this happens don’t worry inside is very nice.

I booked this restaurant prior to arriving in Dubrovnik for our holiday. This restaurant is as close as you’ll get to a Michelin Star restaurant in Dubrovnik - currently Dubrovnik doesn’t have any Michelin star restaurants. In my view, this restaurant deserves a star. When I booked this restaurant I asked for a table with a view. There are two sitting options - an early or later option. I opted for the 6pm sitting so we could watch the sunset outside. The views from our table on the balcony were breathtaking. The degustation menu we chose was delicious. We decided to have the matching wines with our degustation menu - other than one particular wine, they were all perfect matches. Our waiter and sommelier were so friendly and informative. Whilst the service was professional, our waiter was a lot of fun. Unfortunately the weather turned just before our dessert courses so we were moved inside as the rain set in. We loved our dining experience here. I’d definitely recommend that you try to secure an outside table as the atmosphere and views outside are priceless. If you want a truly fine dining experience, don’t miss this restaurant. It was definitely our favourite of all of our dinners in Dubrovnik.

Wonderful romantic restaurant for a lovely date. Do not miss the outside terrasse overseeing the castle. Admire the settings of the gastronomical menu. Enjoy the lovely decorated restaurant and présentations of the dishes. If you want to surprise your love one, choose this restaurant.

We booked a table on the terrace but as it was a very windy evening we were moved inside. A shame we didn't experience the view but this could not be helped and didn't take away from the amazing food and service that we recieved. 
We had a 5 course taster and as I don't eat seafood I picked 4 courses off the main menus. All dishes were delicious and beautifully presented. The waiter had the perfect balance between being attentive and leaving us to enjoy our meal. 
We would certainly return, and hope next time the weather behaves!!!

From the girl in front till the time we get the bill everything was more than perfect!!!The food was amazing and unique the service outstanding but I want to give a specific hint!!Darko the waiter was the best waiter I have met in my life!You must visit this place to see it with your own eyes!Thank you a lot!

Breathtaking view over the sea and the wall! For me, the best restaurant in Dubrovnik! Fantástic food and staff. Everything we ate was excellent, from the straters to the desert and fabulous wine!!! Unforgetable experience!!! The price is what's expected in a restaurant like this.

We went to this perfectly located restaurant on a warm October evening, Outside fully booked, we had a perfect table on the higher terrace. Huge wine list, imported wines a little bit pricy compared to the same wines in similar restaurants in western Europe, but the local wines are great as well. Food is fresh and tasty, good varieties and nice quality.

We celebrated my wife's birthday with dinner at Nautika. And it was a nice, almost private, party. Great food, great service and an a capella birthday song by 6 waiters, who brought a special birthday cake with candle and waited till the candle was blown. My wife was positively shocked by the attention.

Beautiful view. Flowers on the table, especially arranged by the restaurant.
Great starters with Shrimp on Polenta and Carpaccio. We wanted another one!

Mains with Tuna stake very nice and Veal baked to perfection. And then that birthday cake ....

We would definitely recommend the place, especially when you have something to celebrate.

I can't fault the food or the restaurant, but a member of the staff unlike the food left a bad taste in our mouths. We were shown to our table by a lovely lady and then ignored. Eventually a waiter approached us because the floor manager noticed I was trying to grab his attention. The waiter took no notice of me and addressed all his questions to my partner. Even as going as far as handing her the bill instead of placing it on the table. I took it from her, then gave him 600 hundred Kuna. Before I had the chance to say just give me a hundred change which would leave a tip of 50. He handed me the 100 and walked off.

Cannot fault the wait staff with superb service. Heat lamps and blankets available if you opt for outdoor dining to watch the sunset. However we arrived about 5 mins prior to 6 pm reservation and was told the restaurant was not ready and ushered out rather unceremoniously. We waited by the water but staff never came to get us. We're usually not picky about this type of service but if you required my credit card for a reservation AND average meal for two comes to +$200 USD I do expect the host to go the extra mile. Food was great, but portions are small as expected. British couple behind us were smoking during dinner, which was unexpected and unwelcomed for a restaurant of this caliber. Glad we got to try it once but unlikely to try again.
Fine dining, excellent wine, and fabulous ambient. High price but worth the money. Superb services. A memorable evening ....

Yes, the service was excellent and the food was very good and the view was very nice. But the price was at least 1/3 higher than other places we ate in Dubrovnik with the same excellent service, food and atmosphere. I thought the portions were quite small (especially the desert). If you've got money to burn, you'll be quite happy. Nothing about the experience was less than first rate, but not for you if you're at all concerned about price.

We liked this restaurant so much on our first visit that we decided to return again and were given a great table on the upper terrace with fabulous views of the harbour.
The food is delicious and the service was faultless. We were looked after extremely well on both visits and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
Well worth it

I took my wife here for a birthday treat and we both loved it. Upon booking I requested their best table and the restaurant made sure we were given a table on the upper outdoor terrace, which was very romantic and had a beautiful view of the city walls and Fort Lovrijenac.

The service was excellent. Our waiting staff were very attentive without being intrusive, also very polite and helpful with suggesting wine to match our food and making sure we were comfortable on what was quite a windy evening!

The food was also excellent. The highlight for me was the rack of lamb, cooked medium rare, it was perfect. My knife cut through it like butter and the meat pretty much dissolved in my mouth. My wife loved the veal, which was cooked to perfection and accompanied by some very tasty and intricately sliced gratin potatoes. Also the accompanying local olive oils were a very nice touch and well explained to us by the staff. Our food was paired with local Croatian wines, which were also very tasty.

We dined at 6:30pm in early October, so we had a lovely view of the sunset, which is recommended. Take a jacket as it can get a bit chilly after dark, especially if it's breezy.

I have never had a more delicious meal.the lobster tail with pasta that tasted sublime ...can pasta really be that good ..it truly was ...and olive oils of exquisite flovour ,and a dessert of chocolate and fig that melted in the mouth leaving a sensation of joy .My partner's tuna was equally impressive ..Faultess service with a backdrop of the floodlit walls of Dubrovnik .Alas my companion 's severe head cold,meant we had to curtail our evening but when his health restored ,we will be back for the tasting menus.Marvellous .

The five of us went to Nautika to celebrate our daughter's 30th birthday. Four of the 5 had the tasting menu and though it is a very expensive restaurant we all felt that it was worth the expense for this special occasion. The service was outstanding and entertaining. The pre-dinner drinks were highly unusual and presented with much panache. The tuna pate amuse Bouche was delicious and all of the people that had the tasting menu really enjoyed their food. The staff was accommodating and allowed some substitutes from the a la carte menu to some of the tasting choices on the soup and dessert. The one person that ordered a la carte loved her vegetable soup but thought that her tuna entree was good but a little overcooked. There is a small dessert at the end of the meal after dessert and complementary grappa.

I booked this restaurant 3 months in advance & was given front row seating on the corner of the outside terrace - it was absolutely stunning watching the kayaks come in, the sun go down & the lights on the old town wall turn on.
The service was very good, very attentive - what you would expect from a fine dinning restaurant. We choose the 7 course tasting menu which had the beef carpaccio, shrimp soup, cuttlefish medallions, seared tuna, veal, dessert & cheese. We loved the food , perfect portions & we drank outstanding wine.
Yes the wine list is expensive but we expected that for where the restaurant is located & the fact your in Dubrovnik- so you need to get over that & just enjoy a beautiful, romantic experience.
Highly recommend
We experienced Dubrovnik's Nautika restaurant on the night of our engagement. The setting is spectacular and the food was delicious. Overall a thoroughly memorable dinner for all the right reasons!

We visited this Restuarant last evening having expected to sit outside however the weather had taken a turn for the worse, so with apologies we were shown to the upstairs dining room; lovely room plenty of space between tables.
Service was excellent, very attentive waiter, Mario, who clearly enjoys his job. We ordered champagne, beer and a bottle of wine. Food was lovely - little offering by the restaurant a goats cheese mousse, followed by beautiful starters and main course. Could not be faulted. We even had dessert and a cheese board! There was no pressure to vacate the table and the lovely evening was finished off by a selection of grappa on the house. Perfect!

The best restaurant in Dubrovnik? Maybe in 1972. Dated decor (the upstairs room looks like your gran’s living room - mismatched yellow and blue dining chairs being a particular highlight), dodgy piano player, service straight out of the Monty Python playbook (anything else I can get you?), the okay food over shadowed by the hilarious oversized plates and completely unnecessary olive oil flourishes. We did (once again) thoroughly enjoy all the Croatian wines we tried. A tired and sad experience really, the whole place needs dragging into the 21st century asap.

Where to start…

The view and location- It is a short walk from pretty much anywhere in the old city. 
See the photos for an understanding of how close to the city walls you are. At night they are illuminated. We sat outside and it was a bit windy, but super soft blankets were provided on each chair. My suggestion if you are to sit outside would be to bring a light jacket

Cocktails:
While waiting for our table we ordered cocktails while listening to live misc. The pianist took our song request. I had “Show me the bird” G&T and the glass was served in a bird cage with rose pedals covering the bottom stem of the glass. The cocktail was delicious.

Food:
We were blown away by the food both in flavor and presentation. My guest had the 7 course tasting menu. Each course was explained and served with a different olive oil. Each dish was superb. I had the tagliatelle with Istria truffles as a starter and the steak as an entree. Our waiter was professional and genuinely friendly, interesting, and engaging. 

Yes, this is an expensive dinner but we thought it was worth it. 

In closing I can not recommend this restaurant enough.

Saw the good reviews on Tripadvisor and booked a table for 6.30 - arrived early which was no problem. We chose the 5 course fish tasting menu which was very good, particularly the shrimp and sea bass mains and the dessert. Good wine list and knowledgable staff, nice to see the wine handled well and good attention to detail here. The offering of digestifs themed to different areas of Croatia at the end of the meal was a nice touch. Although we'd been informed they would need their table back at 9.15 in the event staff were happy to let us linger. A memorable meal.

I wanted a very special place to celebrate my birthday in Dubrovnik. Nautika Restaurant was exactly what I was looking for: beautiful location overlooking the water and fort and excellent food. It comes at a price - $300 for 5 course tasting menu, 1 glass of wine and a tea and cappuccino for 2. 

Make your reservation a few days ahead and request where you want to sit. We were second row on the balcony and it was lovely. If you are cold, they give you blankets and a heat lamp. We were lucky- the temperature was perfect. 

The service is impeccable. You are escorted to a table and welcomed by a team of professionals. Each course is a culinary experience with service to match. 

When dessert was served the entire team came out to sing "happy birthday" to me. 

A night to remember for sure.

Went here for a couples night and it definitely lived up to our expectations!
I knew nothing about this restaurant prior to coming here as it was my friend who chose the place. Service was 5 star. We received excellent local wine recommendations from the sommelier to pair with our dishes. The food not only tasted amazing, but the presentation was equally delightful. Lovely blend of flavors from appetizer to dessert.
I had scallops with truffles for an appetizer, pasta with lobster for my main, and a lovely chocolate cake for dessert! All worth trying! Would definitely come back to this restaurant when I visit Dubrovnik again! 2 thumbs up!

We visited this restaurant for a birthday treat and called up to book a table by the wall. You have to arrive just before sunset because the view is stunning.

The service was excellent and our waiter was very friendly and helpful. 

My partner and I tried two different tasting menus and we were not disappointed with the food.

Our meal at Nautika was amazing. The views from the restaurant are so lovely and the staff are very helpful and friendly.

We started the meal with two cocktails - I would definitely recommend the Nautika mule and were recommended a lovely bottle of Croatian wine to accompany our meals.

We had scallops to start. Lobster tail and beef fillet for our main courses. Both main courses were amazing and I would recommend both dishes and we shared orange meets prosek and Adriatic chocolate fantasy for dessert. We both really enjoyed the chocolate fantasy.

Nautika proclaims itself as Dubrovnik's finest restaurant and may well be justified in saying so. The location is exceptional and the cuisine distinctive. It's expensive by local standards but the prices are in line with the leading international restaurants among which it can be fairly classed. The on-line menu tells you everything you need to know to avoid bill shock.

The terrace restaurant overlooks the walls of the old town which, despite centuries of real history, are now better known as the setting for King's Landing. The view is stunning although mitigated to some extent by the passing crowds of tourists gathering just outside to take iPhone pictures of the castle and towers. 

Nautika offers a classy but relaxed environment aided by the performance of the pianist whose repertoire helped set the tone.

The cuisine could be described as Dalmatia nouvelle, specialising in local interpretations of contemporary dishes. They claim that they aim to go local in choosing their ingredients and follow this through with distinctive regional touches in the preparation. However, in keeping with the 'nouvelle' approach, the portions are not generous and satisfy the palette more than the appetite.

Service is attentive and helpful, particularly since we had two teenagers with us at dinner for whom this could have been a daunting experience. The waiters were patient with their explanations and helpful in choosing the right local wines to go with our meals. They deliver the style of a Parisian Michelin restaurant but without the arrogance.

Excellent fish and meat dishes were followed by imaginative desserts but the fish soup was watery and lacking flavour. The options for the vegetarian in our party were not inspiring and it took a little effort to have the otherwise excellent waiters bring us a veggie menu.

We made our reservation through the hotel concierge and were surprised to be asked for all our credit card details, including the security number, at time of booking. The concierge explained that Nautika had been arrogant enough to do this ever since hosting the Pope in 2003.

The problem with this exceptional restaurant may be that it's good and it knows it is.

Probably the best food in Dubrovnik.
Really enjoed the evening. The service is impeccable, the evening setting is wonderful if you are sat outside and you do not have to be sat at the very outside to enjoy the view and ambience.
Starter and maincourse with wine and service, allow £100 per head, even choosing carefully with the wine.
They know how to charge but they know how to cook and you have to book well in advance especially in high season.
They also want a deposit on any booking, as they are so popular.

Booked here for my parent's anniversary while we were on holiday. They loved the food and the view. The restaurant made an extra effort because of it being their anniversary and I'm hugely grateful. They had a wonderful time.

My husband and I had a lovely dinner at Nautika. This restaurant is of different standard to the ones you find in old town. Much attention was paid to service, to make sure all patrons were comfortable. As expected, the food was amazing! To top it all off, the great food and service were coupled with amazing views!!! We were given a table right at the front of the terrace and enjoyed the sunset while we ate. All of this however comes at a price unfortunately.. it was the most expensive dinner we had in Dubrovnik. But, it was worth it!!
Make sure you book in advance to get the best table - I was able to so this very easily via email.

I was really looking forward to eating here and when I approached the restaurant I was not disappointed. It's a beautiful building over looking the sea almost perched on the walls of Dubrovnik. There was a piano player in the lobby playing some Lionel Richie covers and it really set the ambience.

The waiter quickly showed us to our table which over looked the sea. The view was lovely but you can get the same view in other places around Drubrovnik. 

I was first a little annoyed when the waiter took me through all the wines on the "expensive" list. I like wine and I have money in the bank. However, I refuse to pay more than £50 for a bottle when I cannot tell the difference. He reluctantly showed me the cheaper side of the menu when he saw my disinterest in a £300 bottle of red. He explained...or you can have this "very basic wine". I chose one of the "very basic wines" which I had enjoyed the night before elsewhere. When the wine arrived it had an awful stench to it. It tasted OK but the smell was definitely wrong. I should have sent it back, but alas I did not as I had already been made to feel like I was a second class citizen for ordering the "basic wine" in the first place. 

The starters came and before I could stop the waiter he had splashed olive oil all over my scallops and my partners pasta. I had to literally stop the guy from doing the same on the main.

Down to the food... They seem to think that throwing piles of black truffle on EVERY dish makes it a "fine dining dish". It doesn't. 

I was left with a £180 bill for two people. For "basic wine" and mediocre food. Given the price this was my worst dining experience in Dubrovnik.

Well, what can I say, other than Thank You for a wonderful experience.

I had a reservation for 18:30, and from the moment I entered the restaurant my every need was taken care of. This was my first solo dining experience (on my first solo holiday) and I was never made to feel out of place. I had a wonderful table on the first row of the terrace with beautiful views and was given a generous 3 hours to finish my meal.

The staff were attentive but not overbearing, and in no way did I feel rushed for time. My very knowledgeable waiter (I'm sorry, I've forgotten your name!) was very helpful in making drink suggestions and explained each dish in perfect detail. As someone who does not eat fish it was refreshing to see the quality and attention put to the non-sea-food dishes; each course was delicious and the perfect size to satiate yet leave room for the next plate.

As another reviewer said, the menu and prices are clear from their website and the menu itself, and I feel the quality of the food and attention to detail in the dishes certainly deserves the pricing.

As it turned out, there was a small error in my bill (which I had not noticed and never would have!). So I was surprised to receive a phone call the next day apologizing for the error and that I would, of course, receive a refund which would be delivered to my hotel (but I chose to pick up from the restaurant directly). 

I would not hesitate recommending this restaurant - thank you again!

My wife and I celebrated our 20th weeding anniversary at this very well known restaurant that resides a few meters from the historic old city. Fantastic food, service and setting that will make any celebratory event an unforgettable memory.

Dubrovnik has plenty of restaurants and plenty of amazing views, so what makes Nautika special enough to take the coveted No1 spot? (At time of writing anyway)

Firstly, yes it is indeed a higher priced establishment. 

These prices are readily available on the website (and upon ordering) so NO this cannot be something used fairly to criticise such a restaurant. I won't bore you with long food descriptions, but you can expect a wonderful fine-dining experience based around fish plates, Croatian traditions and some incredible red meats with a wine selection to die for.

My girlfriend and I experienced a faultless meal which trumps anything else we had during our Croatia trip! I'd actually say that Nautika represents pretty good value for money, considering what we experienced...

- Super slick service provided by well coordinated team. 
- A varied and enticing menu, delivering very well put-together food.
- Unbeatable location for stunning views of the city walls and forts.
- Knowledgeable waiting staff, in our case Mario, who was very warm and informative.
- We made the most of our visit and were shown around the stunning 4 storey building, and made use of the beautifully appointed lounge and loved the pianist! 

Personally I couldn't find any fault with the food, and we found the attention and timing of all staff to be above expectations.
The restaurant manager Tomislav spent a lot of time enthusiastically answering questions and telling us relevant stories.

We felt like Royalty and were lucky enough to have over 3hours here and never felt rushed to leave; to be honest we probably could have stayed for longer sipping our digestifs near reception and listening to the wonderful pianist.

Totally worthy of a 5 star review and the No1 spot!

Thanks for a memorable evening.
This restaurant lives up to its amazing location. Very attentive staff serving delicious food and great wines in a unique location. Worth the extra cost.

We went here on the first night in Dubrovnik - we had a 6pm reservation (640 sunset) and was sure to get there a little before to ensure we got one of the front three tables on the Terrace. Food was excellent, service was superb! The sunset and views were spectacular! Highly recommend this to anyone who wants a special dinner while in town. Good for people who love seafood as well as land lubbers. Nice touch to have blankets and heat lamps for when it gets chilly after dark.

Booked at the last minute for a final night dinner with new friends who we met when sailing round the beautiful islands of Croatia. Overlooking the Adriatic six of us were wowed by the professionalism of the staff and the quality and presentation of the food.

Had a holiday treat dinner here and the food was delicious. Went for the 5-course tasting menu which gave a great selection and portions were just right. Waiter was very knowledgeable and recommended a lovely orange wine which was a first for me. Service dropped off towards end of the meal which is why this isn't a 'five'. Ask for a terrace table when you book and you'll be rewarded with great views too!

location: San Millan de la Cogolla, Spain
review:
Had a fabulous evening overlooking "King's Landing" six of us enjoyed an amazing dinner looked after impeccably by the friendly and superbly trained staff. Try their signature gins..so different and fantastic theatre..especially for the girls. The food is remarkable and delicious and the wine advice excellent and knowledgable. The birthday cake ordered in advance together with musical and vocal accompaniment was superb
A very expensive evening but absolutely no regrets...a real must!

We first came across Nautika when we visited Dubrovnik on a day excursion in 2016, and were very upset to not have booked ahead to get a table!
We came back to visit Dubrovnik again this year and booked the table almost straight after our flights.
The restaurant does not disappoint - I had the beef main and chocolate dessert, both complemented with a wine recommended by our fantastic waiter (I think his name was Doug).
The food was absolutely gorgeous in both presentation and taste, and the service was exceptional - we were not rushed at all but also not left waiting at any point.
I highly recommend sitting along the wall of you can, where you have a lovely view across the sea... also, book ahead!
We will be visiting again :)

As a patron of many Michelin-starred restaurants around the world I am fortunate enough not to be unduly concerned about the cost of a meal. I did not approach my visit to Nautika with awe or any starry-eyed expectations but, in view of its history, thought that it must be on a par with one-star establishments. The initial amuse bouche was interesting, innovative and tasty, whilst the so-called "thick" shrimp soup was almost of consommé consistency. My wife and I decided on the sea bream with French fries and what was served was little more than mundane "fish and chips". The fish was of an acceptable standard but not what one would expect from a restaurant with such claims to gastronomic excellence. The wines were superb but, unsurprisingly, were not made by Nautika! Notwithstanding that the bill was less than I have been presented with in many restaurants, it was nonetheless ridiculously high vis a vis the overall quality of the meal. My next two reservations are at Proto and 360 Degrees and, hopefully, in the zeitgeist of 1997, "things can only get better".

We visited for our anniversary dinner, and we absolutely loved it! The setting and view was incredible, very romantic, and the food was to die for- I would recommend the scallops for starters. The staff were wonderful and attentive, yet at no point did it feel pretentious. I would definitely return.

We had an early booking for 6pm during our stay in Croatia and sat outside on the terrace next to a beautiful view of the old town.
The service was impeccable, with our waiters making suggestions for what we may like to eat and drink. 
They bought out an amuse bouche of goats cheese and beetroot which was really lovely, then had our starters of seafood risotto which we said we could've eaten a huge bowl of. Absolutely delicious, the seafood tasted very fresh and portion size was perfect.
I had the fillet steak which was cooked medium/rare as requested, and very pleasant. Nothing to write home about but it was presented beautifully and again was a good portion size. My other half had the rack of lamb which was cooked perfectly and he said was really delicious.
We didn't have room for dessert but they kindly bought out some local liquor and chocolates which was a really nice touch and finished the meal off nicely.
We were absolutely shocked to see our bill come to the equivalent of nearly £200 when we'd only had one alcoholic drink and two courses each. Absolutely ridiculous price - we frequently dine in London's top restaurants and don't pay that much. It was a great meal but should've been nearer £120-140. Definitely not worth nearly £200, we're still in shock over it!!!
Great location outside the wall. The service was outstanding and the food delicious. The ambience, location and service will cost you, but in my humble opinion well worth the value.

My husband and I ate here the last night of our honeymoon. We had the pleasure of eating at many fine dining establishments throughout Italy and Croatia during our trip 2.5 week trip. Comparatively to other meals we had, it didn't rank at the top of our list, but it was the best we had in Dubrovnik. The food was good and the service was just fine. We would recommend it to anyone wanting a fine dining experience in Dubrovnik. (Get the chocolate fantasy desert! It was delicious.)

Everything that had been said in all the reviews is true. Unique location. Creative good quality food well prepared and presented together with friendly and helpful staff. Expensive but good value. Fine dining at its best. Highly recommended

Excellent supper - lovely location on the terrace overlooking the sea even if it did rain!! 
Started with the seafood risotto which was first class and the best I've ever had followed by John Dory fillets - lovely flavours. Fries were great too even if they arrived separately but the staff were great and oh so apologetic and took these off the bill without being asked. Lovely choice of wines and first class service:/great attentive staff.

This was a lovely restaurant, be sure to book a table especially in peak season. Ask to sit outside the views are incredible. The service and food were simply perfect. Although I went with friends this is a great place for couples, very romantic.

Sundown approaching on a warm autumn evening, a table overlooking the fortress with a glass of pink champagne accompanied by sweet strawberries and blueberries . Piano tinkling in the background . Waiters gliding efficiently. The delicate amuse bouche. Croation riesling was perfect with our seafood and pinot from the same local wine family recommended by Marco topped off by icewine and fig tart and cheese plate were all and more. We could not fault anything. The view back over the old city walls and passing parade of cruise ships, kayakers, yellow submarine and tri masted sailing ship were all additional reasons to recommend this outstanding value for money 5 star restaurant.

The overall experience of food, wine and service (Ivan) was excellent but the prices were on the high side (1000 kunar for a very nice Riesling). The setting is just outside the old city overlooking a harbour is very romantic especially when the sun is going down. I am told that this restaurant is the sister restaurant of 360 which is on the other side of the old town. Undoubted a wiser selection of food and drink would have made the bill more palatable

Wow - what a restaurant. Perfect setting, lovely food and fantastic staff.

It's not very often we would credit staff over food but there's always a first! Every single member of staff was welcoming and attentive at all times, from offering recommendations for food to being given an escort to the toilet - lol!

We were booked on the early sitting and both my husband and I enjoyed the evening immensely.

Would recommend and would go back.

The prices are high but the quality of food and service is impeccable. We loved the view from the balcony and could not have asked for a better experience. I would highly recommend for a special night out. Book in advance or check in with hostess about early seatings that are less popular than after dark.

Location and views stunning with food and service that you will remember for ever . Top draw in every way the attention to detail is full of surprises and food is spectacular certainly an experience you won't forget .

We emailed our reservation a few weeks before coming. We were seated upstairs on the outside deck. The view was mesmerizing. We came at 18:30 which is early for Dubrovnik but a must if you want to catch the gorgeous sunset. There are two tasting menus - a big and a smaller one or you can order a la carte. The food was delicious. The service was superb and the waiter was so kind. He offered to take our family photo with King's Landing in the background. It was definitely an experience to remember. There is no better view so come early, order wine and take it all in.

We went on our final night in dubrovnik and what a memorable evening it was. Top flight service , food and wines. Dont expect a cheap meal but do expect an excellent one. The ambience was superb. You do need to book in advance. We let the waiter choose Croatian wines to match the meals we selected and it paid off big time. Food was amazing. Would recommend to anyone!

We heard great things about Nautika before our trip to Dubrovnik so we decided to book as we have heard it is quite difficult to get a table otherwise. They state on the booking confirmation email where you will be sitting. 

Unfortunately we were placed on a table quite near to the entrance which is full of tourists taking pictures. (try to avoid if possible)
We asked if we could change the table which unfortunately at the time we could not as the restaurant was fully booked.
However, the manager kept us in mind and courteously moved us to a prime spot later in the evening. 

The food was amazing and the waiter was extremely knowledgeable about all aspects including the wine.
As the night went on we were moved inside as other diners were arriving. 
As we finished off the wine we had left, we were showered with chocolates and speciality Croatian Liqueur.

This added touch really surprised and delighted me and I left me feeling that I had been somewhere extremely special.

Thanks again to the team which gave us an extremely memorable night.

This restaurant is worth its prices. Only several other times in my life have I been treated better. We went on the wrong night - a night early for our reservations, but they found us an amazing table, and then provided complementary wine (it was our error not theirs)
The shrimp on polenta and fresh scallop starters were amazing. My husband's lamb was cooked perfectly and my tuna was fresh and prepared medium rare to bring out flavors.
All of this while watching the sun set across the old city wall and the moon rise above it. If there is only one place you splurge while in Dubrovnik, this it it!

Loved every minute of it

My partner and I had a somewhat unpleasant experience concerning the table booking procedure with regard to register our credit card. We were astounded how serious Nautika’s General Manager Mr. Raić and the F&B Manager Mr. Bajagić took our concerns: they made every effort to understand us and satisfy our needs. This was customer orientation at its best.

There are many reviews concerning Nautika’s excellent food but for us the management team's great passion to provide each guest a wonderful experience is what makes it a wonderful place to visit.

The restaurant is amazing, however you do need to book about 2-3 weeks in advance. We had a seat on the upstairs terrace by the sea which was lovely, amazing views. The service was great, the staff could not do more for you and had lots of interesting information about each course of the meal. I had the fish soup to start which was delicious, followed by the lobster which I was not too keen on but I feel that is my personal taste rather than a reflection on the meal itself. The chocolate fantasy for dessert was by far the best part! 

Every part of the restaurant was spotlessly clean, and the toilets were amazing, with lots of freebies. However there was no separate male and female toilet which some may say is a bit disappointing. I was very surprised when the waiter brought over a bag holder so my bag didnt go on the floor - a lovely touch!

It was a truly lovely evening, although for nearly £300 it did seem a rather bit expensive.

We had a fabulous meal overlooking the sea. The food was delicious the service was great! Wine and ambience superb! Probably the best restaurant in town, make a reservation in advance as very popular.

I recently ate at Nautika and had an excellent meal. We had the six course tasting dinner and with the help of our waiter paired it with good wines. We had a front terrace table as we had reserved and the view was spectacular.

My only complaint and the reason I'm not giving the restaurant 5 stars is because of the rudeness of the maitre d'. As he was starting to seat us I asked where the men's room was as I really need to use it. He told me, not now, follow me to the table, place your drink order and then I'll show you where it is. Not wishing to make a scene, I did as he asked, listened to his whole spiel on cocktails, and then ordered a drink. He started to leave the table and I had to follow him to ask about the men's room. 

I'm sorry but this is not acceptable behavior. I realize that he has a routine he likes to follow but his job is to serve the customer, not vice versa. Fortunately, we never saw him again. The waiter who served us did an excellent job.

Incomparable location, and superb fine dining experience, with flawless service.
Avoid the timed sitting at the front row, relax with a booking time of your choice and know you won't get turfed out over your petit fours...
The sunset doesn't look any different two metres back!

We had booked this restaurant months ago because we knew it was going to be special and it was a birthday celebration we wanted to be memorable for all concerned.

From the second we arrived to the moment we left we were treated like Royalty and in no way was this a stuffy restaurant where you were made to feel intimidated. They seriously know their stuff and to that end, give a top class experience to all who dine there.

We lost count of the number of waiters serving us - a truly Michelin style evening.

We had a fabulous table on the front row (book early to secure this!) and we could not have been happier. 3 of us chose from the a la carte and 1 had the 7 course dinner. Every single morsel was first class, as were the beautiful wines and oils the waiters chose to pair for us. We have not stopped talking about this restaurant since the moment we left and no doubt we will do for some time to come. We had smiles on our faces the whole night.

We had a table at 6pm and were told we had to vacate by 9.15pm but in no way did we feel rushed to give up our table at the appointed hour - in fact we offered it back ourselves and had our coffees in the beautiful lounge listening to the pianist playing such lovely tunes.

I would not suggest any particular course to anybody because between the 4 of us we had 16 courses (not including the amuse bouche) and every single one was perfect. 

We have eaten at some top class restaurants around the world and seriously, this is THE BEST. 

Please don't expect it to be a cheap meal but if you want to experience something really special there is a price to pay and we would happily do it again when we come back to Dubrovnik - another trip would not be complete without it!

Thank you to everybody at Nautika - from 4 very happy diners! We will return!!!!

We took a chance and tried to find a table for 4 at 8pm on Tuesday night, but as expected they were full, were able to help us at 9:30pm but as we have children, we decided to book and come back the following evening. We were not disappointed.
All the staff from the Maitre D to the servers were all extremely professional, friendly and not at all snooty. This Michelin style restaurant is not to be missed if you go to Dubrovnik, but be sure to book to avoid disappointment. 

The view of the bay from the restaurant is just beautiful, we watched the kayakers come in and had a lovely dinner from 18:30 to 21:15, the sunset was just amazing. But back to the beautiful food. The cocktails were lovely, the attention to detail is just wonderful. 

For starters I had a trio of seafood delicacies, which had lobster and sea urchin meat, with tuna tartar and marinated white fish, this was sublime, it was incredibly delicate and fresh, and I was in heaven. My husband had Adriatic scallops served with truffle flakes with potato and kale cakes, and he said they were the best scallops he ever had. For mains I had lamb cutlets, which were juicy, tender and pink, just the way I like it with purple cabbage, chickpeas and onion marmalade. My husband tuna fillet for mains with capers and rosemary crispy crust, with zucchini spaghetti, which was the most incredible tuna he has ever had, however he would happily have had a few more pieces. That is fine dining for you. Our eldest daughter had fillet steak with roman gnocci and celery chips and mushroom sauce, she said it was sublime. Out 10 year old did not fancy anything on the menu, and was delighted when the waiter offered grilled chicken and chips to her.

Desserts were just as amazing, we had the Orange meets Procek, which had a tasty brittle with orange peel and jelly made with Procek, this was delicious. I had the mini sun dried fig cake, which was a little dry for me, but still very tasty. My daughter had a cheese selection, which we all shared, the truffle cheese and parmesan were gorgeous. The setting sun, the sound of the sea, amazing food and service, and the piano playing inside the restaurant made it all a very memorable evening.

We all left feeling very well looked after, it was a culinary experience to remember and we would love to return when we next visit Dubrovnik. Special thanks to Mario our waiter who was incredibly professional and friendly, From the ex South Africans now living in the UK. We loved your restaurant! Thank you.

We were in Dubrovnik with friends for a few days and Nautika was a highlight. The beautiful setting at sunset, accommodating service and delicious food we beyond our expectations. The extras were so touching, the chefs appetiser, chocolate after dinner and the local liqueurs. The pianist was incredible - we wish we'd known and arrived early to enjoy a cocktail in the entrance with the pianist. For romance and special treatment - this is the spot to stop. Though make sure you book !

The view is amazing, just outside from me the castle in a privileged location, the pr they had outside was unprofessional .... they told us what is full and we have to wait a week....!!!!!
 So we went back to our yacht and we enjoy a perfect dinner... The behavior they had was very rude

This restaurant has the most beautiful view of Dubrovnik. If you want to spend a romantic night this is the best choice. Service is top class. And now the scampi risotto. Definitely the best risotto in my life. Something beautiful. Desert Names Chocolate Fantasy is awesome. We definitely come back again.

Food in this michelin restaurant was very good and view super. starter pasta with truffle was melting already looking at the dish. Meat as main really great, however potato was not perfect in my view. We where 6 people and price acceptable for this top restaurant

Today we celebrated jan's birtday at Nautika.We had the best meal ever.The service from Vinko and his team was excellent.They sang the birtdaysong to jr,and they served suprice cake.We recommend this restaurant if you visit dubrovnik.

From the beginning to the end, the experience was fantastic. Cocktails are wonderfully amazing ! They have nothing to envy to specialised cocktail bars. The 7 courses menu was our choice for the night and we were happy as it was really good dishes (maybe desserts could be improved...).
Regarding the wine we were leaded by our server who surprised us with some great local wines. We trusted him for the second bottle and some wine by the glass as well.

The service we received was far away from meeting our expectations, it even went beyond. Congratulations to the whole team. They really know what they are serving, and it makes the experience even better. You can see they do the job with passion. Courteous, smiling, professional etc...

Thank you so much. We'll definitely be back on our next mooring in the Dubrovnik region.

Me and my partner visited Nautika whilst staying in Dubrovnik and we were thoroughly delighted with the dining experience we received. The food was absolutely stunning (Maybe the best meal I've ever had!) The service was faultless and the waiters do an amazing job to ensure you enjoy yourself. The restaurant is beautiful and so romantic, you have an amazing view and there is a wonderful pianist playing. 

Nautika is expensive and around £100 pp with a bottle of wine, however we had the most wonderful night and it was well worth the money. I would definitely recommend to others.

This is indeed a fine dining experience. 
The waiter was super, the setting beautiful, the amuse bouche tasty.....but despite reviews saying this was good for vegetarians, I suspect this is for dieting people who eat very little. 

One son's vegetarian main course was minuscule ( smaller than most starters) and very disappointing 1 *. He was totally starving after it! However our other son's beef was beautifully cooked- the best steak he has ever had 5*. Our tuna was very small (3 bites) and cooked more than the requested medium rare - it was really dry. So a real mixture. 

All in all- atmosphere fantastic
Waiter - fantastic 
Food- steak really fantastic, the rest was disappointing and very overpriced.
We had a great dinner with a wonderful waiter. He made very good suggestions and provided 5 star service! The entire experience was fabulous!

Above and beyond thats what we experienced at Nautika. Passionated thats what they are. Crazy good chef warm and open manager stunning bartender who creates the best Ginto's. Personal attention and great story telling by dedicated and well trained staf. Very professional. This is hospitality 3.0. Chapeau!

This restaurant is nothing but first class. From the moment you are greeted by the hosts/hostesses at the reservation desk you know you are going to be treated exquisitely. The wait staff functions so well as a team, pouring water and wine at the proper moment, adding and taking away silverware without obstruction, and bringing the next course at just the right time in the meal. We had excellent appetizers and entrees, beautifully presented and accompanied by a recommended and stunning Croatian Chardonnay wine. Our waiter also recommended a dessert that he remembered learning to make with his grandma, which was also amazing. We were so impressed to restaurant Nautika! We highly recommend you book a table when in Dubrovnik!

Not for a cheap night out, allow €100pp. If you can deal with that, this is the best value for money eating experience in Dubrovnik.

The location is super, the greeting is warm and welcoming, the staff know their stuff and the food is better than great.

Scallops to start were amazing, Sea Bass main even better, Orange .... desert better again. I cannot fault it in anyway

I have written a similar review a few days ago, but I am not sure if it were uploaded, so forgive me if I repeat myself. So, we had no reservation for the first night we got in Dubrovnik, so we visited the place 3 times in the same evening and we were finally rewarded, by the well dressed young girl at the reception and very sweetly smiling to everybody waiting and asking for a table at the beautiful terrace. We were given a superb table looking at both the City Walls and Fort Lavrenjac and experienced a truly professional yet warm and friendly service. The food was very very good and the local wine we were suggested with was truly nice. Our personal waiter, Vinko, was a kind and very friendly local young man who contributed to a great dinner. Soft white blankets were offered to all sitted on the terrace as the wind was getting strong and chilly. The plateau with the liquers after the dinner was exquisite, too. Definitely worth the good money we paid and certainly recommended for a really special dinner. Aris from Greece

In Nautika I had one of the best dinners, the remarkable food, the stunning location and its view combines played a big role in making the dinner Perfect.

We were sitting in a table with a view on the fort and the city walls of the old town, it was very picturesque, the sun was setting and the lights were stunning. The atmosphere in Nautika is very chic. 

The food was very good, every plate curated in every little detail, for every dish a different variety of regional olive oil was combined and introduced to us beforehand. 

The service was very attentive and polite we were really treated with kindness and regard. 

I would definitely visit the restaurant Nautika again and recommend it to everyone who would like to enjoy a wonderful evening.

Just outside the Old City walls in Dubrovnik past the drawbridge, we happened upon this restaurant with tables overlooking the water. The courteous, friendly and efficient staff coupled with exquisite preparation and quality of the food and drink was a highlight of our vacation. While there are many many other good places to eat inside the walls and out, if you are looking for a place to be special, this was it.
We had dinner here, and of all the places around the world we have visited and eaten at..................this is a must. You will kick yourself if you dont sample it. XXX

We booked this restaurant because it is recommend by the Michelin Guide. Wonderful place. From the beginning all the staff is super polite and friendly. The restaurant is above the sea with a beautiful view to the forth. We booked a table 1 month before so we can get a first row seat, but I am sure if you book it with a few days in advance it will be also possible. 
We paid around 1040 kunas, which is around 135 euros, for: 1 bottle of water + 2 glasses of wine + 2 main dishes + couvert. 
It's expensive but it's a fine dining restaurant and it worths all the cents. 
Absolutely a must go in Dubrovnik!

We had the most wonderful evening - the food was superb, the view spectacular, the service impeccable. We finished the evening by enjoying a nightcap and dancing away to the beautiful piano which was being played by Alan the pianist in the foyer. A perfect end to the perfect evening. Couldn't recommend more highly.

My wife and I had a couple of lunches at the Nautica and were extremely happy with both the food and service.
The salads and fish dishes we tried were first rate.
The attentive service from Natalie and Gordian was an outstanding memory.
I have no hesitation in recommending this restaurant.

The restaurant is classy and expensive. One needs to book atleast a day in advance to get a table. The food portions are small but tasty. Wish the staff spoke less, there was too much of explanation and too many people coming and asking if all was fine with not a minute of solace. Final verdict - Good food - increase the portion size.

Waiters were great and presentation of food also. Cocktails fantastic and presented with theatre! Ask for a table next to the sea wall for spectacular views especially as the sun sets.

Food was good but did not match other restaurants we tried and did not meet our expectations. Everything is highly expensive, so rather disappointing overall.

Truly a world class restaurant with a world class view and service to match!
From the time we were greeted to our last good bye the service view and food was as good as it gets anywhere in the world.
A very classy establishment with a comfortable style.
Vinko our waiter was top shelf!

Would be in my top 5 dinning experiences.
Location and views unbeatable 
Food is amazing
Staff are exceptional

This was our final evening in Croatia and we couldn't have picked a finer spot for our last dinner outing. The restaurant has a spectacular setting just outside the western wall of the old town. We had a table on the terrace overlooking the sea where we could admire the sunset and watch the swallows dance above us. The food and service were both excellent. I also had a delicious 'signature' gin and tonic to start (highly recommended). A perfect evening!

From the moment we arrived we were treated like VIPs.
All the staff were lovely, the setting and where we were seated was like a picture postcard.
The signature gins were magical and gorgeous to taste.
All the food we ate was simply magnificent. Our best fine dining find so far.
If you want a special meal this is a must go.
The best of the best !!

Had a meal here with my family and it was a fantastic experience. The hospitality was exceptional - the staff were like a family - and the attention to detail was phenomenal. The food and wine matched this. We were guided through each course with explanations of the wine, olive oil and food. This was all in a perfect place overlooking the fortress and sea. I had the best evening. It is by far the best meal we had in Dubrovnik and surrounding area. If you can, book a table and go. I will certainly be back.
Extraordinary restaurant with one of the best views ever. Impeccable service, magical cocktails, excellent food. One of the best nights of my life.

We had a fantastic dinner on our last night in Dubrovnik, the service was excellent!
The waiters were extremely knowledgeable and we're obviously proud of their restaurant.
The food was the best we had in Dubrvnik! 
Would definitely recommend.
Well worth visiting. We had the taster menu with pared wine and it's definitely worth trying. Beautiful views but staff could have been a little more attentive.

This is a high class, top of the line restaurant located on a beautiful stone wall just outside of Old Town. They showed exemplary service, amazing food, and gave us an experience we'll never forget. You will 100% want to make reservations. I'd request to be on their outdoor patio over the water. It is an unrivaled view. We ate there just past sunset and it was amazing. The food, the wine, the service, all gave us a night we will never forget. Do be warned that this is an expensive, star-rated restaurant. It is not super family friendly (kids may have a bit of a hard time with some of the food). And you are going to spend a pretty penny. In our minds, we would've spent twice the amount and still treasured every minute. Thank you, Nautika team!
Very expensive but very very tasty and beautiful experience. Thanks for fitting us in last minute! We will be back!

Enjoyed 7 course dinner with wine flight here together with stunning view. View is something to remember and can only be described as exceptional. Watch out is the timing as it took the kitchen nearly 4 hours to fullfil our 7 courses with us needing to change the table in the middle of our dinner (without our own fault). Another watch out is the price which is above 400 euros for two for above dinner. These watch outs are however partially made up by really good (excellent actually) service. And try the raspberry G&T. 4 star place with 5 star (or Michelin star) pricing.
very scenic and beautiful a must for all tourist.we had a memorable time, the weather was cool and we enjoyed our meals and the view was most enchanting

This was one of the best meals that I have had in my life. My partner & I ordered the scallop and tuna fish cakes for starters, lobster tail and sea bass for mains, then the chocolate fantasy dessert. I would highly recommend the scallops and sea bass as they were cooked to perfection! I wouldn't order the tuna fish cakes or lobster tail as they were nothing in comparison to the other two dishes and I've had better lobster at other restaurants for the price you pay. We had a bottle of white wine between us which was nice and fresh. I paid roughly 1650kn which comes to just under £200 so it's not a cheap meal. It was also my partner's birthday and there seemed to be quite a few other birthdays around where the waiters would gather and sing happy birthday so I requested the same for my partner. We had to order a dessert in order for them to provide this service which I thought was a bit cheeky considering the cost. Normally when dining in restaurants they prepare something special. I also emailed about my partner's birthday which was ignored when responding to my booking which I felt was quite rude. However, the terrace where we sat and the food made up for this.as it was very beautiful.

Amazing restaurant, traditional chic decor, great views and a tremendous wait staff. Everything's was incredible to the seafood trio and Shrimp Polenta to the Tuna Steak and Seabass. The wines were on point and matched perfectly with the dishes (if you aren't familiar with Croatian grapes, it's best to get a recommendation). Reservations made well in advance are a must as this is one of the top places to see and be seen! Loved every part of it (except for the high temperatures). Enjoy.

We visited mid-June and again in late July. Book early (a month in advance if you want the terrace with the best views). Both times the welcome and the service was exceptional (Marco and Peter) which made the evenings memorable. Food excellent.
