Must haves: gin and tonic (it's no ordinary g&t), scallops, truffle pasta, tuna, fillet steak and Korac Sauvignon Blanc (if you like Marlborough Savvy Bs).

Went for dinner with my gorgeous girlfriend and it was amazing a surprise and she was almost in tears!!!!! Top service and amazing setting!!! Couldn't rate the place higher!!! Expensive but worth every penny!!!! In Dubrovnik then you must visit!!! I will certainly return

Nautika was simply amazing. We were lucky enough to get a table with a fantastic view. Our waiter was lovely and very knowledgable about the food and wine on the menu. The food itself was well presented and tasted divine. This is an expensive restaurant but you get what you pay for. I would highly recommend a visit here but make sure you book in advance. It was the perfect end to our holiday!

Now, all and everyone out there looking for the best place in Dubrovnik to eat and drink, here it is! Do anything you can to go here because its worth bouth the money and the experience. There is a beutiful entrense where you can start with the Aperol Spritz if your keen and before try best staff ever guided you out to the terass. The scenery is spectaculare with the walls of old city on one side and the fort of st. George on the other. Make sure you need the taste-meny and the wine that comes with It for another load of money. Its the best choice you will make during your entire holiday. Then you lean back, enjoy wathever you set your eyes on, sipp the refreshments infront. Relax!The people that works here will lead you through the best meal you ever had. They will make you feel the best, explorer the palett of tastes, learn more about oliveoils, fall inlove with new wines, and fall inlove with them .... so just do it. Go here. Make a reservation today!
It's an expensive restaurant! On our trip this was the best restaurant overall we ate at. Very good food, outstanding service, spectacular views, good wine, excellent overall experience!

Probably one of the beter places in Dubrovnik, the views are astonishing, the food is top and above all the service is classical and very stylish!! It is pricy but it is worth it and you will keep a fabulous memory.
Excellent food, quite expensive, but it is well justified by the quality of the food and of the service.

My wife and I went to the Nautika for our last night in Croatia based on the reviews in TripAdvisor, simply we made the right choice.

Location is stunning with a great view out to sea, the weather was perfectly still. On arrival we were made very welcome and led to our table.

The waiting staff were professional well drilled and organised, a quick look at the menu and we went all in for the 7 course tater menu with matched wines, which also has matched olive oil dressings to go with the courses (well 4).

Portions were perfectly sized, well presented and cooked, maybe not the best in high end dinning but up there where you wont be disappointed.

My one negative was the cheese plate at the end, couple of local hard cheeses, nuts and dried fruit with bread. All a bit dry and hard, needs more fresh fruit, small crackers and variety of cheese, especially when serving two people the exact same plate a sharing plate would have been better.

The wines all went down perfectly well with each course. in all a meal to remember for the full package.

The first thing that is important to say about this restaurant is that you NEED to book in advance. We booked 3 months in advance and could still only get the 2nd row on the terrace so make sure you book! The only thing that was detrimental to being on a 2nd row was an obstructed view for photos but the view in general was still amazing. The staff here were exceptional. This isn't the kind of restaurant my husband and I can usually afford but it was our wedding anniversary so we decided to push the boat out. The food was great. It is small portions as it tends to be at expensive places but every bite was amazing so was well worth it. What I did like was that I expected at posh places you wouldn't get little freebies but you got a little something to start and then there was something that came with your bill; we saw other tables getting free chocolate and we got free cocktails as it was our anniversary.

Nautika was the first restaurant we tried on our first night in Dubrovnik. Even without a reservation for what looked like a busy night, we were generously given a table with the best sunset views near the Pile Gate.

Service was very attentive and the food that included a different kind of olive oil to highlight the dish was tasty.
Amazing service even though we were underdressed they made us feel welcome and special. The sea bass was amazing - what do they do to those tomatoes!

The restaurant location is charming and very romantic (esp. the tables on the sea side). We didn't have a reservation, but they were kind enough to give us a table.
The experience of find dining was very nice, live piano playing,

I'm in general very hesitating on giving 5 stars, i actually think I only given that one time before, but this place is worth a 5 star.

The view and setting from the dining area are amazing, service is excellent and the food is just amazing, same for the desserts. We went for some starters to share, the beef fillet for main and shared some desserts, all plates were very very good.

The only drawback I see is the price tag of wines and food, it's probably one of the most expensive places in Dubrovnik and not the place to you go for a ordinary evening unless you just have to much money. A good example is a bottle of wine we had in Split 2 weeks ago on one of the top 5 TripAdvisor restaurant where is costed about 350 Kunas cost at Nautika 1200 Kunas, same year of the bottle and all. 

Overall though, a really good place and for a extraordinary night in Dubrovnik, go here!

I went to this restaurant by myself as I was in Dubrovnik for a work trip and the staff couldn't have been kinder or more welcoming. The food was some of the best I've ever had and the live piano player was incredible. Perfect atmosphere, amazing food, and good people -- if I could rate it higher, I would!

I have been to many Michelin star restaurants in Europe and in my honest opinion this place does not deserve to price their food in such a manner. Scallop starter with the kale was poisoned with salt and the sea bass whilst good, wasn't out of this world. Deserts were well presented and delicious. Wine also grossly overpriced and glass size incredibly meagre. You're paying for the view and excellent service, both of which I cannot fault. Enjoyable evening overall but we couldn't justify the price.

We got a table at the corner of the terrace, with a fantastic view. The changing view (blue to dark, unfortunately no evening twilight was seen because of the weather) was great.
The staff were very nice to support our better experience at the restaurant.
Every dish was very nice, pasta with truffle was by far our expectation.

Had a special occasion. Got the best service from start (reservation) to end (goodbye), and food was great. The waiters brought in the dessert with a song as a surprise, which was the cherry on the top. Had wine by glass chosen by the sommelier- outstanding local choices at very affordable prices.

Nautika Restaurant in Dubrovnik, Croatia was positively one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. We were fortunate enough to book a reservation (the next day – because they were full for the evening on our first request). From the view of the Old City of Dubrovnik (the restaurant is located just outside the wall), to the attentive wait staff (a minimum of three staff members at any given time), and most importantly, to our dining adventure. It was truly an ‘over-the-top’ encounter – something that we will have again, or probably not very frequently. Our culinary experience consisted of a Summer Cuttlefish Salad with mango, beets and avocado; a Tagliatelle pasta with a creamy sauce, black istrian served with Truffle flakes and Scampi also served with Truffles. To accompany our local wine, the staff brought us a local Orange Wine (different – it tasted like whiskey – quite unusual). We realize that Dubrovnik isn’t around the corner, but if you find that you will be going there – definitely get yourself to Nautika it’s a first-class winner all around. On the “Tommy B Restaurant Rating Scale” from “A” to “F” Nautika in Dubrovnik gets an “A+”. It’s memorable!

We had wonderful evening at Nautika. We arrived a little early so enjoyed cocktails in the Red Room; tasty with innovative presentation.

Our table was in the first row, right next to the views, as we'd requested some months earlier, (I'm very organised!) What a stunning location. The table settings were elegant and chairs were comfortable.

Our waiter, Ivan, was efficient, knowledgeable, personable, charming and funny too. 

I could go on and on about the food, which was amazing. It was simply perfect. (Sea Bass baked in Salt was fantastic). All washed down with a bottle of Grk. Super! 

An expensive meal in Croatia perhaps, but not compared to London/Edinburgh equivalents. The price felt about right. 

You won't be disappointed.
The place has view directly to the GOT port (game of thrones). The food is a combination of traditional Croatian with a modern touch. It is expensive but it is worth it.

We celebrated my fiances bithday at Nautika having booked the restaurant before we left for Dubrovnik. The booking email exchange was excellent and we popped in to check we were happy with table before the booking and the staff were most accomodating. The service was first class, attentive without being overbearing. Very extensive Croatian wine list of which I was clueless and left myself entirely at the mercy of our waiter to chosefor us, a very reasonably priced white wine was selected from Istria. The staff gathered around and sang happy birthday to my fiance which was hilarious watching her discomfort! Would highly recommend, just bring your credit card!

My fiance booked nautika for us to celebrate our engagement. When we arrived we were a little disappointed to be seated away from the fantastic view after having been told we would be on the terrace. After having spoken to the manager, they were extremely accommodating and moved us to a much better table with a fantastic view over the Adriatic and of the fort. 

Mario (with the glasses) was our waiter for the evening and did a fantastic job of talking us through the menu and also the various Olive oils which they pair to each course. He provided the best service that we have experienced in croatia.

My vegetarian fiance particularly loved the asparagus risotto and the chocolate fantasy desert. 
Every course was delicious and they have a separate vegetarian menu for all you non meat eaters out there. 

To top it off, we were treated to a complimentary liquor at the end of the meal.

Overall a brilliant experience and a meal that we won't forget. Make sure you book well in advance.

This was recommended as one of the best restaurant in Dubrovnik and we weren't disappointed small wonderful favoured food served by a very good waiter who explained about what we were eating and the types of oil that was served with each meal, not the cheapest meal in town but for something special this is the place, booking in advance is advised as it extremely busy but designated waiters were always at hand, a nice touch wasthe welcome by the manager who welcomed everyone after they were seated

Celebrated my partner's birthday here, with a table on the terrace facing the sea and the fortress. The view is just breathtaking. Service is impeccable and attentive but not overbearing. Everything we ate was so flavorful and beautifully presented. This is an expensive meal, but spend the money - it's well worth every kuna.

Nautika was, hands down, our favorite restaurant on our honeymoon. We were lucky enough to grab a reservation at the last minute. 

We sat upstairs on the patio overlooking the Fortress. WHAT A VIEW! 

Our server was Mario and he made the night incredibly special. We started with lobster and sea urchin meat, tuna tartar, marinated white fish. The best thing about this appetizer was the dehydrated olive oil that the fish was served on top of. It was such an interesting taste! 

I had the lobster paste and my husband had the Veal Fillet and Dubrovnik Malvasija Sauce. Both were amazing. My husband's dish had this pea mousse on top of the potatoes gratin, which sounds nuts, but was probably my favorite thing. 

Nautika serves every dish with its own olive oil paring. By the end of the night, we had five different olive oils, which we then did a taste test to see which ones we loved the most. Mario explained what made each olive oil different and even explained how Croatians still make olive oil today. We ended up buying our favorite at a shop in Rovinj. 

We ended the meal with a chocolate cake with raspberry sauce. I don't even really like chocolate or raspberries, and I LOVED this cake. 

But I've saved the best for last! My husband has Serbian parents and was talking to Mario about Slivovitz. Mario then showed up with a cart full of special cordials, one of which was Sliovitz and comped us both a drink!

This was such a lovely experience I went twice for dinner! The location is fabulous just by the Old Town and on the sea cliff. The staff were divine, the food and wine was excellent and I was made to feel comfortable and very welcome. Thank you!
Great view, great service and awesome food. Book table before, high prices, but worth it. Live music and very romantic spot.
Beautiful and tasty food. Excellent service. Stunning view from first floor. Good wine and food menu.

Visited here after making reservation online which I highly recommend as is very popular! View is beautiful food was nice but maybe didn't live up to the price tag you are definitely paying for view and service! Service was lovely but my only complaint is it took over an hour to get our main course and apart from beautiful view it was lacking a bit of atmosphere! There was pianist in the reception which seemed a waste because you could not hear out on the terrace and there was no music outside on the terrace which would have made it feel more romantic seems as though it is on the the worlds most romantic restaurant list! Overall very satisfied pricey but your on holidays so worth it!

This is a very good restaurant in Dubrovnik, the food was good but a little over charged, I guess this is because of the view and the privilege place to have dinner. 

The deserts were really good!!!!

If you are after a restaurant to celebrate a special occasion this IS the place to go. 
The service is amongst the best I have experienced, both at home and abroad. You are made to feel special from the moment you set foot in the restaurant until the moment you leave. The waiting staff are truly in a league of their own. 
The food was outstanding. Fine dining without leaving you hungry. Fantastic atmosphere and beautiful views of the city walls. The best restaurant in Dubrovnik. I can't recall a more magical evening.

We reserved edge table for the magnificent view. I had the 7 course tasting and spouse had the 5 course tasting. Although expensive, this was, by far, THE BEST MEAL we had in Croatia, perhaps our best meal in 2017, and one of top 10 ever. Attentive staff and fabulous food. Don't miss this one - it was GREAT!
Great upscale restaurant just outside city wall in Dubrovnik. The view,people watching, music, service and food was excellent. First class all the way.

We had one of the most great experiences in Croatia, food, views, atmosphere and probably we received the best service ever, especially Vinko who served our dinner and very kindly explain every plate, also Petar was very kind to us, the entire service was amazing with a lovely music. Definitely 100% I'll recomend if you are traveling to Dubrovnik

I chose this restaurant to celebrate a wedding anniversary with my wife (of course) and my children. We had to accept an odd time to ensure that we had the best view of the Old Town from the table, but it was worth it. The food is exquisite and despite the eye-watering price this is a restaurant that is worth a visit.

Get a reservation far enough in advance to be right up on the wall with the best view of Old Town and the Fort of St. Lawrence. What makes this restaurant truly special is that the food, wine, and service are just as good as the views. The array of olive oils and Croatian wines is impressive. If you are going to treat yourself to a fine dining experience in Dubrovnik, I can't imagine a better choice than this restaurant. The staff even remembered we were celebrating our anniversary and brought these fun dessert martinis. This is a special place.
Unbelievable food ! (Will be at pains to find anything on this level) made all the more by our knowledgeable and amazing host Ivan. Worth a trip to this beautiful city for the restaurant alone 👌

We came here on recommendation and what a fabulous recommendation this was! We were treated exceptionally, by a team of friendly and knowledgeable waiters. They were on hand to advise about the food and the wine. We started by having two of the signature Gin and Tonics, which in itself was an experience (expensive though) but lovely. One came in a bird cage and had a name relating to the birds in homage to all the swifts in the city! Another was sprayed with an atomiser, adding to the ambience of the setting and taste of the gin. I had the steak which was the most tender steak I think I have ever had, it cut like butter.(A little salty though, which I mentioned) - However still delicious. The chef sent some desert wine as an apology, though really wasn't necessary. They all couldn't do enough for us. I would definitely recommend this, however it is not a cheap night out. We got what we paid for and it was more than just good food, it was an experience. Well done Nautika!
Unbeatable service, 2-3 staff at the table at any given time making sure you are 1000% taken care. One of the best dining experiences of my life thus far:)

Yes it is expensive... But this is a dining experience for the ages.. Impeccable food and absolutely the finest service I've ever received at a restaurant. Book a day in advance for one of the terrace tables overlooking the forts and Ocean. A fine dining experience for that special someone.. Go Ahead... You are on Vacation so make it memorable... Highly recommended...
When I go to Dubrovnik.. I always head here for a great service and lovely food, I would highly recommend it and the seafood.

Me and some friends, were walking when suddenly we saw the restaurant. 

The view is magnificent, the service is very good, (we arrived at 11:00 pm and they seated us even though the kitchen was closed ) the drinks are perfect. The food is delicious !!!

Great place to go !!!

My husband & I recently had dinner at this fabulous restaurant and it was absolute PERFECTION! I had made the rez online & been emailing with Anita, their sales mgr, for weeks prior to the trip. She was amazing accommodating our ever changing schedule. She had enter my request for a lovely romantic table outside and the restaurant really delivered upon getting there. We were seated upstairs on a small semi-private terrace with amazing views of the bay. The entire staff were VERY friendly & professional. The mgr that evening even came to our table twice and asked if we wanted to move closer to the wall for a better view, which we did. Our waiter & his support staff were exceptional! We ordered the 7 course menu which was AMAZING!!! We felt quite special which was such a lovely feeling! 

If I could give this place more than 5 stars, I would in a heartbeat! I HIGHLY recommend dining at this wonderful restaurant!!!

Me and my girlfriend visited Nautika for a dinner evening. It was the best resturant visit we have ever made. I ordered lamb and my girlfriend ordered beef. Cooked with perfection! The same with the desserts. This level of class is unknown to me (I'm a countryboy), but Nautika pulled it off in style. 
I would also like to thank our waiter Ivan aka "John". He made our evening perfect. Thank you Ivan.

We hope to get a table at a another evening.

Best regards,
Tom Erik & Mari.

Well.. im gonna rate everything separately

Location and view: excellent
Service: very professional
Starters: tagliatelle with truffle (very nice) shrimps (just good) 

Main course: we had lobster tail (nice), veal Dubrovnik style (just like most of the veals ive tried if not lower) 

Fish of the day (not bad, not tasty as well)

Price: 1950 kuna / 300 $ / 260 € 

For 3 persons and we dont drink wine ! We ordered juices and water

Ive been great restaurants like Zuma/Novikov/ jean George / etc.. 
when you pay certain amount of money.. you expect tastier food.. not just nice atmosphere and good service.

Apart from the setting, which was perfect, the food was amazing and the Gin choices were out of this world. The staff could not have done to make the occasion special.
We will definitely be returning.

Nautika is just outside the west gate of the wall and it is located directly above the sea. It was a very romantic dinner for my bride of 51 years. The staff was terrific and the food very good. This is a special restaurant for a special occasion.

My girlfriend and I spent 5 days in Dubrovnik, on the tail end of a trip in Paris. We wanted to have a nice dinner in Dubrovnik that was off the Stradun in the Old City and go to a place that offered some different items than everywhere else in Dubrovnik. We ended up scoring a reservation at Nautika, and we are so happy we did. 

They ran a few minutes behind on the reservation, so when we were seated we were greeted by the restaurant manager and two glasses of champagne. They apologized profusely and we got on with the experience. Our server, Ivan, (highlight of the night) introduced himself and explained that he would be guiding us through the journey that was our meal at Nautika. We aren't Croatian, don't speak Croatian, and don't know anything about the territory, so for us to go to a different restaurant and order what we *thought* looked good would have just kept us in our comfort zone and might have prevented us from having such a great experience. 

We started out with the Fish trio taster. It was simply delicious. Amazing flavors such as fresh Sea Bass, Tuna Tartare, and Lobster were accompanied by dehydrated olive oil which was marvelous. Who knew something so simple could be so good. Ivan explained everything about the dish before we dove in- including where each fish came from and how all the garnishes accompanied the meal. Fantastic. Next, we moved on to the Large Shrimp with Polenta that was infused with a creamy Goat Cheese. OMG. The smooth and rich polenta joined by the tender juicy shrimp was something else. 

For our main course, we shared the Beef Charolais Filet and the Lobster Tail over pasta. The beef was cooked to perfection and was joined by a tasty gnoccho patty and sauce that were fantastic. The lobster tail and pasta had some unbelievable flavors that we only wish we could make at home. Fabulous. 

On to the wine. We had heard coming here that Croatia had some of the oldest grape varietals in the world and found out soon that Croatia is actually home of the Zinfandel grape. We ordered a bottle of the Markus Pepejuh 2013 that went with the meal perfectly. Once again, it was Ivan who asked what we liked and what we desired at steered us in the right direction again. He was flawless, and we hadn't even had dessert yet. Of course, we asked to see the dessert menu. 

We ordered the chocolate mousse with chocolate cake that had a dusting of Salt Flower on top and a raspberry sauce drizzle on the plate. Again, it was incredible. 

I know everyone has different opinions and I'm clearly not a food expert, but this place was probably the best meal all around we have had in 5 years. We do quite a bit of traveling and enjoy dining out often, but Nautika really provided an all around experience that left nothing in question. If you come to Dubrovnik, and you don't mind splurging a bit, Nautika is my one and only recommendation. Make sure you ask for Ivan to be your server and get a reservation several days in advance.

We loved this restaurant. The food was very high quality, and super tasteful. Very nice and professional waiters. The restaurant is also super nice. We had a table at a lovely terrace. The only drawback is the price, which was high even for Dubrovnik. We still felt that it was worth if for one evening.

I can not rate this restaurant enough. I emailed about a month before to book an outside table with a sea view. Communication from the start was excellent.
 I wanted to treat my husband to a special meal. As I had requested a fantastic table was waiting for us. From the moment we sat down the service was impeccable. We did not feel pressured or rushed during our meal, any advice about the food or the location of this beautiful restaurant was answered.
We were allocated Evan for our time at the table, I can not thank him enough for making our evening so magical.
The food was truly amazing. I had the beef and my husband had the sea bass, by far was the best beef I have ever tasted. We both had the Croatian rose wine with our meal. Dessert was not a disappointment either, we had different chocolate desserts but swapped half way through so we could taste both. Finished with floating coffee each.
I have already recommended Nautika to my step daughter and partner who will be booking a table later in the year.
Thank you Nautika

Found this restaurant based on other Trip Advisor reviews and happy to say that it did not disappoint. I made reservations via email and even had a few changes along the way and found Anita very responsive and friendly.

The restaurant sits just outside the Pile Gate and was very easy to find. The view of the sea and old walls was absolutely gorgeous.

We had 3 courses and loved each more than the last. We also went with a recommended wine pairing of a Croatian red to pair with our veal and lamb and loved it. 

And the service itself was friendly, knowledgeable, and all around great. 

About me: have been to Alinea in Chicago (three times), Eleven Madison Park in NY, and Tetsuya in Sydney (ages ago). 

You'll certainly pay western prices. But we really enjoyed it.

We had booked a table in the front row on the terrace and was not disappointed with the view. Service was impeccabile, and the food was amazing. If you're after Fine Dining in Dubrovnik look no further.

Croatia is a truly remarkable country, and Dubrovnik, per se, a beautiful city, indeed.
Sumptuous views are in copious supply......

There are many special restaurants, par excellence, in Dubrovnik (Above 5 Roof-Top Restaurant, is another with fantastic food, and views) - and the Nautika is (also) one of them. Wonderful interior, superb exterior!

My colleague and I were to meet some Russian 'guests' for an early dinner, which gave me the opportunity to 'do' my Pavel Chekov and his line - 'guess who's coming to dinner', shortly before they arrived. 

Staff here, are exceptionally professional - friendly, attentive, and affable. Truly remarkable, creative, high-quality food at a very good price, indeed.

Starters consisted of a Fish Trio Plate - which had Tuna Tartar and Cuttlefish in there......Carpacio of Meat was also great, apparently.

Main courses - Lamb Cutlet, a Veal Fillet, Tuna Steak - looked great, and were, apparently top-line......as for my Lobster Tail (not literally), it was tremendous.

Excellent service, exceptional cuisine - a wonderful restaurant !!

So my wife and I have been lucky enough to eat in some awesome places around the world but never have we enjoyed a restaurant like this one.
Tomoslav the maitre de is an exceptional professional and a great dinner experience was had.

Prices are not over the top in our view but I would agree on the up side etc.

Try the piano lounge after dinner

Tomoslav is the handsome one on the right lol

The place is known for being fine dining so obviously the price matches the reputation. We had a good time and enjoyed the food, however if you don't want to spend money they this is not the place for you. The service was very good; as I mentioned we did enjoy the food but wasn't the best I tried in Croatia.

Everything about this restaurant is impressive. The service. Food and location are superb. It is, it has to be said, it's not cheap. Make sure you check the prices before your visit. It is worth it though...

Again, the owners, servers, and management go out of their way to be accommodating even if the hostesses are a bit difficult to deal with. They all try very hard to make each seating epic with over-the-top service, it's just that the food fails to live up to all the ceremony. So you pay through the nose for the theatre and the setting, but the food just doesn't live up to the machinations. Albeit it is well presented on the plate and there it ends.

The restaurant is well situated, with great views of the sea and shore. We had Evan attending to us, service with a flair as he explained the olive oil pairing each dish, and gave a swish of oil on the dish. 
I liked every dish, and especially the fish soup and the sea bass fillet. The desserts were good too. There is a good wine cellar too which Evan gladly showed us.
All in, a great dining experience.
Dine in the the most beautiful spot inside the walled city with views to die for. Food and service top notch. Highly recommend. Reservations a must.

Nautika is one of the more expensive restaurants in town. Some of that, no doubt, goes to offset the rent, the restaurant is on the edge of old town, overlooking the sea. The rest in part covers the team of waiters serving every table and the pianist, who worked really hard to create a romantic ambiance. But as in many other restaurants in Dubrovnik, the service was a little shaky, certainly not commensurate with the menu prices. For example, our glasses sat empty for extended periods of time throughout dinner. The menu itself is limited, which if executed well, can be a strength, but not in our case. Puzzlingly, the tasting menu was nearly identical to the a la carte menu, so we opted for the latter for more latitude. The food was good and at times artfully served, but portions were very small and most of the dishes instantly forgettable. The restaurant makes it a point to garnish each of the courses with a different locally grown olive oil, which did add something to the dining experience, but not enough to make the food stand out. Do yourself a favor, take a few more steps into old town or take a cab to Babin Kuk part of Dubrovnik - you'll find that there are better choices available. Simply put, Nautika is overpriced and under delivers.

Read so many good reviews of this restaurant, I had to see for myself what all the hype was about, and wow! Wonderful food, fantastic service with literally the BEST view of the entire city. Definitely going to come back again next time I visit old town.

My wife booked this fine eatery up prior to our holiday. Arrived 10 mins early and shown to our sea view table. The food and the service were fantastic - Evan was a star, taking us through each dish, we even had time for a brief history lesson on Dubrovnik and his favorite UK based football team Leeds Utd - Never mind!! The steak was by my wife's own words "the best ever" and my sea bass was also very good. I understand this restaurant was voted sixth most romantic in the world. I can see why.

Probably one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik. Good ambiance, nice furniture, magnificent indoor terrace with directs views to the see. Smart service. The menu irreprochable. But anyway for the price I expected more.

The perfect setting. A wonderful, talented, waiter, and great food. We opted for the 7 course taster menu. Yes, it's pricy, but well worth it. Treat yourself to a night here - make sure you get a Sea view table. Splendid restaurant.

My wife and I were out celebrating my birthday and she had pre booked the best seat in the house! Everything about the experience oused class and quality. The wine list is very extensive and the waiter was able to offer detailed information about our selection. The food was exceptional and rates as one of the finest fillet steaks that we have eaten (pic attached) The price was fairly expensive approx £250 with service(Bottle of wine, starters, main course and liqueur coffee's) however, as a special
occasion it was a fantastic evening with an excellent setting and view! An absolute must if the budget can be pushed...!

This is a high end fine dining restaurant by which I mean the environment, the restaurant layout and table setting, the efficient and slick service and of course the quality of the food. The restaurant is just outside the city walls overlooking the sea. It is a beautiful setting and has live piano so is a good venue for celebrations. We went there for dinner so were able to sit outside without being too hot. Our waiter was very welcoming and looked after us well. The food was excellent – we both had veal as we had been eating a lot of fish already. I saw the table next to us have a salt crust baked seabass which looked really good. The prices here are not much more than other seafood restaurants in town and it is definitely worth paying the difference.
No need for a review. Just go and enjoy the delicious food, extensive wine list and great view !!! This place is a MUST try

Hands down the most amazing dining experience we've experienced, service was exceptional, food was fantastic, location unbelievable, will definitely return to enjoy again, thank you Mario and your wonderful team!! Grazi !!
Had a dinner here on May, on the balcony table with my guests. Enjoy both great food and view here, maybe it a little expensive but for this much luxury dining. I would say it just perfect.

This is a superb restaurant and it's location just outside the city walls is amazing. We were fortunate to be able to have a table overlooking the sea, which made it even more special. 

The staff are superb and very attentive. We had the 5 course tasting menu, which was wonderful. 

However, as with all good things, this restaurant is very expensive. We had one bottle of wine and two bottles of still water along with our meal and the bill came to over 1700 kunar (£200+). We knew it would be, but it's worth pointing out to potential visitors that it is not a cheap option! It wouldn't put me off going again though!

The setting was good and best time is to have dinner in the evening so as to catch the sunset in comfort. Otherwise similar view can be seen just outside the restaurant without the price tag. the food here is grossly overpriced but i must admit, they make it up with very good services.
This was some of the best service we received on our trip and the food was amazing. Go before dark and sit outside. the staff made the best suggestion

RESERVATIONS
I recommend making reservations as this place has limited seats. If you can, try to time it so your meal begins as the sun goes down to get the best view! Also, request a table right by the edge as you can see in my pictures. It will make the experience that much better!

ATMOSPHERE
The atmosphere of this place is phenomenal. The view is breathtaking, and very romantic. The tables are on a quiet balcony, that overlooks the castle, and water. I would not recommend for children as they are messy and would likely interfere with the mood.

SERVICE
The service was on point and very friendly when we visited. Our server was very welcoming, and gave us lovely descriptions of food and drink as they were brought to our table. This is a fine dining restaurant, so you can expect the service to be amazing.

FOOD
The food is wonderful, and rich but served in very small fine dining portions (as expected). I recommend the scallops for sure as they were so good, we ordered a second portion! The fish dishes were also very good (Croatia is known for seafood!). This is one of those places where dessert is a must. As you can see from my pictures, we ordered the chocolate cake, and the pear dessert which had a liquor pour over vanilla ice cream. I would be surprised if you found anything beyond amazing here!

My wife and I ate here on our last full night in Dubrovnik and we're lucky to get a cancellation. Our table overlooked the Adriatic Sea and the views were wonderful. 
From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the service was attentive, polite and professional: and then there was the food and wine, which was exceptional. 
We both had the 5 course taster menu and our waiter Mario supplied a different wine with each course, including a dessert wine that was to die for. All the wines had been produced in Croatia and accompanied the food perfectly. 
Our bill, including champagne to start and coffee and Croatian liqueurs to finish came to £250, but it was worth every penny. 
Said we would return at Christmas but unfortunately they close from October through to February. 
Thoroughly recommended.

We booked table by email three weeks erlier out on the terrace right on the edge, the view was spectacular.
I You want Michelin star, finedining meal in romantic athmosphere, this is the place.
The food was excellent, fresh, full of flavour and well presented.
Also desserts and wines were delicious.
Really good professional service, waiter and sommelier were perfect. They knew wines and gave us good recommendation both meals and wines.
This was the best best restaurant our visiting in Dubrovnik.
We have eaten in many restaurants around the world and Nautika is one of the TOP restaurant in our list.
The dinner with wines is not cheap but absolutely worth the experience.
Highly recomended couples looking for romantic evening with finedining.

We visited Dubrovnik a week ago. On recommendation from some other friends, we dined at this fabulous restaurant. The food, the delicious Croatian wine, the ambiance, the breath taking view and last but by no means least the amazing staff all made the evening perfect. What fabulous way to begin a holiday. We chose the tasting menu.....a must!! It's pricy but well worth it especially if you enjoy good food!!
Nautika has great food, but is very pricy. I recommended the veal done medium rare. It is extremely juicy and tender. Although the prices were pretty high, I enjoyed going to Nautika

My wife and wife decided to book the restaurant as we were over in dubrovnik on holiday. The service, view, food were all fantastic. A lovely way to spend second last night on holiday, we hopefully will come back again some time!
Same, top end, price range and def fine dining but just didn't feel as good as 360. Service was just a bit too over the top for my liking. Food very good but not awesome. Lovely views.

This restaurant is first class all the way. The view is literally one of the best in the city, the servers were super attentive, and the food was delicious. You cannot visit Dubrovnik without coming to Nautika.

Our dinner at Nautika was one of the most memorable meals of our honeymoon. Everything was wonderful, from the stunning views to the impeccable service. Our waiter Mario had some very helpful suggestions to guide us in our food and wine choices. We could tell that the staff were carefully trained and took a lot of pride in the quality of their work. Very friendly, too. And the food was just dazzling; rich in flavor, texture, and color. They even threw in complimentary dessert wine as a nice gesture for our honeymoon. We noticed too that the waiters brought out some lovely ivory blankets for customers who got a little chilly on the terrace as the sun went down, but we weren't cold. We were simply blown away by our experience at Nautika. I hate to think we could have left Croatia without eating here. I will never forget it!

The best restaurant in town. Food and service were excellent, and the location adds to the experience - overlooking the walls and the old fort. It is not cheap, but if you are a foodie and/or want a dining experience then look no further. Even the Pope has been a client.....
It would be advisable to book given it is very busy, but you may get a table if you go early.

My wife and I had a fabulous meal here whilst spending a week in Dubrovnik. An affordable luxury and in no way snobby, as some fine dining experiences can be. The staff were very professional and the food from the carpaccio to the pag cheeses was delicious. Booked a couple of weeks in advance to ensure we got a table at the end of the terrace, but the restaurant was not overly busy, possibly because we were eating early. 
Amazing view too.
Excellent service! Great food and spectacular view. Staff was pleasant and very attentive. Food was well presented. This is a must for a very special occasion.
Service at Nautika was truly first class. The best meal on our holiday hands down. Amazing dining experience overall. Our waiters and food were excellent. Highly recommended.
Amazing fish food,best fish soup i ever use.. Lovely staff and amazing viev from restaurant! All the best!

Nautika is located closely to Pile Gate, the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old Town. They say it's the best restaurant in town, and I have to agree! The food was absolutly delicious. I had the Creamy Shrimp Risotto with green asparagus and fried rice vermicelli and it was absolutly devine and the Adriatic Chocolate Fantasy was so yummy. The view from the terrace is just breathtaking. amazing. Staff is also very friendly and welcoming. 
Prices will be a little bit higher than anywhere else in town, but it's oh so worth it!

My boyfriend had the idea to stop by here and it was a wonderful surprise. Food quality was excellent, the service was excellent and I recommend it to anyone who's looking for a fine dinner in a romantic place. By the way, the location is lovely. Their terrace has a lovely sea view! Totally recommend it !

Nautika is located a few steps away from Pila Gate, the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old Town. Nautika is said to be one of the best restaurants in town. Food was really amazing and of top top quality. Mediterranean cuisine is offered in an innovative and sophisticated way. Seafood dishes are the most popular but meat and vegetarian dishes are also served. Our table was on one of the two terraces - so we had stunning views over the Adriatic sea and Bokar. Wine-list is great. Service is very professional and helpful. An unforgettable evening!

Having never been to Croatia or the Dalmatian coast I wanted to make sure i visited a quality restaurant whilst I was there. I found Nautika via a somewhat dated looking website but saw the patronage and the setting and went ahead and booked. Since then the website had improved dramatically. I was quite concerned when arriving in Dubrovnik the amount of places the restaurant advertised with leaflets etc and its setting is slap bang in the middle of the tourist center. However, when i finally made it there for dinner it was exceptional. A restaurant in the grand old style where service is paramount above anything else. All complimented by a wonderful pianist and setting. Our waiter, Darko, was attentive, informative and exceptionally good at doing his job. A job that far too many restaurants think is taking an order and putting a plate on a table. Places like Nautika make you realise that it is a highly skilled job only a few can carry off with aplomb. The food was perfect accompanied by various Croatian olive oils (a signature theme of the restaurant). There is a picture of Sir Roger Moore outside on the restaurant terrace at table 37 on the website. I found myself in the same position just a few days after his death and feeling very James Bond as the setting simply begs you to. I would recommend this place to anyone and look forward to going back.

Where to begin? The setting is fabulous located on Pile gate overlooking the sea and fort up on the hill. We were seated outside the restaurant in the courtyard. A table of 9 we were well looked after. Our Waiters - we had 2 were introduced to us on arrival and helped us with wine and drinks selection. We had heard about the speciality Gin cocktail served in a bird cage - wow! A gin, raspberry, ginger and mint combination served on a bed of rose petals was a work of art. We went for local White wine - delicious. A section of warmed very fresh breads were served to us with oils. Scallops starter was popular amongst our group and a great voice. 3 large scallops with white truffle - delicious. Lobster tail on gnocchi also recommended. Blankets were supplied later evening when the air chilled. A complimentary local drink served at the end of the meal must be tried. It was a fine dining experience and a fine dining bill - worth every penny. Would return. If a couple or smaller group asking for a table overlooking the sea would be recommended.

10 women dined at Nautika Restaurant. 
It was lovely from the time we arrived til when we departed. 
Beautiful food in a gorgeous setting with outstanding service. 
Thank you memorable evening!

Everything in this place was brilliant - the food, the wine, the view, the service, the music. We had the tasting menu with a Croatian red wine and this ranks amongst the best food I have ever had in my life. Will definitely go again.

We went there back in October 2016, and after being blown away on the first day by what Dubrovnik has to offer we stumbled across this place when leaving the old city.

The food was incredible - typical Mediterranean feel but with obvious local influences. 

So good we went back before we left!

If you want a romantic setting, which includes a view of the Adriatic Sea and Old Town Dubrovnik, quality food, and exceptional service, this is the place! Make your terrace reservations in advance. The staff is very good about communicating with you via e-mail. This was the highlight of our cruise experience.

We dined here during a short break to Dubrovnik, and absolutely loved it. If I could award 4 1/2 stars I would, and the only thing keeping it from being 5 stars in my opinion is the price in comparison to other similar restaurants we've been to in other countries. (Although we definitely didn't mind paying for such a lovely setting). Our waiter was charming and knowledgable and made the experience to be honest. He chose glasses of white wine specially paired with our starters for us, and both were excellent. We had scallops, prawns, lamb and veal- and all was delicious. We had a 6pm sitting and this was well worth doing as the view during sunset is brilliant. Would definitely visit again- thank you!

My boyfriend treated us here last night with our toddler daughter. We had the 7 course taster menu that was delightful and delicious! The romantic ambience looking over the old wall and sea was simply beautiful. The service delivered by Evan and Marco and their team was ever so attentive that added to it being so special. Thank you for a lovely dining experience!

My wife and I visited here for our first wedding anniversary, we originally wanted to dine at 360 but unfortunately they are closed on Mondays they recommended Nautika to us as an alternative. 
 
We had the 7 course taster menu which was delicious particularly the shrimp soup. 

They have a large selection of wines most of which are overpriced however the service is excellent and professional.

The overall experience is possibly slightly over priced compared to similar establishments throughout Europe. 

Would recommend for a special occasion. 

Although I consider this to be 4.5 star it's closer to 4 than it is 5 hence the review.

I always say a great dining experience is made up of 3 equal parts - the food, the setting and the service. Get any one of these wrong and the overall experience isn't perhaps what it could be. As such I'm delighted to say that last night's dinner at Nautika was outstanding on all 3 levels. 

We enjoyed the 7 course tasting menu's where the stand out dishes were the shrimp bisque, the tuna and the veal. This all took place in what could best be described as a Hollywood setting - perfectly positioned looking out onto the walls of the city and the sea beyond. It doesn't get any better.

However perhaps the best part of all was the service - from the manager Marco to our waiter Ivan, we were treated like kings, queens and princesses from the start. Just perfect and truly a very special place to dine when in Dubrovnik. 

And if you're not n Dubrovnik....its well worth the journey in itself.
Nautica is in Michelin guide. With reason. Very professional stuff ingenious Chef memorable food. Not to forget to mention perfect atmosphere

Our last night in Dubrovnik and we did it in style! Such a perfect location, amazing service and wonderful food. A pianist in the lobby too. Watching the sun set as we ate and drank was just amazing - nothing to fault whatsoever.

We ordered the 7 course tasting menu with wine pairing. Although it was expensive ($400 US) it was delicious and the pricing was comparable to a good restaurant in New York. 

The shrimp soup and steak medallion were my favorite, however, the cuttlefish cake and carpaccio were superb as well. 

Above all else, the staff was the best. We were served by Peter, Mario, Mario (the 2nd), and Darko. They were very accommodating, even moving us to a seat with a better view once space opened up. The view is gorgeous by the way, looking over the dubrovnik bay at the old town wall and fort. 

Definitely go! If not for the tasting menu then for the shrimp soup.

2 positives and a negative.... they need to improve their portions (I know I'm American), but it was pathetic.

Starter: 

Shrimp with goat cheese and polenta (good and decently sized)

Main:

Tuna: got 3 small 1 inch by 1 inch cubes of tuna. Ridiculous!

Wine: 2 glasses equal 1 normal one anywhere in the world.

The manager did come over with complimentary glass of wine and some cheese. I first refused but he insisted. Good that he did that. 

My check was $110 without tipping yet. This is for one person.

If you want great service, high quality food and excellent ambience, this is the spot. You may leave hungry and feel a bit ripped off if you're a world traveler.
It's not just the food, which is delicious. It's the service and the whole atmosphere. Croatia is much more than just Cevapcici.

This was our best meal in 10 days in Croatia. We had great service, extensive wine list, and great food. View right outside of Pile gate, view is of the sea and an old fort. Food was excellent and seafood done very well. Loved the chocolate fig dessert with the croatian dessert wine. Would return again.

Such a wonderful evening to end our trip in beautiful Dubrovnik. Staff were so lovely and knowledgeable about the food and drink on offer. Kept us warm and smiling on a chilly evening. Managed to get an alternative made for main course fussy eater!! Cocktails were prefect, as were the wine and drinks suggestions.
Definitely would recommend and return if we visit again

We had the most wonderful experience at nautika, breathtaking views and incredible food. The meal was elegantly plated and paired with olive oils and wines. The service was top notch on par with fine dining restaurants across the globe. Also it is very well priced given the caliber of the restaurant, cannot recommend highly enough.

The place to be in Dubrovnik! Welcoming and professional staff combined with the finest seafood dishes makes this place the top of our dining experience.
Unique romantic setting with the most spectacular view of fortress Lovrijenac takes your breath away. High quality in every way.

From start to finish, this restaurant was impressive. Great service....don't remember the gentleman's name, but he deserves a mention! One of the best steaks I ever tasted....and that is something I really wasn't expecting, and amazing scallops and sea bass. Not cheap, but the food was sublime. Worth every penny! Thanks for a great evening.

It has been 41 years. We went to an expensive highly rated restaurant. Would they come through? Our table was facing a sea at sunset. We started with champagne. Soup and a salad that was great. I had the most flavorful steak ever. Tuna was excellent. The service was the best. They even heat the toilet paper in the bathrooms. Was it expensive. You bet. Was it an event worth remembering You bet it was incredible evening. Thanks for a magical evening

We ate here during a week long holiday in Dubrovnik. Located just outside the Pile Gate, with a great view out to sea and a romantic setting. The service was excellent (Mario!), very attentive as you'd expect from a fine dining restaurant. Prices aren't cheap but the quality of the food was high. My wife is gluten free and that was catered for with ease. Would highly recommend even if just for an after dinner drink!

We were in Croatia for three weeks for our honeymoon and decided to have a special meal as our last dinner before heading home. This was a wonderful choice and we had a great night! The service was second to none and the food was delicious. We had the 6 course tasting menu and it really made our last night something to remember :)

We booked late but the management was kind enough to accommodate us for an early sitting. First, the atmosphere. We were seated at their covered balcony overlooking the ramparts and the smashing waves below.. whilst the sun set the moon quickly arose to cap the beautiful evening. A couple of us had the degustation seven course menu.. (they come in five courses as well)..let me warn you if your ordering this tasting menu..the portion size is quite generous..Each course is two third the normal menu servings! Our palate was tantalized with a fresh approach in their recipe's to their presentation..From seafood to meat portions the chef entertained us with his culinary delights. On their way to a Michelin Star I should think.. well done and keep it up!

Sea Bass par excellence, which was the highlight of the evening. Delightful staff and very polished performance , with sea views and the sunset while the piano tinkles in the background . Ask for a table on the terrace inside which is more private than the terrace at the entrance. Nice little touches of amuse bouche to start and finish . Good recommendations for local wines . All in all a very special evening .

Myself and my wife dined here for our 7th Wedding Anniversary and it was a very good experience. We booked weeks in advance to ensure we got a seat on the terrace nearer the ocean and I would urge anyone to do the same. 

The service was attentive and informative and not overly snobbish as some places of this standard can be. We ordered a nice bottle of Croatian wine which was delicious. 

Before the starters arrived there was a complimentary goats cheese and pea mouse which was a nice surprise. We ordered Shrimp Soup each, I then had Scallops with truffle and my wife had the Cuttlefish and then we both had the lobster for the main. All was superbly cooked and portion size was ok for this type of restaurant. 

There was also bread with every course and different olive oils which was a nice touch. 

We didn't have room for dessert but the kind waiter wouldn't let us leave without something sweet and brought a small selection of their own white and milk chocolates. Devine!

The view is also simply stunning and couldn't have asked for a nicer location. 

Yes it is expensive - about £100 a head +. But for a special occasion and if in budget I would recommend. 

The only niggle was we had a prior engagement to get to and we had to ask for the bill twice and took about 15 mins to arrive. They did apologise after and said it was an oversight. 

Overall a fantastic night.

Our guests took us out to the latest" in place "as it was going to be our last night in Dubrovnik and what a place . We where told cannot confirm if true, is that it is only opened at night as the chef is out catching today's fresh lobsters and fish and that if he is not happy he tosses them back whilst on the boat. I was promised they are all locally caught.get a table right up against the wall the view at night you could kill for.Nautika's chef knows what he is doing.. From an array of seafood to veggies specials to meats you will be spoilt for choice. It is also a Michelin recommended the terrace on our night out was perfect to round off a great break. Cannot tell what happened afterwards.please book ahead..
This is my second visit here with my husband and children. Food was absolutely tasty and the environment was really amazing. My children love to have our dinner here.
We celebrated my daughters birthday at Nautika. It was expensive but worth every penny. The service was second to none and the food was heavenly. If you can - you should !

A great experience, both the view and the food. The staff were also very knowledgeable, attentive and friendly. We have dined at many fine places, including 3 michelin star, and this restaurant was up there on our list. Definitely recommend!

Everything you in a good restaurant is here . The chef is great and 5 course menu was outstanding. You need to book. The view is great. The hostess greeting us was very courteous. Each meal had a touch of special olive oil. A must to visit.

My daughter and I had dinner here one night. It was warm enough to sit outside , it was very cozy and the ambiance was delightful, not to mention how beautiful the setting was as well. It was a Michelin guide recommended restaurant that deserves its recognition. The service was excellent from start to finish. They even give you a little extra treat at the end of your meal. They had a variety of olive oil choices for every course they served all proudly Croatian. The food was delicious and we enjoyed our experience here very much. I would say that for couples, this would be a very romantic setting for a date . Advanced reservations is advisable.

This is definitely not the place that you go to very often. However, when it is a very special occasion, and you really do want to push the boat out into very deep waters, then Nautika is a place that you really have to visit.
It is far from cheap, and expect to pay £100 a head. However the food is truly fantastic and the service is absolutely immaculate. 
this is when m

This is not a restaurant to eat at but to get an experience as well. The view is amazing and so is the food and service. Everything was absolutely impeccable. This is a fine dining place, so the portions are quite small, so, don't think about sharing a meal unless you hardly eat ;)
I wanted to try the dessert but was quite full. But they got us some handmade chocolates along with the bill :) 
Highly recommended.

Great location, amazing food, exquisite drinks and the most personalised service I ever experienced - felt pampered and truly cared for !! Special thanks to Ivan - your choices were heavenly !! Excellent service and can't recommend enough !!

We had an absolutely magical dinner here on our visit to Dubrovnik.

We didn't have a booking and were given one of the outside tables left. Very kindly, halfway during our meal, the staff moved to us to one of the tables on the terrace. This really was one of the most stunning settings for a meal I have ever experienced. This was a very thoughtful gesture that we hugely appreciated. 

The staff really were great. They had all of the skill and professionalism that a fine dining establishment requires, but without any sense of pretension. We recieved some excellent guidance on choosing a superb, but reasonable bottle of white to accompany our meal. The food was great as well, and the Sea Bass dish I eat may have been the finest I have ever had. 

As another reviewer commented, Nautika really does live up to the hype.

Nautika was our fun bet restaurant on the third leg of our Med breakaway.
We booked nearly 2 months out for a table on the terrace right on the edge, and Nautika did us proud. I'm not saying that's how long you need to book in advance, but this was our Dubrovnik wager on the restaurant we felt would best capture what the place means to us and we wanted to get the view.
Probably one of the most romantic and beautiful restaurant tables in the world.
We then were presented with Mario; who was to look after us both for the night, and he did not disappoint. A true professional and one of our best waiters ever.
The food was excellent and one of the few places, not only matching wines, but also Olive oils to every course.
The Nautika bet came at a higher price than our wagers in Venice and Rome, but our choice wasn't about price, it was betting on an experience and Nautika delivered.
No reflection on Nautika, but if your looking for restaurant value anywhere in Dubrovnik, your looking in the wrong place.

We went to Nautilus Judy on the of chance, and we were lucky enough to get an table without reservation on the small terrace, overlooking the sea and Fort Lovrijenac.

We decided to opt for the 7 course tasting menu in order to try some items we had not previously. This was a good idea! The first course of beef carpaccio was stunning; followed by shrimp soup, which was stunning, then uttlefish, tuna, veal, carob cake and cheese. All adding up to a dining experience that makes you physically smile with every mouthful.

I can't recommend this place highly enough!

Booked this restaurant by email before travelling g to Dubrovnik for my friends 40th. I've given 4 stars as there was a blip with our booking. I needed to go to the restaurant before the Saturday evening, which I did. I was even shown where we would be sittIng. On the night, our booking wasn't on the list and they said it's because I hadn't confirmed the booking which I had. They had availability and our table was set up, the only thing I would say is that I don't think there was any need to make such a point about this especially as it was their error. 

The evening though was lovely, a great way to end three days in Dubrovnik. it is fine dining and the staff are very attentive. The food was divine, it is expensive but for a special ocassion it is worth it and I would recommend.

This really is a very special place with the most amazing views from the terrace. The food was excellent and this was the best meal we had in Dubrovnik. A good wine list and very attentive staff. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.
You can be on the old town side by the church or the sea side by the harbor which opens a little later. Service was great and coffees were perfect.

We ate here last night and it really was a treat. The food was superb, I'm really surprised this place doesn't have a Michelin star! The whole place was spotless, the waiting staff excellent and very attentive. Definitely our best meal in town.

A great start to our short break in Dubrovnik was dinner here. Most surprising was the different olive oils served with each course - we should have had a dessert to see what they brought with that! But the bread and oil to start with was lovely but then there were the exquisite scallops (him) & beautiful tagliatelle with mushrooms & truffles (me). Husband is always on the lookout for the best steak ever and this is what we both had here - totally delicious and more than a match for the previous best-ever at a small place in Germany! Total melt-in-the-mouth yummy. The service was superb and the staff friendly, although possibly very slightly pretentious with the performance of opening the wine we had chosen - the cheapest on an expensive menu, but very good indeed. One of the best meals we have ever had, and of course not cheap.

We were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived in this gorgeous restaurant. Wines by the glass were divine. The risotto with prawns outstanding. We loved the progressively more delicious olive oils by the course. Oh, and the views fantastic!
Fantastic service, food and views. Reservations recommended. We had the sea bass and the seven course sampler. Everything was amazing!
from the setting to the staff to the food everything was spot on.We wanted a special dinner on our trip and this is the place to go ...

The food here is very good, high cuisine or at least trying to be and mostly succeeding. View is spectacular and you can sit on outside with it. They put on a big show for service and are really nice people, but sometimes they bungle up. For two dishes I had ordered a glass of wine and had to wait for 10 minutes both time for the wine to arrive after the food served. They apologized, but I think they are spending a lot of effort on putting on these great shows and sometimes falling down. But this is really a good place and the food is fine. I especially liked a fish soup, very clear with fine pieces of sea bream in it.

We ate here twice whilst on 4 night stay in Dubrovnik. We have eaten in many restaurants around the world but would put this top of our list. It does not use the modern tricks found in Michelin star restaurants but the food is undoubtedly of similar quality & the service is unsurpassed. The view from the terrace if you are lucky enough yo get a table there is magical. We tried both taster menus , one predominantly meat & the other fish & both were excellent. This is one of those restaurants you would fly in for one night just to repeat the experience....truly wonderful!

One of the pricier restaurants in Dubrovnik, but well worth it. The view from the terrace is spectacular, the service is impeccable, and the food is great. They even added a few nice touches I had never seen before (e.g. olive oil pairings with each course). If you want to splurge for a meal, I highly recommend Nautika.

This restaurant deserves a Michelin star! Outstanding service, delicious food, breathtaking view with a fairytale scenery!

This was definitely one of the best restaurants we visited in Dubrovnik, from that moment we literally fell in love with the city and cuisine. 

For the quality of food and experience we were surprised with the bill, it's reasonably affordable! We wanted to try something local and immerse in the culture, so it was definitely a hidden treasure in Croatia!

We love it <3 and will back soon!!

We had a nice dinner yesterday. Well prepared dishes, nice wine list, perfect service. Expect no experiments though. No espumas, no liquid nitrogen or other molecular stuff. Simply good food, with attention for details in flavour and plated with care. Higher price bracket.
Thoroughly recommended. Exterior terrace overlooks bay and city walls and Fort. Food and drinks top class.

We were 8 for a Birthday dinner. We started on the outside terrace and moved indoors. Sumptuous room - Nautical pictures. Very fine food (fish) and Croatian wine. Highly attentive staff and an absolutely top notch experience. Thank you all

We celebrated a special birthday over dinner here recently. The restaurant occupies a wonderful position next to Pile Gate, just outside the old city walls. The welcome is warm and sincere and the atmosphere on a spring evening delightfully relaxed. We sat on the terrace, with blankets and an electric heater at our disposal (although we didn't need either in the mild weather). The food is outstanding: our starters of beef carpaccio, fish soup and scallops, mains of seabass and dentex, and desserts all impressed. Our waiter was charmingly hospitable and knowledgeable, describing the dishes, deftly de-boning and serving up a whole dentex, advising on wines and discussing the merits of the different olive oils on offer with skill and panache. The wine list is a delight, with several outstanding Croatian wines on offer by the glass. We had a truly memorable meal.

We been in Nautika on Saturday night, early dinner at beautiful terrace whit amazing view on the city walls and see. Everything that we eat was amazing. We eat trio seafood delicacies, base in the salt, Jacob's, excellent desserts.....and everything is high recommended. But the best thing in the restaurant is wonderful service. Those guys and doing excellent job to please you in every possible way. That night was the best night in Dubrovnik so I just wanna to say thank you and I only can hope so to see you again. Wish you all the best in new season.

I'm back in Dubrovnik and dined at one of the city's best restaurants, Nautika, located just outside the Ploce Gate entrance to the beautiful walled city. 
There's a reason Nautika continues to garner rave reviews. It's simply outstanding! You can dine inside, on the front patio, or the side terrace which offers diners spectacular views of the Adriatic. 
The Nautika's ambiance is wonderful with its redecorated interior and the live piano music of maestro Nevio Koncic, one of the city's most talented musicians. He knows every classic you can think of. And, he sings, too! 
Marko Bajagic, the Food & Beverage Manager, takes personal delight in greeting each table to ensure your complete satisfaction. 
My waiter, Ivan, knows the menu forwards and backwards. I trusted his recommendations on various selections and was not disappointed. 
Although Nautika is popular for its 5 and 7 course dinners, I opted for something less filling, but equally delightful. 
Their shrimp soup is superb. My entree was the sea bass with vegetables and it was perfectly prepared. Ivan recommended a glass of the Casa Grassvina Mitrovac, a smooth white wine from Croatia's northern region. It was light and refreshing and went well with the sea bass. 
I splurged on dessert and ordered Ivan's favorite, their chocolate fig cake. It was a great finish to one of the best meals I've had in Europe. 
Nautika is moderately priced. My dinner costs 560KN (US$85) which was reasonable given the excellent quality of food, wine, service and location. Gratuities are extra at 10-15% usually. 
When you visit Dubrovnik, plan one very special dinner at Nautika. 
By the way, Nautika is one of four restaurants owed and operated by the same group. The others are Dubravka 1836, and Panorama located atop the cable car station on Srd Hill with its spectacular views of the city and coastline. Their fourth restaurant is Gradska kavana Arsenal located inside the old walled city. Enjoy!

My three travel companions and I had a very nice dining experience at Nautika Restaurant. We were seated on the patio on the side of the restaurant and we had a magnificent sea view and view of the fortress. The service was excellent and top notch to the point that we were even brought lap blankets when the weather got chilly. We all enjoyed fresh local fish that was very well prepared and the wine was terrific. In summary, it was a very pleasant outing that was enjoyed by all.

It is hard to summarize our dinner here. The ambiance, views, service, and quality of the food is by far the best we have had in Croatia (or in many places throughout Europe). This place deserves a Michelin star.

Each table on the terrace is beautifully arranged and has a wonderful view over the bay and castle walls of Dubrovnik. The whole team makes you feel as a dear guest and treats you exclusively. The food is fresh, delicious and perfectly presented. Every single detail, the table, the placement, the service, is excellent. A dinner is costly, but absolutely worth the experience.

there is only one place to have your table, the terrace at the side of the restaurant, not the one at the front where you enter the restaurant, don't eat inside as the view from the side terrace of the sea & Dubrovnik is just amazing.
this is not a cheap restaurant but it is well worth the price, the staff are very professional, the food is presented well & the taste is amazing, if you want a special meal & relaxing night this is the best restaurant in Dubrovnik, but like I say the view from the side terrace plays a big part of the experience.

We ate at Nautika Restaurant our first night in Dubrovnik. Nautika lies on the edge of the sea, alongside the western entrance to Dubrovnik's Old City. The restaurant is housed in the former Dubrovnik School of Maritime Studies, where it welcomed seafarers as far back as 1881.

Nautika was recognized as sixth most romantic restaurant in the world by Condé Nast Traveller magazine. Its cliffside terrace offers breathtaking views of the Adriatic and the fortresses of Lovrijenac and Bokar.

Nautika specializes in seafood dishes that are specific to the Dalmatian coast. There were lots of enticing dishes to choose from on the menu. We started with the scallops and the trio of seafood delicacies.

Both dishes were beautifully presented. The scallops were served with potato and kale cakes; a nice combination of flavors. Of the trio of fresh Dalmatian delicacies – tuna tartare, lobster and sea urchin meat, and prawns – the prawns were the most interesting. They were perfectly poached and served on a bed of fresh cucumber and cheese. The cucumber added crunch and the cheese offered a creamy, sharp taste to the prawns, which had been marinated in olive oil, white wine and lemon.

For our main courses, we shared the sea bass and the lobster tail pasta. The sweet tender lobster atop perfectly cooked homemade pasta was a nice dish. But the sea bass was outstanding. The sweet acidic preparation perfectly complimented the tender fish and its crispy skin.

Our first dinner in Croatia ended with a sweet finish – a yummy "chocolate square" dessert!

Really good professional staff
Weather wasn't great so inside dining but food was great as was choice of wines. Make sure you check with waiters for something you like and don't be afraid to ask the price. They have some really high end wines that could hurt the budget but also great wine at about €40
Had the 7 course tasting menu. Portion size just right. 
As with other reviews it's on the high end price wise but highly recommend. Booking advisable in higher season

This is one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik, and right on the main square just outside the western gate to the walled city. The interior is beautiful and atmospheric, but almost everyone eats on the terrace in back, weather permitting. You can look right at the Fort St. Lawrence and other parts of the wall, as well as the Adriatic Sea. It is quite romantic except there are a lot of tables on the terrace, so it isn't private at all unless no one else is there.

The food is among the best in the city. It specializes in fish and seafood (hence the name), but meat dishes are just as good, so consider this if your party has a mix of fish and meat lovers. The portions are small as this is nouveau cousine. I had sea bass and it was cooked perfectly but very simply. Deserts were very good. Service was very polished and attentive. It is expensive, but worth it.

Had the absolute pleasure to be the first guests of Nautika's 2017 season! Have read many reviews and do not normally spend this much on dinner while vacationing. I'm certainly glad I decided to do so here. 
The food was fabulous! The olive oil pairing was unique and wonderful. 
Had the scallops with Truffles from the hot appetizer menu and it was delicious ! My friend had the Shrimp Risotto, also very good. 
For entrees we had the lobster with pasta and filet mignon. Both delicious. The chef is brilliant!
I read that the food was average and the portions small. Totally disagree!
For dessert we had a bartender special- wow!!! Vanilla ice cream with sliced baby pears, accompanied by a teapot full of zacaba rum and Tia Maria! A bit strong for a non drinker like me but luscious. We finished our night with the very talked about, Gin and Tonic. 
Sooo Special. I won't spoil the surprise but definitely have one. 
The atmosphere , service and friendliness was nothing short of impeccable. Mr Marco , the 
Maitre d ; our waiter, Vinco, and his young asst. were the best! Professional, efficient and friendly. 
Don't worry about the cold. Reserve a terrace table. There are portable heaters and plush blankets to keep you warm while admiring the best views in Dubrovnik. If you are there early, you may even be serenaded by the swallows. 
A most memorable high point of our visit to Croatia. 
A special thank you to Ms Anita for communicating with me via email prior to our arrival and Mr Marco for making our night so special
Puno vam hvala

We just finished our dinner at Nautika, and it was honestly on the top of our list of dining experiences EVER! 

My husband and I work in travel for a living, so we've been so many places and so many countries. (And have eaten in SO many restaurants!) 

Nautika was right up there with the best. 
The ambiance, service, and food are unbeatable. The view alone is simply spectacular.
Every dish was meticulously created to be something truly special. 
It's rather pricey, but we felt it was well worth every penny. 

(We had two glasses of wine, mineral water, shrimp soup, two warm appetizers (scallops and shrimp risotto), two entrees (veal and lobster), and a shared dessert (yummy orange cake specialty). Our total bill was 1600 kuna, which is about $230 US, not including tip.)

Like most restaurants in this caliber, the portions could be a bit larger. (My husband likes to eat.) But this by no means takes away from the overall experience. (If you arrive hungry, order an appetizer along with your entree.) Plus, you get bread included, with a variety of award-winning olive oils.)
 
Make reservations! We reserved a table on the outside terrace. 

Highly recommended - we will definitely be back, and we'll tell our friends and family about this amazing restaurant.
Another fine restaurant I visited during my stay in Dubrovnik last year. Great service, great food, perfect location, excellent view on fortress Lovrenjac and old city. Must visit place.

This is one of the famous restaurant in Dubrovnik with exceptional terace and even better view on the Old Town. You should be ready to pay for it but this restaurant is in the same range as similar restaurants in Paris or New York.

Had a fabulous dining experience here for my birthday in October .Location great, food awesome and service exceptional - they couldn't do enough for us. Wine choice extensive and amazing quality. Best dining experience in Dubrovnik by far.

Loved the place, spectacular view. Had a wonderful experience and loved the concept of the olive oil pairing. Had an awesome gin and tonic before dinner. Dinner was spectacular, I had the meat and my partner the fish. The appetizers were also super good. Worth a visit, reservations are required

It is like many Michelin Starred restaurant, small portions but tasty food. Servicw was also nice. Best thing was the view of the place. Recommend to book a table outside and feel the history. Especially Game of Thrones lovers gonna love!

Our tour group had the final dinner at Nautica, and we were not disappointed. It was enchanted with the views of the mediteranean sea and ancient city wall with towers. The food was wonderful. I would highly recommend this as a special dinner while exploring the marvelous city of Dubrovnik. Heart breaking that in the 1990s stupidity and greed waged a war on this place which destroyed a lot of the ancient buildings. THey re-built, but scars still can be felt.

I am so glad my wife and I went here - the food was outstanding!! The service, the staff, and the view were excellent, which made for a outstanding meal.
