It's very rare that things go this good, but I can't say enough about the people here. The staff helped with the selction of food to the wine we drink. I would recommend getting a reservation a head of time so you can get the tables with the ocean and fort view. I would suggest, making your reservation around sunset so you can see the evening chance - it's spectacular to watch the sunset and than watch the fort light up etc... just a wonderful spot. It's expensive, but well worth every penny!

This place offers sort amazing panoramic terraces. The food here is great serving amazing seafood using locally sourced ingredients, the Fishermans Carpaccio is delicious and as are the lobster medallions.
Had a lovely dinner overlooking the Adriatic at this romantic spot. Beautiful food, very nice wine service. Piano music too-many places seem to have a piano player and we enjoyed it.

Very difficult to get a table. It is essential to get a table on the terrace overlooking the Old City. Some of the others are a bit close to the road and bus stops. The restaurant is very good and the service impeccable, but it does come at a price. This was the most expensive meal we had in Croatia but was also probably the best. I was particularly impressed by the aperitif. Having discussed the properties of the various gins they have I was supplied with Gin Mare garnished with a sprig of rosemary and a basil leaf. Was, perhaps, the best G&T ever. The food is small in portion but big in flavour, and we enjoyed the meal and the ambience. The restaurant was voted by Conde Nast as the "Sixth most romantic restaurant in the World". Not sure where numbers one to five are but this one is pretty atmospheric. But you have to get the right seats!

My wife and I were honeymooning in Dubrovnik in 2015. So we wanted to pick an upscale restaurant to have our first dinner there. 

I made the reservations online a few weeks prior to our trip. that was a plus because i am big on planning before hand. The location of the restaurant is right in front of the old city entrance. It cant be missed.

The views of the walled city were amazing! literally some of the best in the city. If you do eat there, make sure you plan on sunset. 

Our meal set us back about 120 dollars (including wine and desert). Since I am from the US, this wasnt to much of a big deal. A similar restaurant in the states would cost us about 150+. 

The food was okay but not great. nothing special really. I cant recall what i ordered but i remember the serving sizes being small. 

I manger of the place was very nice and offered us some free samples that the chef was working on.

Overall i rate this place as 'very good' because of the views, professionalism and ambiance. The food was okay.
Between the views, the service, the creative menu, and the piano man in the bar, this is the perfect place to spend a relaxing evening over fine food

End of October but superb weather so we sat outside on their terrace overlooking the city walls and the Adriatic - it really is just like the pictures! Food was superb. Shrimp soup and scallops to start then we both had the lobster with homemade pasta, beans tomato in a fabby fish stock. Michelin standard food (mind you at £48 it should be). Watch the drink - v expensive - glass of good champagne (£22) and fancy g&t (£15) pushed the bill with one bottle of wine up to £240. But you get what you pay for - finest dining in an exquisite setting.

Title says it all. But pay enough for decent local wine. The Nautika is for couples and not a young person's menu. Next to it is Dubravska which was excellent for the youger ones as well (they ar 12 and 22)

We were seated outside with amazing views of the Lovrjenac Fortress and City Walls (Kings Landing for Game of Thrones Fans). This is proper fine dining (and prices to match) with excellent service and the sea food dishes all met expectations using high quality fresh ingredients (be warned the lobster tail dish is not a lot of fish but although expensive you can pay a lot more in Dubrovnik).

My wife and I were touring Croatia with 43 others and Dubrovnik was one of key highlights of our tour. We had researched on Tripadvisor for the places to eat in Dubrovnik and Nautika Restaurant came out tops in the 'fine dining' category. We also had a long list of restaurants that we we wanted to try out. Funny enough and by chance, our tour bus stopped us right in front of Nautika Restaurant where we started our short walking tour of the Bokar Fortress in the afternoon. What luck! We managed to reserve a table for two for dinner on the same day. We requested for a table at the patio with a sea view and a view of Lovrjenac Fort (St. Lawrence Fort). Very friendly service and courteous restaurant staff from the start (when we first made the table reservation). 

The meal we had was absolutely 'five-star' and the view from the patio was something out of a travel magazine. We shared a 5-course meal of Tuna Tartare, Fish Soup, Large Shrimp on Polenta, Sea Bass Fillet and Fruit&Chocolate Desert, with a separate order of Adriatic scallops (as a starter) and a lobster tail (as a main). More than enough for us. There is a 7-course meal (for an extra USD10 or thereabouts) if you're hungry or keen to try more, and don't want to bother too much with the a la carte items. Everything turned out perfectly prepared and the attending waiter was very friendly and informative about the food and the different types of accompanying olive oils that were presented to us. The restaurant manager was equally courteous and was very receptive. When I asked about our 'not-so-inconvenient' wait for our mains, he apologised, gave us complimentary 'top-ups' on the pouring house white, and explained that they did not want to 'rush' us on our romantic dinner. Then our mains came within 2 minutes. Now that's a good recovery! Dinner took close to 2-3 hours. A tad long perhaps, but the quality of the food, service and the fantastic view from the patio made it all worthwhile. Will I come back to this restaurant when I visit Dubrovnik, Crotia? I'll come back to Dubrovnik because of this restaurant!

Four and half stars for the meal we enjoyed on the outdoor patio at Nautika. The food was terrific - the kitchen knows how to handle both beef and seafood, and the flavors were divine. Our waiter was excellent and recommended/brought several nice wines and olive oils! for every course we ate. Throughout the meal the staff was attentive and we felt very taken care of. Pricey - absolutely!! but well worth its given the locale and the service. Sometimes you just have to indulge.

We ate dinner here, overlooking the sea, fort and the old town walls. Service was excellent. We ate fish as starters and mains with the seabass served as very tasty. The waiter recommended a nice Croatian white wine which went well. Overall, very good. It is pricey, even by European standards, but top food at such locations does drive this economic reality.

All the reviews I have read echo our experience.
We celebrated our 32 nd wedding anniversary here and what a fantastic setting.
The service and staff attention was amazing , their knowledge was first class and the food matched everything.
It was the most expensive meal we have had for a long while but it was all worth it , the memories will last for a long time .

This restaurant deserves to charge the prices on the menu. Everything you want in a night out is done to perfection. The food is stunning - both the carnivore and the pescatarian left very satisfied - the setting is beautiful and the staff were the perfect balance of attentive but discrete. For a special occasion or simply a night to remember, it would be very hard to beat
What a super restaurant. It's really beautiful and the food is amazing. Yes it's is expensive but chalk it down to one of those really special occasions

We ended our trip to Dubrovnik in this restaurant after reading other trip advisor reviews. Thank you to everyone who already reviewed because we had a perfect time here. We had first class views and were made extremely welcome. The local fizzy was as good as any champagne, the carpaccio was delicious as were the lamb chops. All the staff were attentive and knowledgable. It really was a gourmet evening and if we weren't already married I'd recommend as a perfect place for a proposal! Thank you Anita for sorting the table. Book in advance is my tip! A perfect evening.
Lovely located restaurant, London prices but amazing food (!!!) beef it's a heaven in a mouth <3 best restaurant in Dubrovnik for sure !!!

A first class restaurant but at high end prices. Sommelier, waiters and commis waiters. Piano live. Romantic position overlooking sea. All excellent nouvelle cuisine which does come at a price as does the wine but worth it if your budget can be stretched to probably three times the local average. Quality!!!!! :-)

Really enjoyed our meal. Was pricey but we expected that and felt the price was fair for what we had. We had a whole salt baked fish which was amazing. We ordered g&t and they asked if they could make it special which we accepted. Won't ruin the surprise for others but was pretty cool.

Booked for my boyfriends birthday meal, and so glad I did my research and booked this restaurant. it was faultless. Darko was an outstanding waiter so friendly and knowledgeable, funny man and so glad he was our waiter for the evening. The whole evening was amazing from the food, drinks and the views are breathe taking. Yes it is expensive and yes the portions aren't huge but the food does all the talking! The lobster tail pasta was beautiful with two huge pieces of lobster my boyfriend had the veal (which he love and orders at every opportunity) he said it was out of this world and melted when he tried to cut through it. being that we went at a slightly colder time of year, the restaurant provide heater for every table, and blankets for every person should you need them. if you want a beautiful meal in a stunning location and are willing to pay the price for a meal like this make sure you go here!

Perched on a cliff just outside the walled city of Dubrovnik, Nautika offers excellent food. We ate on the terrace and watched the sun set over the sea as the lights began to illuminate the city. Our food was excellent with a fairly straightforward presentation. The staff was solicitous; when the temperature dropped, they offered blankets. Because of a computer glitch (those things happen to all of us), our dessert took quite a while to arrive. The manager brought the dessert together with his apology and a complimentary drink. Highly recommend dining here.

We ate here recently whilst on holiday in this wonderful place. We had been recommended to book a restaurant overlooking the walls and in error booked here instead of the recommendation! it was a rather lucky error. What a place this is from the beautiful hostess at the entrance to all the charming waiting staff. The menu isnt extensive and actually my OH chose 2 starters as he preferred them to anything on the entree list- personal preference. All the food was amazing and the whole experience is one we shall never forget. The price tag is one which reflects the food, location and overall quality.

We made a reservation online about a week in advance of our arrival. We were told we could have a seaside table if we booked half an hour later so we did that. It was perhaps the most romantic meal we've ever experienced. A number of lanterns with candles are perched along the wall and the sound of the water, especially when boats go by, and the lights on the nearby forts add to the ambiance.

The setting was spectacular, the service was first rate, and the food was incredible. While this is an expensive restaurant, we found it worth the money. They provide blankets for the patrons if you wish them, although we found we did not need them. They also have heaters on the patio for each table if you prefer to have them on (we didn't but our nearest neighbours did and we unfortunately found the bright red glow from theirs took away from our ambience. Eventually we asked our servers to redirect the light away from us which helped).

Our meal started with breads and 5 types of olive oil to try. We also got a seafood amuse bouche which was also excellent. I ordered the sea bass, which was amazing. We also ordered a bottle of Grgich Posip, which was so good we had to find a wine store to get some more to bring home to Canada with us.

For dessert I ordered the chocolate fantasy square topped with fresh figs. Also delicious!

Thanks to Nautika for this memorable experience on our Croatia trip, in honour of our 35th anniversary

Lovely location, fabulous service and excellent good. Would highly recommend the taster menu and the signature gin and tonic! 

We booked for the 9.30pm sitting and arrived early they could not have been more welcoming and accommodating. 
Thank you for a memorable evening.
The food was so good! we got a sample of a lot of dished and shared all 5 of us enjoyed the combination of food. Would love to go back!

We dined here as a couple in June 2016. 

We booked online well in advance and had a wonderful table on the first level with a view out to the water. The restaurant is clearly very service orientated and this shows. Everyone we encountered was so passionate and seemed genuinely proud to be working there. This made the meal so much more enjoyable and set it apart from other restaurants we had visited in Dubrovnik, where we'd been disappointed. 

Needless to say, the food was wonderful. Get the shrimp risotto to start. It is unmissable. The lamb and lobster mains are also very good. Have whatever wine they suggest -- it is bound to be good. 

This is an expensive meal but it is so worth it. Go at sunset. 

I cannot recommend it highly enough.

We booked this restaurant on short notice so obviously we got a "bad table", it was a good table actually, but no view. 

The cuisine here is mediterranian. Quite a large menu for a "fine dining" restaurant. The food was very good. 

The service was polite, friendly and informative. 

Highly recommended, but expensive.

Fabulous food, great location and excellent service, we had a very enjoyable evening on the terrace and even witnessed a marriage proposal, not surprised as it is a very romantic restaurant. Best to arrive before sunset to experience the ambiance fully.

Important disclaimer, this is an expensive place.

But the food is excellent as well as the service and setting which at the end makes it a great experience.

If you are looking to celebrate a special occasion this is a great choice.

Rated as one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik, we were looking forward to our visit and we were not disappointed. You need to book in advance, especially if you want a table on the terrace overlooking the cove. The food is well presented and tasty with a strong fish bias, service is excellent and our waiter was extremely helpful, explaining the menu and the wine list, which contained a large selection of local wines. Croatian wine is of a very good quality, production is on a small scale, so not much is exported, as with all things in life, quality does not come cheap, expect to pay £25+ in restaurants. If you are on a budget, Nautika may be the treat of your holiday, as prices reflect the high standards, however compared to London or Paris they are quite reasonable.
At the end of our meal, we were treated to a complimentary local liquor with our coffee. It may be pricey but it was worth it, just treat yourself.

One of the best in Croatia! We came here on our last night in Dubrovnik...saving the best for last.

We came with our good friends and travel buddies totalling 8 people. We arrived an hour early than our reservation and wanted to take more pictures of the Old City. So the Manager offered to check our bags so we won't have to carry all the bags with us when we walked around. Came back later and were seated upstairs on the terrace. Order different dishes to enjoy:
Vegetable Cream Soup
Squid Salad
Warm Foie Gras
Truffle Pasta
Sea Bass Filet
Beef Filet
Lamb Chop
Chef started with a Carrot Panna Cotta. Everything was delicious! The food is definitely up there at Michelin standard! Dubrovnik being our last stop in Croatia, and we've been to all the best restaurants in other parts of Croatia. I have to say this was the best we've had on this trip! Everything from food, beautiful view and service, was perfect! Will definitely be back next time we're in town!

Called in without booking and managed to get a table right at the front over looking the bay and the fort. The meal was delicious and service fantastic but you would expect that for the prices. I had Adriatic Scallops on crushed potato served with shavings of black truffle followed by Tuna coated in parsley. My partner had vegetables soup followed also by the Tuna steak. We both had very tasty desserts, I had Fruit & Chocolate Fantasy whilst my partner had the Parfait 

Each course was accompanied with a different award winning regional olive oil.

Images are red as we were sat near a heat lamp

I can highly recommend for a special meal. Our bill came to 1477kn (approx £147) which included a nice bottle of Prosecco

The view here is spectacular. Go earlier to catch the sunset while relaxing over a glass of wine. 

Service is excellent as it is a fine dining restaurant. However, it is going to sting your pockets. 

I came here for my wife's birthday and she loved it.

What a fantastic restaurant. The food is absolutely gorgeous. The setting is incredible and the staff are the most polite restaurant staff that I have ever come across. 
It's a little pricey but perfect for a special occasion.

Visit Nautika! Not only does it offer delicious food, but the staff really want you to enjoy your time there and makes you feel so welcome. 

My husband and I had the best time there. Our waiter was so passionate about the restaurant and really wanted to know our thoughts on the food, olive oil and wine. 

The balcony views are perfect for an evening dinner. They offer heat lamps and blankets for comfort. The restaurant wants to take every opportunity to improve and really wants customer feedback. We were asked about which of the flight of 5 regional olive oils were our favorite (the truffle infused one had an unfair advantage here) and were also polled for our favorite dish of the night. We loved the veal dish. 

If you want a romantic dinner with a view, I'd recommend this place. After all, this place was recommended by a friend and I'd continue to do the same. If you are asked to pick a "grappa," the Walnut was perfect! :)

We were seated even though we didn't have the reservation. The service was excellent, the food even better. This restaurant is not inexpensive, but every penny is well spent. The pity was that we were in a hurry to get to the Dubrovnik Summer Festival performance and could not take our time and fully enjoy this restaurant. The best of all is the location, next to the small bay near the Pile gate with the fantastic view of the Lovrijenac and Bokar towers. Strongly recommended!

We dined at Nautika on the first night of our holiday and it was wonderful. The location is amazing, overlooking the water right at the entrance to the old town. The service was brilliant, really good, as was the food. I really couldn't find fault. Their house G&T - a surprise Tanqueray & Tonic was also great. It set our holiday off to a very special start.
Great service, great location, mini portions of average food, at best. The total cost per person with taxes €140. Beyond expensive and fine dining it is not. Save your money, and dine elsewhere.

Absolutely spot on . Several restaurants advertise fine dining excellence in Dubrovnik , but we have only experienced one that lives up to reputation & Nautika is it.
Impeccable service - so knowledgeable but also so passionate about their country's provenance in food &'wines 
 There are other fine dining restaurants available but this is the only only one that lives up to its name .
Nautika is second to none 
Worth while having coffee/ tea for the handmade chocs .
Our best dining experience ever & we have dined at some of the best & would recommend .
We booked 1 week in advance for a table onthe terrace & this was well worth it so suggest you if you want aDining experience Excellence then book it's- more expensive than the norm but we thought to was well worth the extra

Enjoyed the most amazing meal here on ourmlast night innDubrovnik. The restaurant is in a great location just outside the Pile Gate. From the moment you are seated the staff are focused on giving great service. The sommelier was very helpful with wine choices. The food when served was piping hot and really tasty. We chose lobster tails with hand made pasta. It was light, flavoursome and the right portion size. Dessert of Carob cake was equally delicious.

We had a fantastic evening at Nautika Restaurant! Not only was the food outstanding, but the service was off-the-charts! Everyone we interacted with was gracious, welcoming and just lovely! And there is no way to adequately describe the stunning location - with crashing waves below you, the walls of the Old City lit to your left, and the hulking Lovrijenac Fortress shining on your right. 

From the starting cocktail and amuse-bouche to dessert and glass of port, every sip and bite was delectable. The wine list is extensive and contains many well-curated Croatian wines. Thankfully, all of the 8 head waiters and the maître d' are well-trained somelliers and ours selected the perfect one for us. The menu changes and there is something for every taste. They will also gladly customize any dish. (I don't like fish and was worried when I looked at the menu outside the restaurant. But I was exceedingly pleased with my waiter's suggestions.) And each course was served with a different custom Croatian olive oil which was also explained by the waiter. One won the international Grand Prize last year. After dinner, we were offered a tour of the restaurant and wine cellar. Although we sat on the upper terrace, the restaurant is also very beautiful and offers private dining rooms as well. 

Other than "trust your waiter", my only other recommendation is a big one: Make reservations in advance so that you can request a table on the front row of the terrace. 

Thank you to the entire staff of Nautika for a perfect dinner in Dubrovnik. We will never forget this evening.

We have really enjoyed our dinner in the Nautika restaurant. We had the fresh fish of the day and it was amazing. Yes it's maybe more expensive than others restaurants but it's completely worth it. Perfect food, perfect location and top service. You will not be disappointed. We had such a lovely time there. We would like to thank our waiter who made this dinner even more enjoyable. If you want to have a great dining experience, go there.

Had the best meal of my holiday here. They do a prawn tail risotto starter which is one of the most delicious dishes I have ever tasted. It is also a huge portion - have it with a salad as a main. The staff here are lovely and all of the food is good. They also gave us a delicious pear liqueur after our meal. I can highly recommend this restaurant
Unfortunately it was a rainy night so we ate indoors and were unable to enjoy the view. The food was incredible. The chef was very accommodating to my dietary requirements.
The atmosphere and the views are great. The food was excellent. My only criticism is the price of the meal. London prices in Croatia.

The food was amazing! We had 7 courses, slightly over our budget but definitely worth it for the quality of the food and the location was fantastic. Quite a pretentious restaurant and definitely suited to the upper classes! However very happy with the service and food quality. Would highly recommend!
Perfect service, great ambiance and excellent food. Beautiful view on sunset. Extra service with heatinglamps and blankets. Food was very tastfull and wine was top choice. We had a superb evening.

Booked a month in advance to get a terrace table but unfortunately we were only able to get a second tier table. Apparently to get the front tier requires 3 months notice. I have waited before giving this review until after we ate at another top restaurant in Dubrovnik and so I can say that the food we had at nautica was the best we had in Dubrovnik as was the service. I would also like to thank the waiters for moving us to the terrace when another couple had finished. All in all a very special meal.

Booked this restaurant a month in advance for an outside table with seaview and the night we dined it poured down with rain !!
We were given a lovely table inside the restaurant and we decided to try the 5 courses tasting menu. The food was excellent ,especially the tuna tartare and sea bass dish. 
Our waiter for the evening was excellent ..... each course was served with a drizzle of different olive oils to compliment each dish.
We had a wonderful evening here . I would highly recommend this restaurant .
You can eat the same food for less money. You pay the view not food. Location is good, stuff is ok..but try something else
The location is great just outside pile gate. The view is fantastic. But too expensive limited menu. More hyped.

Be sure to book early and ask for a table on the side terrace where you'll find yourself looking out across the Mediterranean with the walls of the old city on one side and an ancient fort on the other. A really great setting in which to eat excellent food well served by very efficient waiters. The menu offers a wide choice accompanied by an excellent wine list.
We were fortunate that one of the waiters gave us a conducted tour of the inside of the building which was originally a sailing school making a really nice ending to a memorable evening.

Nautica is a fabulous restaurant by the sea just outside the Pile Gate and old town of Dubrovnic 
The area appears to be very hectic but once you are seated in this very pretty restaurant at your table by the water it is a calm and wonderful place for a romantic dinner.
We would recommend booking at least one or two days before for the best tables. 
Both the food and service were exceptional 
We chose the fillet steak with celery crisps on a bed of gnocchi with a delicious sauce and a glass of Merlot with chocolates to finish.
All very enjoyable

Dining as a single person is often a challenge. When I approached the hostesses they were both gracious and accommodating and showed me to a table, explaining that they were fully booked. If you wish to be seated closer to the water and the walls, make a reservation! Once seated, the wait staff was somewhat surly and dismissive--I was in jeans and an overworked T-shirt. I was presented with the menu and wine list. The menu is short, featuring a limited choice but highlighting two separate tasting menus. I asked for the apertif menu and ordered one. The attitude of the wait staff changed. For starters I had the Carpaccio Charlais, garnished with caviar and thin slices of Parmesian cheese. The combination was delightful, but the beef was a bit chewy. I followed that with the tuna fillet, which was accompanied by an ingenious spaghetti cum zucchini thinly julienned and intricately intertwined served chilled. I ended the meal with the fantasy fruit chocolate, which consisted of a chocolate shell filled with custard and a medley of fresh fruit. The wine list is extensive in the extreme but dining alone I ordered my wine by the glass. I must admit the plating of the dishes was superb and visually attractive, and each course was brought to the table on a silver tray by a junior and then served by a senior. If you suffer from sticker shock, this is not the place for you.

With it's breathtaking view onto the Pile bay, the mere location of this restaurant is worth checking it out. The waiters will all do anything to be as helpful and nice as possible and the dishes are succulent. Of course all this has a price but we were surprised to pay 150€ for 2 as we had one aperitif, two glasses of wine, a bottle of water, the shrimp risotto, the homemade fish soup, the lobster tail (50€), a dessert, and one rakija. 150€ didn't seem over the top given the quality of the food and service we were provided.

Booked here several weeks before Holiday by e mail to request a good table for our anniversary.We were not disappointed booked the 9.30 time slot to ensure good spot overlooking " King's Landing ". The food was good and Service excellent

Was treated to wonderful view from out terrance table from which we could watch the sunset over the ocean. Great choice of cuisine and wine, which our waiter Evan was amazingly helpful in describing each dish and recommending wine with our meal. Would highly recommend the veal for main choice. Beautiful panio music been played live inside the restaurant. This place is a must visit worth every penny. Looking forward to coming back. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

If you are looking for a truly fine dining experience in Dubrovnik, this is the place. The location is wonderful (on the water), the food is very good, and the service is impeccable. Shrimp soup, fish soup, sea bass, and even lamb were all very good. The wine list is excellent. Prices are higher than most other restaurants in the city but it is worth it.

Absolutely impeccable food, beautifully presented beautiful service, went for my boyfriends birthday on our last night here in Dubrovnik and I am so glad it was the restaurant I picked. Could not fault. Yes a bit expensive but so worth it for what it is ! You'd get less for your money in London thats for sure !

We visited on Sunday 28 August and booked a table for 9.30 to secure a front row table. The welcome, waiting lounge with live music and while experience were stunning. As an aperitif ask for the "special" G&T. Wonderful presentation and taste. Another fantastic experience in Dubrovnik.
Lovely setting for evening dinner. The staff were wonderful and the food was excellent. For the best view of the evening ask for a table on the terrace overlooking the water.

Great restaurant at a great location. The setting was beautiful especially as it was sunset. Staff was extremely accomodating on the busiest night even though we hadn't had a reservation. The food was tasteful and the atmosphere was perfect. Live pianist added made it that much more special. Expect to pay higher prices but worth it for the atmosphere, service and level of food

Just outside of the Pile Gate in the new town area, Nautika has a great view of the sea. Its a pricey restaurant and limited menu choice, but we enjoyed both the starters and main course, really delicious food. Nice service as you would expect. we got one of the few table for two under the exterior window-boxed windows. Great for people watching in this lively area.

My husband & I visited on our last night in Dubrovnik. We didn't have reservations but were accommodated on the upper level terrace, which was tres chic with excellent views & very romantic. The awesome service was notable from our first entrance.

The wine list is world class & features wines from many regions around the world. 

Our server was Ivan. He was wonderful & offered wonderful pairings with our meal.

We ordered:
Shrimps w. Polenta - good selection
Scallops- excellent selection
Sea bass-good selection. Great crispy skin
Lamb chops-great selection

Overall we were satisfied. We ordered 2 starters, 2 mains, 3 glasses of wine, Jameson on the rocks, water, and ginger ale. The bill was $240. Pricey, even by NYC standards. 

I would recommend, particularly for a special occasion. You won't be disappointed.

Location: Outside the main gate of Dubrovnik. Overlooking a rampart and the ocean. 

Facility: multi story building with multiple levels for dinner but outside is where everyone eats in the summer. Inside is well air conditioned. The facility was completely remodeled in 2015 and is beautiful and classic. White tablecloth service. 

Service: 100% professional. English speaking. 

Food: I have to recommend the appetizer tagliatelle with the truffle..........WOW.....I could eat it for every meal. My wife and I shared it but I should have made her get her own. We both agreed. 
Main courses: this is a fish eating area being on the coast but we were done with fish after 2 weeks so we went with meat. She had the steak with a gnocchi that was more like polenta but still very good. I had the veal tenderloin and both were excellent. Make sure your are specific on the temp you want the meat. My family is Croatian and they have a tendency for medium whereas we prefer rare to medium rare. 

Desert: fruit & chocolate and also a chocolate "square" which were excellent. The square is rich do be forewarned. 

Wine list: best I had seen. They also have Opus One and Petrus if you have that budget level. I went to the wine cave and storage is properly done and monitored. Side note: the waiter recommended a Plavi Mali which I have had before but it was fruit forward and too sweet so I changed and went with a cab/cab-franc/Merlot blend that was excellent. Our desert wines were great. I had an ice wine they make here and only 600 cases and it got the top award in Europe. Fantastic. 

Price: we went large so our bill was about 1600 Kuna. My wife is worth it. This is the first Restuarant to really meet USA standards.

My girlfriend and I visited Nautika and had the five course tasting menu. The table was perfect with beautiful views and the food was absolutely tremendous. All of the dishes were perfect and were served at the right pace.

We had the traditional Croatian local liquor to begin with and then a lovely bottle of white wine to accompany our meal - a very good recommendation from the waiter.

The food was also served with some gorgeous olive oils all varying in flavour and density which complimented the courses.

To finish we were offered complimentary local liquors and the one that we both loved was the Carob which we ended up buying from a shop in the old town along with a couple of bottles of the olive oil that we liked (shop near the restaurant).

All in all a fantastic place for dinner on our last night in Dubrovnik, we had to book a few days before to have the table we wanted but it as well worth the wait. 

I would recommend visiting this restaurant as you will not be disappointed as its excellent!

The restaurant is just outside the walls of the old town with great sea views. The service was faultless and very attentive and you feel very welcome there. The prices are not cheap, but the meal was worth every penny, we had the lobster tail. The manager also offered us a nice cocktail before we left, free of charge, which was very considerate ;) Would defintely return. I definitely recommend a trip to Nautika while in Dubrovnik, for an excellent dining experience.

The view from the terrace is beautiful, I couldn't stop taking photos. The service was impeccable and the food was delicious. It was a true dining experience. We sat over dinner for a few hours, never felt rushed, and everyone was very attentive. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Dubrovnik and would go back in a heartbeat.

Omg don't know how only rated #15 out of 311. There is no other experience that can lace their boots. Food, service, ambience, location the list goes on. Try this out or live your life regretting what you have missed. There is no superlative. Just do it but make sure you book it. Don't be fooled by empty tables during day time. They only open in evening.

I could not fault the service as it was very good attentive and informative. The setting is beautiful. Our dinner was superb along with the choice in wine. It is a pricey meal but the flavours in the food were divine and there is the pleasure in just experiencing the setting and atmosphere of the place. The staff made great efforts during the last four days to accommodate us with a table at the front overlooking the sea and we were well rewarded in waiting!

Found the Nautica on our second night here and after our first visit immediately booked to come again.
The terrace is the place to dine, worth waiting to get a table here.
The views are to die for, the food and service are fantastic.
Got to be the best restaurant in Dubrovnik!

Unbelievable service. They left rose petals on our table for our honeymoon, food was amazing. The staff could not have gone out of their way more. Live music, great views of the Old City walls. Probably the best all around restaurant in Dubrovnik!

What a fantastic location! Only to be matched by the amazing food, superbly matched with local wines. We were so well looked after so well after by Ivan. It was our favourite place to eat in Dubrovnik and possibly ever!! 
We were on the terrace having booked by email in March!! And we loved every moment of it! Brilliant views of the city walls and fort at night. 
Fantastic service, with great attention to detail, yet very relaxed. 
We lived the Nautika homemade Blueberry liquor.

I wish Tripadvisor had more grades above three average, maybe four good, five excellent, six - superb and seven - mind blowing. If they did this would be a seven. Why?

Well the location gets it off to a good start. Just outside the town walls with stunning views of the walls and the sea. Throughout the meal, less fortunate visitors crowded outside the restaurant to take photos. Then there were the swallows, wheeling and crying as they swept round the tower.

But of course the food is important and here the restaurant performed well. Everything was tasty and of a high standard, not only the main courses but also the bread and olive oils.

For us, wine is important and there was a comprehensive wine list.

But for any restaurant it lives or dies by its staff and we were fortunate to be served by Marco. He pushed this firmly into the seven star wow category. He is a highly qualified sommelier and relished the opportunity to talk to people interested in wine. Indeed he even took us round his cellar. If you eat here and have any interest in wine, however slight, ask for Marco's advice.

We turned up at 6 pm at the end of August when the restaurant opened and got the only available table so I would advise booking in advance. They have some tables round the corner with even better views so if you want these book well in advance.

A seven star wow experience. Thank you Marco.

I enjoyed my meal here . Waiters were excellent and menu was good . Typical fine dining experience with smaller than average portions .everything was cooked perfectly and the waiters wine recommendation went down a treat. Prices are high compared to other restaurants. Overall I would recommend as setting and service was excellent
It's a fine dining restaurant where clientele dress up in their beautiful summer dresses. There's a life music. The view is just amazing with the fort in the background. Romantic place for couple.
needed a place to rest . nice view, clean. The food was OK. you are paying for the view . check out other restaurants

The food was excellent and the service was fantastic. A little bit on the pricey side but this was positively reflected in the delicious food. Service was quick and view was spectacular. Definitely worth the visit, especially if it's for a special occasion.

This restaurant was recommended as a must go to which can sometimes not go well. However on this occasion everything was perfect. The view and location as the sun goes down is breath taking and the quality of food, wine and especially the service was top drawer. Plan ahead to secure a front row table and you wont be disappointed.

We ate at Nautika during our last night on a 10 day trip throughout Croatia. This was by far the best meal we had. I had the shrimp with polenta and my husband the beef charolais, both were very delicious. The shrimps were very tasty and the meat was cooked perfectly. Wines were also good. We had a front row seat in the terrace and enjoyed the great atmosphere and views for a few hours. Definitely a must when in Dubrovnik. Recommend to make reservations in advance if you would like a first row table.

Last night we ate at Nautical, a wonderful experience. We started with a gin and tonic and that's when the theatre began. Mine was presented in a bird cage with rose petals, my husbands was sprayed with blood orange essence. We chose to eat the 5 course tasting menu starting with tuna tartare. Each course is matched with an olive oil; an interesting Croatian twist. The food is wonderful, the staff are very attentive, a wonderful evening!

We had an outdoor table overlooking the sea. Great view. I had the sea bass. It was very good. Simply prepared with vegetables. Healthy dinner. Service was good. Overall very good experience. 

I would recommend this restaurant.

experienced an enjoyable dinner with dazzling views of the city wall. Excellent choices and full range of seafood, meat and vegetarian option. Extensive wine list with charming servers to guide and make the experience.

This restaurant was recommended to us by our local guide and being the best of the best in Dubrovnik. While this was our only dinner in Dubrovnik, I don't know how any place could be any better! Spectacular location, we had a superb table on the upstairs patio. The food was Michelin-starred quality. Although more expensive than other restaurants along the Dalmatian Coast, we can understand why and it was worth every penny! If we had had another night in Dubrovnik, we would have repeated.

My friends and I had been traveling through Europe for seven weeks by this point, needless to say that we’ve eaten in an assortment of places. This was by far the best meal of trip for me by far! Everything was wonderful and personal. The views of the city walls weren’t too bad either. I would have eaten at this restaurant every night if we had stayed longer. The wait staff was so attentive and gave all the right suggestions. I had the tuna and my fiancé had the filet. Of the two dishes the filet was the better in my opinion. Do yourself a favor and eat here!

What an excellent restaurant. We had a front row seat overlooking the sea and spent a lovely couple of hours enjoying some absolutely delicious food and perfect service. It's not the cheapest place to eat, but certainly the best we had in Dubrovnik. I would highly recommend that you book early and ask for a front row seat - you will not be disappointed.
I took my fiancé out for a romantic dinner. We both were really impressed by the superb service and the good food. I highly recommend it for people who enjoy quality food with a superb view

Went there by walk in service and had the best seat in the city. Wow what a view! Sun setting with kayaker a paddling back to shore. The prawn and goats cheese starter is amazing. Had fresh fish too, beautifully displayed and filleted once cooked by the waiters. The service was phenomenal - educational in culture and food, and all with a smile. Couldn't recommend anywhere better than here if you're looking for a tasty dinner with brilliant views

We've been for the first time in Dubrovnik this summer and after reading numerous reviews about places for having a nice diner in town, we chose Nautika restaurant, of course afterwards we've been in many other places, that's why we talk about this place in comparison with others that we've had visited and been considered good ones, for those who sick real good food in the most sceneric spot of Dubrovnik with exemplary services and ohhhh the pianist playing in background of the restaurant make's the place TOP one by far! 
Was a windy evening and there was blankets provided to all of us who requested, we ordered different starters as we wanted to make degustation of their menu, was divine, absolutely everything was delicious!

My girlfriend made a reservation for a table on the terrace a month in advance and it was absolutely worth it. We have never had better service and the food was incredible! Our server was attentive, had great recommendations and made the experience even more special. They served several different olive oils to pair perfectly with each of the dishes, we chose to go with the special which was white fish and was to die for and the view..unlike anything we’ve ever experienced. It was like we were sitting on a movie set for our entire meal. We got to enjoy several hours of a breathtaking view, dinner and dessert without being rushed (despite another reservation coming in). I would recommend this restaurant in a heartbeat. We loved it!

We came for our 25th wedding anniversary dinner-so we were already in a good mood. We booked a few days before to get a balcony table overlooking the harbour. I doubt you could find a more romantic spot.

We splashed out on the 7 course taster menu (£100 each). It was worth every penny, the tastes were sublime and the mix of courses superb (Think Fat Duck quality for UK foodies).

The service was attentive and appropriate, the courtesy of the staff very high.

I cannot over emphasise how good this visit was.

We're back in Dubrovnic next year and this is a must visit for us.

Beautiful venue with helpful and well trained staff. I went there with three friends for my birthday dinner and sat out front. Setting was stunning. Two of us ordered the seven course tasting menu whilst two ordered a variety of other dishes. Whilst the food was really good, I wouldn't extend that to great - which is what I was expecting. Also, the three bottles of wine we ordered after seeking advice for each, only one was 'nice'. Despite a pleasant evening I left a little underwhelmed and some €550 poorer.

Not a cheap restaurant, but the food and wine were absolutely delicious. We hadn't booked in enough time to get a table looking over the sea, which was a shame - would recommend being more organised than we were! Our seats were still good and looked onto a sweet square. The staff were super friendly and it felt like a really special place.

The food was delicious and the setting overlooking the water was lovely. On the whole, staff were attentive but occasionally we had do things ourselves (topping up wine or water). Would recommend a table on the terrace, away from all the crowds. A great restaurant in Dubrovnik for food but comes at a price!

I love great food. I have also been privileged to travel a lot and eat in great places. Dubrovnik and Nautica is among the great places to eat worldwide. The ambiance and service is top. The food was truly amazing. The ingredients make all the difference. What really stands out is the quality and quantity of the truffle, the olive oil and seafood. The wine was also a very pleasant surprise.
Some additional comments. I didn't like the dessert so they didn't charge for it and suggested a different dessert that I loved. Also, the suggestions for the wine (even insisting that I chose a different wine) were excellent.

Surprised that this restaurant isn't ranked higher on TripAdvisor. The set menu is expensive, but is an incredible experience. Wine pairings show off the amazing Croatian wine that very few people ever get to experience. Incredible setting on the water near the castle.

Perfect restaurant. For me it was a special day cause I aaked my girlfriend if she want to marry me. The personel knows about my plan and all together it was supurb. Nice, love, chique and a super view. Thanks a lot for this happening.
Very nice restaurant with an amazing view. Waiters are super nice and dishes are awful. I'd recommend it

This was the best meal of our holiday in Croatia. The setting is stunning, the service is faultless and the food is amazing. We had the seven course tasting menu, accompanied by wine pairing. It was a real treat.... Absolutely loved it. Sure it's a little pricey in comparison to other meals we've had in Croatia, but cheap in comparison to what we would pay for this quality of meal in the UK.

We were extremely excited to visit Nautika as we had read some great reviews. It exceeded every expectation we had. The staff were attentive, but not overly - they had the perfect balance. The food was fantastic, in fact, it was the best meal we had during our two week stay in Croatia! The views from our table were spectacular. It was one of the more expensive meals, but without a doubt, worth every penny! Highly recommended!

Chosen by many Famous people including Pope John Paul II, Roger Moore, Novak Đjoković, Eva Longorija, Goldie Hawn, Kurt Russell, the Prince and Princess Akishino of Japan and the king and queen of Norway! when you step out onto the balcony you immediately realise why, the setting is stunning, one of the most romantic and majestic locations in the World, between the walled coastal City of Dubrovnik and one of its' adjacent Fortresses. The meal itself did not disappoint, We had the amazingly tasty Shrimp soup to start and quite possibly the Best Steak any of the 4 of us have tasted in our lives. 

After asking for a bottle of Pošip Stina (voted Croatia's Number 1 Wine in 2015), we decided to go with the recommendation of our colourful waiter, who was quite excited and animated in his tale of the fabulous Grk white wine, one of Croatia's oldest wines produced on the Island of Korčula (reputed birthplace of Marco Polo), it didn't disappoint and is absolutely delicious, only 30,000 bottles are produced each year so if you get the chance to try it I would highly recommend it.

Nautika is now firmly planted in our Top 3 restaurants on the Adriatic, we will definitely be back.

Having read previous reviews on TripAdvisor decided to splash out on a top quality dinner. Was not disappointed. Service from Thomaslav was excellent and food was exquisite. Mr Michelin needs to visit here an award them a star!

We just walked upon this place and thought "wow!" We had no reservation, but had to give it a try. I want to personally thank the hostess. She worked on the evening of Thursday, July 14th. I forgot her name but she had straight dark hair and helped us get great seats. She also helped my mom who is 73 and going blind to the bathroom, my mom loved her! The waiter was Peter, he was smooth and professional, a class act. We loved the view (Game of Thrones, too), and the food was delecious. We had an app that was similar to shrimp and grits, coupled with a local wine (Pomet), that was supurb. This experience will never be forgotten, thank you for making my 50th birthday so memorable!!

Excellent experience with drinks, food and view. Though not cheap at all. 

Manager Marko is friendly and helpful. Sommelier is very knowledgeable, if u like to explore more Croatian wine, he is the one to ask for.
Unfortunately they didn't have a table with a view available. It might be smart to go on off hours. The food was really good and super nice staff.

My dad and I ate at Nautika, and their food is to die for. The dishes are beautifully prepared, with a new and special type of olive oil for each dish. 

The setting is absolutely breath taking. I honestly have never seen anything like it, and were so lucky to get a table on the balcony looking out over the ocean and the castle. 

Also a special thanks to the waiters. They were a great part of making the experience special and were extremely tentative. 

It's a must-go-to restaurant!
We had dinner at Nautica. The waiter was great, the food was excellent and the view was amazing. This is the best restaurant in Dubrovnik.

What's not to love about this restaurant! The setting is beautiful and all staff were friendly and very professional. Our waiter was attentive and helpful with wine recommendations. I enjoyed the beef carpaccio as a starter and it's definitely the best I've ever had. The beef melted in the mouth and the small pieces of goat cheese added another dimension. My partner enjoyed his cuttlefish and pasta starter as well. We both had the lobster tail which was fresh and sweet and served on a bed of pasta and broad beans. For dessert I had a chocolate and fruit tray and he had the chocolate square. Neither were too sweet or filling. We enjoyed traditional Croatian wines on recommendation by our waiter, as well as tasting some local olive oil which was lightly poured on our meal. It was a special occasion for us and we weren't disappointed with the location, food or service. Yes, a little expensive, but for fine dining, it was reasonably priced.

We dropped in here at 9.30 not expecting any tables. One left at the front. Shame was we wanted to sit under the moonlit castle fort. We met our waiter, who had a word, an dthey instantly moved us the one of the best table sin the terrace, watching the sea and the fort under the moonlight! Perfect. We chose the taster menu, i dont do fish, but i do now! Absoultely brilliant. Cant fault the place. Yes expensive, but what do you expect, its five star! Briliant romantic, courteous, good food and wine. ideal. Thanks guys, really made us welcome.

There are a number of very good restaurants in Dubrovnik and this one is definitely up there but somehow it didn't quite hit the overall satisfaction levels we enjoyed elsewhere. Maybe it's because we sat down in daylight and were finished by 9.00 or maybe it's the view - which is good but not the best. But it's billed as one of the world's top 10 romantic restaurants and somehow something was missing from the overall ambience. It's a shame as the service was excellent, the waiters friendly and attentive and the food very tasty and well presented. Next time I'll try it later in the evening.

Very nice restaurant with excellent and attentive staff. We ate quite early so the restaurant was quiet at the time, but the service and food was excellent. We only had main courses, but the staff gave us small appetizers and chocolate desserts complimentary. The wine was the nicest ove had during my visit to Croatia, and it definitely was the nicest meal I ate there also. The staff were very professional, but also friendly. We were expecting our bill to be more expensive than what it was so we were pleased with that. If you are a gin fan, try their own special gin. It is spectacularly served and worth the money if you have it to spare.

Another fabulous evening at Nautica, with incredible service and attention from Ivan, who guided us through food and wine choices like the consummate professional he is. 
Marco, the manager was a delight and informative too. 
We were delighted to eat there again, and enjoy all that Nautika is and does - theatre of food and wine performed beautifully with a stunning backdrop.

We ate here tonight on our son's recommendation. Great reception; we ended up inside as the terrace was a bit hot when we arrived. So half an hour inside before the sun set and then a nice table outside. We went for the 7 course tasting menu, which turned out to be excellent!. A misunderstanding at the end led us to feel we were being ushered out before our tasting menu was completed, but I must say the restaurant really made up for their mistake in first apologising and then serving us some fantastically elaborate drinks at the end as a compensation. Kudos!!

All on all a very nice experience on my wife's birthday.

Well it has a very nice view over the sea and overall food was descent. Our problem was that there was a 45 minute wait from from appetizers to our main course. The starter cocktails were not very tasty either. When the service was available they were good but more often than not we served ourselves and had to prompt them when we needed help. More surprising was the bill. $750 American dollars later we were able to feed six people including one bottle of local wine and three cocktails in addition to our meals. Not worth the wait and I've paid less for five star restaurants in the states. Try a place higher ranked on trip advisor and beware of tourist price gauging.

Wow! What a delight. We made a reservation before our trip began so was seated at a table overlooking the Adriatic. A little hot and sunny in the beginning but within 30 minutes we watched the sun slowly set.

The service was top notch. The food unbelievable. The view breathtaking. 

We started with a signature drink. My husband ordered the 7 course tasting menu - way too much food. We could have shared it. I only ordered 2 courses and they were great about spreading my dishes out. 

It was a splurge. We knew that going in. It was worth the price. It is rated a 5* and deserves the rating. 

Most people were dressed a little nicer - not touristy short casual.

Visited in July 2016 for dinner. Tried to book in advance but told no space however asked as we happened to walk past and enquire and they could fit us in. 
Probably a bit too romantic for two friends travelling together but I'm not one to miss out
Be prepared to spend
Most amazing dessert - Lemon and cheese parfait !!
It was a lovely meal, excellently presented and fantastically served. The view is amazing and adds to the ambience - well worth a visit.

Rated 5* and so it is. We asked for and were sat at a beautiful table in the patio overlooking the Adriatic; bliss

The service was impeccable, the food outstanding and accompanying wines perfect. Pre dinner drinks suggestions were excellent 

This is as good as any meal I have experienced and well worth the advanced booking. 

Don't be put off by the fear of expense; sure it is more than other restaurants but it its not at all overpriced and value for money

We were on a cruise along the Adriatic coast and stopped in Dubrovnik for a day . We were told this was the best restaurant in town. They said it was fully booked for a week but when we said we would eat early and quickly we got a table for two on the balcony overlooking the sea with the historic walls around. Wonderful situation . the food was excellent and the service first class. Could not fault anything . It is very expensive by Croatian standards but not to be missed.

The food and service is in a class of it's own in Dubrovnik. But obviously so are the prices so be prepared to splurge ... 
Reservation is needed at least a few days in advance. 
Ask for the "front row" for the best view of the fortress and city wall.

Spectacular food, drinks and service, combined for an amazing experience. We ordered the vegetarian's menu ( soup, salad, risotto and vermicelli rice) and it was the best I've tasted. This restaurant is the definition of luxury. There's so many good restaurants in Dubrovnik but I think Nautica is the best. A little bit expensive comparing to other restaurants nearby but definitely worth it! 
A must try!

Fine dining and fine service, fresh seafood and a really nice wine list, combined with wonderful views of the city walls and the water below = best night out in Dubrovnik. Service was solicitous without being obsequious. The food was good. And location was very special.
Great food and location, service overdone , and very expensive - Croatian wines are priced ridiculously however the food and ambience are very good

Visited during our stay in Dubrovnik. Booked a 'inner' table on the terrace a few nites before. It's worth noting that the 'outer' tables next to the wall are 6.30 and 9pm sittings 

Upon arriving we were shown to our table and looked after superbly by our waiter. Each waiter had a helper to which we thought was cute!

The view is really something. After spending a week looking at the city walls it's really a treat to see the sights. 

We ordered mains and a wine by the glass and after reading some of the reviews on here never once felt like we weren't been looked after as well as others spending more

We had steak and fish for mains and both were beautifully cooked and presented. We had time out before desert and never felt rushed which was nice

I ordered desert and coffee and the wife a tea. The waiter brought out some homemade chocolate which was nice. 

The bill wasn't cheap, easily the most expensive meal of the holiday and we've eaten in almost all the top 10 on here. 

The food was on par with other fine dining, the service too. The usp is the view and I don't think the premium on price is proportionate to it. Despite this I'm happy we had the experience and would recommend if in Dubrovnik and not on a budget

Our third visit to Croatia and second visit to this amazing restaurant. The first time a couple of years ago was astonishing and this visit with the children (both 17 years) was no less and even better. The food and wine is just sublime but what makes this so special is the perfect and professional service from all the staff.
Our booking was made three weeks before we travelled to Croatia. On the day, we journeyed into Dubrovnik at 11am from Lopud Island where we stay and had time to visit some shops and sites before dinner at 6:00pm. The weather being hot we didn't want to walk around in our evening clothes and the staff were very kind enough to allow us to leave a change of clothes for when we returned to eat.
Every course was just delicious and the pre-starter was unbelievably good. The children can be choosey at times with food and that can make fine dining a little tricky, but like us, they both resoundingly approved of everything, the food, the service, the setting, the ambiance and the whole experience.
The attention to detail is impressive, from the knowledge and choice of local wine by the sommelier, the presentation of different olive oils for each course and the Maître D' remembering my first review on TripAdvisor.
At dessert my partner commented on her choice and that although it was delicious, she might have made a different choice having seen what everyone else had. With this in mind but not because of it, but because we were returning customers and the fact we show our appreciation, we were rewarded with a lovely surprise.
So we will return as this is on our list of favourite restaurants in the world.
A big thank you to all the staff, in particular Marko and Mario. See you soon.

Can't even remember what my main dish was. It was great, sure, but they kept bringing out baskets of warm, fresh bread with a range of different olive oils that was just amazing. Literally could have had it for starter and main and still paid the bill with tip on top. Great views and other dishes sure what man, that bread. That olive oil.

The restaurant was more than I expected it to be, starting with the best view in Dubrovnik out into the sea with the city walls on 1 side & the red keep on the other. Next up was the food which was melt in your mouth throughout every course. But to top it all off, the knowledge of the staff of the locally produced food & wine which was used to create the dishes was very impressive.

My husband and three children dined here one evening during our stay in Dubrovnik. My kids are ages 12, 11 and 8. They love seafood so take that into consideration when reading this review. The waiter brought out a giant platter of fresh fish to choose from. The restaurant itself was right next to the walls and we ate on the terrace right overlooking the water. Our reservations were for 6:30 and by the time we were done it was around 8:30 or 9. The sky was gorgeous and the views changed from hour to hour. The sunset view and the walls lit up at night were spectacular. The food was amazing and the service was terrific. I would HIGHLY recommend eating at this restaurant. It is pricey, but worth it.

My husband and I had dinner here on our 5th wedding anniversary. We made reservations in advance through the restaurant website, but never received a final confirmation from Anita (the Sales Manager). When we arrived in Dubrovnik, we had to have our hotel call to ensure that we had reservations. Even though we offered to dine at any time, Anita informed us that the only table left for that night was in the "third row from the sea" on the "Brsalje terrace." When we arrived, we saw the HORRIBLE table that we reserved for us. It wasn't even close to the sea. I wouldn't even call the "Brsalje terrace" a terrace. It was a street level table in front of the restaurant. You could hardly see the ocean and the noise and chaos from all around us would have undoubtedly ruined our experience. Luckily, the seating hostess, Maria, sensed my extreme disappointment and offered to show us another table on one of the small upper terraces. It was beautiful. Though we weren't near the wall facing the sea, we had a lovely view and there were only 4 tables on the terrace. It was very private and very serene - perfect for celebrating an anniversary.

While the food that we ordered was delicious, we were extremely underwhelmed by the service of our waiter. He seemed to cater to every table except for ours, and we are convinced it is because the other tables were ordering multiple bottles of expensive wine. Unfortunately for the restaurant, we did not partake in the extensive wine list that evening because I am 8 months pregnant. My husband enjoyed a glass of wine and we enjoyed multiple courses, but it was not enough to warrant the waiter's attention. I had to continuously ask for water (every single time that I ran out) and we had to wait a long time in between service even when I tried to get his attention. He was just entirely too preoccupied with the other tables. At the end, the waiter brought out a nice table with homemade Croatian liqueurs. He spent quite a bit of time with each table, allowing them to taste multiple and have their fix. He COMPLETELY skipped over our table and asked if we wanted some as an afterthought. It was so disappointing. Additionally, the restaurant did NOTHING to celebrate our anniversary, even though I told Anita, Maria, and the waiter. A simple candle in the dessert that we paid for would have been nice. When spending this much on dinner for two (approximately 190 euro), we just expect better service and to be treated special. While the food was good, we will definitely not be going back. There are plenty of other great restaurants in Dubrovnik.
Great views of the old walls and the sea. very friendly staff and delicious dining with an excellent wine list. Add it to your list for fine dining.

We had a very memorable dinner here. The setting is just wonderful and very romantic yes. The service was first class and we were well taken care of by Ivan. The food and wine was excellent and in view of the whole ambiance and service and food we felt that the prices reflected this. We had the table right on the edge and it was a breathtaking evening. Love to go again if we ever get back to Dubrovnik.

Our "dining experience" started with a disappointment. In the afternoon we called the restaurant and wanted to book a table for the same evening. A friendly voice told us that the restaurant is fully booked but we should come at 8.00pm in case they have a cancellation......once in town we followed the advice, got a wonderful table and were surprised that at least half a dozen of tables have not been occupied the whole evening.....(?)
Although the management (and chef) have changed since we have been here the last time we have not been disappointed. The food is absolutely excellent. No doubt the Nautika belongs to the more expensive restaurants but is finally worth the money. It's situated in one of the top locations in Dubrovnik and the service is highly professional, friendly and attentive. Highly recommended!

We enjoyed the service and the view. When the sun went down it was a much better experience. I thought the food was good but nothing blew my mind. I was very perplexed by the goat cheese salad. All of the elements were good but it didn't seem to have any cohesiveness. The elements didn't compliment each other. The truffle pasta was good and the beef steak was tender and cooked perfectly. I'm glad I went but I'm not sure I'd go back if I visit dubrovnik in the future. I feel with a little more thought into all of the elements on the plate this restaurant could be top notch.

It is difficult to say which is the best quality of Nautika because the quality of the food, the helpfulness of the staff and the location of the restaurant are all outstanding and, because of that, it really is very good value in spite of being pricier than most restaurants in the area. My wife and I had a truly memorable evening there.

This restaurant was more than we could have asked for. Excellent food - melt in your mouth steak for main course worth every penny. Service was friendly and subtle. Left reasonable gap between courses allowing us to enjoy the view and the location. Try the gin house cocktail. Was delicious.

This restaurant is amazing. It was recommended by our resort but good tables were already fully booked. My wife and I stopped by and spoke to the team and we were able to get back in later for dinner outside on the terrace. The position and view is amazing below the fort and old town, food was delicious, the service exceptional from Mario and the manager Marco and Maria were extremely helpful. First place we revisit when we return to Dubrovnik. It's not cheap but the experience is worth it.

Hands down the best dining experience ever. From the service to the environment and the most incredible food. Ten of us turned up without a booking and were looked after as soon as we entered the doorway. we waited 30mins for a table but it was well worth every second. I ordered the seafood risotto which was out of this world. Our waitress was so informative of each meal and ensured we were happy with everything. If I could repeat this evening I would in a heartbeat. The live music was a bonus on top of the incredible service. Highlight of Croatia!
Great food and one of the best meals of the trip. Expect to pay the same as you would for 5 star dining in London or NYC.

You should book at least 2 days in advance since its always full. It has not too many tables and only 2 seat times for dinner. Ask for tables in the first row so you can appreciate the view. 
I would recommend to book for early dinner at 19:3 in order to enjoy the sunset. 
Amazing food! 
Staff was friendly and knowledgable. 
I would really recommend this Restaurante for a romantic dinner.

Surprised my wife with dinner at Nautika for our anniversary and it was an absolutely amazing meal. I believe it is ranked in the top 10 for most romantic restaurants in the world by Conde Naste. Would recommend starting with a cocktail and booking one of the front row tables on the terrace under the stars on the harbour. Our waiter Darko was brilliant! He was very knowledgeable, friendly and made sure we were always looked after. Thank you for making our evening so special!

Booked this restaurant a few days in advance. Was blue to to have a first row table, overlooking the bay. Food was gorgeous, staff were friendly and very knowledgable about the food and drink they were serving. Beautiful building inside too. On the expensive side, but well worth it for a holiday treat.

This is one of the most beautiful spots in the old town. The views are breathtaking. You can see the gorgeous sea, the wall, and at sunset it's stunning. 

It's ideal for couples, and family meals. However, my friend and I had a great time here. Evening cocktails are extraordinary. The food is sublime and service is attentive and thoughtful. The crisp, white linens and silver service give this a luxurious feel to already beautiful restaurant. The cocktails are amazing in taste and presentation.

It was our wedding anniversary and we were disappointed to be told the restaurant was fully booked when I Emailed one day prior.
However we were told to just turn up on the day as cancellations were likely. However as we passed the restaurant I thought that I would ask to be advised if a cancellation did appear and left my phone number. Within 15 minutes I received a call to say we were booked in for the following night as requested.
I was somewhat surprised to find the internal tables were empty whilst the terraces were full as we were taken up to the higher terrace.
Opting for the 7 course degustation menu and a good bottle of Serbian white wine we began the epic journey. It was nearly midnight when the final cheese course arrived and by then I was ready to leave.
So great experience, certainly not cheap with service that could be a little faster.

Wonderful food, wonderful service and a wonderful location. This was the best meal we had in Dubrovnik. We were lucky to have a table at the edge of the terrace overlooking the sea. The food was delicious and we loved the different selection of olive oils. The service was very attentive. It was a birthday treat for my husband and the staff kindly surprised him with a birthday cake and sang Happy Birthday to him. A wonderful experience, we would definitely go back if we return to Dubrovnik. Highly recommend booking in advance.

Very attentive waiters. Beautiful setting, lovely terrace and great cuisine make the Nautika to the top choice for fine dining in Dubrovnik.
We also enjoyed the olive oil selection very much.
We would like to visit it again.

Spectacular location on the hill overlooking the water, the walls and the fort.
Fabulous food, great wine, excellent service.

This restaurant was the best one we visited in Dubrovnik, it is just outside the old town and I would suggest you book and ask for a table overlooking the harbour, the setting is beautiful and the food was delicious. The service is excellent and the waiters are very friendly, helpful and informative. We even got shown around the restaurant and wine cellar at the end of the meal. This was a highlight of our visit to Dubrovnik, it's not cheap but it's worth it.

Breathtaking view, wonderful food, cocktails, good wine list, and great and attentive service. What a wonderful location to have a meal. We were celebrating a special birthday and were about 15 for dinner and the folks at Nautika could not have more accommodating. The seafood was spectacular in particular. They truely made the evening special for everyone.

Had a late dinner here and got a great table on the terrace. Enjoyed a delicious Croatian wine that our waiter helped us select. Best dishes we had were fish soup, tuna and steak. The dessert was so-so but everything else, the food, the setting and the service were amazing. Can be on the pricier side, but not everything on the menu is expensive and its well worth the price!

The restaurant is in a great position before you enter the walled city overlooking the sea. Our waiter, Ivan, was very helpful and spoke good English. The food was delicious and so was the wine. This restaurant and 360 are probably the best in Dubrovnik. Opposite this restaurant is a more bistro style place (owned by the same people) which looked busy and fun

Our second meal in Dubrovnik and the best by far! We sat on the terrace and lucky for us the set was ready for filming Game of Thrones so a plus! We had a great Keal and recommend the scallops and tuna ! Our waiter was Ivan who was amazing and so happy to chat and was so knowledgeable! This is a great place, good atmosphere and location. Expensive for Dubrovnik but worth it if your budget allows.

So fallin in love by this place, we were celebrating our engagement and was everything so perfect, the food is one of the best I tasted so far. 
The view is magnific!
But have something special to say, we were served by a gentleman, with glasses, dark hair, around 40, so humble, professional and polite, so sorry to don't know his name but he was totally perfect during all service. 
Totally recomend this lovely restaurant for a special night.

We made a reservation at Nautika for our last night in Dubrovnik and were not disappointed! We were seated with an amazing view of Old Town and the coastline, and treated to fabulous service throughout our two hour meal. I started with the scallops (delicious, if a little small) while my wife had the tagliatelle (a hearty portion size!). I then had the sea bass (refreshing and cooked perfectly) while me wife had the beef (fabulous). The Croatian wine pairings were spot on and our lemon desert was excellent. I would recommend booking in advance in order to have the best seats. We're so glad we did - it was the perfect end to our lovely Croatian vacation.

This is the best restauant in Dubrovnik, hands down. Not only is the food incredible but the service provided by the knowledable and helpful staff made our meal experience the best we've ever had. In particular, Tomislav was extremely attentive and was able to recommend great suggestions for food and wine. In addition, It was the first restaurant I've ever been to where various olive oils were paired with specific courses. If you ever decide to visit Dubrovnik, do not hesistate to have dinner at Nautika. Ask for Tomislav and you're guaranteed to have a great meal and an enjoyable evening.

This restaurant may be appear expensive compared to other places in Dubrovnic but if you want something special this is it. We booked several days earlier to avoid disappointment and were offered a 9.00 p.m. slot. A little late for us but we said 'why not'. We arrived a little early to be told our booking was 8.00 p.m. Some restaurants could have been difficult about this but we were assured it was not a problem and we were politely escorted to our table. Having ordered an excellent bottle of Chablis, we started with a lovely amuse bouche involving some local cheese. Spoilt for choice I reverted to type and ordered two starters. The first was a stunning trio of tuna, prawns and sea urchin which was both beautiful and tasted amazing. JR ordered the beef fillet for his main and I moved on to the shrimp risotto. Both these dishes were faultless. Indeed, at this point I was considering divorce and running away with the chef. Service was attentive but not intrusive. Staff were knowledgeable and obviously have great pride in the restaurant and the food it serves. We could not manage dessert but were offered a liqueur to finish our meal which was delicious. The location is superb looking out over the fort. This is not to be missed if you eat in Dubrovnic - it is a meal to remember. Yes, it is pricey but it it is exceptional.

We had dinner at Nautika on the last night of our Dubrovnik trip and it rounded our stay off beautifully with its gorgeous views over the sea and city walls. The food and wine was lovely and so was the amuse bouche sent by the chef and the hand made chocolate with fruits and selection of grappas at the end. Book 2-3 weeks ahead in the height of the season.

Visited nautika on our honeymoon and it was well worth the price. The dishes were delicious and each dish is served with a different olive oil. Our server took great care of us and and they brought out a few surprises which made the meal even better. Highly recommend if you are in Dubrovnik

My wife and I reserved a table one week in advance to ensure we had a front line position overlooking the sea. The restaurant has a wonderful location situated between two castles and the staff and decor are impeccably turned out.
The waiters are incredibly smart and knowledgable gave us a full insight into the Croatian wine that we had ordered which incidentally turned out to be surprisingly good.
We both had the five course tasting menu which was very well executed with good tasty ingredients.We also got the opportunity to sample a number of the local Croatian olive oils which again were very good .
