All in all a great experience for our wedding anniversary, the bill was a bit steep at about £300 pounds for two but we pushed the boat out with champagne as an aperitif and local dessert wines to finish - you only live once -Go Enjoy

I don't know where to begin... Just left the restaurant, I am speechless! The food is the best I have EVER had in my life! Opted for the scallops and then the beef with the fruit and chocolate fantasy for dessert and a fantasy it was, WOW!! There are no words for how perfect the food was! The waiter was superb, he knew everything about everything we were eating and drinking! AMAZING!! I will definitely be visiting again! Thank you so much for an amazing dining experience! THE BEST MEAL AND SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD! Thank you for making me feel like a princess!
Fabulous atmosphere and wonderful staff. Catered to us and had the best food selections!! A must to done at in Dubrovnik!!

Fabulous setting on the terrace overlooking the Bokor fortress (The King’s Landing harbour of Game of Thrones!) for our wedding anniversary dinner. Exceptional personal service with blankets and heaters to ease the late evening spring chill. We ordered the five course ‘tasting menu’ together with a couple of nice glasses of wine. The food was nothing less than superb.
Highly recommended for that special occasion.
TOP TIPS
Booking required at busy times.
Ask for an outside table.
This was the most expensive meal we had in the Balkans by a very, very significant margin so check the prices before you enter if you are on a budget.

We booked this restaurant for a special birthday dinner and it surpassed expectations in every possible way.

The location is superb. Book a table in the terrace looking out to sea. We did, sitting right at the edge with views out to sea and to the old city walls. 

Our waiter, Darko, was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We gave him the challenge of finding a wine to match both fish and beef and his recommendation was excellent. The service throughout from Darko as well as the rest of the team, was probably the best we've ever experienced, and we eat out a lot across the world. Unfortunately we didn't catch his name but the front of house Manager was excellent and made my birthday a very special event. 

The food was amazing, and they even arranged a surprise birthday cake for me. We didn't have the tasting menu but ate off the a la carte menu and were very happy with every course. 

The meal started on a sunny evening but ended in a spectacular thunderstorm. We were whisked inside to a lovely cosy table. Nothing was too much trouble for the team at this excellent restaurant. 

We can't rate them highly enough! Thank you for an amazing dinner.

We had a perfect table, overlooking the castle and the old walls of the city. Absolutely and completely delightful.

We had the degustation menu and the food was great. Of the five courses I truly enjoyed four as I didn't think much of the fish soup. Otherwise everything else was really delicious. Of note, the tuna tartar and the shrimps on polenta.

We were given a free after dinner digestive and I went for the cherry liquor which was full of flavor.

So why 4 out of 5? 

It certainly wasn't the cost, At about 100 Euros per person I found it quite reasonable for the quality.

It was a couple of little things. First the waiters were pushing the alcohol. I don't mind being asked if I care for a glass of champagne to start but I do mind being asked twice by the same waiter. The second are the "airs" that the Maitre'De tries to put on, as if to remind us that we are in classy establishment. 

Anyone coming here and willing to pay the price obviously knows their food, so please just calm down and do what you do best.

Nautical, Thanks for a great evening.

As a group of four we had a wonderful evening set in a stunning location at the top of the rocky Adriatic Sea coast at the foot of the Old Town city walls (make sure you get the terrace at the back not the front courtyard). Delicious sea food and Croatian wines chosen to compliment the lobster, John Dory dishes with great help from our attentive waiter. Finally cheeses and local liqueurs, not cheap for this part of the world (we paid just over £100 per head equivalent) but it felt like good value for an exceptional dining experience. Bring a jacket or wrap for when the sunsets to keep warm.

The restaurant has a beautiful view over the city and is perfect for a couple-night-out. The atmosphere is romantic and the service on point (surprisingly for Croatia). The menu is well balanced but a little over priced. All in all, though, a stop here is a must for a couple on a trip.

Booked here for a Sunday night. Lovely setting though the front row of the terrace is limited and you need to book well in advance for this!

The service was great and the food exceptional. It's meant to be the most expensive restaurant around here so we were pleasantly surprised when it fell well short of London prices!

Would recommend this place for a special occasion.

I visited Nautika for dinner on the 25th with a friend. I decided to the full experience and opted for the 7 course menu which was DIVINE! The Tuna steak was out of this world, it was such an exquisite dish with the rosemary and salt crust. The carpaccio with the reduced balsamic vinegar balls was the best i ever had. The veal dish was magnificent. My friend had risotto that was perfect perfect perfect! 
The view was the best in Dubrovnik and it is definitely my favourite spot in Dubrovnik.
The whole staff was very warm and pleasing. Our waiter Draco was definitely the best! He was very passionate about his job, the food, and sincerely eager to make our dinner not less than perfect.
This was by far my best dining experience in years.
Nautika would be a major reason for me to go back to Dubrovnik

Fabulous setting with highly attentive staff. Front of house manager to be commended as well. Fine food. Small menu but presented with care and taste.Here you get what you pay for and I will not hesitate to return.

As it was my birthday meal I had emailed in advance to book and ask for a nice table - the restaurant didn't disappoint. We had a great table in the first row with a fantastic view. It was a windy night and quite chilly but we were given wonderful fluffy blankets and a personal heater so we didn't feel the cold at all! The service was impeccable, the food was delicious and although the portions were small (as you would expect for fine dining) they were perfectly balanced. We both had the veal for our main course and it was wonderful. It's not cheap but for a special occasion it was well worth it - we paid around £150 for a three course meal for two plus an aperitif and a glass of wine each. We were also given a complimentary drink of brandy / liqueur at the end of the meal. My only (small) disappointment was that they didn't sing happy birthday to me as they did for a couple of other diners that night!! But all in all it was a perfect birthday meal and we had a wonderful, atmospheric evening.

This is a wonderful restaurant in a stunning location. The food is sublime. The staff were really helpful in making suggestions and it was amazing to have a different olive oil introduced at each course.

The food was absolutely fantastic! First class cuisine with the most professional, friendly, attentive and happy staff. I went with 7 other girls to celebrate our 30th and we were not disappointed whatsoever. Would recommend anyone to go to this beautiful restaurant. Thank you for making this experience so special! Not only was the service and food exceptional, the price was great value for what you get! Will come to this restaurant again and again.

This restaurant is on the small cliff near Pile Gate. It faces the harbor, which is really nice. The candle lit make it a romantic night. Food is excellent. I had shrimp soup and veal steak. I was surprised that veal in a sea town is very good. Service here is good. I asked a few questions about olive oil on the table. The waiter brought 3 more flavors of olive oil for me to try and they are superb. He told me that the original flavor won Croatia olive oil.

A special romantic birthday dinner was enhanced by the view and the impeccable service. Nothing was too much trouble. An excellent starter of scallops on a bed of kale and potato with white truffle shavings was followed by superbly grilled John Dory (fish of the day) which was filleted at the table. They asked, when we arrived whether it was a birthday dinner (how did they know?) and brought a wonderful Korib cake for dessert. It's not cheap but, if you want this kind of service and quality, it doesn't come much better. Full marks for everything.

Based upon our experience, and having tried other equally excellent restaurants in the city, we would rate this as the best. Food and service are excellent, and having booked for a second visit we were remembered by the staff, even to the extent of choosing a different 'chefs compliments' course for us, rather than serve what we had the previous night. Highly recommended.

Normally I just order one course and that is plenty. I was worried about ordering the 5 course meal as I would leave stuffed. But the size was very small and I started eating bread to try to make up for it. So yes, the view is great, the service is great, the food is good, but the portions are small. So for one person 850 (2 drinks) seems like I should have left not being able to eat one more morsel.

There is no Michelin star restaurant in Croatia. We have eaten in many stars Michelin restaurant around the world and we would give definitely a 2 stars to this outstanding restaurant.

Even if it was a cool night, we had a magical diner that will stay in our memory for a long time. 

If you are a foodie like us make sure to not miss this stunning place.

You better reserve well in advance to have the first row sitting

This restaurant is absolutely stunning It faces the seafront with views of both the walled city and the fortress. The food is extremely delicious and the service superb. Our waiter Ivan was very helpful with the menu and also took photos for us ensuring that we captured this magical place from all angles!!
Can't recommend this place highly enough! Fine dining at its best!

We sat on the terrace overlooking the walls. Ivan our waiter was brilliant. His recommendations were worth listening to! We had beef capacious (super tender and tasty), veal (beautifully cooked) and fruit in a chocolate basket. The local wine is very good, just a little bit different. It got a little bit chilly, but blankets are ready for you on your chair arm and there are patio heaters. It is a bit pricey, but excellent for a special occasion.

Let me just start with the word incredible, as this fits just about every aspect of this restaurant from the location, (which is unbeatable) to the food, which is the best I have had yet.

The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and make you feel welcome and comfortable from the moment you arrive.

The food was outstanding and the flavours mouth watering.

The view is second to none and as the sun sets just gets better.

We have eaten in some amazing restaurants around the world and this is on our top 3 list.

This was an exceptional meal by any standards. Start with the imposing premises and beautiful terrace overlooking the sea just by the main gates. We went a la carte. Try the veal. Quite exceptional. Well-chosen wine list. Attentive service. As others have commented they push a local brand of olive old rather hard.

We celebrated my wife's birthday at this wonderful restaurant.
Whether you're a fish or meat lover, you'll enjoy every minute you spend at this fabulous venue. If the weather is good, reserve a table on the terrace and enjoy the beautiful view of the city walls and the sea. The service is impeccable with food and wine to match.

We enjoyed a romantic dinner as the sun set on the old town of Dubrovnik. Our waiter, Mario, was very attentive and the food was outstanding. We were treated to an appetizer and after dinner grappa samples, gratis, which we did not expect. We were treated as welcomed guests even though we walked in without a reservation. With drinks and all the trimmings it's an expensive evening but worth every penny.

best view. Amazing cocktails (ask for one of their specialities that aren't listed on the menu. The gin, orange and rosemary one is amazing! And so is the raspberry one known as 'a bird in the hand'). The waiters are absolutely lovely and make you feel so welcome. Bit more expensive than other places but definitely worth it. Thoroughly recommend.

location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
review: outstanding, maybe even over-attentive, service, and stunning view! very good food for sure -- the veal was amazing, great wine, dessert was not so great -- but it is overpriced. wasn't so thrilled to see the exclusive olive oil brand that they sold me a bottle of also available for cheaper at the duty free store in dubrovnik airport.

We wanted to try the Croatian kitchen and booked a table at Nautika. The place had a nice atmosphere and attentive staff. The food did not quite live up to our expectations, could be that the local flavours did not appeal to us.

I feel there aren't enough words for me to describe the wonder of this eatery. The staff are immaculate, as is the venue. A pianist was playing just inside the entrance, a lovely touch as his music was streamed throughout the venue. 

A simple menu, I think perhaps 4 options to each section, but all varying greatly to one another. 

We were given a choice of tables and took one in a corner on an upstairs terrace overlooking the Fort. 

Each course came with knowledge of locally produced award winning olive oils and were used to dress each course at the table. 

To start we were served aperitifs, a green tea mousse with a cuttlefish ink 'crisp'. The flavours were so so good. 

To follow we had scallops and a prawn and asparagus risotto. 100% for presentation. My O/H said his scallops were a little slimy, I think perhaps a tad undercooked for his taste. My risotto was a generous portion. Enough for a main course. Good flavours, plenty of prawns throughout. 

For main course we had Beef Filet and Tuna. I could not believe the size of the beef, lol! A huge portion, tender and well seasoned. My tuna was a brave choice, it had a caper and Rosemary crust, not usually so fond of capers but the flavours were well matched and I'm definitely a 'caper convert'. 

We declined dessert, but we were served some choices of local liquors. 

Overall a fabulous experience, there's no denying it's expensive but I believe for the service, the quality of food and the added local knowledge of wines, olive oils and liquors, this place is a wonder and completely worth it.

We made a reservation for here a few days ago after reading about its status as one of the top romantic places for dinner. There was a little mix up with our reservation but this was quickly sorted out and we ended up on a more intimate, higher terrace. This still had a wonderful view of the Adriatic and city walls and was maybe less exposed as well as we didn't feel a chill at all throughout the evening. We could also still hear the live piano music. 
The maître d' was wonderful and kept checking in with us throughout the course of the meal to make sure our meals were enjoyable and we were having a good time yet without being intrusive. 
Our waiter was also amazing. He knew every course on the menu and was able to explain even the way things would be cooked. I was also so impressed with the way he presented the food along with his recommendations of olive oil to have with each part of the meal. 
Now to the food, we started with the shrimp soup and fish soup, both of which were excellent. Then for main we had the beef fillet with large Roman gnocchi and celery chips, and the veal with potato gratin and pea puree. These were expertly cooked. After two courses we were nicely full and even though the desserts were very tempting e.g. cheese and lemon parfait, chocolate and orange cake we finished the evening with hot drinks. 
We were so relaxed throughout the whole meal and never felt hassled or neglected by the waiter. They could not have been nicer or more helpful and we could not recommend this restaurant enough.

I heard about this restaurant before I visited Dubrovnik. I was drawn in to the restaurant by Ivan who was my waiter. He was very informative and pleasant with his manners. He invited me with a tour of the restaurant and its wine collection. I learned important stuff about Croatian wine. I tried the five course tasting menu and it was worth the price and the enchanted view experience. Now I understand why it was voted in 2013 as the top romantic dining in the world by Condé Nast traveler. I was lucky enough to experience and all the oil tasting (six varieties). Even pairing and pouring all the olive oil with the dessert was a pleasant surprise. I was lucky enough to be given a complementary ice wine by a multi awarded winemaker old friend from Croatia. Unfortunately due to limited production it was not for sale but the taste left a lasting grand finale impression. I texted my friends to bring their wives here for a second honeymoon.

We visited on a recommendation from a friend from home, to celebrate the last evening of our honeymoon in Dubrovnik.

From the moment we arrived we were so warmly welcomed and shown to a fabulous table on the terrace.

Our waiter (I wish I could remember his name!!) was exceptional and made the evening one to remember. We were so well looked after and his words about our special occasion nearly bought a tear to my eye!

The food and paired wine were delicious - the scallops and tuna were particular favourites as well as the chocolate cake.

We love eating out but are sometimes put off by overly pretentious food - this is anything but - quality and presentation were incredible.

Thank you Nautika for an evening that we will remember for many years to come!

We were two, celebrating my friend's big birthday. It turned out we had chosen the perfect restaurant for it.

The location of the restaurant by the old town, facing the sea and magnificent fortresses, is quite spectacular. We had a table outside, and the individual radiator placed behind and above us kept us warm enough through the evening.

Our waiter was experienced, fun and a great MC for the evening. He chose the perfect regional wines for our dishes, and shared his enthusiasm about the special Croatian olive oils that were tied in the dishes and the tasting.

The thick shrimp soup (without cream) was spot-on. The taste of shrimps and shellfish was astounding in the reduced and thickened broth, with large whole shrimps and "coins" of fresh cheese in it.

The veal was among the best of the best we've had, done to a perfect rosé medium as we had asked, and the potato cakes laced with truffle and spinach mousse added to the round, succulent impression.

A cheese and lemon parfait and a cake of dark chocolate, almonds, sun dried figs with orange-ginger sauce were our happy desert choices. 

There's an impressive range of local brandies to close the evening. We tasted 4 different and the walnut was our No.1. Nautika is our contender for the same position among the Dubrovnik restaurants.

We had decided on dining at Nautika before arriving in Dubrovnik. When visiting the Old Town, we stumbled across the restaurant and paused to look at the menu. We explained we were coming the following night, and were immediately invited in for a tour of the beautiful dining areas in the restaurant - a lovely touch.
When we did arrive to eat, we were greeted warmly and offered a table on the terrace overlooking the bay. It was a little chilly, so we were wrapped up in soft white blankets and an electric heater was provided. Our waiter Mario catered to our every need, explaining wine and food with expert knowledge. Each course came with a recommended olive oil which added depth and flavour, along with a little bit of theatre. We were not constantly bothered, but our wine and water glasses never ran empty. The food was exquisite, and between us we never left a crumb on a plate. Beautifully cooked lobster tail, veal and lamb, professionally presented with wonderful accompaniments.
On finishing, we enquired about one of the dessert wines, and immediately a sample was brought for us to taste. The digestif provided at the end of the meal was both unexpected and delicious.
As we left, we were invited into the wine cellar, and Mario, along with the maître' d talked us through some of the most popular wines from the different regions of Croatia - a real education.
Thank you for making our final evening in Dubrovnik such a special one - the staff really went above and beyond to ensure an experience we won't forget.
Yes - the price tag is a little higher than other places in Dubrovnik, but for the quality of food and service you receive at Nautika, it is well worth every penny.

Just amazed by Nautika. 
Food was great, ambience is greater and the service was the best. The waiter named Darko Dabic was the one of the best service providers I have ever met. They will tell you the story of what they bring over to your table. 
Just had the best night in dubrovnik. Strongly recommend.

We had a superb evening at Nautika this week. It was the restaurants' opening night of the season. As we had not visited before we had a chance to see the various rooms and terraces that guests might experience - or the next time we come:) 
We sat at a table with a lovely view of the old city walls. The service was super from start to finish - so nice to see many of the staff we know from Panorama and Gradska Kavana restaurants. 
The food was excellent. We had the Beef Charolais and the Teleci with a great sald to start. Only the desert had a name that didn't fit the course served - easily fixed as it was only their first night of the season.

We came here on the recommendation of one of my clients and immediately noticed that 1) we were seriously under-dressed for the place and 2) it was a bit pricier than any other meal we'd had in Croatia. The view could not be better, but we were worried we'd end up paying for the view and the food would be mediocre. However, we had the impression that Dubrovnik tended to be more expensive than the other cities we'd been to, so we decided to give it a shot. We are definitely glad we did! 

The waiter was above average even for a region with excellent customer service. He made us feel really comfortable, even though we were dressed like shlubs. When he found out we were chefs, he engaged us about our experience of Croatian food and seemed genuinely flattered when we praised his restaurant. The customer service really set this place apart, but of course that wouldn't be worth visiting if the food was not also really good. 

This was the first place we tried the ubiquitous Croatian fish soup. It's a simple soup - fish stock, rice, a little bit of flaked white fish for texture - but it really blew me away with it's flavor. We've been in Croatia for 3 months now, and I've tried many versions of the fish soup, but the one here is still my favorite. Then the entrees arrived. My fiance's was good, but not all that memorable. Mine on the other hand, was amazing. It was (surprisingly) one of the most affordable options on the menu. The sesame encrusted tuna steak was perfectly seared, served rare, with a delightful sauce, and was HUGE. It was the biggest serving of Tuna I'd ever seen. Best value you could possibly hope for. Dessert was a strawberry balsamic tart, which was incredibly flavorful and balanced. 

Overall, I'd say if you're willing to spend the money, Nautika is an excellent fine-dining establishment, with solid food, spectacular views, and a excellent service.

We came here for my mom's birthday. The place was really nice and the service and food good. It's worthwhile to make a reservation well in advance, especially if you want to get an outdoor table closer to the sea!

During my stay in Dubrovnik I visited Nautika at least 5 times. First I wanted to stop by only for a quick beer but enjoyed the athmosphere there, so I visited there almost daily. They provide good service and good steaks.
Excellent food and service, a bit pricey though. Great view outside. We had jeans and were definitely not over-dressed. Book in advance.

I'll visit this restaurant with my fiance to have a special night on our holiday. It was 
recommended to me and I can definitely say I was not let down. Surroundings, and and the service is fantastic and totally matched by the food. We had a waiter called Ivan looking after us on the Terrace and he was a gem.. I can't recommend it any more it was definitely the highlight of our holiday

My husband and I visited Nautika whilst on honeymoon in Dubrovnik. We selected the 7 course tasting menu, which was around £80 per person, so it is a more expensive venue but is definitely fine dining. The setting was just beautiful and I was provided with a fleece blanket for when the evening became chillier, which was a great touch. They also had outside heaters on so it was very enjoyable being outside and experiencing the view to go with the food. The 7 courses were extremely tasty, however (and this is only personal preference) there were quite a lot of fish courses with not many meat courses, but this did not detract from my enjoyment of the food. My only criticism, and this may sound ridiculous, is that the portion sizes for each course were very large. This meant that by course 3 I was stuffed and felt quite uncomfortably full when getting through the rest of the courses. I know a lot of people would enjoy this, but to say it was a tasting menu I thought the sizes could have been slightly smaller, as you get bread also. That would be my only downside as I would have loved to have enjoyed each of the courses equally. The wine was superb, which was recommended to us, and the waiting staff could not have been more efficient. Definitely a place to experience whilst in Dubrovnik.

There are a plethora of fantastic restaurants in Dubrovnik but if you want to feel special, eat the most delicious food and be treated like a king / queen with the most incredible views, then come here. Truly the best experience in town. Staff could not have been more welcoming to my family and made this not only memorable for our holiday but one of the best meals I can remember. Nautika should be number 1 restaurant in Dubrovnik hands down. 

Thank you for such a wonderful night and your hospitality to my family.

I will be honest, I was kind of expecting a tourist trap when we went to Nautika Restaurant in Dubrovnik. The amount of marketing done, just the whole vibe of the thing (from the airport to the actual inner city you will have seen the name somewhere) but it lives up the hype. It is not fine dining per se but the food is really good, the service is better and then the view just completes the whole experience. All in all, yes it is worth it, go.

Elegant dinner. Delicious food. Delightful wine. Exceptional Service. Glorious view. Nautika is frequently cited as the best restaurant in Dubrovnik for a reason. We dined "al fresco" in mid-October. Servers provided us with a light blanket/throw to use if we felt a chill, and portable heaters we're quickly arranged for each table so diners could enjoy the meal in comfort (without detracting from the aesthetic dining experience). Well done!

The food was good although a llitlle salty. The local wine was reasonably good value at about €50. Service was good and the head waiter professional and friendly. The view from the outside terrace is excellent.

Location is perfect and the restaurant itself delivers the best experience you can get in Dubrovnik - the food and the service are top notch! It is an expensive place for Croatian standards but here you pay for the best quality.

We had an almost private dinner for 10 here, and the service from the beginning to end was exceptionally good, from both front of house through to the waiter. Better food (both meat and fish) would be hard to find in Croatia, or even elsewhere. Fantastic wines and a great view from their private terrace at the top of the restaurant. Views over the bay with the waves crashing around and walls lit up at night gave the place a great atmosphere. They know they are better than good, but they live up to it when you are there, not resting on it. Great job.
The views are incredible, the food is absolutely fresh and delicious, and they staff are warm and friendly. This is a Dubrovnik MUST.
The food is exquisite, locally sourced and beautifully presented. We enjoyed an olive oil tasting with each course from small Dalmatian groves. Visit for a very special evening.
Fantastic location overlooking the harbour between the Old Town and Fortress with the moon shining on the sea. Food and wine were expensive but very good as was the service.

Came for dinner with high expectations and we were not disappointed. The service was attentive without being intrusive, the setting is glorious and the food was amazing. We have thre course - very filling but very beautifully presented and delicately flavoured. 
Great dinner out and highly recommended

We enquired if we could just come in for a drink and we were advised we could have a table for a short while. Taken to a lovely outside table with an amazing view, the air was chilly so lovely fleecy blankets were provided and an outside heater.
We decided on two french martinis, they are our favourite cocktail and even though they were not on the menu it wwas no problem at all.
Cocktails arrived along with some complimentary nibbles. Not the best french martini we have sampled but no doubt that the best ingredients were used. 

We very much appreciated the beautiful table, service, attentive staff and setting for a drink on our last evening in the lovely Dubrovnik.

Nautika boldly declares itself "the best seafood restaurant in Dubrovnik," and for once the claims are absolutely justified by the quality of the food and service. The scallops here are simply divine, and shrimp risotto equally splendid. Salads, too, are a work of art, especially the restaurant's classy take on the usual mixed green number, creatively prepared and amazingly fresh. Each dish comes paired with a special olive oil, available for purchase at the restaurant. The location, on a terrace overlooking both Dubrovnik's Pile Gate and the St. Lawrence fortress, is one of the city's best scenic views, and the wait staff are pleasant and attentive. If they seem unduly proud of their offerings, they have good reason.

I chose to celebrate my birthday here. I knew going in that it would be an expensive meal and it was but it met every expectation. The view was nice (though not too special). The service was impeccable. I don't think I have ever had such good service. I felt like our waiter was only serving us. He would always be right there to refill our drinks, grab our plates and asked questions to make sure our meal was exactly what we wanted. The food was absolutely top tier. I don't think it could be any better. I loved the scallops with truffles and my steak. Very well prepared, innovative and just delicious!

The food is outstanding. The location is the best. Overall the view is mesmerising. A must visit place! Although a little expensive so if you are on a budget holiday then this is not the place for you.
Best restaurant ever. The food was amazing. The setting was amazing, but what really made it was the staff. Out waiter has to be the best I have ever experienced - thank you.

Celebrated wife's birthday here. Booked a Friday night table a few days in advance. Views are incredible - I recommend going earlier from 6.30 pm - 9 pm (or later if you can stay) as you will see the sunset and the old town and fortress become illuminated.
Food and wine is exquisite. We had fish soup which contained quite a lot of fish so was very filling. Breads are tasty and fresh out oven. The staff are very warm, friendly, knowledgable and respectful. Good list of wines available by the glass and well paired with food. There was an excellent pianist playing music inside that was piped quietly out to the terrace. Lobster is well advertised and did not disappoint. Fish of the day was extremely tasty and finally the staff brought a delicious complementary chocolate cake and sang Happy Birthday to my wife.
Very romantic and special.
Ideal for that special occasion, good food, excellent service. Pricey but well worth it as you pay for the whole experience.

A magical place! The setting is incredible, especially if you get a seat outside. Service was wonderful as was the food. The Muscat desert wine was the best I've tasted and the olive oil was complex and delicious. It was our honeymoon and was one the highlights of our trip to Croatia, which is now our favourite destination.

We booked dinner at Nautika as a treat for our last night of our honeymoon in Dubrovnik, and it didn't disappoint.
Firstly, the service, impeccable. The waiter was knowledgeable of the food, wine and surroundings, was always on hand to refill our glasses and offered light conversation when required.
The food.. amazing!
I have been lucky enough to eat in some nice restaurants in my life but the steak I had here was out of this world. As I explained it to my wife.. "it melted in my mouth"
The views, as others have commented.. are beautiful, and watching the sun go down over the fort is something I will never forget.
Thank you to all the staff and the cooks, a treasured memory!

Went here on our last night in dubrovnik having booked a few days earlier (not sure if we would have got in/such a good spot if not) and had delicious 3 courses and wine. It is expensive but every course was delicious. Service was really good and views are lovely especially at sunset. They offer blankets when it gets a bit colder too. Would recommend to any foodies looking for a special meal during their stay in this area. Feels like you're gettinng away from the overcrowded old town as well even though its right by entrance as main outside seating is round corner.

My wife and I were in Dubrovnik and booked a late dinner (9:30 PM) at Nautika. The setting is something out of a story book. The meal was excellent. We chose to do the smaller tasting menu which was not small at all. It was five courses and each one of them was delicious. The staff was top notch and catered to our every need. From the moment we walked in for a pre-dinner drink to the moment we left, approximately 3 hours later, we were taken care of by an extremely professional, classy and elegant staff. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about all of the wines we were having as we were having each course paired with a complementing wine. We will definitely return to Nautika on our next trip to Dubrovnik. Highly recommend.

Had a lovely meal only surpassed by the view. Excellent, friendly and attentive staff. Great spot to celebrate an occasion but pricey for an impromptu meal. Excellent, memorable, quality dining experience to cap off a trip to the old city.

This restaurant offers exceptional location, food, service and ambiance. We were warmly greeted and shown to a table overlooking the sea and walls. The food was exquisitely prepared and presented and each course was paired with a unique croatian olive oil. Service was impeccable. For this level of excellence the price was very reasonable.

Went here based on tripadvisor reviews but went with an open mind as always. It looks really swanky and the staff are very polite if a little pretentious. I had a scallop starter which was nice, nothing special and the main was tuna steak which was covered in spice which completely over powered everything, it was terrible. My partner had a shrimp risotto starter which was boring and a lamb main which was delicious but the portion size wouldn't fill a gap in your teeth. Then came the bill which was exorbitant for the standard we got. I would avoid this place and head for anywhere else in Dubrovnik

This is the place to go for that special meal. Book in advance and get a table facing the sea. Order the best wine you can afford and have them grill a fish for you, John Dory please.

Enjoy

I don't mind to pay a little bit more if the food is really good. The place is beautiful, the service is almost perfect but the food is only pretentious - someone without too much talent is pretending to be a gold award chef. Well, it wasn't terrible, it was good but not as good as one would hope for. Also, the selections are rather limited - on purpose, I suspect.

Got table outside overlooking the sea. View was terrific but try to get a table away from the front of the restaurant as you'll get a lot of passerbys wanting to snap photos of the fort and they'll be right next to your table.

Seafood soup was favorable and light, seabass was fine but average. Very nice service staff.

It was our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted to spend the evening somewhere special. Even thought we didn't have a reservation and didn't look too good as we'd toured the city and walked the walls, Nautika couldn't have been more welcoming or a more perfect venue. The staff were superb, the views across to the floodlit city walls and the sea were wonderful, and the meal itself was delicious. Pricey, but worth it.
Had my first meal in Dubrovnik here, looking out at the fort and the sea - seafood risotto and a glass of white wine were very nice
fabulous location, immaculately presented and very attentive staff. good selection and variety on the menu offering traditional and European dishes
We enjoyed dinner here on our final evening in Dubrovnik. This was a great location and one of the best meals we have had anywhere (and we have had many). The service was impeccable.
I wish I'd stayed here! We had a fabulous meal here one September evening. The food and staff were the best by far in the whole of Dubrovnik.

This restaurant deserves all best comments. It is an amazing and highly attractive place to have a memorable dinner. Food is neatly prepared, as well as table setting. You will taste all that flavour you can get from this charming and unique part of the world.
Service is beyond my expectations because you would expect exaggerating in servicing the meals, but the waiter Ivan is completely professional and he knew the perfect line of servicing customers without any annoying and overwhelming moments of presenting the food and taking orders but giving the information on food and wine smoothly and easily. 
I have been trying all day to find something that bothered me last night, but I couldn't.
I usually find bad sides of restaurants and hotels without any problems, but this time my delicate sense of detecting imperfections is out-of-order!
The food and presentation were stunning and the service was immaculate and charming. Among the best meals we have had. Expensive but worth the treat.

We booked in advance over email and very efficient. 
Food was beautifully served and table right on the bay. We are early (645) to get the table we wanted but actually it's relaxing and we got to see the sun go down. 
Food was good, we had fish. I've had better cooked tuna before but was tasty nonetheless. 
Good wine selection and they pair each course with a different local olive oil. 
The Croatian sparkling was pretty good too. Recommended but do book ahead.

Nautika is fine dining. The food and wine were very good. I had a steak for a change of pace from seafood. It was excellent. The view is, of course, the real reason to come. It's spectacular at sunset!

Had a lovely dinner here on our last night. The waiter was excellent, very well dressed, professional and helpful. You get the service you pay for. The food was very good, i wouldnt say the best we had in dubrovnik however the competion between the top 5 restaurants must be fierce because it was still a fantastic dinner. There was a live singer playing the piano in the hallway which fed through speakers to the dining area outside, which took me completely by suprise when i visited the toilet as it sounded so wonderful from the speakers and i was unaware there was a performer on the premises. A fantastic view too!

Having stayed in Split, Hvar and Dubrovnik, we have enjoyed a wide variety of Croatian food and wine over the last 10 days. My wife and I found Nautika to be the best amongst them. 

We booked a table on the terrace (a must) and arrived as the Starlings were shooting and diving through the sky, circling the iconic edges of the city walls. Our waiter, I believe was the head waiter and he worked with his team smoothly and efficiently. 

We were treated with an amuse-bouche of young goats cheese, tomato and an accompanying olive oil. Each course was given its own matching olive oil.

We enjoyed Sancerre with our starters (Scallops, Truffle tagliatelle) and then, by suggestion of our waiter, I opted for a Croatian Orange wine to compliment a succulent and flavoursome fillet steak. My wife had the Sea Bream which was delicate, light and delicious. 

We shared the strawberry desert which was sublime and whilst we were not necessarily a fan of the Carab liqueur, we were appreciative of it as a gift from the restaurant for our honeymoon. 

If we return to Dubrovnik, I am sure we would find ourselves back at this wonderful restaurant and we could not recommend it highly enough. Fantastic. P.s make sure you book ahead!

We had the seven course tasting menu and some delicious wine so thoroughly enjoyed our meal. It's pricey and a bit flash (not sure it's the most romantic place in the world) but if you want a higher end meal it's one to go for.
Lovely meal in beautiful setting. We had some very good value local wine and a delicious dinner - lovely use of truffles and perfectly cooked meat. Great spot on the terrace for a peaceful dinner

We went to Nautika as we had gone to the restaurant next door earlier in the day and were sat in folding directors chairs (folding chairs are a personal hatred of mine as seem more suited to cafes not restaurants) looking across at Nautika we could see they had proper chairs and the same view so decided in the evening we would go there instead. We were not disappointed the food was sophisticated and well presented. The location on the terrace overlooking the castle was lovely and it is worth visiting this restaurant for the view alone. The service was high end and the waiters were very attentive and knowledgeable although I didn't quite understand the olive oil talk at each course, it felt like a gimmick rather than needed. I would though recommend a visit as the food is very good, particularly the truffle pasta.

We felt that the food here was average. Unfortunately the price was astronomical. Service was okay. And although the views are absolutely stunning you can't help but feel like you're WAY overpaying for just average food and service. We probably would not return.

My husband and I had a fantastic meal here tonight. Ivan was our waiter and his recommendations were spot on. We were fortunate to have a table in the front row at the terrace. The view of the cliffs and sea below is amazing, especially at sunset. The service and interior, as well as the food are all outstanding at Nautika and we would love to return!

My wife and I have just visited Nautika on our honeymoon in Dubrovnik. The setting on the terrace is spectacular. We couldn't think of a more beautiful setting for a romantic dinner. The food was outstanding. My wife's lamb and her dessert (strawberries in green pepper) were excellent and my fillet was delicious, made so by its slightly salty crust. The service was friendly and enthusiastic and they very kindly gave us a dessert wine on the house to celebrate our honeymoon and it was absolutely to die for. Having said all of that, there are little things that I suspect will keep Nautika from a Michelin unless addressed: the sides were uninspiring; the presentation not quite to standard; butter that took too long to arrive when requested; plates that weren't cleared away for a little too long and glasses not filled up until they had been empty a while. I am being critical but we really loved this restaurant and want it to get a Michelin, so perhaps this feed back will help. Anyway, if you're in Dubrovnik, book a table and go. It's definitely worth it.

I had booked by email and asked for a front row terrace table. We had shrimp soup to start and lobster tail with freshly made pasta ; both were sublime. We choose a local wine Popsic which was a perfect compliment to the meal.the bread rolls (four types) were also freshly made and butter instead of oil olive was quickly provided. We had no room for dessert and with coffee and tip the bill was £160 and worth every penny for this magical experience. As the light faded the castle lit up and sail boats bobbed in the harbour. Later lightening flashed in the sky and forked into the ocean. Service was impeccable and we had a wonderful experience. Do book ahead for the front row of the terrace.

This is a great restaurant. I went with friends and we sat on a small upper patio overlooking the fortress and the bay. They light the fortress up at night and it was very romantic. I asked for a green salad and it was a work of art. They grilled a sea bass for two and it was perfection. The strawberry desert with pepper was amazing. You must eat here and soak in the atmosphere.

Had a wonderful breakfast here with my wife! Good and reasonably priced for their breakfast before we walked the old city walls. The view of the sea was beautiful and remember to ask for a seat next to the sea.

We happened upon this high rated restaurant at the end of a long day. We were simply looking for a nice place with above average food. We were pleasantly surprised. While the prices were not inexpensive, the ambience and quality of the food, as well as the service, were exceptional. We visited at a busy time and they found a nice table for four on upstairs outside balcony. There is also outside eating on the first floor.

The view was terrific, food was very good but not terrific. I ordered a medium steak. The steak was actually very juicy but it was more medium well ( in my view medium always have just a little pink but this had none). My nephew had the same problem and sent it back explaining that it wasn't medium. They cooked him another one howeveR it looked just like the one he had returned which was strange. Again though not medium my steak was very good so overall I enjoyed the meal.

Our second time in Dubrovnik and we were looking for a nice place for dinner. Nautika come up from a review in one of the guidebooks, apparently it's been voted the sixth most romantic restaurant in the world, so we decided to give it a try. Well worth it and we would definitely recommend it to anyone and will be back.
The location is amazing, right next to the Old Town walls & overlooking the sea. The staff were excellent, informative on local wines, great service but not too intrusive. And the food was perfect!

First of all the setting - gorgeous and a lovely, romantic experience. However I think you are paying the price for the setting, rather than paying the price for the service or food. 

We ate here and a few days later at restaurant 360 (inside the city walls), spent a similar amount of money but 360 was miles better. And you have a wonderful setting there too - so I'd say if you want to push the boat out for a pricey but lovely meal go with 360 instead of Nautika. 

My husband loved his meal and in hindsight I probably should have ordered what he had - his veal was stunning. I however had lamb for my main which was a bit average. The truffle pasta I had was over the top, completely covered in black truffle - yes I wanted truffle pasta but couldnt see the pasta for the amount of truffle (a mountain of giant shavings)! Black Truffle is such a strong flavour I would expect a chef at this sort of restaurant to use it sparingly rather than overwhelming a dish in this fashion. Same situation with my dessert too, it was chocolate and almond, yet so many almonds in there you couldnt taste the chocolate.Think the chefs struggle somewhat with the balance of flavours which is a shame when working with such wonderful ingredients.

I actually had a similar meal a few days later in Split (at a much cheaper restaurant) with lamb followed by a chocolate and almond dessert, and I had a far better meal with bigger portions for much less! 

We had no input from the sommelier, I am always keen to try local wines when abroad but when I asked what red would go well with my dinner I just got given a glass of house red from the waiter, no attempt to get the sommelier to recommend me anything - probably because we were not ordering a bottle! We got a bit pushed into ordering champagne to start as well which I didnt like; as soon as we sat down they asked would we like an aperitif (Champagne) which turned out to be Moet at £16.50 per glass! Other restaurants we went to also asked if we'd like an aperitif but instead they'd suggest a Croatian sparkling at half the price - I dont like having the most expensive item on the menu forced at you on arrival! 

As I said my husband loved his food here so I'm not in any way saying the food is bad, just the items I ordered unfortunately had poorly balanced ingredients and flavours and had I chosen differently the review could be a very different story! For the money you pay (we spent around £160) I expected more, service didnt stand out, sommelier was non-existent for us and my food wasnt up to scratch.

A very special evening spent at Nautika which I would thoroughly recommend for a special occasion. The food was delightful as was the wine, the view and the service. A very special restaurant in Dubrovnik which has lots of good restaurants but I'm sure this is the best.

Amazing evening on a beautiful sea view terrace.
Exsquisite service enjoyed on their VIP terrace, perfect for our daughters 20th birthday with family
Stuuning food matches the quality of the view
Very knowledgable waiter/somelier extremely helpful with advice that helped to make the evening
High end bills worth every penny for that special evening
We mainly ate the 7 course tadting menu, one other enjoyed the truffle pasta with more truffles than I have ever seen, followed by the tenderest lamb. My highlight was the seared rare Tuna, cooked to perefction served on hot plates so still warm throughout.
Other highlight were the recommendations of Croatian wines, expensive but quite excellent

I had dinner here while on a trip to Dubrovnik.
The restaurant is beautifully located just outside the old city walls.
A friend had recommended it to me, so I reserved a table well in advance
The food is fantastic and is beautifully presented
Service is incredibly attentive and the waiting staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable 
Highly recommended

A romantic dinning experience but I have had better food for a lot cheaper. Try the restaurant opposite, don't want to name names but it has the same view with better food at a better price. Sorry. The staff are very friendly though and the view is beautiful. It was a nice atmosphere as someone was playing the piano. We made sure to reserve in advance a table by the wall.

This was a memorable meal. The food, service and presentation were phenominal. Our waiter was very knowledgable about every aspect of our dinner explaining everything from the regions and complexities of the bottles of different olive oil presented thought parts of dinner, wines and even down to the ways in which the desserts were prepared. 
We made reservations the day prior to ensure a table outside against the ledge looking parts of the Old City walls and the Adriatic Sea. 
We had 5 courses a la carte but will do a tasting menu next time around. 
Our meal was on the expensive side because of the additional courses and bottle of wine we chose plus pre dinner cocktails, but well well worth it. A special evening and wonderful experience.

We spent two evenings in this lovely restaurant. Incredible service from the staff and a wonderful location where you can enjoy the ocean view. The food was worth every penny;) 
It's romantic and cosy and I really recommend this place.

Honestly, one of the best meals I've ever had in my life. Yes, it is expensive, but well, well worth it, if you are able to go. Despite not having a reservation, we were seated on the VIP Terrace, overlooking the Fortress. The sunset was amazing. Our server, Maru, was wonderful. Everything we ate was absolutely delicious, and their catch of the day is a true treat. Maru recommended different Croatian olive oils to go with each course, which was such a special touch. I didn't want the meal to end! Should you have a special occasion to celebrate while in Dubrovnik, look no further. Or, like us, if being in Dubrovnik is the special occasion to celebrate, you couldn't do any better!

We had diner here in August 2015 with my two teenager boys. 
This is a beautiful place. We reserved a table at the terrace and it was an beautiful setting. 
Service was impeccable and the food simply delicious. 
It's a bit expensive but totally worth it!

We chose Nautika for our anniversary dinner and it hit the spot. Service was excellent and our server was knowledgeable about local wines which were great surprise. We opted for tasting menu consisting of tuna tartare, fish soup, shrimps, sea bass fillet and fruit torte. Must visit!

We visited this restaurant on 6th August 2015 at the occasion of our 10Y anniversary - looking for a romantic dinner with excellent food and perfect atmosphere. Nautika ticked all the boxes and we would highly recommend this place which we will visit again in future.

The dinner was a surprise evening for my then fiancée-to-be - we were greeted with great professionalism yet with a special/discreet touch arranged throughout the evening.
 
Prior to booking, I had read a small number of negative comments on trip advisor, regarding the service, food or price - as far as we are concerned these were all unfounded. Our dinner experience was fantastic on all aspects, from start to finish. We enjoy gastronomic cuisine and regukarly try very reputable restaurants - we would not normally go on to write reviews but this deserved an exception. 

Nautika is of similar standard to most Michelin-star restaurants we have been to. Pricing wise, it is of course more expensive compared to other restaurants in Dubrovnik Old Town but overall this remains reasonable for the quality you get. We did not go "À la carte" - as it was our first visit, we went for the 5-course set menus. Overall we were looking at £200-220 for dinner for two with a glass of champagne and a nicebottle of local Croatian/Bosnian wine (you want to try those local wines - they are a true delicacy compared to the classic and typically expensive French wines).

A special thanks to Nikol and Zlatko, for the lovely service and attendance that evening - and to the Chef, for the amazing food (the tuna tartare in particular was out of this world).

Our dinner at Nautika was majestic, just as it was unforgettable. We were favoured with a table by the sea from which we were able to enjoy watching sailing boats pass by as the sun set behind the nearby fortress. 

We ordered cuttlefish salad, scallops with truffles, lobster. The food was sublime and it became immediately clear why many people, including Italians, point out that the bottom of the Adriatic of Croatia is rocky rather than muddy and think Croatia's seafood superior to Italy's.

We popped into old town to have a casual dinner and ended up at Nautika! The service was phenomenal and the food was excellent. We were given a lovely starter compliments of the chef. I had the scallops as a starter and the beef fillet. Everything was delicious. It ended up being a very expensive night out but it was worth the experience.

If price is no object and you simply want the finest food, fresh from the sea, somewhat imaginative offerings, although not quite on par with top Michelin restaurants in Europe and North America, fine local wine and exceptional service, Nautika is for you. 

This is a tough reservation to get in season. The patio out front is highly sought after (especially the first row with views of the sea). 

 The ambience is beautiful, situated just outside the Walls of the Old City near the main gate. Dinner begins with an amuse bouche. It took reminding to receive the wine we ordered after our appetizers arrived. Opening and decanting the bottle was a pretentious production complete with candle light pour. 

The cuddle fish salad appetizer was tasty and beautifully presented. The truffled scallops were well prepared but the scallops were tiny. This would have been far superior with large, plump scallops. Truffles were not spared. 

The main courses of lobster pasta with a lovely bean ragout was really great. Succulent morsels of lobster in an imaginative sauce was a big hit. The sea bass was superb on a bed of vegetables. Rather small portion but expertly prepared with a crispy exterior and tender center. This chef is excellent with sea food. 

Overall a fine experience but really nothing to rave about. 

The sea food on the Adriatic coast is first rate. There are many fine restaurants with fresh offerings daily and chefs quite adept at preparing sea food at a fraction of the cost. 

The wine list has a decent selection of outstanding local wines but at astounding mark ups. 

Reservations required.

We had dinner at Nautika on the first night of our honeymoon in Dubrovnik. It was the perfect dining experience with an amazing view, great food, and attentive service.

The only recommendation that I have is to book in advance! Make sure you ask for a table by the water (pictures of our view attached). The old fort, or King’s Landing for you Game of Thrones fans, is lit up by night and you will be serenaded by the sound of water lapping up against the walls as you eat. 

I had the scallops (with black truffle) followed by the sea bass. Both excellent!

Wow!!! What a lovely place! With such a great food! We visit Dubrovnik for 5 days and we went twice to Nautika because we got addicted!!! We seated in the best place of the restaurant in front of amazing view. The service of the restaurant is outstanding and the food is a great culinary experience that I ever had.

This is perfect place for romantic fancy dinner. Your lady will be treated like a princess, and man guest like a king. I ordered a meal that one guest 31.7. gave a bed review, inspite of his low raiting. My decision was'nt spectaculary brave because it's his only review ever, and I supposed it was on purpose. Tuna steak was a perfect choice for us and red vine Negromant perfectly match. Price is a little bit higher, but you actually got value for money.

A really good dinner experience sitting on the terrace at Nautika overlooking the small bay, fort and the old town walls. Interesting Croatian wine list and a good selection of fresh fish and meats. The lamb was the best dish we had, very succulent and tasty.

My husband and I celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary in Nautika. When we arrived at the restaurant, we received a very warm welcome and were shown to the perfect table, with a stunning view, on the terrace. Our waiter was courteous, attentive and very professional. The meal was delicious and very beautifully presented. We would highly recommend this restaurant as we wish others to experience the wonderful visit we enjoyed there. Many thanks to the wonderful Nautika Team.

My wife and I were at dinner 31.07.2015. We ordered tuna steak with sesame and it was awful .... fully unbaked, crude. Also we ordered the lobster and it was funny, but also sad to see the plate which the waiter brought. Terrible expensive restaurant with terrible food
Excelent food, romantic atmosphere and very friendly staff. Very expensive but worth any cent..... We enjoyed so much and will come back for sure one day!

My wife and I dined here on our last night in Dubrovnik on the recommendation of a friend. We had reserved a table on the front tier of the terrace which afforded us lovely views of the Old City Wall and ocean. The service was attentive yet friendly and unobtrusive and the food was excellent. It was definitely a restaurant where you would want to dress up but it was not stuffy or full of itself. A great ending to our vacation.

The three stars are only (and only) for the views which are out of this world, especially if you watch Game of Throne fan. We were a group of ten, most of us are food Specialists! Meaning we know good food and good restaurants and have traveled the world! Well the food was horrendous! They told us that they revamped the entire staff recently (new Chef, Maître D, etc.). Well they need to do shuffle the staff again. 

This is typical problem with many restaurants these days, they try too much! They think combining bunch of ingredients give you flavor. Some of the best dishes do not have a zillion ingredient!

The Maître D was arrogant at the beginning acting as if he is working in a three Micheline star restaurant (he loosened up as the evening went by). We had good wine, cannot complain about that. The prices are way up there. You are paying for the views pretty much. Conde Nest listed it as one of the top ten most romantic restaurants in the world, I don't think the Conde Nest people ate there!!!

Services provided by our server MR Zlatko was excellent. He is very attentive and doesn't overly recommend. The food and wine served was very fairly priced. Ambience is good too... 
Will visit here if I ever travel to this part of the world again... 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

I went here on a one day trip in Dubrovnik. Me and my wife had an excellent lunch. The service was great, food fantastic and I can only recommend this restaurant. We did a 10 course menu, which was really good. Ask for a table outside overlooking the bay if the weather permits it. That is absolutely wonderfull.

Just outside the city wall this restaurant has the best location. My husband booked for my birthday and it was very special. We had a beautiful table on the terrace with views of the ocean, the staff were very attentive and the food was delicious. Had a particularly nice bottle of red wine - who knew Croatian wine was so good - expensive and 15.4% strength!!!!!!! - but so worth it! Would definitely recommend.

The restaurant is famous for its view, that sure is very nice. The service is very good and friendly. We had lobster... Now I don't know if the lobster was bad or we just don't like lobster. Overall the food was nicely prepared and served, hence a bit pricy even for us Swiss.

Nautika is probably the most known restaurant in Dubrovnik, perhaps even Croatia. It has a reputation of a pricy place with outstanding view on the Lovrijenac fortress and old city walls. Recently the restaurant has changed the owner. With this in mind, we went for a business dinner and had a set, five course menu agreed in advance.

Pricing is difficult to discuss; even in cheap restaurant one can leave feeling ripped off and even in premium venues one can leave feeling light(er) yet very satisfied. Anyways, prices are clearly visible on the menu in front of the entrance, so the main question is – are they justified by the quality of experience.

Nautika has a very professional service that fully justifies its reputation. It reads individual needs, is available just as needed, but subtly present otherwise. My only objection is occasional lack of more elaborate story to carry the dish, selected olive oil or wine selection. Staff can be more spontaneous and laid back and still not compromise professional posture and attitude.

Some dishes were more complex (techniques and flavors), some a bit too simple for the scale of the venue. However, what sets Nautika apart is the quality of ingredients. Adriatic shrimp salad was very rustic in appearance, seasoned mildly and the dish had a bit of a tavern and not fine dining character; nevertheless, the sweetness of the shrimp, its clean sea aroma, firm on bite yet succulent texture were outstanding. Lobster bisque was perhaps a bit heavier in texture than expected, but the depth of flavor and freshness of meat were definitely there. Scallops were perfect, perhaps the best I ever had, and one has to wonder if a more innovative side would improve the dish or just distract raw, genuine, direct experience (offered mash is too basic, if not dull). For the main, sea bass was fresh as fresh can be, but very basic and unimaginative. Finally, the cake was very homemade like, very tasty, but nutritious, heavy. Wine list fits any combination one can imagine. 

Leaving Nautika, we felt relaxed, satisfied and full (perhaps portions can be reduced somewhat). Restaurant made sure we have tasted the top ingredients available, fresh, full of flavor and perfectly prepared. From that perspective, the price is justified. Perhaps the next time we come, complexity of dishes, their conceptualization, sophistication, will add value and provide an unforgettable experience. 

I have spoken with the owner, who has very ambitious plans for Nautika, but want to honor its heritage and not use shortcuts. First goal was to maintain consistency which was successfully accomplished, exterior was opened to views and surrounding square, interior was slightly refreshed but kept the upscale them and the menu stayed true to original themes. Given the heritage, view, quality of ingredients and level of service, Nutika has the star potential.

We made a reservaton to the restaurant a month before going to be sure the table would be of a really niceview. Although we arrived at a peak time (around 9 pm) with some people waiting before us - we were happy to see that indeed they havd reserved one of the best tables for two.
The staff was extremely friendly and they couldn;t do enough for us to explain the ingredients and origins of the plates we were tasting.
The view is simply amazing and the atmosphere is very nice.
The menu offers different possibilities and the different tastes are indeed both native and original still the prices for the different courses seemed a bit overpriced.

This restaurant sums up our wonderful trip in Croatia. We had a fantastic truffle tagliatelle and oven baked sea bass. Food and wine are top quality, service is excellent, location is just right next to Pile gate of the Old City which is the centre of everything in Dubrovnik. I will give this place a 5-star.

I had read good reviews about Nautika before coming to Dubrovnik; however, from a few Dubrovnik locals I was told to not waste my money. My boyfriend and I went to Nautika anyway despite the mixed reviews. The restaurant is beautiful and located right on the water with a magical view. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful. The wine was delicious and overall we enjoyed our time at the restaurant; however, overall the food did not impress me. We liked everything that we ate, but nothing stood out. The best thing we ate was the truffled pasta starter, but my shrimp and polenta and the sea bass were quite bland. If I come back to Dubrovnik, I will not go back to Nautika as we had better food elsewhere and there are other restaurants with almost as good of a view for less of a cost. If allowed, I would have given the restaurant a 3.5 rather than 4 stars.

We came here as a large group of thirteen; five adults and eight teens. Delicious food, gorgeous views. The cuisine here is not the rustic cuisine that most of the other restaurants in Dubrovnik have but more refined, beautifully plated, more attention to detail, table wear, etc. You do pay for that, however, this restaurant was much more expensive than the other restaurants we ate in during this stay. Still, unless you are a big drinker the bill won't be large by American big city standards.

I give this restaurant 4 points mailnly because of its spectaculure view. The place has ambitions to be luxurus, but I find the food quit ordinary. Further the price is very high, but as said we really enyoid our stay there for lunch.
Food, setting, staff.. all just superb!! Waiters are well trained and very friendly. Food was very good, we had pasta with truffle and the steak and also seabass... Beautiful experience!

Nautika claims to be one of the most romantic restaurants in the world. Given its location on a terrace overlooking the walled old town of Dubrovnik, and the attention to detail of the restaurant staff, I cannot dispute this. I celebrated my birthday at Nautika with my wife and another couple with who we have travelled overseas on numerous occasions. We were all very impressed.

My main course was a Croatian specialty, black risotto of squid ink. It was offered as an entrée, but I asked for a main course size dish, and was not disappointed.

I should have known something was not right. Every restaurant in the old city was packed and when we walked into Nautika which is vast there were but a few diners. Once we ordered, and our meals arrived I could understand why. The food is very very expensive for what it is. I have eaten at many fine dining restaurants and this one just does not cut it. My main was a small piece of fillet, ordered medium it arrived well done and practically cremated. It was served with some mashed potato, a couple of greens and literally a teaspoon of Malvasia special sauce. It looked like a meal you would get in a mid range bistro just not as good. I was with friends and was too embarrassed to make a scene and return it. Most people's mains were underwhelming. The presentation and complexity of the food was just average at this price point and you were not able to order any sided dishes which again is strange in this type of establishment. If you are going to go then I suggest you order the lamb or tuna at least they are a proper serve. 

The pluses were excellent wines, great staff and a knockout location. Sorry will not be back.

We had a very good meal at Nautika on a beautiful night in Dubrovnik. We were seated on the back terrace with a view of the Adriatic , the town walls and the fort outside the main walls. There is also seating on the front terrace with a direct view of the town walls. 

The food was very good overall. The tuna tartare was a classic preparation with a touch of wasabi. The Adriatic scallops with shaved truffles were nicely seared on a bed of herbed potatoes as a local twist. The tuna steak seared with a coating of white and black sesame was relatively simple although the fig sauce pairing was appreciated. The lobster tail with pasta was ok, the sauce was lacking clear definition of flavor. The chocolate square with orange ginger sauce was a nice finish. 

Service was excellent - very attentive throughout the meal with service levels you would expect for a restaurant of this quality. Our server was well versed in the local wines and helped us make nice selections . Dinner for 8 with 2 bottles came to about 600 euros - a bit pricey for the food relative to European standards but a nice night overall.

Well positioned except that it's right next to a main gathering point for sightseers and at times you feel like you are on display.
Frankly it's a dressed up restaurant where the food is just average and yet expensive. Service is good.
Plenty of other choices in Dubrovnik.

What a wonderful restaurant in a brilliant setting.

The menu, while short has some amazing dishes and the mixed seafood starter was out of this world!

The mains and desert were also a really balance of flavours and were interesting. (In a good way)

Also have a very varied wine selection of Croatian wines: which are amazing!

The service was also very attentive without being overbearing.

Would highly recommend the restaurant to couples looking for a Romantic evening.

Definitely a 'must do' when visiting Dubrovnik.

Great terrace with sea-view, great interior. As of the first step into Nautika a warm welcome and top service is awaiting you. On top of this there is live easy listening music every evening! Even personal music requests are welcome. Great!
My husband and I had a lovely dinner of seafood, the best dinner during the 10 days time we spent in Dubrovnik!
Thank you Nautika team :-).

We had visited Dubrovnik in June for a friend's 50th birthday and fell in love, not only with the city but the island of Lopud, where we stayed this time.

During our stay we took a couple of day trips to Dubrovnik on the ferry and on one occasion book to have lunch at Nautika. We requested a table on the terrace by the wall overlooking the cove behind the city wall.

A beautiful building and entrance hall where we were greeted and shown to our table. It was a warm sunny day, clear blue sky and the setting of beautifully laid tables white and blue with large white awning. The view is fantastic, looking over the cove with kayak groups coming and going to a full view out to sea.

The service was absolutely top quality, with attentive waiter and sommelier at any moment we needed something but somehow you didn't know they were there.

The food is faultless and exceptionally high and fine dining quality and with a bottle of champagne rounding it off to a perfect experience.

On leaving the restaurant we were given our shopping and a Nautika bag with a very large hard back book all about Nautika and Dubrovnik.

Pricing is at the upper end but well worth it especially if you go there for a special occasion.

An experience not to be missed.
The location is breath-taking, the food and the service outstanding. Expensive but definitely first class.

Just outside the Pile Gate, the inside spaces have recently been refurbished, we were proudly told as we were ushered through to the terrace, and very nicely too. The large terrace was two thirds full at 8pm, mainly with young couples but also an extended family complete with happy baby. 

There are great views of the wall, fortress and sea. As dusk deepened to night, the floodlighting made everything look stunning and an almost full moon glittered on the sea. 

An excellent and extensive wine list offered an international range of wines and prices from about 30-500 Euros. The Amuse Bouche was not memorable but bread rolls were very good and the naturally spicy olive oil was superb. All our starters were exquisite: truffle pasta, scallops with truffles, thick shrimp soup and an unusual sweet potato soup that one waiter confided he used to have every day for years.

Our mains were more about showing off the superb quality of the ingredients than of sauces or garnishes. Dalmatian lamb chops were butter-soft, Charolais beef fillet equally so, and the veal fillet was also declared good by our picky guests, who both had the same dish.

340 Euros bought us 2 courses each for 4 people, including an 85 Euro bottle of wine; we were too full to consider dessert and had been there for 2 hours by then. Very expensive for Croatia but justified for an anniversary celebration.

We also ate at 360. While we would return to the solid Nautika, 360 was a one-time experience as its execution fell short of its ambition.

Having found food on the whole in Croatia to be OK rather than in anyway memorable Nautika moved the bar several metres higher. The food was superb - trio of fish to start (KN310 ouch!) followed by the Fillet steak - up there with the very best restaurants I have eaten in. Deserts were disappointing - nothing wrong with them - just uninspiring. We had a fantastic bottle of local produced Merlot which was fantastic and put Croatian wine in an entirely new light (KN588 but worth every penny). The location needs no description but ask for a table on the terrace overlooking the bay if you can get it - the tables near the entrance are not as good. Service was immaculate. If you have the budget this is a must.

Make a reservation and ask for the upstairs terrace for a great sunset view and more privacy. Food selections and wine list were most excellent! The prawn risotto and truffle pasta are delicious! Great romantic spot with perfect touches and service for a night out!

Very classy, nice view of the wall. We had a 5 course seafood menu and a bottle of wine which costed us over A$300. The service was excellent and you could easily be overwhelmed by their attentiveness ! It's good for special occasions.

This restaurant aspires to fine dining and is priced accordingly. The menu is limited and the food is just adequate. The service is attentive but perhaps overly so to the point of irritation. The location and view is excellent but not, I think, worth the price

My wife and I have just returned from Nautika and we do not know where to start...

I mean,we all know that Nautika was Dubrovnik's best fine dining restaurant in the late '90 and throughout the '00 but I think we were all a bit sceptic when we heard about the new management taking over this institution of Dubrovnik...

Well,no need to be sceptic anymore...the amazing view is still there (in ours opinion,much better and more romantic to that of ex Gil's,now 360°) and the food is still spectacular...from the entry-level till the most expensive dishes, from "plain" dishes like the sea bass file till those,a bit more extravagant like the strawberry cake with green paper and aceto balsamico..also,we have to mention that you get to try 4 different extra quality olive oils,one for each dish...

Even though the service in the "old" Nautika was very high quality, the new one is exceptional..Ivan,our waiter was very well informed about our meals and Dubrovnik and Marko (we think he is the manager) was really something else...really informative,kind and on top of things but not too intrusive..also,we heard him speak to other guests on different languages...

Overall, Nautika is still Dubrovnik's number 1 in terms of fine and quality dining...it is rather expensive (for Croatian standards) buy it's well worth it...would recommend it to anyone...just be sure to book a table on the main terrace, it's spectacular! A well deserved 5 stars...

Hope you'll enjoy it...

We had seating outdoor and beside the ocean view. It was such a wonderful view especially during sunset. Food were superb, we loved cuttlefish salad and lavender mousse dessert was delicious. Service staff had a very good take care. Good place to have dinner.

My husband and I were hesitant to eat at such a nice restaurant with our very loud and active 14 month old son but thought we would give it a try. They brought out a very nice high chair and everyone was so very welcoming and accommodating to us. All the waiters and maitre d's came up to our son and smiled at him and gave him attention. I've never written a review here, but the fact that such a nice place didn't scoff at us trying to have a nice meal with our baby really meant a lot. The food was excellent as well but go for the view and the service. You won't be disappointed!

We ate here on our last night in Dubrovnik. The restaurant is very expensive but definitely worth the visit. A table on the terrace at the side of the restaurant is definitely a better choice as it's away from all the tourists taking photos. The views are amazing and the service is excellent, we were made to feel very special. The food was very good especially the desserts. Excellent choice for a special evening.

Had dinner there last week, worth going just for the views over the small bay with the cliffs and city walls in the background. Staff were absolutely delightful and couldn't have been more helpful. Unfortunately the food just didn't match a restaurant of this standard. Fish was seriously over cooked and burnt in places. Fillet steak ordered medium arrived well done, vegetable selection and presentation was poor. A great shame, with the setting, staff, table linen, crockery and cutlery this could be a great place but they do need to get the food sorted out.

Went there this evening with my friends, since they have not been here before I wanted to show them what this beautiful country has to offer, I called the night before and the on the phone was really kind explaining me the menu and reserving the sea view table for me and my friends even though they were pretty booked. When we arrived the girl at the entrance showed us the table and she kindly invited us to try the wine bar they opened recently. All the other personnel was just as kind, and english proficient, the food is amazing and the view is just stunning. Definitely coming back as soon as possible.

This restaurant has recently re opened after a major refurbishment internally, we ate outside overlooing the wall, fort amd the sea, excellent views the only downside was the tourists who can get close to you as they look at the view and take pictures -- but hey ho we are tourists too!

The food and service were excellent, indeed having eaten several times in Dubrovnik this was the best seafood restaurant in town -- or in Nautikas case just outside the town walls.

The portions were good, the quality excellent and value for money amazing.

For any person serious about food who is looking for good seafood, ambience, service etc this is a must go to venue.

I would suggest when you book and book you will have to if you want a table with a view you ask for a table overlooking the wall, fort and sea.

very classy restaurant just outside the city walls of Dubrovnik 
Nice menu that caters for most 
Great value for money considering the class of restaurant 
One point let them down when the asked us for the table back when we were finished eating 
We weren't best pleased about that
But it's very good and definitely recommended

We happened upon the restaurant on our first night in Dubrovnik.

Situated on top of a large cliff just outside the old town it offers a sophisticated and extensive menu with excellent service.

Well worth a visit.
